**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Yellow Register Fast Ritual*. Fifty-eight fascicles. Compiled by Du Guangting of the late Tang and Five Dynasties period. Base text from: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, Dongxuan Section, *Weiyi* (Ritual Dignity) Category.

**Fascicle One of The Supreme Yellow Register Fast Ritual**
Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting

**Ritual for Circumambulation at Dawn on the First Day**

According to the old ritual, the fast’s sponsor was required to submit a petition daily, following the method of announcing the fast. However, since a petition was already submitted at the fast’s initial establishment, daily repetition would be excessive in observance. Thus, it shall be done only once, and all subsequent petitions shall cease.

The assembled officials arrange their positions, banners, tablets, and incense altars, standing in solemn order before the Mystic Master. Once settled, the cantor intones:

*"All participants in the Daoist hall, each turn your minds to take refuge in the Three Treasures and all revered ones—"*

The *Huaxia Hymn* is chanted, leading to the *Huaxia Hymn at the Earth Gate*. The *Scripture of the Jade Casket Revealing Perfection* is recited. Now, only the eighteen empty sounds are used.

**Hymn for Opening the Hall**
With diligence we uphold the fast and precepts,
Reciting scriptures to restrain the six passions.
Thus we ride the void in flight,
Radiant, ascending to Jade Clarity.
With focused mind we honor the scriptural teachings,
Refining the five spirits through exhaled nectar.
Our merit crowns the heavens,
Turning the wheel to ascend as immortals.

The *Entering the Gate Spell* is recited, proceeding to the left of the Earth Gate. The Dharma Master recites the esoteric incantation:

*"Officers of the Four Luminaries, Messengers Who Convey to Perfection, Jade Lads Who Transmit Words, Jade Maidens Who Serve in Stillness—convey my words to the presiding deities of the Daoist chamber. May the qi of the Upper Prime enter my body."*

The *Huaxia Hymn* is chanted, leading into the altar. Ascending the Heavenly Gate, the procession begins with the incense offering to the ten directions, starting in the east. Upon reaching the imperial table, incense is offered thrice.

**Esoteric Incantation for Offering Incense**

Amidst jade radiance scattering light, each pays homage and visualizes as prescribed. The Dharma Master closes his eyes and envisions the Supreme Three Honored Ones descending through the void, flanked by dragon and tiger, with a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. The revered spirits of the Three Realms and the assembled perfected attendants array themselves at their seats. Thereupon, on behalf of the disciples, he presents the intent of the fast.

Next, he visualizes the Scripture Master attending to the right of the Supreme Ones, bowing thrice in his heart, wishing that the master attain the Dao of immortality and that his own body ascend and be delivered. Then he visualizes the Register Master, followed by the Ordination Master, with wishes as before.

For the night rite, he next envisions azure qi suffusing the fast hall, with green dragons and lions guarding front and rear. Immortal lads and jade maidens, heavenly immortals, earthly immortals, flying immortals, the sun, moon, and stellar lodges, the five Thearchs’ troops and horses, nine hundred million riders, overseers of the fast’s affairs, and the officials of the Three Realms array themselves to left and right.

Then he envisions azure qi issuing from the master’s liver like clouds ascending. Within the azure qi are green dragons and lions. Heavenly immortals, earthly immortals, flying immortals, and the Five Thearchs of the five directions, with their troops and horses, envelop the bodies of the fast’s host and his household. Again, he visualizes the five viscera and the Five Marchmounts’ Five Thearchs, as in the initial night rite.

**Incantation for Guarding the Spirits**
*"Golden Perfected and verdant auroras
illumine and reflect the Three Heavens.
Flying clouds in the cinnabar firmament,
all heavens command their chariots.
Morning brilliance dawns,
dark shadows dissolve entirely.
Ninefold subtleties shake the void,
five stars revolve in cycles.
Myriad immortals respond to the resonance,
naturally wondrous and mysterious.
In the distant obscurity, radiance scatters,
shapes divide into billions.
Veiled in luminous splendor,
auspiciousness descends upon the altar’s heaven.
The living and the dead receive grace,
bathed and refined in the golden spring.
Demon kings tremble in fear,
converging their light upon the Three Fields."*

The Dharma drum is sounded twenty-four times.
The incense burner is opened.

**Supreme Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Origin, Three Qi of the Most High Lord Lao, summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officials, Left and Right Attendant Envoys, Incense-Bearing Golden Lads, Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-six each—to emerge. Now summon here the local earth deities and true officials of this domain to swiftly open the passes and present themselves. We now burn incense in proper ritual, dedicating this to so-and-so official, so-and-so person, for state and family, conducting the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat for so many days and nights. May the life-breath of the Most High’s Ten Directions and True Perfected descend and flow into our bodies, that our petitions swiftly ascend before the Jade Thearch of the Supreme Dao of the Utmost Limit, the Most High Lord of the Dao. Each person bows three times.**

All officials kneel. The Dharma Master sounds the Dharma drum twenty-four times. The officers and soldiers emerge to present the petition.

**We reverently summon forth from within our bodies the true officials and merit officials of our five viscera. From the Supreme Three Heavens, the Enforcers of the Dharma and Agents of Transformation, the Yin-Yang Merit Officials, the Salvific Dao Officers who dispel calamities, and the Lords who disperse misfortune and resolve adversity—twelve each—to emerge. From within our bodies, the governing officials: the Great General of such-and-such jurisdiction, builder of standards and overseer of merits; the Vanguard Merit Officers and Rear Guard Execution Officers; the Post Station Commandant and Post Station Deputy; the Fourfold Merit Overseers and Audience Attendants. From within our bodies, the Transcendent Envoys, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officials, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Yin-Yang Spirit-Deciding Officers, the Scarlet Talisman Chariot Officers, the Gale-Wind Courier Post Horses, and the Memorial-Presenting Officials—two each—to emerge. Let all who emerge don their solemn attire, adorned with caps and pendent tassels, arraying their majestic dignity.**

The Direct Merit Officials wear the Heaven-Piercing Crown and black silk unlined robes. The Orthodox Unity Merit Officials wear the Vermilion Yang Cap and crimson ceremonial robes. The Healing Merit Officials wear the Nine Virtues Crown, multicolored sashes, unlined robes, tiger-tally belts, and hold jade tablets.

The Direct Merit Officials stand at the four directions. The Orthodox Unity Merit Official stands at the center. The Healing Merit Officials guard and protect our bodies.

The Left Attendant Envoys bear standards at the fore. The Right Attendant Envoys hold banners at the rear. The Yang Spirit-Deciding Officers stand to the left; the Yin Spirit Officers stand to the right. The Upper Merit Officials stand above; the Middle Merit Officials stand within our bodies. The Qi-Urging Merit Officials hasten the Ten Directions. The Upper Envoys gaze afar toward the heavens. The Middle Envoys survey the eight directions. The Capital Envoys encircle our bodies.

The Tiger-Strong Attendants, the Sentry Officers, the Capital Commanders, the Heavenly Might Warriors, the Heavenly Couriers, the Armored Soldiers, the Qi-Gathering and Qi-Consuming Officers, the Spirit-Gathering and Spirit-Consuming Officers, the Ghost-Gathering and Ghost-Consuming Officers, the Malevolence-Gathering and Malevolence-Consuming Officers, the Essence-Gathering and Essence-Consuming Officers, the Toxin-Gathering and Toxin-Consuming Officers, the Talisman-Subduing and Shrine-Destroying Officers, the Scarlet Talisman Chariot Officers, the Gale-Wind Courier Post Horses, the Memorial-Presenting Officers, the Flying Dragon Riders, and others—all assemble before, behind, to the left, and right of us.

The Merit Officials and Envoys, having completed their solemn preparations, array their processional regalia. They open the passes and present the petitions to the divine retinue of the Numinous Treasure, the Transcendent Overseers of the Retreat, the Officers of the Heavenly Master’s Twenty-Four Dioceses, the Thirty-Six Sacred Abodes, the Seventy-Two Blessed Lands, the Three Hundred Sixty Famous Mountains, Kunlun and the other celestial palaces, the thirty-six thousand deities, the sun, moon, and stellar lodges, the Northern Asterism, the officials of the Three Realms of Heaven and Earth, their generals, officers, and soldiers.

The Dao’s Two Mysteries, Three Origins, Four Beginnings, the Four Directions, the winds and qi, the qi-infusing officers of the celestial stems and earthly branches, the Summoning Lords, the Nine Yi and Hu Elders of the East, the Eight Man and Yue Elders of the South, the Six Rong and Di Elders of the West, the Five Di and Qiang Elders of the North, the Three Qin and Cang Elders of the Center, the Lords of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the marsh and pond deities, the spirits of all temples, the masters of high mountains, forests, valleys, and groves, the Twelve Stream Matriarchs, the root-source and primordial earth deities, the lords of the altars and granaries—all at once don their solemn attire and, with the Merit Officials, Envoys, and Flying Dragon Riders from within our bodies, ascend to present their petitions before the Supreme Dao of the Utmost Limit, the Most High Lord of the Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Venerable One, the Supreme Mysterious Elder, the Ten Directions’ Utmost Limit Great Dao, the Hosts of Sagely Virtues, the Heavenly Worthies, the Perfected, the Supreme Thearchs, the Heavenly Thearchs, the Heavenly Master Lords, the Numinous Treasure Retreat-Overseeing Great Dharma Masters, and all the divine officials.

**We, born and raised in the floating world of dust, are mired in its clamor. The three karmic bonds entangle us; the six emotions drift like waves.**

By gracious encounter with the supreme transformation, we have met true masters. They opened the gates of the Three Clarities’ myriad wonders and expounded the principles of the Eight Radiant Immortals’ longevity. They clarified the sea of desires and dredged the river of love to its depths. We gird ourselves with the Dragon Script and hold fast to the divine registers, propagating the Dao and extolling the Dharma, aiding the state and delivering people. In saving beings and establishing merit, purification and abstinence are the foundation.

Now there is the official so-and-so, who, mindful of the state above and the unseen realms beside, seeks blessings and entreats grace, turning his heart toward the Ten Ultimates. He requests the performance of the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Purification Rite. We have heard that the Three Caverns’ precious scriptures, the ranks of numinous immortals, the supreme wondrous Dharma, and the Yellow Register sacred altar communicate with the sagely and summon the perfected, modeling heaven and earth. They safeguard the state and family, so that lord and ministers receive the grace of protection; they deliver the living and the dead, so that all in life and death bear the power of preservation. When the Nine Dragons’ talismanic commands are opened, the hells become tranquil; when the Five Thearchs’ majestic spirits are summoned, the celestial charts shine bright and serene. Their merit surpasses all Dharmas, and their beneficence pervades all beings.

Thus, in accordance with the mysterious statutes, we present the ritual tokens: incense, flowers, oil, candles, brocade, and golden dragons, pledging faith to the ten directions and allying our hearts with the three realms. We, upholding the sagely teachings and humbly serving in the mysterious offices, are duty-bound to report all prayers and petitions. Today, we purify our minds and compose our thoughts, bathing in clarity and emptiness. We establish and perform the Yellow Register Grand Purification Rite, offering repentance and gratitude beneath the Three Luminaries for so many days and nights. We surrender our lives to the Utmost Perfected, to deliver so-and-so’s living and deceased kin, freeing them from suffering and ascending to bliss, reconciling grievances and dissolving karmic hindrances, dispelling calamities and dissolving disasters.

We reverently summon the celestial immortals’ armies of the Three Caverns, the flying immortals’ armies, the terrestrial immortals’ armies, the perfected ones’ armies, the divine beings’ armies, the sun, moon, and stellar constellations’ armies, the Nine Palaces and Five Thearchs’ armies, the Three Rivers and Four Seas’ armies—each numbering nine hundred million myriad riders. We summon the thirty-two overseers of the purification rite, the thirty-two golden lads attending incense, the thirty-two jade maidens scattering flowers, the Five Thearchs’ direct talismans, and the messengers who transmit words and memorials. We summon the thirty-two Flying Dragon Riders and the like. Together, they descend to oversee the purification site, secure the state’s fortune, protect all beings, and deliver the myriad generations of so-and-so’s ancestors. May the suffering souls of the unseen realms sever all evil karmic ties, enter the light, forever escape the three evil destinies, transcend the five sufferings, and surrender their lives to the boundless worlds of the ten directions, to the assemblies of great sages who have attained the Dao, and to the Utmost Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones. We beseech the dissolution of calamities and the removal of disasters, the prolongation of life and the preservation of destiny, passage through the three calamities and eight difficulties amid all evils, the protection of the state and the pacification of the family, and universal benefit to all sentient beings.

Once the Daoist rites are completed, those who have rendered meritorious service may report to the immortal palaces. The Merit Officials and Flying Dragon Riders shall separately memorialize and transmit these matters in due course. When the list of petitions is concluded, they shall return to our bodies and resume their places in the palaces. When summoned again, they shall arrive as before, in accordance with precedent.

We strike our teeth three times, swallow our saliva twice, and conclude the *Ritual of the Supreme Ultimate’s Purification Rite*.

Each proclaims his Dharma rank, and all the officials secretly recite their own Dharma ranks:

Disciple of the Three Luminaries of the Supreme Clarity’s Mysterious Capital and Great Cavern, Supreme Master of the Three Caverns, Master Practitioner of the Yellow Register Grand Purification Rite, Master of the Sacred Peak so-and-so, Perfected Lord of the Thearch so-and-so, your subject so-and-so, together in sincerity, reverently memorializes the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, the Utmost Limit Great Dao, the Most High Lord of the Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the August Jade Thearch on High, the assemblies of great sages who have attained the Dao in the ten directions, the Utmost Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones, the thirty-two Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Supreme Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Watchtower, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity, Supreme Palace, Numinous Treasure, Utmost Perfected, Radiant August Dao Lord, the thirty-six divisions of venerable scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the officials and retinues of the three realms, and all true numina.

We, having accrued good causes over kalpas, were born into this great transformation. The mysterious and true awakened and delivered us, allowing us to dwell within the mysterious gate. Our three masters pledged and transmitted the Three Treasures’ true scriptures, with the Dharma duty to deliver ninety-nine thousand beings. Though we have ascended to the Utmost Perfected, our merit is slight and our virtue meager, and we have not yet attained immortality. Bearing transgressions and treading errors, we linger in the dusty world. Yet from the moment we received the Dharma, we pledged before the three realms to deliver beings and save creatures, making merit our priority. For all who take refuge, we are duty-bound to report.

Now, in obedience to the edict, how dare we not make this known above?

We read the words:

As the petition states, the devotion is truly sincere. The purification master, having inherited blessings from past lives and risen in human rank, serves the state and family, aspiring to exalted fortune. Reflecting on his myriad generations of ancestors and the divine spirits of ten lifetimes—who, in their time in the world, accumulated transgressions and faults, wandering the long night of rebirth without means of deliverance—he desires to repay their boundless grace, which is as vast as the heavens.

We have heard that the Great Dao of Emptiness and Non-Being nurtures all beings. The Supreme Dharma King and the great sages of the heavens extend their compassionate grace, inaugurating the statutes of the Yellow Register. Repenting before the ten heavens and baring our hearts to the eight directions, our red sincerity turns toward them, and ten thousand sins are absolved. Reverently following the mysterious statutes, we present the golden dragon brocade as the token of our destined life, along with incense, flowers, oil, and candles, to manifest our faith and sincerity. We beseech the deliverance of the living and the dead, praying for mysterious protection.

We purify our spirits and compose our thoughts, cleansing our minds and darkening our hearts. In accordance with the Yellow Register’s simple texts and the numinous immortals’ statutes, we deliver the living and the deceased, establishing the sacred altar. The four quarters and eight directions model heaven and earth. We establish the purification rite and perform the Dao, burning incense and lighting lamps. We reveal the luminous texts of the Jade Treasury, breaking the suffering of the dark night’s underworld gates. We remove the net of sins and rescue those lost in the ford.

Today, at this dawn of the purification rite, we first offer incense, making offerings to the Utmost Perfected and the supreme Dao Treasure. We surrender our bodies, spirits, and lives to the Great Dao. We prostrate ourselves, surrendering our lives to the Three Honored Ones on High. By this merit, we dedicate blessings to the purification master so-and-so’s myriad generations of ancestors and all divine spirits, liberating them from the three evil destinies and transcending the six paths of rebirth.

We deliver the roots of suffering across the ten directions of the world, guiding beings out of the dark and desolate realms of fire and ash. Our shadows rest in the Jade City, our spirits roam the Purple Palaces. The Jeweled Grove spreads its canopy, and the fragrance of merit and cultivation pervades. May we swiftly enter the wellspring of wisdom and accomplish the immortal Dao.

Now we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of our Master and the virtues of the Utmost Perfected. After attaining the Dao, we ascend into formlessness, merging with the Dao in truth.

Second pinch of incense: we offer it to the Utmost Perfected and the supreme Sutra Treasury. We surrender our bodies, spirits, and lives to the Great Dao. We prostrate ourselves, surrendering our lives to the Three Honored Ones on High. By this merit, we dedicate blessings to the ancestral lineage of the purification master, the former sages, and the revered spirits of the altars and state. May the phoenix’s reign endure and the dragon’s chart remain eternal. May the emperor’s sacred person receive protection, and the dynastic fortune be prolonged. May transformation embrace Hua and Yi, and merit surpass that of the ancient sage-kings. May the empress’s earthly virtue shine with maternal grace. May the crown prince and princes inherit the celestial mandate, and the dukes, ministers, and officials, both within and beyond the court, adorn the imperial way and expand the great enterprise. May the myriad subjects each preserve their proper place, dwelling in filial piety at home and serving with loyalty to the state. May the nine regions share a common path, and the four seas unite in culture. May the fields yield timely harvests, and no demonic calamities arise. May all under heaven sing in harmony.

May the disciples of the Dao, dwelling in forests and marshes, proclaim the Dao and praise the Dharma with courage, diligence, and vigor. May they attain the One and the Primal Truth, penetrate the mysterious, and merge with the Dao.

Now we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of our Master and the virtues of the Utmost Perfected. After attaining the Dao, we ascend into formlessness, merging with the Dao in truth.

Third pinch of incense: we offer it to the Utmost Perfected and the supreme Teacher Treasure. We surrender our bodies, spirits, and lives to the Great Dao. We prostrate ourselves, surrendering our lives to the Three Honored Ones on High. By this merit, we dedicate blessings to the purification master’s own kin and relations. May each enjoy peace of spirit and ease of body, their sins extinguished and disasters dispelled. May no sorrows or afflictions assail them, and may their dreams and waking hours be true. May their mortal forms be transformed, their appearances perfected. May their shortened years be extended, and their lives endure. May they diminish selfishness and desire, aligning their conduct with nature. May the noble remain humble, and the wealthy know contentment. May the six relations and nine clans dwell together in harmony and goodness, their hearts united in righteousness, all sharing in blessed fortune.

May all beings—those that fly and swim, those with consciousness and perception—along with the nine dark realms, the five paths, the six destinies, and the three evil destinies, be freed from suffering and reborn in heaven. May enmities be resolved and grievances released. May they escape the three disasters, the ten thousand calamities, punishments, and misfortunes. May merit flourish and virtuous deeds shine forth.

Now we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of our Master and the virtues of the Utmost Perfected. After attaining the Dao, we ascend into formlessness, merging with the Dao in truth.

The ritual of repentance follows the directions—twenty directions in sequence, or the fivefold general repentance, as detailed in the lower scroll. Each visualizes the nine-colored circular radiance, swallows saliva, and recites the secret demon-quelling incantation.

The Dharma Master stands at the Ghost Gate, the Precentor at the Heavenly Gate. The Dharma Master visualizes the sun and moon and the nine-colored circular light behind his neck, illuminating all within and without, as in the *Visualization of the Spirits* diagram. Upon completing the mudra, he strikes his teeth three times and recites the secret incantation:

*"The Yellow Center commands qi to sever demonic lineages,
Scrutinizing and subduing strong spirits, cutting off the old fiend.
The Supreme has decreed from the Supreme Chamber—
Hasten! Summon the Northern Emperor to the Jade Palace.
Receive the mighty command to proclaim to the Demon Kings,
The Five Emperors flourish with life’s vital force.
The secret jade texts are now fully revealed—
The Three Heavens revolve in brightness, the Six Heavens reach their end.
How wise! How wise!"*

This incantation must be recited in secret, inaudible even to oneself. To violate this is to incur fault. Be cautious! Be cautious!

Circling in the *Step of Emptiness*,
Treading the cloud-net in spiraling motion, riding the void to walk the dark warp.
Chanting and intoning the honored *Emperor Unity*,
A hundred passages naturally harmonize.
Bowing to command the lads of the Eight Seas,
Looking up to escort the lofty immortals.
The heavens scatter incense and blossoms,
A numinous wind arises, serene.
Long-held vows settle the root of destiny,
Thus attaining lofty eminence.
Rejoicing before the *Most High*,
Even ten thousand kalpas are but a beginning.

Again—
The towering *Dark Capital Mountain*,
Where the ten directions revere the *August Unity*.
The soaring *Celestial Treasure Terrace*,
Radiance and flame flowing like the sun.
Resplendent jade groves in brilliance,
Vermilion fruits gleaming in splendor.
Ever mindful to consume primordial essence,
Refining fluids to solidify form and substance.
Golden light scatters through the *Purple Tenuity*,
Profound and serene, the *Great Vehicle* in ease.

Again—
Looking up to visualize the *Most High*,
Flowering light flourishing in the cinnabar field.
Gazing left to lift the *Gloom-Dispeller*,
Gazing right to escort the *Essence-Binder*.
The *Six Perfections* observe the *Brahma-conduct*,
Virtue and power renew with the sun.
Long-accumulated merit responds to past causes,
Hearing the scriptures as if meeting kin.
Heaven-endowed with transcendent talent,
Delighting in reciting the subtle texts.
The *Primordial Harmony* of emptiness and peace,
Exhaling and inhaling the flowing rosy mist.
*Womb-breathing* stills the hundred passages,
In profound solitude, mastering the three expedients.
The *Mud-Pill Palace* becomes a luminous mirror,
Thus attaining the *Golden Flower Immortal*.
The *Demon Kings* respectfully receive the task,
Thus able to ascend and attend the heavens.
All begins with purification and abstinence,
Accumulating merit to bind past affinities.
Soaring flight through the Great Void,
Escorting the loftiest adepts.

*Three Invocations*—
Taking the Dharma as wife,
Cherishing the scriptures like pearls and jade.
Holding precepts to restrain the six senses,
Mindful of the Dao to dispel desires.
In purity, the upright qi abides,
Serene, the spirit in silent stillness.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
Lifetimes enjoying great fortune.

*Three Bows*—
We, with devoted hearts, prostrate and bow to the *Most High Boundless Dao*.
We, with devoted hearts, prostrate and bow to the thirty-six revered scriptures.
We, with devoted hearts, prostrate and bow to the *Great Dharma Master of the Dark Mystery*.

*Reiterating the Dharma Rank*—
We, [your] humble servants, [names] in unison and sincerity, humbly address and invoke the *Most High Boundless Dao*, the *Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning*; the *Most High Lord of the Dao*; the *Most High Lord Lao*; the *Boundless Dao* of the ten directions and the *Virtuous Host of Sages*; the *Celestial Worthies* and *Perfected*; the *Supreme Emperors* and *Celestial Emperors*; the thirty-six revered scriptures; the *Great Dharma Master of the Dark Mystery*; the *High Ministers* and *Prime Ministers*; the *Four Offices* and *Five Emperors*; the officials and retinues of the Three Realms; and all true numina.

We, molded by the Two Modes, planted causes over myriad kalpas.
Presumptuously receiving the transformative influence of the Dao, yet still unenlightened to the *Ultimate Perfection*.

Yet we, though devoted to revering the mysterious scriptures and venerating the hidden mysteries, have failed to extend our merit to the moving and the growing, while our transgressions have already amassed like hills and forests. Ever fearful that our allotted span may end, we shall face judgment in the dark night. Yet on this day of covenant, we hold salvation as foremost, proclaiming the Dao to deliver beings and assisting the state in its transformative work. We humbly offer our meager service, that it may accord with the boundless compassion of the Primordial.

Now the patron of this retreat, submitting to the *Perfected of the Highest*, devoutly reveres the *Great Dao*. Above, they pray for the enduring fortune of the state; below, they extend their care to both the living and the departed. They seek to repay the nurturing grace of sovereign and kin, and to contemplate the sufferings of those trapped in the cycles of the dark night. Bearing their vows and pledges, they have established this sacred precinct, to atone for past faults and to invoke blessings for the future. With earnest and sincere supplication, how dare we not make this known above?

Thus, we lead and exhort our fellow practitioners, adhering strictly to the ritual codes. We arrange the altar, array the scriptures, and model the sacred space upon heaven. Pouring forth our sincerity to the *Supreme Mystery*, we still our minds before the *Most Holy*. We prostrate ourselves, hoping that the *Great Dao of Emptiness and Non-Being*, the *Lofty and Boundless Honored One*, will look upon our earnest devotion with compassion and bestow the profound blessings of the *Mysterious*. May the *Four Offices and Five Emperors*, the *Mighty Spirits of the Three Realms*, descend with their transformative power, dispelling the mists and clouds to bring blessings; may they manifest their luminous might, attending our prayers and repentance in unison.

May the gates of the netherworld’s long night be opened, and the sufferings of the imprisoned souls in the dark prisons be released. May they depart the shadowy realms, ascend the celestial thoroughfares, awaken to the Dharma, hear the scriptures, and through contemplation of the *Mysterious*, realize the Dao.

May the patron’s household—nine generations of kin, both departed and living—see their three karmic offenses dissolved and their six sensory obstructions extinguished. May the celestial nets and earthly snares not bring calamity to their three destinies; may the dark stars and bright constellations forever still the misfortunes of the five phases. May the divine and true protect them, increasing their fortune and longevity.

Above, may the state’s prosperity know no bounds, and the imperial reign endure forever. May the sacred person of the sovereign enjoy boundless longevity, towering like the mountains; may their sagely grace flow abundantly, vast as the deep seas. May all regions submit in harmony, and the eight directions shine with clarity. May the three luminaries follow their courses in the primordial heavens, and the hundred grains flourish throughout the land. May borders know no war, and customs resound with songs of praise. May the world attain great peace, and all beings fulfill their natures. May this extend to all, whether hidden or manifest, sinking or submerged, that together they may ascend the steps of the true and reach the shore of blessings.

May the *Heavenly Worthy’s* choice to broadly deliver accord with our humble submission, and may our sincerity in devotion be met below. We respectfully make this known.

We now invoke:
First, the harmonious union of heaven and earth;
Second, the steadfast brightness of sun and moon;
Third, the orderly succession of yin and yang;
Fourth, the peace of the realm;
Fifth, the flourishing fortune of the emperor;
Sixth, the loyalty and integrity of ministers;
Seventh, the well-being of the myriad people;
Eighth, the abundance of the hundred grains;
Ninth, the liberation of the suffering in the dark paths;
Tenth, the flourishing of the Great Dao.

We replenish the incense burner.
O *Incense Official Messengers*, *Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger*, and all *Spirit Officials* attendant upon the incense, may this place where we perform the Dao naturally generate golden elixir, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms. May the hundred spirits and host of Perfected gather here before the incense burner. O jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions, attend the fragrant smoke and convey our supplications, transmitting them directly to the presence of the *Most True and Boundless Dao*, the *Jade Emperor* upon his throne.

We bow three times.
*Exiting the Hall Chant*

illumine and prepare the divine palace.
Then exit the chamber,
the right armrest first.

*Supervising the Fast and Rectifying Errors*

*The Second Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites*

**Midday Procession of the Dao**
*Entering the Chamber*
Each bows to the Master,
visualizing as prescribed.

*Guardian Spirits*
The hymn resounds through the empty void,
the Celestial Lord guards the altar.
The Five Emperors review the records,
receiving talismans from the Three Officials.
The four gates are secured,
binding demons and expelling treachery.
Flying bells and cast fire
purify and burn away defilement.
The body bears the Golden Script,
refining the elixir and the mushroom countenance.
Mysterious emptiness unites with purity,
the heart stirs the Three Passes.
Riding dragons and mounting cranes,
controlling horned serpents and riding simurghs.
The stars guard their stations,
a thousand demons dare not intrude.
The Dao-qi abides eternally,
the myriad immortals forever at peace.

*Sounding the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times*
O Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, Three Qi, Supreme Lord Lao:
Summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Official Messengers, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the thirty-six Fragrant Officials of the Five Emperors and the Direct Day—let them emerge.
Now summon the local Earth Gods and Territorial True Officials to swiftly open the gates.
We now burn incense and offer it on behalf of so-and-so official, so-and-so person, for state and family, having established the Supreme Yellow Register Great Fast for so many days and nights.
May we receive the life-qi of the Supreme Ten Directions’ True and Upright Ones, flowing down into our bodies, that our supplications swiftly reach the presence of the Most True and Boundless Dao, the Jade Emperor upon his throne.

*Each declares their Dharma rank:*
Disciples of the Mysterious Capital of Supreme Purity, we, so-and-so, with one heart offer this to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous Origin, the Boundless Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Great Saintly Ancestor, the Highest Lord of the Golden Portal of the Mysterious Origin Heavenly Emperor, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Supreme Elder, the Most High Mysterious Elder, the Great Sage Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Lords and Elders, the Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors, the Jade Void Emperor, the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern True, the Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Portal, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity, Supreme Palace, Numinous Treasure, Supreme Clarity, Radiant Sovereign Dao Lord, the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center, the officials of the Three Realms, and all true numina.

We have heard that the Perfect Dao is all-pervading,
the celestial perfected broadly save.
They bestow teachings beyond the subtle and profound,
fusing spirit before the workings of creation.

Encompassing the ten thousand existents to shape and mold,
guiding the Three Vehicles to initiate and instruct.
The sages bequeath their models,
the superior scholars diligently cultivate.
Assisting the state in transforming the people,
compassion is their foundation.
Your servant has relied upon the wondrous and subtle,
presumptuously bearing the true and orthodox.
Though faults accumulate like hills and mountains,
merits remain no more than dust or dew.
Truly, one ought to reflect and examine,
to discipline and cultivate oneself.
Yet at the outset of receiving the Dharma,
at the beginning of the covenant’s proclamation,
the Mysterious Regulations stipulate:
salvation of beings comes first.
All that is invoked and entreated
should properly be reported above.
Moreover, in following the imperial decree,
how dare I not make this known on high?

Reading the decree:
In accordance with the imperial command,
earnestly and reverently cultivating devotion.
For the state and for the family,
encompassing both the living and the deceased.
Respectfully following the ritual statutes,
devoutly establishing the altar.
Lighting lamps and burning incense,
reciting scriptures and performing the Dao-circumambulation.
Hoping that through sincere devotion,
we may attain resonance and communion.

Now, at the midpoint of the Dao-circumambulation,
as the first incense is offered,
we return body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao.
Your servants prostrate ourselves,
returning life to the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High.
May these merits first benefit the ancestral temples and the altars of soil and grain.
May the august spirits repose in tranquility,
as jade-pure auspiciousness flows from the Jade Clarity.
May the precious mandate of the Two Modes endure,
and the myriad states flourish in eternal harmony.
May the emperor who pays homage to the ancestral court
succeed the sagely Yu and Tang,
following in the footsteps of Xuan and Huang.
May his longevity extend to the Northern Culmen,
his reign endure as long as the boundless heavens.
May the empress, imperial consorts, and princes
assist in perfecting his enlightened transformation.
May worthy ministers and sagacious aides
uphold and protect his grand designs.
May weapons be sheathed and sashes hang long,
as the Dao’s fortune flourishes and prospers.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Master and Venerable Ones, whose virtue is most perfect. Having attained the Dao, they ascend into the formless, merging with the Dao in truth.

At this midpoint of the ritual procession, offering this second pinch of incense, we dedicate body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao. With heads bowed to the earth, we take refuge in the Most High Venerable Scriptures. May these merits flow to the ancestral spirits of the nine generations of the patron’s household, and to the sevenfold hidden consciousness of the departed. May they transcend the nether courts and wander the azure heavens; ascend beyond the cold halls and shed their forms in the cinnabar mounds.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Master and Venerable Ones, whose virtue is most perfect. Having attained the Dao, they ascend into the formless, merging with the Dao in truth.

As the sun declines in the ritual procession, offering this third pinch of incense, we dedicate body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao. With heads bowed to the earth, we take refuge in the Three Masters Most High. May these merits extend to all beings, universally reaching those with consciousness. May all transcend dullness and ignorance, each attaining union with the true and correct. May the ninefold kin of the patron’s household renew their blessed fortune and bear the divine efficacy. May longevity and prosperity flourish within, while calamities and misfortunes cease without. May the three paths and nine nights, the six destinies and four modes of birth, together bathe in the mysterious grace and universally receive the true protection.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Master and Venerable Ones, whose virtue is most perfect. Having attained the Dao, they ascend into the formless, merging with the Dao in truth.

We now perform the rites of the directions and make confession.

**Procession of the Void**

Treading the cloud-net in circling steps, we ride the void to walk the mystic record.
Chanting and intoning the honor of the One Emperor,
the hundred passages regulate themselves.
Below, we command the lads of the Eight Seas;
above, we escort the lofty immortals.
The heavens scatter fragrant blossoms,
and a numinous wind arises, serene.
The root of destiny is fixed by past vows,
thus we ascend to high emulation.
Rejoicing before the Most High,
even ten thousand kalpas are but the beginning.

**Threefold Invocation**
**Three Bows**

We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Most High and Boundless Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Titles**

Disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mystic Capital, your servants [Names] once more proclaim and address:
the Most High and Boundless Dao, the Perfected and True;
the Most Exalted Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures, the Celestial Worthies;
the Perfected Thearchs and Heavenly Emperors;
the Jade Assistants, Supreme Ministers, and the Perfected of the Four Poles;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
and all the true numina within and beyond the Three Realms.

We, who have planted causes through kalpas uncounted and transmitted blessings through ages untold,
have by great fortune encountered the wondrous transformation and been privileged to enter the Dharma-gate.
We have perused the true scriptures and delved into the sacred intent.
We have learned that to invoke the Perfected and summon the Sages, one must establish merit—
assisting the state and aiding the times, as is fitting, by propagating the transformation.
We proclaim the essential Dao and extol the mystic ordinances,
observing purification to reach the true numina, and cultivating sincerity to pray for blessings and protection.

Now, the patron [Name], resolved in devotion and cultivation,
hopes to attract auspicious omens. We pour forth our earnest pleas before the Mystic Altar,
with minds stilled in the Purple Palace.
May the Heavenly Worthies, the Great Sages, and the host of Perfected Ones above
receive our reverence and bestow blessings in abundance.
May the imperial plan endure, the sagely reign extend far;
may cultural patterns unite and all vessels converge.
May the stars and constellations keep their measure, wind and rain come in season.
May weapons of war not rise, and blessings and felicity gather in full.
May the chief ministers and worthy aides, extending to the eight directions, enjoy long lives;
may the inner screens and outer bulwarks, together with the Nine Rivers, channel forth fortune.
May the radiance of the Shun-sun shine forth, clouds ascend the Yao-steps.
May rain and dew bathe the nine lands, and auspicious favor spread to the ten thousand states.
May the patron’s household, both seen and unseen, receive grace, the living and the dead all find peace.
May the jade calendar be opened to add years, the golden register continued to record good deeds.
May the six relations dwell in harmony, all excellences converge.
Extending below to the Three Paths, and encompassing all beings,
in the realm of the long night’s cold court, within the Fengdu hells,
may they behold the compassionate light of the Most High and bathe in the Dharma-power of the Heavenly Perfected.
May all together receive deliverance and emerge from darkness and sinking.
May the moving and crawling beings, the flying and hidden creatures of diverse natures,
have the Dao-wind spread afar and the beneficent rain universally moisten.
May all attain peace and tranquility, and ascend to the realm of longevity.
Above, may the Heavenly Worthies’ vast salvific work be made manifest;
below, may our servants’ devotion in taking refuge be answered.

**Vows**

First vow: May the Great Dao abide in tranquil emptiness,
dwelling in serene stillness, clarity, and purity.
May the Dharma-gates be widely opened to instruct the stubborn,
all receiving the grace of beneficence and cultivating with diligence.
May those who study together universally ascend to the void,
preserving the Dao in harmony with Heaven, ever abiding in primordial care.

Second vow: May the various heavens congeal qi in limpid clarity,
their vast emptiness broadly covering, preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the seasons be regulated, the four movements harmonious.
May the state be secure and the people prosperous, the world universally at peace.
May all be broadly saved, grace extending to all beings.
May the kalpa be preserved long, enduring through countless kalpas without decline.

Third vow: May the earth’s covering and bearing be without end,
stable and unshaken, seas and abysses not collapsing.
May it protect and guard the household and state, the myriad people flourishing in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead find peace, grace pervading the ten directions.
May crops and plants flourish, enterprises daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant bearing, the ten thousand kinds all following.

Fourth vow: May the two luminaries of sun and moon shine brightly on high,
without comets or eclipses, their waxing and waning peaceful and clear.
May their light illumine the heavens, penetrating and dispelling darkness.
May the kalpa’s destiny be secured, the world’s reign harmonious.
May they universally bestow moisture, grace showering upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations shine with the sun’s brilliance,
their revolving torches illuminating, brightly reflecting the ten directions.
May each keep to its place, their warp and weft proceeding straight.
May they protect and guard the household and state, without calamity or harm.
May the four seas be at peace as one, the world universally flourish.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons proceed in accord with their nodes,
their qi harmonious and regulated, without calamity or misfortune.
May pestilence and poison be extinguished, the world universally at peace.
May the five grains ripen abundantly, the state be rich and the people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds congeal qi and gather mist,
soaring high and limpid, shading the profound and mysterious.
Concealing wealth without action, when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals dwell together, befriending the host of Perfected Ones.
May grace flow to all, loving the people and benefiting the state.
May all beings be universally saved, humanity sharing the kalpa’s years.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and scatter without end,
universally bestowing their release, receiving their flourishing.
May the ten thousand things grow abundantly, the state’s stores and people’s wealth abound.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks each secure their direction,
lofty and encompassing, long serving as immortal palaces.
May they secure the state’s destiny, preserving Heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none not looking up in reverence.

Tenth vow: May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless,
containing and embracing, expansive and broad, nurturing even the smallest.
Profound and gentle, their moisture extending to all that wriggles and breathes.
May Heaven and humanity receive blessings, their years equaling the kalpa’s stone.

Eleventh vow: May the imperial lands of kings and states daily prosper,
the four guards at peace, weapons of war not raised.
May Heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious responses come flying.
May teachings be widely spread, majestic transformations overflowing and auspicious.
May the myriad people rejoice, their joy unending.

Twelfth vow: May the crawling and flying, the moving and stirring,
whether already born or yet to be born,
all receive safety, universally attaining life and growth.
May all behold the primordial qi and receive the forms of yang.
May grasses and trees, fruits and groves, not wither through winter.
May all be delivered, none not flourishing and glorious.

Harmonizing with the Dao, uniting with the True.

**Replenishing the Censer**

May the Fragrant Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attendant Fragrant Spirits ensure that where this Dao-practitioner treads, golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs naturally arise. May the hundred numinous perfected ones gather here, assembling before the incense burner. May the disciple of the fast, so-and-so, whether living or deceased, receive blessings, and may the hidden and manifest alike be graced with favor.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions guard the incense smoke, swiftly conveying the petitions just uttered directly to the presence of the Most High Jade Emperor of the Boundless True Dao.

**First Day: Twilight Procession of the Dao**
*Entering the chamber*

Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guarding Spirits**
Divine radiance shines brightly, auspicious qi swirls like rain.
The Dipper and Ladle gleam pure, the mushroom hall stands serene.
Jade eyes and golden perfected ones— the precious altar is wholly yang.
Night transformed to day, the hour reversed to noon.
Mount Tai streams with color, the vermilion phoenix soars in circles.
Demons stilled, treachery destroyed, one strides through auspicious mist.
Heavenly perfected gather as one, all arriving before the Emperor.
The dharma drum sounds twenty-four times.

**Invocation of the Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, the Most High Lord Lao**

The Most High Lord Lao of the Three Qi of the Mysterious Primordial Three Heavens summons forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officials, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Incense Officials of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Direct Days—thirty-six of each—commanding them to emerge. Let the local earth deities and domain spirits, the true officials and upright gods of this place, swiftly unseal the passes and present themselves.

We now burn incense in this very moment, offering it on behalf of such-and-such an official, such-and-such a person, for the state and for the family, as we undertake the Most High Yellow Register Grand Fast for so many days and nights. Today, on the first day, at twilight, we ascend the altar, burn incense, and perform the Dao-procession. May we receive the life-generating qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions’ Upright Perfected Ones, descending and flowing into our bodies, so that the sincerity of our petition may swiftly reach the presence of the August Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Boundless Dao of the Utmost True.

Each declares their dharma rank:

Disciples of the Supreme Clarity Mysterious Capital, we, your servants, with one heart offer this petition to the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Commencement of the Void and Spontaneous, the Boundless Dao, the Most High Lord of the Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the August Jade Emperor on High, the Great Sage Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the True Lords and Masters of the Myriad Realms, the Thirty-Six Heavenly Lords, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, the Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Watchtower, Seven-Treasured Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace, the Perfected August Sovereign of Numinous Treasure, the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center, the Supreme Minister of the Eastern Marchmount, the True Lord of Life and Destiny, the King of Total Perfection of the Western Culmen, the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lesser Teaching, the divine immortals who have attained the Dao in the named mountains and grotto-heavens, and all responsive and perceptive true numina of the Three Realms.

By fortunate karmic causes, we have personally encountered the transformation of the Dao. Through the guidance of master and disciple, we have gained entry into the dharma gate.

Clutching scriptures and talismans, we uphold and cultivate precepts and registers.
Yet unable to concentrate the spirit, we nurture our resolve in forests and valleys.
Mists and rosy clouds drift by, time lingers in stillness.
In the bustle of court and market, we secretly seek the sutras’ purport, taking salvation of beings as foremost.
For all who turn their hearts in devotion, it is fitting to report in memorial.
We, mere vessels of your edict, dare not but make this known above.

Reading the petition:
As the words declare, the sentiment and principle are sincere and earnest.
Turning hearts toward the Ten Poles, we bow our heads to the myriad heavens.
Hoping to establish an altar for purification, to exalt blessings and felicity.
We, your servants, humbly join hands and follow the prescribed rites and rituals.
We initiate the Daoist sanctuary, inviting the descent of perfected sages and sacred beings.
Devoted to the performance of the Yellow Register Wondrous Purification, each of us directs our cinnabar hearts upward, beseeching the mysterious protection of the Dao.

On this day, as the setting sun moves and the Dao is practiced, we now perform the first offering of incense, dedicating body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao.
We prostrate our heads to the earth, surrendering our lives to the Three August Ones on High.
May these merits and virtues ascend to benefit the ancestral temples and forebears.
May the present emperor’s jade chart endure as long as the earth, his precious throne as long as the heavens.
May sun and moon shine with equal brightness, mountains and rivers enjoy equal longevity.
May the heir apparent, consorts, and empresses be sagely and divine;
may the myriad officials and ministers be both cultured and martial.
May weapons of war forever fall silent, and pernicious evils never arise.
May the Four Seas be at peace, and the ten thousand regions come to offer tribute.

Now we kindle incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Masters, in their perfect and true virtue, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, uniting with the Dao in truth.

As the sun sets and the Dao is practiced, we now perform the second offering of incense, dedicating body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao. We prostrate our heads to the earth, surrendering our lives to the Most August Sacred Scriptures. May these merits and virtues flow to the ancestral spirits of the ritual sponsor’s family—seven generations of hidden souls and nine lineages of lingering consciousness. May they ascend to the realm of the living spirits and refine their souls in the Southern Palace. May they bear the transformative power of yang’s radiance and attain the wondrous subtlety of yin’s lingering form. May the divine elixir bathe and cleanse them, and may the Dao’s qi nourish and suffuse them. May those now living receive blessings and protection, wandering carefree and at ease.

Now we kindle incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Masters, in their perfect and true virtue, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, uniting with the Dao in truth.

As the sun sets and the Dao is practiced, we now perform the third offering of incense, dedicating body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao. We prostrate our heads to the earth, surrendering our lives to the Three August Masters. May these merits and virtues flow to all sentient beings under heaven and all living creatures on earth. May all together be bathed in the fragrance of cultivation and each attain their rightful place. May the ritual sponsor’s own family and kin be untroubled by calamity or decline, their transgressions and faults dissolving of themselves. May their official emoluments and lifespan be prolonged, and may fortune and felicity gather abundantly.

Now we kindle incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Masters, in their perfect and true virtue, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, uniting with the Dao in truth.

We now perform the rites and offer repentance.

**Fascicle Four of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat*
Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting
Second Day: Dawn Dao Procession**

**Entering the Chamber**
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

The Five Stars cast their empty radiance,
Illuminating the divine courtyard with splendor.

**Pacing the Void**

Mud and the Nine Caverns reveal bright visions,
Thus attaining the Golden Flower Immortal.
The Demon Kings respectfully receive their charge,

All begins with fasting and precepts,
Piling merit to bind past-life affinities.
Soaring through the Great Void,

Extending to this very body, kin, and affines,

May the people praise the Great Peace,
The four barbarians submit in awe.

Sages and worthies be born daily.

Third aspiration: For the Dharma Master, may great merit and virtue be established.
May their teachings be clear and far-reaching,
All attaining the flight of immortals.

Fourth aspiration: For fellow practitioners of the same aspiration.
May they swiftly attain the immortal Dao,
Mutually aiding and delivering one another.

Fifth aspiration: For the ninefold kin to live in harmony,
Esteeming benevolence and righteousness,

Their conduct a model for all beings.

May all people under heaven
Each find their rightful place.

Seventh aspiration: For the wriggling and crawling,
All sentient beings,
May they universally attain completion.

Eighth aspiration: For the pardoning of past-life offenses.
May the sins of this life be redressed through merit,
Establishing virtue to compensate for faults.

Ninth aspiration: For the prosperity of family and nation.
May the ancestral temples have heirs,
Generations give rise to worthy talent.

Tenth aspiration: For reverently receiving the scriptures and teachers,
Never daring to slacken in equanimity.
With one mind, broadly delivering all,
May they attain the rank of upper immortals,
Ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
Bow before the Most High,
Forever become perfected ones,
Riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages,
In harmony and union with the Dao in truth.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds congeal qi and gather mist. May they soar high and become clear, shading the mysterious and profound. When hidden, they are without action; when dispersed, they fill the heavens. May immortals and transcendents dwell together, forming friendships with the host of perfected. May beneficence flow to all, loving the state and cherishing the people. May all beings be universally saved, humanity enduring kalpas together.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without limit. May they universally bestow and release, receiving their flourishing. May the myriad things flourish, the state’s stores and the people’s abundance increase.

Ninth vow: May the Five Marchmounts each abide in their proper place. May they tower majestically, containing and concealing, forever serving as immortal palaces. May they secure the state’s destiny, preserving Heaven without end. May they protect and deliver all, none not looking up in reverence.

Tenth vow: May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless. May they contain and embrace, expansive and broad, nurturing even the smallest. May their depths be profound and their kindness gentle, moistening all that wriggles and breathes. May Heaven and humanity protect and bless, their years enduring like kalpic stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor’s state daily flourish. May the Four Quarters be peaceful and harmonious, weapons of war not raised. May Heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious responses arriving in flight. May teachings be widely disseminated, majestic transformations overflowing. May the myriad people rejoice, eternal joy without end.

Twelfth vow: May the crawling and flying, the moving and stirring, those already born and those yet to be born, all receive safety and universally attain life. May all see the primordial qi and receive the forms of yang. May grasses and trees, fruits and forests endure winter without withering. May all be delivered and saved, none not flourishing and radiant.

To bestow alms upon Daoist priests and the hungry and cold.
May all people under heaven
Each find their rightful place.

Seventh resolve: For crawling and creeping beings,
May all sentient beings
Be perfected and accomplished.

Eighth resolve: To pardon past lives’ karmic retributions in this present existence,
To establish merit and redress transgressions.

Ninth resolve: For the prosperity of family and state,
May ancestral temples have descendants,
The world produce worthy talent.

Tenth resolve: To honor and receive the scriptural masters,
Never daring to slacken in equanimity.
With one heart, broadly deliver all,
Attain the rank of superior immortals,
Ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
Pay homage to the Supreme,
Eternally become perfected beings,
Riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages.
Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

**Third Day: Midday Procession of the Dao**

[Entering the chamber]
Each pays homage to the master, contemplating the visualization as prescribed.

**Guarding the Spirits**
The Primordial Sovereign of the Void, gathering qi, abides at the center.
The Three Realms stretch into profound obscurity,
Giving rise to the vault of heaven.
Seven revolutions and nine voids,
Merging with the whirling winds.
Transforming into ten thousand spirits,
Heaven and earth open and connect.
On this auspicious day, the procession of the Dao proceeds,
Myriad demons pay reverent homage.
The radiance of dawn shines brightly,
Silently enacting the primal work.

Holding the staff and raising the banner,
Scattering flowers into the vast sky.
The ten directions universally rejoice,
The kalpas’ turning knows no end.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

The Most High Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Venerable Lord Lao, summon forth from within us, our thirty-six attendants of the Three and Five Merit Officers, the left and right official messengers, the left and right incense-bearing dragon-riding couriers, the Golden Lads attending incense, the Jade Maidens transmitting words, and the thirty-six incense officials of the Five Thearchs’ direct registers and appointed days. Let the local earth deities and territorial true officials swiftly emerge to open the passes.

We now, in this very moment, burn incense and perform the Dao-procession, dedicating it to such-and-such an official or such-and-such a person, for the state and for the household, in the offering of the Most High Yellow Register Grand Fast for so many days and nights. On this third day’s midday ascent to the altar to pay homage to the Perfected and perform the Dao-procession, may we receive the life-generating qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions’ true and correct Perfected, descending into our bodies, that our prayers swiftly ascend and directly reach the presence of the Jade Thearch of the Supreme Dao, the Limitless Great Dao.

Each declares their dharma-rank:

Disciples of the Mysterious Capital of Supreme Purity, we, so-and-so and others, reverently and with unified sincerity, address the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous, the Limitless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Highest August Thearch of the Golden Watchtower, the Mysterious Primordial Heavenly Sovereign, the Supreme Venerable Lord Lao, the Highest Jade Thearch, the great holy and perfected hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Lords, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Florescence and Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous and Northern Perfected, the Mysterious Capital and Jade Metropolis, the Golden Watchtower and Seven-Jewel Mysterious Terrace, the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure’s Perfected Radiant August Lord of the Dao, the thirty-six divisions of the venerable scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the True Lord of Life and Minister of the Eastern Marchmount, the King of Total Perfection of the Western Ultimate, the twenty-four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lesser Teaching, the numinous palaces of the Five Marchmounts, the grotto-heavens of the famous mountains, and the perfected transcendents of the Three Realms who respond to invocations.

We prostrate and have heard: the Supreme Dao is profoundly empty, its mysterious workings congeal in stillness. It embraces the ten thousand images, nurtures the hundred spirits. Its grace extends to the living and the dead, its benevolence embraces household and state. By the kindness of masters and companions, we have received transmission of the utmost Perfected. We ought to assist the state in establishing merit, delivering people and rescuing beings. In all our prayers and supplications, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
In accordance with the petition’s intent, we earnestly cultivate reverence. We repay the nurturing kindness of heaven and earth, reciprocate the beneficent gifts of the state. Above, we dedicate this to the nine generations; broadly, we extend it to all beings. We offer jade disks to express our sincerity, prepare incense and flowers to demonstrate our faith. Our minds are solely devoted and pure, hoping to attain resonance and communion.

We reverently follow the Yellow Register’s scriptural texts and the numinous transcendents’ ritual codes. We concentrate our spirits at the cinnabar watchtower, contemplate the Purple Tenuity in profound meditation. We arrange the altar’s array, turn our hearts to entreat the mandate. We humbly pray that the ninefold radiance may shine from afar, that the ten thousand sages may bestow their compassion. May they take pity on and witness our sincere devotion, broadly bestowing vast blessings.

On this midday performance of the Dao-procession, we, the assembly of dharma-practitioners, now offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the sky, directly offering reverence to the Most High and Utmost Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Supreme. May this merit, above, benefit the august spirits of the nine ancestral temples and the ancestral sages of the imperial lineage. May they ascend to the Jade Watchtower of Primordial Purity, shed their forms in the Jasper Palace. May the Emperor’s virtue extend to the eight seas, his longevity equal the Five Marchmounts. May his precious chart grow ever more secure, his jade calendar ever more prolonged. May the consorts and six palaces receive the splendor of Hua and divine protection. May the princes and crown princes be blessed with extended years. May the marquises, earls, dukes, ministers, and worthy assistants assist in perfecting the sagely transformation, aiding and supporting the imperial enterprise.

Now, therefore, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Master Venerables, whose virtue is most perfect. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

At this midpoint of the ritual, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer this second pinch of incense. May its fragrant smoke rise to the heavens, directly ascending to make offering to the Supreme and Most Perfect Sutra-Treasure. We prostrate ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Supreme. May this merit flow back to the nine generations of ancestors and all departed spirits of such-and-such a family. May their records of transgression be stricken from the registers of Fengdu, their souls refined in the Southern Flame. Calamities dissolve across kalpas, forever transcending the realm of the Five Sufferings; sins vanish without end, opening the path to deliverance from the Four Delusions. Those who suffer in the cold courts of night shall all behold the radiant light.

Now, therefore, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Master Venerables, whose virtue is most perfect. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

At this midpoint of the ritual, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer this third pinch of incense. May its fragrant smoke rise to the heavens, directly ascending to make offering to the Supreme and Most Perfect Master-Treasure. We prostrate ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Supreme. May this merit confer blessings upon such-and-such a family and all their kin. May their years be inscribed on the Tortoise Terrace, their longevity extended in the Phoenix Register. The clouds of the Five Turbidities disperse, the mists of the Four Demons vanish. Blessings extend without limit, misfortunes cease before they take form. May it extend to all beings, encompassing every sentient existence. May all escape the fruits of samsara, ascending together to the realm of wealth and longevity.

Now, therefore, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Master Venerables, whose virtue is most perfect. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

We complete the rites and make our repentance.

**The Hymn of Pacing the Void**

We array our Nine-Dragon Chariot,
Riding the void in carefree flight.
The Eight Heavens lie like palm and fingers,
The Six Directions—how could they be distant?
The host of perfected ones chant the Mystic Profound,
The Most High sings the pure hymn.
Incense and blossoms scatter on the wind,
Jade tones ascend to form the Purple Empyrean.
The Five Sufferings shatter in an instant,
The Eight Difficulties dissolve like sparse scripture.
Wondrous is the Garden of Numinous Treasure,
Raising this great Dharma Bridge.

Master and disciple open the path to salvation,

Let the nine generations of ancestral spirits

Awakening to the Dao, hearing the scriptures,

May [Name]’s family, kin, and relations

May heaven spare them from exile and conscription,

In the hells of Mount Feng,
At the gates of Mount Tai’s Yellow Springs,
May lawsuits not arise,
May blessings and descendants know peace.
Above, may wind and rain be bright and clear,
Sun and moon steadfast in their splendor.
May heaven display auspicious stars,
May people be free from plague and blight.
May the sagely reign endure,
The great enterprise flourish.
May the hundred grains ripen in abundance,

May the times be harmonious, customs prosperous,

In the Nine Nights and Three Paths,

**Petitioning the Vows**

First vow: May the Great Dao
Abide in tranquil emptiness,
Dwelling in serene stillness,
Clearing all to reside in purity.
May it widely open the gates of Dharma,
Instructing the stubborn and foolish.
All shall receive its beneficent grace,
Cultivating diligently with devotion.
May all fellow students
Together ascend to the void,
Preserving harmony with heaven,
Abiding forever without sorrow.

Second vow: May the myriad heavens
Congeal qi in clarity,
Vast and boundless in their embrace,
Preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the climate be harmonious,
The four seasons balanced in peace.
May the nation be secure, the people prosperous,
The world universally at peace.
May all be broadly delivered,
The beneficence reach all beings.
May heaven be preserved for eternity,
Unshaken through kalpas uncounted.

Third vow: May the earth
Bear its boundless load,
Stable and unshaken,
Seas and abysses uncollapsed.
May it protect and secure the nation,
The multitudes flourishing in accord.
Nurturing life, comforting the dead,
Its grace extending to the ten directions.
May crops and plants thrive,
Commerce and enterprise daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant support,
All things following in harmony.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon,
The two luminaries, shine on high,
Free from eclipse or dimming,
Their waxing and waning serene.
May their light illumine the heavens,
Dispelling all darkness and gloom.
May they safeguard the kalpas’ passage,
The world’s destiny peaceful.
May their moistening grace be universal,
Bestowing blessings upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars
Shine with brilliance equal to the sun,
Their revolving torches illuminating,
Radiant across the ten directions.
May each hold its proper place,
Their paths straight and true.
May they protect and secure the nation,
Free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be united in peace,
The world universally flourishing.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons
Follow their appointed course,
Their climates harmonious and balanced,
Free from disaster or affliction.
May pestilence and plague vanish,
The world universally at peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance,
Nation wealthy, people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds
Congeal qi and gather mist,
Soaring high and settling in clarity,
Shading the profound and mysterious.
In concealment, they abide in non-action,
In dispersion, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and perfected ones dwell together,
Forming friendships with the host of transcendents.
May their grace flow to all,
Nurturing the nation and cherishing the people.
May they broadly deliver all beings,
People and kalpas sharing longevity.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain
Flow and scatter without end,
Universally bestowing their bounty,
Nurturing all growth.
May the myriad things flourish,
Nation’s stores and people’s wealth abundant.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks
Each abide in its proper place,
Towering and encompassing,
Ever serving as palaces of immortals.
May they secure the nation’s destiny,
Preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all,
None who do not revere them as their foundation.

Tenth vow: May the vast seas
Stretch boundlessly,
Containing and embracing all,
Nurturing even the tiniest life.
Profound and gentle in their grace,
Moistening all crawling and creeping things.
May heaven and humanity receive blessings,
Their years enduring like the kalpas’ stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor
See his lands daily prosper,
The four frontiers at peace,
Weapons of war stilled.
May heaven and humanity sing in praise,
Auspicious omens soaring forth.
May teachings be widely spread,
Transformative virtue overflowing.
May the multitudes rejoice,
Their joy unending.

Twelfth vow: May all crawling and creeping things,
Born and unborn,
All receive safety,
Universally attain life and growth.
May they all behold the primal qi,
Assuming forms of sinew and bone.
May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests
Not wither through winter.
May all be delivered,
None not flourishing in fresh glory.

Harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

with reverent sincerity, humbly re-invoke and supplicate:
the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning;
the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
the Supreme Lord Lao;
