Now, therefore, we kindle incense and take refuge in the Master, the Venerable Assembly, and the virtue of the Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

The rite is complete; we repent.

Three Invocations, Three Bows

Prosperous is the realm, flourishing the state;
Majestic the scriptures, the Dao’s teachings rise.
Heaven and humankind share one aspiration,
In misty vastness, they enter the Great Vehicle.
From the heart, the field of blessings is established,
The Wheel of Dharma ascends, boundless and grand.
Seven generations ascend to celestial halls,
While this body soars in the light of day.

We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reiterating the Dharma Titles:
Disciple of the Three Luminaries of the Great Cavern of the Mystic Capital, Supreme Master of the Three Caverns,
Your servant [Name] respectfully invokes once more the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning;
The Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
The Supreme Lord Lao;
The hosts of sagely and virtuous beings of the Boundless Dao and Power in the ten directions;
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
The Heavenly Master, Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
The High Ministers, High Chancellors, High Protectors, High Tutors;
The Four Directors and Five Emperors;
All the divine officials and revered spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that the Dao’s workings unfold,
And the true scriptures spread their transforming influence.
The luminous precepts and wondrous teachings
Awaken those in the heavens and the human realm;
The sacred registers and marvelous texts
Are proclaimed to those in darkness and stagnation.
Thus, the Three Vehicles and Three Caverns
Guide the lost and grieving to return;
The dragon scripts and phoenix writings
Assist the state and bring forth blessings.
With profound sincerity and responsive resonance,
The empty chamber connects to the true.
All rests in utmost devotion,
To honor and receive divine grace.

Reverently considering the Great Dao,
It silently aids the Emperor’s work.
The Emperor, in his official capacity, encounters obscurity and adversity,
Yet his compassionate concern runs deep.
To dispel and resolve these, he seeks to preserve purity and peace.
Offering dragon jades, incense, flowers, and patterned silks as ritual tokens,
He establishes a fast and erects an altar.
We, your servants, undeservingly hold office in the Mystic Bureau,
And reverently receive the enlightened command.
Following the ritual codes and forms,
We earnestly invoke the true spirits.
Burning incense and lighting lamps,
We illuminate the darkest nights.
Above, they shine upon the halls of blessings;
Below, they open the courts of the unseen and benighted.
For [Name], we repent and offer gratitude for the living and the dead,
Reconciling karmic adversaries.
For so many days and nights,
We perform the Dao and recite the scriptures.
We repent for the nine generations and seven lineages,
For past lives and the present existence.
For transgressions in the unseen and manifest realms,
For faults and flaws in life and death.
For malevolent karmic ties and the roots of sin,
For past debts and ancient enmities.
For the nine palaces and eight trigrams,
For the three destinies and five phases.
For the dark and bright stars,
For boundless calamities and misfortunes.
Through this prayer and repentance,
We beseech their complete eradication.
May the ancestral spirits ascend,
And accumulated faults be pardoned.
May misfortune dissolve with repentance,
And fortune follow wishes to arrive.
May a hundred blessings suffuse,
And a thousand disasters be cleansed.
May official emoluments and blessings be renewed,
And years of life extended.
Ever serving the sagely court,
Above, repaying the Emperor’s grace;
Below, may the two forces maintain their purity,
And the three luminaries radiate splendor.
May the five planets follow their courses,
And the eight winds harmonize.
May the precious chart stand firm,
And the sagely reign endure.
Surpassing the ways of emperors and kings,
Pacifying the nine regions and purifying the myriad states.
May the six palaces and hundred offices
Proclaim virtue within and beyond.
May the Crown Prince and the various princes
Assist with wisdom and sagacity.
May the years be free of pestilence,
And the people sing in praise.
May the world know great peace,
And all beings fulfill their nature.
In the depths of the darkest nights,
Whether moving or still, flying or sinking,
May all share in the merit of this repentance and gratitude,
And together awaken to the Dao of mystic communion.
Above, may the Heavenly Venerable’s vast grace of deliverance be manifest;
Below, may our repentance and gratitude be sincere.
Respectfully, we make this invocation known.

**Vows**

First Vow:
May the Great Dao be serene and formless,
Abiding in tranquility and emptiness,
In clarity and stillness, dwelling in purity.
May the gates of the Dharma be widely opened,
To instruct the stubborn and foolish.
May all receive its beneficent grace,
And through diligent cultivation,
Join the ranks of fellow learners,
Together ascending to the void,
Preserving harmony with heaven,
And abiding in eternal peace.

Second Vow:
May the various heavens
Condense their qi and attain clarity.
In the vast expanse, they shelter and protect,
Preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the qi and seasons be harmonized,
And the four movements be at peace.
May the state be secure and the people prosperous,
And all under heaven enjoy tranquility.
May all beings be universally delivered,
And the grace extend to all that lives.
May the heavens be preserved,
And endure for countless kalpas unshaken.

Third Vow:
May the earth
Bear its boundless load.
May it remain stable and unshaken,
And the seas not collapse.
May it protect and secure the state,
And the myriad people flourish.
May it nurture life and bring peace in death,
Extending its grace to the ten directions.
May crops and plants thrive,
And enterprises daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant support,
And the myriad beings follow.

Fourth Vow:
May the sun and moon,
The two luminaries, shine brightly.
Free from eclipses and obscurations,
Their waxing and waning be serene.
May their light illuminate the heavens,
Dispelling all darkness.
May they safeguard the kalpas,
And the world’s destiny know peace.
May their beneficence be universally bestowed,
And all beings receive their grace.

Fifth Vow:
May the stars
Shine with the brilliance of the sun.
Revolving and illuminating,
They brightly reflect the ten directions.
May each remain in its proper place,
Following their celestial paths.
May they protect and secure the state,
Free from calamity and harm.
May the four seas be at peace,
And all under heaven prosper.

Sixth Vow:
May the four seasons
Follow their cycles in due order.
May the climates be harmonious,
Free from disasters and afflictions.
May plagues and poisons vanish,
And all under heaven know peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance,
And the state be rich, the people joyful.

Seventh Vow:
May the floating clouds
Condense their qi and gather their mists.
Soaring high and settling,
They shade the profound and mysterious.
In concealment, they act without effort;
When dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together,
Forming friendships with the hosts of perfected beings.
May their grace flow to all,
Bringing prosperity to the state and love to the people.
May all beings be universally delivered,
And humanity endure through the kalpas.

Eighth Vow:
May wind and rain
Flow and descend without end.
Universally bestowed,
They nourish and bring forth growth.
May the myriad things flourish,
And the state’s stores and people’s wealth abound.

Ninth Vow:
May the Five Peaks
Each remain in its proper place.
Towering and encompassing,
They stand as eternal abodes of immortals.
May they secure the state’s destiny,
And protect the heavens without end.
May they deliver and shield all,
And all look up to them in reverence.

Tenth Vow:
May the rivers and seas
Flow boundlessly and without limit.
Vast and embracing,
No creature is too small to nurture.
Deep and gentle, they bestow moisture,
Nourishing all that wriggles and breathes.
May heaven and humankind receive blessings,
And their years endure like the kalpas and stones.

Eleventh Vow:
May the Emperor’s realm
Daily prosper.
May the four frontiers be at peace,
And weapons of war not be raised.
May heaven and humankind sing in praise,
And auspicious omens come in flight.
May teachings be widely spread,
And virtuous influence widely proclaimed.
May the myriad people rejoice,
And eternal joy know no end.

Twelfth Vow:
May all creatures—
Those that fly and crawl, born and unborn—
Be included.

May all be granted safety,
And all under heaven flourish.
Each beholds the primal qi,
Receiving the forms of yang.
Grasses and trees, fruits and groves,
Endure winter without withering.
All delivered and shielded,
None fail to bloom in fresh glory.
Harmony unites with the true Dao.

Again at the furnace,
May the Fragrant Palace Envoys,
The Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
And all attendant spirit-officials of incense
Cause this place of my audience with the Origin
To naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar,
And jasper mushrooms.
May the hundred numinous perfected ones
Gather here, assembling before the cavern furnace.
May my body radiate golden splendor,
Severing the roots of the womb’s bonds.
May the Seven Mysteries be uprooted,
And the hundred passages prepared for immortality.
May the register of death be erased,
And I feast in repose at the Mud-Pill Palace.
May the Eastern Flower record my name,
And my spirit-stride ascend the void’s mystery.
May the jade maidens and jade lads of the ten directions,
Attending the incense smoke,
Convey the words I have just uttered
Swiftly to the presence of the Supreme,
The Boundless Dao of the Formless and Nameless,
The Void and Spontaneous,
Before the Jade Threshold of the Golden Portals,
In the court of the Nine Celestial Thearchs of Divine Empyrean.

Exiting the chamber,
The Fourteenth Scroll of the *Yellow Register Fast Rites* of the Supreme concludes.

**The Fifteenth Scroll of the *Yellow Register Fast Rites***
*Compiled by Tang Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting*
*By Special Decree for the Minister’s Disaster-Dispelling and Twilight Dao-Procession*

**Entering the Chamber**

The Five Stars blaze on high,
Auspicious *qi* soars and drifts.
The Primal Beginning gathers the gods,
Heaven and Earth unite in circuit.
Jade talismans and precious seals,
Whisper commands to the subtle and hidden.
Flames cast forth majesty,
No treachery or evil lingers.
The Ten Thousand Demons tremble and submit,
Their noxious blooms wither away.
Monsters are crushed, wickedness felled,
The *qi* of the Dao flows as one.
Divine radiance illumines the night,
Darkness and shadows are wholly gathered.
The Ten Thousand Gods descend in attendance,
Fanning the light as they ride the whirlwind.
All living beings attain their fulfillment,
Grace pervades the divine lands.

**Strike the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

The Supreme Mysterious Origin, the Most High Dao Lord,
Summons forth from within this minister’s body:
The Three-and-Five Merit Scribes,
The Attendant Officials of Left and Right,
The Incense-Bearing Golden Lads,
The Petition-Conveying, Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens,
The Five Thearchs’ Direct Talisman-Officers,
The Incense-Officers of the Day—
Each in their thirty-two ranks, emerge.
As they depart, arrayed in solemn vestments,
They unlock the gates of the Mystic Altar’s Heavenly Thearchs,
And summon the local earth gods, territorial spirits,
And true officials of this realm.
On this day, in service of the intent to beseech grace at the Jade Threshold,
We present our prostrations before the Cinnabar Writs.
May the numinous light of the Jade Purity’s Dao-*qi* and Numinous Treasure
Descend and flow into our bodies,
That purple essence may flourish in abundance,
And the Jade Pass be opened and illumined.
May the Five Elders fortify our roots,
The Ten Thousand Thearchs guard our true nature.
Our bodies, like pearls, reflect the round,
Riding the light as we mount the celestial court.
Golden radiance blazes resplendent,
As we harness the *qi* to ascend to the Upper Clarity.
May the words we have uttered
Swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme,
The Boundless Dao of the Formless and Nameless,
The Void and Spontaneous,
Before the Jade Threshold of the Golden Portals,
In the court of the Nine Celestial Thearchs of Divine Empyrean.

**Each Declare Their Dharma Rank**

We, disciples of the Three Luminaries of the Supreme Clarity’s Mystic Capital and Grand Grotto,
Supreme Masters of the Three Caverns,
Conducting the great *Yellow Register Fast* for disaster-dispelling rites,
The Master of [such-and-such] Peak, the Perfected of [such-and-such] Thearch, your ministers [Names],
With one heart, reverently address the
Void and Spontaneous Primal Beginning Heavenly Worthy,
The Boundless Dao, the Most High Great Dao Lord,
The Supreme Great Dao, the Golden Portals Mysterious Origin Heavenly Thearch, the Great Emperor, the Most High Lord Lao,
The Jade Thearch of the August Heaven,
The Ten Directions’ Attained Great Sage Perfected Lords and Venerable Masters,
The Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearchs,
The Jade Clarity Thearch,
The Jade Emperor and Great Emperor,
The Eastern Flower, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern True, and Mystic Capital’s Jade Capital, Golden Portals, Seven Treasures, and Mystic Terrace,
The officials and retinues of the Three Realms,
And all true numina.

We, your ministers, by long-standing karmic affinity,
Have been blessed to encounter the mysterious transformation.
The Three Caverns spread the teachings of vast compassion,
Bestowing universal blessings upon humans and heavens.

The Four Luminaries unfold the rites of vast salvation,
Manifesting blessings for state and realm.
Thus do jade scriptures expound profound mysteries,
And golden tablets enumerate merits.
Where there is devotion, there is response;
Where there is prayer, there is answer.
Moreover, this matter bears the Mandate of the Thearch,
And the thoughts of the imperial heart.
The grace between sovereign and subject is profound,
The sincerity for blessings and protection is earnest.
Therefore, we dare to consult the canons of the Cavernous Mystery,
Follow the ritual texts of the Numinous Treasure,
Lead the assembly in the Dharma current,
And diligently perform the fast and vigil.
Reverently upholding the imperial decree,
We dare not but make this known above.

The Emperor’s blue-green memorial shall now be respectfully proclaimed.
As the words declare, so shall the matter be reported.

The Emperor, by virtue of his Five Phases’ waxing and waning,
Faces a time of obstruction and adversity;
The Three Destiny’s revolutions bear the principle of rise and decline.
Encountering this inauspicious conjunction,
His sagely compassion is deeply moved.
With the incense and flowers of the inner treasury,
And the rites and ranks of the Supreme Clarity,
He establishes the fast to invoke blessings,
Reverently opening the altar precincts.
Pledging his heart with the brocade of the dragon’s essence,
And conveying his entreaty with the orchid’s burning stalk.
May the eight simurghs and ten cranes hasten to attend,
And the phoenix chimes and dragon smoke ascend unhurriedly on high.

At this hour of the setting sun, as the Dao is practiced,
The Dharma assembly now offers the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke rise to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme, Perfect, and True Treasure of the Dao.

We, your ministers, surrender body and life,
Prostrate ourselves in full submission,
And look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to the ancestral temples and altars of the sagely dynasty,
To the numinous spirits of the soil and grain,
To the tranquil vastness of the Great Void,
And the numinous palaces of cinnabar.
May feathered banners and jade canopies attend the myriad sages in audience at the Origin;
May jade leaves and golden branches transcend a thousand ages to receive blessings.
May the imperial destiny flourish like the Zhou,
And the realm expand like the lands of Yao.
May the eight directions know peace,
And all beings enjoy perpetual prosperity.

Thus do we now burn incense,
Taking refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of Venerable Masters,
In the virtue of the Perfected and True,
Who, having attained the Dao,
Ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

At this hour of the setting sun, as the Dao is practiced,
The Dharma assembly now offers the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke rise to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme, Perfect, and True Treasure of the Scriptures.

We, your ministers, surrender body and life,
Prostrate ourselves in full submission,
And look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to the Emperor.
We humbly pray that the numinous talismans of the Primordial One be activated,
And the might of the Jade Dipper assembled;
That the cinnabar registers and precious charts summon the hosts of the Jasper Palace.
May the imperial destiny be exalted,
And the sagely years prolonged,
Abiding in peace with the Pole Star,
Shining in radiance with the sun’s splendor.

May the Empress, arrayed beside the Tortoise Terrace,
Enjoy the longevity of the crane.
May the Crown Prince and the various princes,
Embrace great felicity and serve the sagely;
May the six palaces and hundred officials,
Uphold the imperial pole and receive glory.
May all realms know well-being,
And the entire heavens share in blessings.

Thus do we now burn incense,
Taking refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of Venerable Masters,
In the virtue of the Perfected and True,
Who, having attained the Dao,
Ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

At this hour of the setting sun, as the Dao is practiced,
The Dharma assembly now offers the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke rise to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme, Perfect, and True Treasure of the Masters.

We, your ministers, surrender body and life,
Prostrate ourselves in full submission,
And look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to the Ten Poles and Nine Netherworlds,
To all heavens and all earths.
Where the mysterious wind blows,
Where the Dao’s transformation extends,
May the hidden and manifest alike flourish,
And humans and heavens share in blessings.

May the official’s nine ancestors and seven generations,
Ride the grace of goodness to ascend as Perfected;
May his outer kin and inner relatives,
Receive the divine efficacy and align with the Dao.
May accumulated transgressions be dissolved,
And all calamities dispelled.
May his years and emoluments be long,
And blessings and goodness gather in abundance.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Host of Masters, in their Perfect and True virtue. Having attained the Dao, they ascend into the formless. In harmony, we unite with the True Dao.

**Ritual of the Four Directions**
**Confession**
**Threefold Invocation**

The Great Dao abides in the Mysterious Void,
All thoughts find resonance without fail.
Refining the body to enter the Immortal Real,
We attain the adamantine form.
Transcending the Three Realms’ trials,
The Five Pains of hell are dissolved.
All returns to the Supreme Scriptures;
In silent devotion, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your ministers, with utmost sincerity bow in reverence to the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao.
We, your ministers, with utmost sincerity bow in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your ministers, with utmost sincerity bow in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Titles**
We, your ministers, humbly reaffirm our address to the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning; the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Venerable and Perfect Host of the Boundless Dao and Virtue in the Ten Directions; the Celestial Thearchs and Heavenly Emperors; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Heavenly Master and Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center; the Jade Assistants and High Ministers; the Four Directors and Five Emperors; and all divine officials and numinous spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your ministers, prostrate ourselves and declare:
The transformations of the Dao are subtle and profound, exalted above the Nine Purities;
Its divine efficacy shines forth, flowing through the Eight Extremities.
Like echo and shadow, they correspond;
Through resonance and response, all are answered.
When mortal sentiments ascend, the mysterious blessings must flow.
How much more when issuing from the imperial heart,
Manifest in the sovereign’s thoughts?
We await the blessings that follow the moment,
To manifest the true resonance of the divine.
The Host of the Great Dao and Venerable Ones
Will surely bestow their gracious favor.

The Emperor, through this official, has received the dual images of spirit and matter,
And coalesced the qi of the Three Powers.
Yin and yang differ in ascent and descent;
Fortune and misfortune follow the principles of change.
Facing this time of adversity,
He commands with solemn urgency.
Thus, we are bidden to present our utmost sincerity,
To offer this fast and make our supplication.
The blue memorial ascends to the throne,
And the heavens respond with their protective benevolence;
The vermilion petition rises to be heard,
And the myriad sages descend with their radiant blessings.
We command the Four Directors and Five Emperors,
And summon the Three Realms and Ten Directions.
Open the Upper Palace of Purple Yang,
And descend the Nine Dragon Talismanic Mandate.

For this official, dissolve past karmic debts and deep transgressions,
Erase the records of sin and guilt,
And remove the registers of suffering and delay.
Bestow the blessing of longevity,
And reverse the decree of brevity.
The Three Lifespans and Five Phases,
The celestial patterns and earthly records—
All calamities and misfortunes,
Are hereby dispelled.
May his emoluments be renewed,
And his years and lifespan increased.
May his spirit and qi flourish,
And all decline and fault be eradicated.
May his nine ancestors and seven generations
Ascend to heaven and receive blessings.

Above, may the Heavenly Origin shine brightly,
And the earthly foundation remain secure.
May the Three Luminaries be resplendent as jade and pearls,
And the Eight Directions be free of malevolent winds and pestilent qi.
May the sacred chart stand firm,
And the sage’s longevity be vast.
May the Generals of the Square Eyes hurl their fire bells to sweep away mists and vapors;
May the Long-Browed Censors wield their purple brushes to record auspicious omens.
May the Empress and imperial consorts
Ever receive radiant protection;
May the princes and crown princes
Together tread upon extraordinary blessings.
May the enlightened court abound with upright ministers,
And the frontier regions know no beacon fires of war.
May the Jade Candle be harmonious,
And the Jade Storehouses overflow.
May the myriad people rejoice in well-being,
And the realm be tranquil and serene.

Extending to the lords of yin and yang,
The dragon spirits of rivers and mountains—
May they assist in the flourishing age,
And manifest the transformations of the Dao.
The Three Paths and Nine Nights,
The Six Realms of diverse destinies—
May all together receive the merit of this fast,
And attain the shore of blessings.

May the great compassion of the Heavenly Venerable
Fully respond to the Emperor’s reverent devotion.

**Supplication**
We humbly present our address.

**Vows**
First, may Heaven and Earth be bright and pure.
Second, may the cosmic signs be clear and mysterious.
Third, may the sagely ruler enjoy myriad years.
Fourth, may his transformative influence reach the Eight Boundaries.
Fifth, may sweet dew descend from heaven.
Sixth, may the earth emit auspicious vapors.
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their proper course.
Eighth, may the myriad beings thrive in wholeness.
Ninth, may families abound in filial piety and fraternal duty.
Tenth, may the state flourish with talent and virtue.
Eleventh, may the merit of this fast spread widely.
Twelfth, may auspicious signs daily increase.

**Replenishing the Censer**
Incense Officials, Envoys, the Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all Attending Numinous Officials—
At this place where we face the Origin,
May golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise.
May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones
Gather here before the censer in the cavernous chamber.
May our bodies radiate golden splendor,
Severing the roots of the womb’s bonds,
Uplifting the seven generations,
And preparing the hundred passages for immortality.
May the registers of death be dissolved,
And the Mud Pill Palace be seated in darkness.
May the Eastern Florescence record our names,
And the luminous tally ascend to the Mysterious Void.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the Ten Directions
Receive the incense smoke,
And swiftly convey our supplications
To the Celestial Venerable of the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao,
Before the Throne of the Formless and Nameless,
The Spontaneous and Natural,
In the Golden Towers and Jade Palaces,
In the presence of the Nine Celestial Thearchs of the Divine Empyrean.

**Exiting the Chamber**
Here concludes the fifteenth scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

**Sixteenth Scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*
Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting
By Special Decree: For the Subordinate’s Promotion and Elevation—Morning Daoist Observances**

**Entering the Chamber**
Each pays homage to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
Azure radiance illumines the void, the sun’s essence revolves in numinous splendor.
Divine tigers repel evil, flying immortals ring celestial bells.
Rebellious spirits are crushed, myriad demons bound in submission.
Ninefold subtle Dao turns back, eightfold might seizes their essence.
A thousand perfected ones review the records, the Three Primes purge all defilement.
To the left, the Central Yellow is invoked; to the right, the Six Dings are summoned.
Seven cycles, eight unions—revolving through the celestial scriptures.
The sagely transformation towers sublime, the Three Ways flow in harmony.
Auspicious clouds spread forth, merging with the luminous Yellow Court.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

O Most Supreme Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Dao Lord of the Great Dao:
Summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the left and right attendant messengers, the incense-bearing Golden Lads, the word-transmitting and flower-scattering Jade Maidens, and the thirty-two Fragrant Officials of the Five Thearchs on duty this day. Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to open the gates of the Mysterious Altar’s Celestial Thearchs. Let them swiftly summon the local earth deities and territorial true officials to ascend and open the gates.

This servant now humbly offers this morning’s Daoist observances for the petitioner’s intent, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend, flowing into our bodies. May the Mysterious Altar be purified, inner and outer realms perfected as true, the heavens freed from impurity, and the earth cleansed of demonic dust. Let the chiming of jade resound, the Ten Directions grow solemn and clear. May the myriad demons not intrude, and our sincere prayers ascend unobstructed. Let this servant’s supplications swiftly reach the imperial throne of the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Thearch of the August Heaven.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**

With unified sincerity, we, disciples of the Mysterious Capital, humbly petition the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Spontaneous and Natural, the Boundless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the August Thearch of the Golden Towers and Mysterious Primordial Heavenly Emperor, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the perfected and sagely hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, the Heavenly Worthies who respond to conditions and deliver from suffering, the thirty-six Celestial Thearchs, the Jade Void Thearch, the Jade Thearch and Supreme Thearch, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Towers, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Illuminated August Lord of the Numinous Treasure, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Realm, and all responsive numina of the Three Realms.

We prostrate ourselves, having heard that the Perfect Dao extends its compassion, its mysterious efficacy aiding all beings. It unfolds its luminous transformation, shielding and succoring both the manifest and the hidden.

Thus do the flying celestial transcendents receive the teachings of the Jade Coffer’s Illuminated Perfected; the youths of supreme wisdom entreat the rites of the Jade Altar’s Three Registers. Proclaiming the Dharma’s resonance, they open deliverance for all ranks. Their benevolence encompasses state and household, their grace suffuses past and present.

The Emperor, mindful of meritorious worthies, pities the suffering of the dark and silent realms. The [deceased] official, grieving beyond the gates of the nether springs, cherishes remembrance in the hidden earth. We, in reverent cultivation of supreme merit, array the altar precincts, hoping to invoke the compassion of the Most Sagely and relieve the torments of the underworld’s barriers. Moreover, in obedience to the imperial edict, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the petition states, it is fitting to submit this plea.

We, your servants, reverently follow the wondrous decrees of the Nine Heavens and the scriptures of the Three Registers. Modeling our rites upon the patterns of Heaven and Earth, we present the liturgy of repentance and supplication. Above, we reach the Three Realms; below, we extend to the Nine Netherworlds. We burn incense and kindle lamps, recite scriptures and circumambulate the Dao. Silver braziers scatter radiance, hoping to illumine the endless night’s gloom; immortal hymns flow in melody, awaiting the descent of blessings from Heaven.

**This morning’s ritual procession now begins.**
The Dharma assembly, having invoked the first pinch of incense, declares:
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Dao-Treasure.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and reverently rely upon the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits flow to the august spirits of the altars of state, the ancestral line of sagely forebears, that they may ascend to the ranks of the Perfected and wander in the gardens of felicity. May they protect and bless the imperial domain, prolonging its reign for distant ages. May Heaven and Earth endure together, seas and mountains ever at peace.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Host of Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

**This morning’s ritual procession now begins.**
The Dharma assembly, having invoked the second pinch of incense, declares:
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Scripture-Treasure.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and reverently rely upon the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits flow to the Emperor. We humbly pray that the azure waves of the vast sea may compare to his sagely longevity without end; that the myriad peaks and lands may stand firm with the imperial enterprise. May the empress, consorts, and attendants ever enjoy auspicious blessings; may the crown prince and princes perpetually renew their felicitous destiny. May civil ministers and military officers, all officials within and without, unite in loyal devotion, fostering a reign of benevolence, longevity, harmony, and prosperity. May the celestial element be serene and bright, the terrestrial order tranquil and secure. May grain harvests ever be abundant, weapons forever stilled. May blessings extend to all quarters, universally reaching all beings. Wherever the power of the Dao prevails, may the exalted and the lowly alike know peace.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Host of Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

**This morning’s ritual procession now begins.**
The Dharma assembly, having invoked the third pinch of incense, declares:
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Master-Treasure.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and reverently rely upon the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits flow to the [deceased] official in the nether realms at this very moment. We humbly pray that the merit of this fast may ascend above, and the power of the Sagely One descend below. May the jade coffer’s sacred texts be opened, the Nine Dragons’ talismanic decrees be issued. May his numinous consciousness transcend and ascend directly to the Southern Palace. Passing through the courtyard of fire, may he refine and purge all impurities; entering the hall of luminous rosy clouds, may he don the radiant vestments of yang’s splendor. May he be elevated to the blessed realms, his name stricken from the ghostly registers. May the nine generations of ancestors and the seven lineages be transformed and reborn in Heaven; may the five clans and six relations receive blessings and protection. May grievances be cleansed, debts and disputes resolved. May the six destinies and three paths all partake of boundless fortune.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Host of Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

**Completing the Rites**
**Confession**

**Threefold Invocation**
May the Dharma be cherished as a wife,
the scriptures loved as pearls and jade.
Holding fast to precepts to restrain the six passions,
mindful of the Dao to dispel all desires.
In purity, the upright qi abides;
in serenity, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and guard,
life after life receiving boundless fortune.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
paying homage to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
paying homage to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
paying homage to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirming Dharma Ranks**
We, your disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mysterious Capital, humbly reaffirm our devotion and reverently address:
the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Origin;
the Supreme Great Dao Lord;
the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Ten Directions’ Spontaneous Numinous Treasure Heavenly Venerables;
the Heavenly Venerable Who Responds to Conditions and Delivers from Suffering;
the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
the Heavenly Master Lord, Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center;
the High Ministers and Prime Ministers;
the Four Offices and Five Emperors;
and all responsive and efficacious numinous beings within and beyond the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that:
the two qi mold and refine,
the Five Phases engender and transform.
Yin and yang interdepend and alternate,
good and evil shift and transmute.

Within the snares of the worldly net, amid the mechanisms of transformation—
the six passions stir and disturb,
the three karmas entangle and constrain.
Sinking and drifting, adrift and submerged,
such has been the unceasing plight from ancient times to the present.

Unless one is endowed with the qi of the Dao from birth,
or heaven-bestowed with immortal talent,
one cannot shatter the chariot of misfortune by ascending the ranks of blessings,
nor traverse the cloud-lined thoroughfare to transcend the earthly realm.
In this fleeting, floating world,
who can escape the wheel of rebirth?

This official, since his birth into this life and through countless kalpas past,
has accumulated transgressions,
his sins amassing like a string of beads.

As a military officer, he may have drilled troops and commanded armies,
punished the wicked and suppressed rebels,
or in the midst of mowing down and eradicating,
found jade and stone indistinguishable.
Though his service to the times may have been tied to establishing merit,
his reliance on killing and his pursuit of victory
have inevitably incurred guilt.

Moreover, in the course of feasts and rewards,
there must be slaughter and roasting.
In enforcing the laws to punish the wicked,
there must be the execution of penal codes.
Thus, in cases of accidental or mistaken killing,
transgressions and violations are unavoidable.

Or when soldiers march through camps and fortifications,
encroaching upon and desecrating ancient tombs,
offending and provoking dragon spirits,
digging and excavating hills and plains,
defiling and polluting springs and streams,
trampling sacred lands,
and defiling numinous traces—
these acts may stem from unresolved past debts
or unredressed former grievances.

Or when, in the course of official duties,
he has wielded authority with personal bias,
his judgments in life bearing the stain of guilt,
and in death facing karmic retribution—
in the dark, hidden prisons of the underworld,
there is no means of repentance or redemption.

As a civil official, when administering affairs,
he may have acted willfully and indulged his inclinations,
weighing punishments and discerning cases
without regard for compassion or mercy,
enforcing the law and upholding regulations
without thought of pardon or leniency.
In matters of granting or withholding, encouraging or discouraging,
he may have erred in balancing severity and leniency.
In levying and collecting taxes,
he may have harmed through harshness and urgency,
provoking the resentment of people and the grievance of all things.
These offenses, once firmly established,
may stem from past debts or former grievances,
or from defying heaven and betraying earth,
yet he has never offered repentance or atonement.
Accumulated in the courts of the underworld,
since the time of his death,
karmic retribution has befallen him,
with no means of deliverance or redemption.

The Emperor, mindful of his past merits
and grieving for his journey to the netherworld,
has examined the standards of the Purple Yang,
and unfolded the statutes of repentance and deliverance.
He has solemnly established the magnificent altar,
and reverently implored the boundless grace of the heavens.

We humbly beseech the host of saints and sages of the myriad heavens,
and the Three Supreme Venerables,
to turn their limitless mercy
and bestow the great compassion of their grace.
May they command the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus,
the Five Emperors and Four Offices,
the Thirty-Six Prisons of Mount Tai and Fengdu,
to reconcile grievances and dissolve karmic retribution,
to erase and cast away the records of sins.
By the edict of great pardon,
may he be released from the depths of darkness,
receive transformation in the Southern Palace,
and be born upon the path of blessings.
May nine generations and seven lineages
together partake in this radiant protection.

May all beings in the Three Paths and Six Realms,
of every rank and kind,
whether moving or still, flying or submerged,
ascend to the shore of blessings.
May the Three Luminaries display auspicious signs,
and the Four Seasons attain perfect harmony.
May the sacred lifespan be long and enduring,
and the nation’s fortune prosperous and eternal.
May weapons be laid to rest,
and plagues and poisons vanish.
May the hundred grains ever flourish,
and all under heaven enjoy peace and prosperity.

Thus, the great compassion of the Most High Heavenly Venerable
shall be manifest above,
and the sincerity of our devotion in seeking refuge
shall be fulfilled below.

We reverently present this petition for your hearing.

**Invocation of Intentions**

First intention: For the four great elements of the Dao,
and the host of the retreat’s virtuous patrons—
may the seven generations of parents
be freed from sorrow and suffering,
ascend to the heavenly halls,
and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second intention: For the Emperor and the lords of the realm—
may the Dao’s transformation flourish and prosper.
May the schools and academies thrive,
and the imperial teachings expand in grandeur.
May their majesty and decorum be reverent and awe-inspiring,
admired by all under heaven.
May the people praise the Great Peace,
and the four barbarians submit in deference.
May evil and malevolence self-destruct,
and the worthy and sagely be born daily.

Third intention: For the Dharma Master—
may his merit and virtue be greatly established,
his teachings enlightened and far-reaching,
and may he, together with all, attain transcendence as an immortal.

Fourth intention: For fellow aspirants and disciples—
may they swiftly attain the Dao of immortality,
and mutually guide and deliver one another.

Fifth intention: For the harmony of the nine relations—
may they esteem benevolence and righteousness,
value the Dao and despise wealth,
and their conduct serve as a model for all things.

Sixth intention: For self-denial—
may alms be given to Daoist priests and the hungry and cold.
May all people under heaven
each find their rightful place.

Seventh intention: For the crawling and creeping,
all sentient beings—
may they all attain fulfillment.

Eighth intention: For the remission of past lives’ sins
and this life’s karmic retribution—
may merits be established to compensate for transgressions.

Ninth intention: For the prosperity of the family—
may the ancestral temple be maintained,
and worthy talents be born in every generation.

Tenth intention: For the reverence of scripture masters—
may they never falter in diligence,
and with a mind of perfect equality,
widely deliver all beings,
and attain transcendence as immortals.
May they ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
and pay homage to the Most High.
May they forever become perfected beings,
riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages,
in harmony and union with the true Dao.

**Replenishing the Crucible**

Fragrant Office Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Fragrance Spirits—may they cause this place of my audience with the Primordial to naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and jade blossoms. May the hundred numinous perfected beings gather here before the incense burner. May I, in learning the Dao, attain the Dao; in learning immortality, attain immortality. May the patron of this retreat receive blessings, and may both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions, attending the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly convey all that I have just petitioned directly to the Most High, the Boundless Dao, the Perfectly True Jade Emperor of the Supreme Ultimate before the Celestial Throne.

*Exiting the Chamber*
*End of the Sixteenth Scroll of the* **Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High**

*Seventeenth Scroll of the* **Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High**
*Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang, by Imperial Decree, for the Subordinate’s Promotion and Merit-Transference through the Performance of the Dao*

*Entering the Chamber*
Each pays homage to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
Cinnabar numina, vermilion flames—
radiant clouds ignite the winds.
The crimson wheel turns with刚 force,
celestial light surging through the eight directions.
Its might bursts forth, encompassing all,
transforming myriad realms.
Molten gold scatters, demons vanish without trace.
Evil is dispelled, malevolence shattered—
illuminating the primal work.
Golden talismans summon and command,
treading clouds, spurring dragons.
Songs of celebration resound,
flowers scatter across the vast heavens.
Spirits transmute in hidden motion,
the four extremities secure and prosperous.
Prostrate before the Celestial Throne,
none dare be irreverent.

*Strike the Dharma Drum twenty-four times*

The Most High Lord of the Dao of the Three Heavens, the Primordial Three Qi of the Mysterious Origin—
summon forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Envoys, the Golden Youths Attending Incense, the Jade Maidens Transmitting Words, and the Fragrance Officials of the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans and Direct Days—thirty-two each—to emerge.
Let them, in solemn array, report to the Divine Lords of the Mysterious Altar of the Celestial Emperor, and urgently command the local earth deities and true officials of this realm to ascend and make their report.

I now, on behalf of the intent of this rite, perform the audience with the Primordial. May I beseech the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure to descend, flowing into our bodies, thereby rendering the Mysterious Altar pure and both inner and outer realms perfected as true. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth purged of demonic dust. May the jade chimes resound, the ten directions solemn and clear. May the myriad demons not intrude, and our sincerity ascend unobstructed. First, may the Great Dao spread and flow, and may all under Heaven embrace virtue.
Second, may all sentient beings awaken to the Dao.
Third, may the sorrowful souls of the Nine Nights all attain liberation.
Fourth, may the lonely and unattached spirits all receive rebirth.
Fifth, may the world know great peace, and may the five grains be abundant.
Sixth, may ministers be loyal and children filial, may rulers be benevolent and fathers kind.
Seventh, may the Four Seas be united, and may the six relations be harmonious.
Eighth, may the hidden in wombs and the sheltered in eggs all attain birth and growth.
Ninth, may chronic and acute illnesses swiftly be cured.
Tenth, may the destitute and exposed among the living be clothed and fed.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**

Incense Official Messengers, Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all the Attendant Spirit Officials: At this place where we face the Origin, may the golden liquid elixir and the azure mushroom naturally arise. May the hosts of the Hundred Spirits and all the Perfected gather here before the incense burner and the altar of fragrant fire. May we who study the Dao attain the Dao, and those who seek immortality attain immortality. May the patrons of this ritual receive blessings, and may both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the Ten Directions, guarding the orchid incense, swiftly transmit our recent invocations directly to the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Emperor.

**Exiting the Chamber**

Here concludes the eighteenth scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

**Nineteenth Scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*

A Minister’s Dawn Ritual for the State’s Disaster Dispelling and Dao-Pursuit**

**Entering the Chamber**
Each bows to the masters, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits Invocation**
Azure yang illumines the void, radiance returning to the numinous.
Divine tigers repel evil,
Flying immortals stream with bells.
Crush treachery, annihilate trials—
Ten thousand demons bind their forms.
Ninefold subtleties revolve the Dao,
Eightfold mights seize essences.
A thousand Perfected audit records,
The Three Origins purge all defilement.
To the left, the Central Yellow roars;
To the right, the Six Dings are commanded.
Seven revolutions, eight unions—
Traversing the celestial scriptures.
Majestic transformations tower,
The Three Ways proceed in harmony.
Auspicious clouds flow forth,
Merging with the Yellow Court’s luminous scene.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
O Most Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Three *Qi*’s Supreme Dao Lord, summon forth from within this minister’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-two each—to emerge.
Let them, in solemn array, report to the Mysterious Altar’s Celestial Thearch and Divine Lords, urgently commanding this land’s local deities and true officials to ascend and receive the report.
This minister now, on behalf of the stated intent, performs the dawn’s *qi*-uniting and Dao-pursuing rites. May the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and Numinous Treasure’s wondrous radiance descend, flowing into our bodies.
Thus shall the Mysterious Altar be purified, inner and outer made true.
Heaven freed of miasmic filth,
Earth cut off from demonic dust.
Jade chimes resound—
The Ten Directions grow solemn and clear.
No myriad demons shall intrude,
True sincerity ascends.
May this minister’s petition swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Emperor.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**
We, disciples of the Mysterious Capital of Supreme Clarity, jointly and sincerely petition the Self-So, Natural Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Boundless Great Dao’s Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Lofty Great Dao’s Golden Watchtower Mysterious Primordial Heavenly Thearch, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the Ten Directions’ Attained Great Sage Perfected Lords and Masters, the Thirty-Six Celestial Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Watchtower, Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace’s Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the Thirty-Six Divisions’ Venerable Scriptures, the Mysterious Center’s Great Dharma Masters, and all responsive and perceptive true numina of the Three Realms.
We prostrate and hear: the Great Dao’s proclamation spreads, the Three Powers establish their stations. Emperors set the ultimate standard, the Four Great Ones share equal reverence.

Thus are states inaugurated and lands governed, the multitudes shepherded and all beings tended. With regal tassels draped and screens of state behind, the sovereign presides over the myriad regions. Though sagely rule emulates Heaven, it must draw upon unseen aid; when times are harmonious and customs prosperous, it is truly by the work of numinous power. Therefore, we reverently observe the constant rites of suburban sacrifice and prepare the grand ceremonies of auspicious purification. Bearing Heaven and serving Earth, we manifestly honor the Supreme Mystery.

Now, as calamitous fate converges and adversity takes shape, we must pray for auspicious blessings to usher in peace and prosperity. So-and-so, such-and-such an official, deeply concerned for the sovereign and earnestly devoted to governing the realm, devoutly conducts purification rites and vigil, hoping to move the true numina. We, unworthy as we are in our offices of the Mysterious Bureau, deem it our duty to submit this memorial. Humbly receiving the imperial decree, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the petition states, the matter concerns the altars of state and the fate of the realm. We feel the virtue of nurturing completion and bear the grace of encompassing sustenance. Without knocking at the Gate of Mystery, one cannot hope for radiant protection. Therefore, with solemn reverence and earnest devotion, we establish the imperial altar. Our hearts soar toward the Azure Vault, our prayers ascend to the Pure Capital.

At this dawn’s ritual, the assembly of Dharma-initiates and we raise the first incense pinch. May this fragrant smoke ascend to offer reverence to the Most High and Perfect Dao Treasure. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High. May this merit flow to the august numina of the altars of state and the ancestral shrines of former sages, merging with the Mysterious Ultimate and feasting in the Cinnabar Terrace of Effulgent Light. In the Golden Watchtower and Jade Capital, we present the sagely designs to the Primordial Beginning; in the Jeweled Charts and Sacred Records, we extend great blessings to the divine descendants. When transformation prevails, seas will be calm and rivers clear; as blessings flow, Heaven will endure and Earth will last.

Now, we burn incense in devotion to the Great Sage Assembly of Master and Honored Ones, the virtue of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into formlessness, harmonizing with the true Dao.

At this dawn’s ritual, the assembly of Dharma-initiates and we raise the second incense pinch. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to offer reverence to the Most High and Perfect Scripture Treasure. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Most High Venerable Scriptures. May this merit, above all, wish the emperor’s auspicious radiance to coalesce at the imperial throne and blessings to gather upon his sagely person. May he shine with the brightness of sun and moon, illuminating the ten thousand dwellings; may he emulate the virtue of Heaven and Earth, nurturing and sheltering all living beings. May the empress, consorts, and concubines gloriously uphold the great treasure; may the heir apparent and imperial princes harmoniously assist in the grand enterprise. May the ministers, officials, meritorious generals, and wise counselors—both civil and martial—together bring peace to the realm and its seas.

This day we kindle incense, surrendering body and life to the Great Sage Host of Venerable Masters, whose perfect virtue, having attained the Dao, preserves Heaven’s eternal abiding.

Harmony unites with the true Dao.

At this pure dawn of ritual practice, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer this three-pinch incense. May its fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly upholding the Most High and Perfect Treasure of Masters. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Masters. May this merit flow forth to the heavens above and below, to the Three Realms and Ten Directions, to the divine hosts of the Great Dao and all the sagely beings of the heavens.

We humbly pray for the stabilization and pacification of the imperial destiny, that the sagely dynasty be blessed with trust and protection. May their majesty shine with the awe of snow, frost, thunder, and lightning, rightly governing the seasons of spring, summer, autumn, and winter. May all things be nurtured and brought to fruition, while malevolent spirits and pernicious demons are vanquished. May calamities be swept away and the imperial lineage prolonged.

May the Five Sacred Peaks stand tall, the Eight Pillars remain steadfast. Ever encircling the imperial throne, may they eternally uphold the imperial pole. May the Nine Mysteries ascend and be delivered, and all beings revive in clarity. May the myriad multitudes enjoy peace and well-being, and weapons of war be stilled. May all creatures—whether soaring or sinking, endowed with consciousness—together partake in prosperity and uprightness.

This day we kindle incense, surrendering body and life to the Great Sage Host of Venerable Masters, whose perfect virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless.

Harmony unites with the true Dao.

The rite is complete. We repent.

The "Threefold Invocation Hymn"

To take the Dharma as one’s wife,
To cherish the sutras as pearls and jade.
By upholding precepts, the six passions are restrained;
Through mindfulness of the Dao, desires are dispelled.
In purity, the true qi abides;
In serenity, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
And through every life, great blessings are received.

The Threefold Prostration
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks
We, your disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mystic Capital, servants [Name] and others, with deepest sincerity, once more reverently invoke:
The Most High, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin;
The Most High Lord of the Great Dao;
The Most High Lord Lao;
The Perfect and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
The Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
The High Ministers and Prime Chancellors, the Four Directors and Five Emperors, and all the divine officials and spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, humbly recall:
The Three Venerables established the teachings, prioritizing sincerity and resonance;
The Supreme Sages transmitted the precepts, holding solemnity and reverence as their foundation.

Should we express our unadorned sincerity, it shall surely reach the august spirits.

We reflect that from the inception of creation to this very day, the sovereign cannot spread transformation without the people, nor can the people attain tranquility without the sovereign. The sovereign aligns with Heaven, and the king establishes the ultimate standard. How could they not draw upon the power of creation and rely upon divine efficacy? Only then can they transmit glory through generations and perpetuate blessings across the ages.

Since the primordial past, states and households have endured. Those who faithfully adhere to the principles of purity and quiescence are graced by the profound blessings of the Mysterious Origin. The Emperor, upholding Heaven’s mandate and grasping the cosmic order, has assumed the throne in accordance with destiny. Reverent, frugal, benevolent, and harmonious, he labors diligently over all affairs of state, ever more vigilant with each passing day. Yet even as he governs with ceaseless diligence, darkness and adversity still afflict the realm. Without recourse to the Supreme Dao, how could peace and deliverance be achieved?

The official [Name], long renowned for his great merit, redoubles his earnest devotion. Devoted to the sovereign and the state, he knows no rest. Thus, with utmost reverence, he prepares fragrant flowers, abundant offerings, and solemn pledges of faith. Laying bare his heart before the Three Realms, he bows in homage to the heavens. He exhausts his luminous sincerity, humbly beseeching auspicious protection.

May his crimson petition ascend, and the profound grace of the Mysterious descend. May the awe-inspiring power of transformation be bestowed, preserving the Emperor’s distant and enduring reign. Let the decree command the Nine Heavens, and the celestial hosts patrol the Eight Extremities. May wind and thunder sweep away the miasmic vapors, clearing the cosmos, and annihilate calamities to secure the altars of state. Let treacherous omens be purged, the sun and moon shine with steadfast clarity, and comets and baleful stars be driven away. May weapons of war melt like ice, rebellious ministers and their factions reform their hearts, and epidemic plagues and malevolent spirits vanish like clouds dispersed by lightning.

May the Hua and Yi peoples alike joyfully follow the winds of virtue, and the entire realm delight in the radiance of sagely governance. May the official [Name] enjoy emoluments as lofty as Mount Song and Mount Heng, and years as enduring as the pine and cassia. May he forever uphold loyalty and filial piety in service to his sovereign and parents. May the Emperor’s sagely longevity rise like the North Star and Mount Tai, his illustrious reign extend as far as the heavens and earth endure. May all beings, seen and unseen, ascend to the realm of longevity.

Thus, the transformative compassion of the Most High Heavenly Worthy is made manifest, and the sincerity of your servants’ devotion is answered.

With reverence, we make this declaration.

**Invocation of Intentions**

First intention: For the Dao, the Four Great Elements unite in virtue. May the seven generations of the retreat’s sponsor be freed from sorrow and suffering, ascend to the heavenly halls, and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second intention: For the Emperor and rulers of states, may the Dao’s transformation flourish. May schools and academies thrive, the imperial teachings expand, and solemn decorum be universally observed. May the people praise great peace, the four barbarians submit in reverence, evil vanish of itself, and sages and worthies arise daily.

Third intention: For the Dharma Master, may great merit be established. May teachings be luminous and enlightened, and all attain transcendence.

Fourth intention: For fellow practitioners of the Dao, may they swiftly attain immortality and mutually guide one another.

Fifth intention: For the nine relations to live in harmony, esteeming benevolence and righteousness, prizing the Dao and despising wealth, serving as models for all.

Sixth intention: For those who humble themselves to bestow alms, Daoists and the hungry and cold. May all people under heaven find their rightful place.

Seventh intention: For crawling and creeping creatures, all sentient beings, may they all achieve fulfillment.

Eighth intention: For the pardon of past lives’ transgressions. May this life’s karmic retribution be redressed through meritorious deeds.

Ninth intention: For the prosperity of family and state. May ancestral temples be maintained, and worthy talents arise in every generation.

Tenth intention: For revering the master and the scriptures. May we never falter in devotion, cultivating equanimity and single-mindedness. May all beings be broadly delivered, attaining the rank of immortals, ascending to heaven in broad daylight, and paying homage to the Most High. May we forever become perfected beings, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the Real.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**

To the Incense Officials and Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attendant Incense Spirits: May this

By this the high and low are fixed, and kingdoms rise.
The sovereign is the head, governing both the unseen and the manifest.
Exercising the power of yin and yang to nurture all things,
holding the reins of joy and sorrow for the myriad people.
Accordant with Heaven, embodying the Dao, sheltering the realm entire.
Yet should the times grow dark and murky, and all things suffer adversity,
if even one man remains unblessed, the multitude shares in sorrow.

We, the officials [Name] and [Name], earnestly seek to rectify the age,
our hearts deeply devoted to praying for blessings.
We now beseech auspicious favor to aid and sustain the sacred dynasty.
As our duty lies in propagating and magnifying the Dao, we must submit this petition.
Having received the imperial command, how dare we not make it known?

**Reading the Petition**
As the words herein bear profound meaning of vast salvation,
we now follow the mystic rites and solemnly open the imperial altar.
We prepare the ceremonies for the descent of the perfected and the advent of the sagely,
examining the forms of the Three Registers and the Nine Purities.
With fragrant flowers we offer our sincerity, and with tokens of faith we convey our devotion.
We pour forth our crimson sincerity in the mortal realm, awaiting the mysterious blessings of the celestial palace.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May these merits flow to the august spirits of the altars of state and the ancestral temples,
ascending to the Three Realms, treading the Ten Flowers.
Bestowing great blessings to enrich the grand design,
granting extraordinary omens to prosper the sacred lineage.
In the lands of fire-mice and ice-silkworms, may no corner lack the imperial calendar;
among the ministers of Cock Forest and Child Tree, may songs of praise resound in harmony.
Surpassing the millennial reigns of old, exceeding the boundaries of Yu’s domain.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May these merits ascend as prayers for the Emperor.
We humbly hope that blessings flow to the mysterious extremity, and grace suffuses the purple imperial chambers.
May the eight seas settle into tranquil waves, their vastness equaling the sovereign’s benevolence.
May the ten mountains rise in verdant splendor, their heights matching the sagely years.
Harmonizing the jade candle of the four seasons, spreading jeweled branches through ten thousand generations.
May the empress, consorts, and imperial concubines, the crown prince and the various princes,
all receive vast blessings and together uphold the imperial throne.
May the civil ranks and military posts, the worthy ministers and meritorious officials,
proclaim the seven virtues to pacify the nine regions, upholding the Three Absences to bring peace to the four seas.
May the five weapons be sheathed, and the hundred grains flourish.
May auspicious portents fill the records, overflowing the pages.
May all under heaven, in perfect accord, enjoy harmony and prosperity.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, preserve the heavens and endure forever.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Masters of the Most High.
May these merits flow to the boundless expanse, within the domains of the Dao,
to the utmost Three Purities above, and the deepest Nine Ramparts below,
to the lords of yin and yang, the administrators of Heaven and Earth.
May the vast compassion of the Heavenly Worthies extend their salvation,
and the encompassing virtue of the Sagely Hosts manifest their embrace.
Washing away pestilence and calamity, eradicating disasters and misfortunes.
Secretly blessing the imperial enterprise, eternally securing the nation’s destiny.
Bringing forth the transformation of Great Peace, opening the court of benevolence and longevity.
May the officials [Name] and [Name] widely spread blessings and felicity,
renewing their longevity and emoluments.
May they ever deeply partake of the sovereign’s grace, long aiding his sagely brilliance.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

**Threefold Invocation Hymn**
Abundant flourishes the house and state,

In subtle vastness entering the Great Vehicle.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Titles**
Disciple of the Supreme Mystery and Mysterious Capital, your servant [Name],
with due reverence, once more addresses and invokes:
the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Origin;
the Supreme Great Dao Lord; the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Perfect and Most High Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center;
the High Ministers and Prime Chancellors, the Four Directors and Five Emperors,
all divine officials and spirits of the Three Realms.

By karmic conditions of former lives, we have personally encountered the turning of the Dao’s fortune.
Jade tablets and golden writs descend from the celestial gates,
tortoise-shell registers and tiger tallies circulate through the world’s domains.
Through the transmission of master and disciple, we have received and cultivated the teachings.
Yet our bodies dwell far from cloudy springs, our traces lost in the dusty sea.
Our merits have not yet aided the state, our Dao has not yet attained ascension.
We can but rouse our cinnabar resolve, hoping to repay the mysterious creation.

Moreover, in establishing merit and propagating the teachings, aiding the state takes precedence.
In all sincere supplications, how dare we fail to comply?
Officials [Name] and [Name], encountering times of calamity and adversity,
grieve for the nation in their hearts.
With devout preparation of offerings and utmost sincerity, they diligently perform the fast and vigil.
Following the decrees of the Supreme Ultimate and Ninefold Purity,
adhering to the texts of the Golden Clarity and Three Caverns,
they burn incense, light lamps, recite scriptures, and perform the Dao-circuits.

We humbly consider that the Great Teaching of Non-Action takes luminous response as foremost;
the unfathomable divine efficacy takes utmost sincerity as its foundation.
Exhausting sincerity in the earthly realm, it must evoke response from the Supreme Mystery.
We prostrate ourselves in reverence before the Three Supreme Worthies,
the hosts of saints in the ten directions,
the deities of all heavens and earths,
the responsive and efficacious divine spirits.
May they open the grace of great pardon, bestow boundless blessings.
Release and absolve the ancestral temples and former sages,
extending to the imperial person,
the accumulated transgressions and deep faults,
the limitless errors and offenses.
May the divine source be serene and pure, the Dao’s kindness luminous and radiant.
May the earth’s records and heaven’s origins halt the reckoning of disasters and blessings;
may the eight vast realms and ten thousand states spread the winds of harmony and joy.
May the two images be at peace, the three luminaries bright and clear.
May weapons be sheathed and stilled, pestilence and poison dissolved and submerged.
May fierce and violent beings be vanquished, dragons and spirits reconciled in harmony.
May the celestial armies and their mounts punish and eradicate wicked demons.
May the rebellious factions and malevolent followers be annihilated in due time.
May wind and rain be harmonious and timely, crops and grains abundant and flourishing.
May all creatures of diverse forms, flying and submerged beings of varied endowments,
the suffering souls of the three paths, the imprisoned spirits of the six destinies,
by the condition of this confession and supplication, attain their desire for freedom.
May they not be afflicted by plagues, ever preserving safety and integrity.
May the eight seas be free from perilous waves, the ten thousand streams flow in perfect accord.
May the manifest and hidden alike universally witness the advent of Great Peace.
May all living beings together attain the transformation of the Dao.

Above, may the Heavenly Worthy’s vast salvific blessings be made manifest;
below, may they correspond to the sincerity of we, your servants, who take refuge in the mandate.
We respectfully present this invocation for your hearing.

**Vows**
First vow: May the Great Dao be serene in quiescence and emptiness,
abiding in tranquility and stillness, dwelling in clarity and purity.
May it widely open the gates of the Dharma, instructing the obstinate.
May all receive its beneficent blessings, cultivating with diligence and austerity.
May those who study together universally ascend to the void,
preserving harmony with heaven, enduring without care.

Second vow: May the myriad heavens condense qi and attain clarity,
their lofty vastness broadly sheltering, preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the seasons of qi be harmoniously regulated, the four movements at peace.
May the state be secure and the people prosperous, the world universally at rest.
May all be broadly saved, blessings extending to all living beings.
May heaven be preserved for eternity, enduring through kalpas without decline.

Third vow: May the earth bear and sustain without end,
stable and unshaken, seas and abysses uncollapsed.
May it protect and secure the house and state, the multitudes flourishing in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead at peace, blessings encompassing the ten directions.
May crops and grains flourish and grow, enterprises daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant sustenance, the myriad beings universally accord.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, be lofty and bright,
free from eclipses or dimming, their waxing and waning serene and clear.
May their light illumine all heavens, dispelling darkness and obscurity.
May they preserve the kalpas’ destiny, the world’s mandate at peace.
May they universally bestow moistening blessings, showering grace upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations shine with the brilliance of the sun and moon,
their revolving torches illuminating, casting radiance through the ten directions.
May each abide in its proper place, their paths straight and true.
May they protect and secure the house and state, free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be at peace as one, the world universally flourish.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons progress in accord with their nodes,
their qi harmonious and regulated, free from disasters or afflictions.
May pestilence and poison be eradicated, the world universally at peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance, the state prosperous and the people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds condense qi and gather mist,
soaring high and clear in the sky, casting shade over the profound mystery.
When concealed, they are non-active; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the hosts of perfected beings.
May blessings flow universally, aiding the state and cherishing the people.
May all beings be universally saved, their years equal to the kalpas.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without end,
universally bestowing their release, receiving their flourishing.
May the myriad things flourish and grow, the state’s stores and people’s wealth abundant.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks each abide in their proper direction,
their towering majesty encompassing and sheltering, ever serving as immortal palaces.
May they secure the state’s destiny, preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none who do not revere and honor them.

Tenth vow: May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless,
containing and embracing with magnanimity, nurturing even the smallest beings.
Profound and gentle, their moisture bestowing blessings upon all creatures.
May heaven and humankind receive felicity, their years equal to the kalpas’ stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor and lord of the state daily prosper,
the four frontiers at peace, weapons and warfare stilled.
May heaven and humankind sing in praise, auspicious omens alighting.
May the teachings be widely disseminated, majestic transformations overflowing.
May the multitudes rejoice in celebration, enduring joy without end.

Twelfth vow: May crawling and flying creatures, born and unborn alike,
universally receive safety, universally attain generation and growth.
May all perceive the primordial qi, receiving the forms of yang.
May grasses and trees, fruits and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and saved, none who do not flourish in brilliance.

Harmony unites with the true Dao.

Return to the furnace. O Fragrance-Official Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Fragrance Spirits, may this place of my audience with the Primordial cause golden liquid elixir and azure mushroom blossoms to arise spontaneously. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones gather here before the incense burner. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the state receive felicity, and both the hidden and manifest realms partake in grace.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend upon the orchid-scented smoke. Convey my supplications just uttered swiftly and directly to the presence of the Most High, Boundless, and Great Dao—the Perfect and True Jade Sovereign of the August Heaven.

Exiting the chamber.
