*Beginning of the Twenty-First Scroll of the Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High*
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang, the Broadly Accomplished

For ministers to eliminate disasters and perform the *Luo Jing* Daoist rites for the state:

Entering the chamber.
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

Guarding the Spirits:
The five stars shine brightly, auspicious qi soars and floats.
The Primordial Origin gathers the gods, heaven and earth unite in harmony.
Jade talismans and precious seals command the subtle and hidden.
Fire is cast and might displayed—no treachery or evil lingers.
The ten thousand demons tremble and submit, their malevolence dissolved.
Monsters are subdued, wickedness vanquished, the Dao’s qi flows as one.
Divine radiance illuminates the night, shadows and darkness wholly withdrawn.
The myriad immortals descend in state, riding the winds on billowing light.
All beings attain fulfillment, grace pervading the divine lands.
The dharma drum is sounded twenty-four times.

The Most High Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Origin, the Three Qi’s Supreme Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officials, the Attendants of the Left and Right, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Incense Officials of the Day—thirty-two each in number—to emerge. As they emerge, let them solemnly prepare and report to the Divine Lord of the Mysterious Altar of the Heavenly Thearch. Let the local earth gods and territorial true officials of this realm be urgently summoned to ascend and report.

This servant now reverently acts on behalf of [the sponsor’s] intent, burning incense and performing the Dao rites, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Purity’s Dao qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into the bodies of this servant and all present. Thereby, may the Mysterious Altar be purified, and inner and outer realms become true. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth rid of demonic dust. May the chiming of jade resound, and the ten directions be solemnly cleansed. May the ten thousand demons not intrude, and true sincerity ascend unobstructed. May this servant’s petition swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao’s Most Perfect Jade Thearch of the August Heaven.

Each proclaims their dharma rank:
The disciples of the Supreme Clarity’s Mysterious Capital, this servant and others, with unified sincerity, reverently address the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Non-Ultimate Great Dao’s Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Highest Great Dao’s Golden Portal Mysterious Primordial August Thearch, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Lords, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, the Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital, Golden Portal, Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Supreme Palace, the Numinous Treasure’s Most Perfect Illuminated August Lord of the Dao, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, and all true numina of the three realms’ official retinues.

This servant has heard that when the three systems first divided and the myriad states spread like a chessboard, without emperors and kings, there would be none to govern and pacify; without the Dao and virtue, there would be none to secure and stabilize.

The Three Sovereigns embodied the Dao, ruling as lords over the Five Emperors, proclaiming virtue to perfect transformation. Thus the people cherished simplicity and sincerity, and customs attained pure harmony. The six qi were balanced and harmonious, the four seasons peaceful and prosperous. Thereafter, yin and yang fell into discord, the nine and six clashed in opposition. The Flame and Yellow Emperors saw the rise of military campaigns; Yao and Tang encountered the calamities of flood and drought. They relied upon the abundance of virtue, and leaned upon the numinous power of the gods. The myriad spirits of heaven and earth all lent their hidden assistance. When encountering adversity, it is fitting to pray to the true numina. Following the rites of reverent offering, may boundless blessings descend. Moreover, in accordance with the imperial decree, how dare we not report this above? The prayer is read.

According to the words of the prayer, the ritual concerns the state and the household. Official So-and-so, with utmost sincerity, aids and supports, yearning in reverence for the august numina. Presenting offerings of faith, he devoutly performs the fast and vigil. In accordance with the Three Primordials’ rank and the Numinous Treasure’s luminous statutes, he burns incense, lights lamps, recites scriptures, and performs the Dao-circumambulation. Traversing the myriad heavens to offer thanks, he circumambulates the ten thousand sages in homage. May it reach the Supreme Mystery, widely bestowing auspicious blessings.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Dao. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits flow to the august numina of the altars of soil and grain, the ancestral temples and former sages, ascending their spirits to the Purple Palaces, bestowing blessings upon the imperial domain. May they befriend the Five Emperors in the Jasper Palace, freely roaming in ease; may they bequeath a thousand auspicious signs to the imperial heirs, flourishing without end.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Scriptures. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits extend upward to bless the Emperor. We humbly pray that the precious calendar of the Nine Heavens may augment the sagely longevity without bound; that the jasper waves of the Eight Seas may widely expand boundless prosperity. May his brilliance surpass the sun and moon, illuminating all without partiality. May his virtue parallel the Two Modes, embracing and nurturing all things. May the Empress, consorts, and concubines spread their gentle virtue throughout the nine regions; may the Crown Prince and the various princes radiate their illustrious splendor through ten thousand generations. May the civil and military ministers, the officials within and without, propagate and disseminate the imperial designs, vigorously promoting the grand transformation. Extending to the distant frontiers and foreign lands, may all realms constantly enjoy harmony and peace, attaining the perfection of the Dao.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao preserved the heavens and endured eternally, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Master. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits extend throughout the Three Realms, universally reaching all directions. Together may they spread the mysterious merit, jointly proclaiming the vast blessings. Invoking the upright qi of the Three Heavens, may they cleanse and eliminate the treacherous and malevolent; summoning the divine soldiers of the Eight Poles, may they annihilate and pacify demonic afflictions. May the great enterprise flourish, the grand foundation be firmly established. May Official So-and-so be divinely aided with auspicious blessings, his heavenly endowment of longevity enduring. May he forever revere loyalty and filial piety, constantly serving the sagely brilliance.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

The rites are concluded.
Confession and repentance.

**Threefold Invocation Hymn**
The Great Dao pervades the mysterious void,
With thought, none fails to harmonize.
Refining the form to enter immortality,
Thus attaining the adamantine body.
Transcending the three realms’ tribulations,
Hell’s five sufferings are dissolved.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures—
In stillness, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Ranks**
Disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mysterious Capital, your servants [Name] et al., now reverently reaffirm our supplication to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Origin; the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Perfected and Utmost Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center; the High Ministers and Prime Chancellors; the Four Directors and Five Emperors; and all divine officials and venerated spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that the sagely sovereign, robed in grace, governs the multitudes of the realm. Upholding Heaven’s transformative mandate, embodying the Dao to rule the seasons, he must manifest reverence for the Supreme Mystery to secure radiant blessings, and foster harmony in the lands below to perpetuate the grand design. Thus, the Dao of Heaven subtly sustains, while divine spirits secretly assist. Heaven and humanity interact in resonance, and the seas and lands enjoy tranquility.

Recently, as the cyclical nine and six converge, yin and yang fall into discord. Calamities arise in the course of destiny, causing inner and outer realms to share in sorrow. Official So-and-so, deeply committed to governing the state and earnestly devoted to serving the sovereign, seeks to amplify supreme blessings and reverently serve the sagely court. He has examined and adhered to canonical rites, meticulously upholding the Dharma’s sanctity. His heart races toward the Three Realms, his thoughts fixed upon the myriad heavens. Reverently establishing the altar, he devoutly conducts the fast and vigil.

We, your servants, purify our hearts and still our thoughts, bathing in clarity and emptiness. We burn incense and light lamps, recite scriptures, and circumambulate the Dao. Our sincere words ascend to the Ten Poles, our prayers for protection directed to the Three Clarities. We humbly beseech the Supreme Dharma King and the assembly of Perfected Sages: gazing down from jade pavilions, may you bestow vast blessings to universally bestow grace. Rectify the celestial origins, harmonize the earthly principles. Let the Three Luminaries shine brightly, the Five Planets follow their courses. Comets and baleful stars conceal their forms, while auspicious stars manifest their blessings. The eight winds align in sequence, the six qi balance in harmony. Drought and flood are averted, disasters and malevolent forces eradicated. Mountains and rivers remain serene, fierce beasts retreat and vanish. Customs become pure and virtuous, creatures free from plague. Ghosts and demons flee without trace, evil and perverse forces are crushed and destroyed. Barbarians submit in reverence, borderlands enjoy peace. Treacherous ministers and rebellious sons offer loyalty and devotion. Beacons remain unlit, weapons fall silent. The imperial enterprise flourishes, the sagely lifespan endures. The court abounds in loyal and worthy officials, the countryside harbors no neglected talents. The six palaces and hundred ministers together propagate the wind of virtue and power; the crown prince and various kings jointly support the vast and grand enterprise. Ships and caravans gather in full, harvests are ever abundant. May Official So-and-so be truly blessed with auspicious fortune, his official emoluments and state sacrifices renewed.

May even those in the dark springs and cold underworld, the six destinies and three paths, be illuminated by the radiance of wisdom, forever dispelling gloom and obscurity. May the divine wind cleanse impurities, attaining perfect coolness and purity. May all crawling, flying, sinking, and soaring beings ascend to the Dharma realm. Above, may the great compassion of the Heavenly Worthy be manifest; below, may the sincerity of our repentance and gratitude be fulfilled.

We respectfully present this supplication for your hearing.

**Vows**
First vow: May the Great Dao flow universally, and all under Heaven embrace virtue.
Second vow: May all sentient beings awaken to the Dao.
Third vow: May the souls in the nine nights of darkness attain liberation at once.
Fourth vow: May the lonely and unsupported spirits all receive rebirth.
Fifth vow: May the world enjoy great peace and the five grains abundant harvests.
Sixth vow: May ministers be loyal and sons filial, rulers benevolent and fathers kind.
Seventh vow: May the four seas be united, and enmities and affections reconciled.
Eighth vow: May those in hidden wombs and eggs all attain birth and completion.
Ninth vow: May chronic and recent illnesses swiftly be healed.
Tenth vow: May orphaned and destitute beings enjoy ample clothing and food.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**
Incense Official Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, Attendant Incense Spirits, and all divine officials: at the place where we conduct the Dao, may golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise. May the hundred spirits and host of Perfected Ones gather here before the incense burner and sacred flame. May we, your servants, who study the Dao attain the Dao, and those who seek immortality attain immortality. May the nation receive blessings, and both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions, attending the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly transmit our recent supplications directly to the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Utmost Perfected Jade Emperor.

**Exiting the Chamber**
Here concludes the twenty-first scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

**Scroll Twenty-Two of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*
Revised by Master Du Guangting of Tang Dynasty’s Guangcheng**

**Morning Dao Practice for Pacifying the Dwelling**
**Entering the Chamber**
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Invoking the Protective Spirits**
Azure radiance illumines the void, sunlight revolves with numinous power.
Divine tigers repel evil,
Flying immortals stream with ringing bells.
Crushing treachery and dispelling trials,
All demons bind their forms.
Ninefold subtle lights return the Dao,
Eightfold might seizes essence.
A thousand Perfected Ones verify records,
The Three Primes purify all.
To the left, the Central Yellow roars;
To the right, the Six Dings are commanded.
Seven cycles, eight unions,
Revolving through the celestial scriptures.
The sagely transformation towers sublime,
The Three Ways proceed in harmony.
Auspicious clouds flow and spread,
Merging with the Yellow Court of the luminous scene.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
O Supreme Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Three *Qi* of the Most High Lord Lao, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans, and the Daily Incense Officials—thirty-two of each—to emerge.
Let them solemnly prepare and report to the Divine Lords of the Mysterious Altar of the Celestial Emperor. Summon this land’s local earth deities and true officials to swiftly ascend and make their report.
Your servant now acts on behalf of the intent herein, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into the bodies of your servants, thereby purifying the Mysterious Altar within and without, making all real.
May the heavens be free of defilement,
The earth rid of demonic dust.
Jade chimes resound,
The ten directions grow solemn and clear.
Let no demon intrude,
Let true sincerity ascend.
May the supplications of your servant swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Self-So and Spontaneous Golden Gate and Jade Steps of the Celestial Emperor.

**Declaring the Dharma Positions**
Your servants, [Names], with utmost sincerity jointly address the Self-So and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Boundless Great Dao’s Most High Lord of the Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, the host of Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao in the ten directions, the Thirty-Six Celestial Emperors, the Jade Clarity Emperor, the Great Emperor of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Flowery, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, and Northern Perfected Lords of the Mysterious Capital, the Golden Gate and Jade Steps of the Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace, the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure’s Perfected Radiant August Lord of the Dao, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the Five Primordial Emperors, the Nine Lands’ Jade Emperors, and all responsive and perceptive true numina of yin and yang.

Your servants have heard that the Heavenly Venerable conceived and transformed the Great Dao, bestowing the merit of the Two *Qi*.
Shaping the myriad numina,
It provided the origin and perfected purity.
Above, it bound the suspended sun and moon,
Arranging the stars and constellations across the four turbid realms;
Below, it congealed and spread the mountains and rivers,
Merging the seas and watercourses.
Thus, the hundred spirits received their offices,
Fixing the boundaries of the four directions.
The Five Emperors governed their divisions,
Each securing their proper place.
Even the Purple Capital’s hundred towers and ninefold walls,
The commanderies, cities, and moats,
The human dwellings and abodes—
All possess their dharma images,
Corresponding to Heaven and Earth.
Relying on the merit of pacification and stabilization,
They harmonize with the blessings of governance and peace.
Your servants, charged with propagating the teachings and assisting the state in establishing merit,
In all matters of prayer, properly submit reports.
How much more so when following imperial decrees—
Dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the words state, our sincerity is earnest and sincere.
May it, through the power of concentrated devotion, ascend to the true numina.

Your servants, leading the Dharma assembly and adhering to the ritual codes,
Arrange the altar and array the scriptures,
Modeling earth after heaven.
We adorn the ten directions with dragon banners,
Presenting our sincere words to the Three Realms.
At this morning’s Dao practice, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
Your servants surrender body and life,
Prostrating body and head,
Reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the Emperor.
We humbly pray that the five mountains stabilize the earth,
Eternally matching the grand design;
The eight seas float the heavens,
Ever equaling the phoenix’s reign.
May the imperial fortune surpass that of Zhou and Han,
The sagely virtue exceed that of Fuxi and Shennong.
May the empress and crown prince
Illumine their wise virtue;
The princes and princesses
Harmonize with auspicious signs.
May the nine regions unite under one chariot,
The myriad lands gather through ships and bridges.
For this reason, we now burn incense,
Returning to the great sagely host of our masters and venerables,
The virtue of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
We shall ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

At this morning’s Dao practice, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
Your servants surrender body and life,
Prostrating body and head,
Reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the household of the fast’s sponsor.
May nine generations and seven lineages
All transcend the night’s abode;
The six relations and five clans
Together realize the immortal ranks.
May the dwelling be peaceful and secure,
Dragon spirits guard it.
May misfortunes and disasters cease,
Evil and demonic forces not arise.
For this reason, we now burn incense,
Returning to the great sagely host of our masters and venerables,
The virtue of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
We shall ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

At this morning’s Dao practice, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.
Your servants surrender body and life,
Prostrating body and head,
Reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to all sentient beings within Heaven and Earth.
May all bathe in the Dao’s breeze,
Attaining the fruit of Perfection.
May the fast’s sponsor, [Name], have disasters dispelled before they manifest,
Blessings descend without limit.
May all together receive the merit of the wondrous Dao,
Forever realizing the rank of long life.
For this reason, we now burn incense,
Returning to the great sagely host of our masters and venerables,
The virtue of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
We shall ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

**Bowing to the Directions**
**Confession**

Let each contemplate the nine-colored perfect image, swallow the saliva, and recite the secret incantation to command demons.
Step into the void, circumambulate,
Prostrate and bow to the Most High,
Burn incense and return to emptiness.
Luminous radiance follows my return,
The Dharma-wheel likewise turns thrice.
Mysterious vows arise in the four directions,
Blessings extend to kings and lords.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven,
Resplendent, their glory unfurls.
Chanting and singing crown the vast desert,
Heavenly music delights my joy.
Together we offer fragrant incense to the supreme virtue,
Lesser immortals cannot compare.
Wondrous thoughts illumine profound awakening,
In throngs they ride the void in flight.
Circumambulating, treading the cloud-net,
Mounting the void, pacing the mysterious register.
Chanting the hymns of the Supreme Unity,
A hundred passages naturally harmonize.
Below, I command the youths of the Eight Seas;
Above, I escort the lofty immortals.
All heavens scatter flowers of incense,
A serene numinous wind arises.
Long-held vows secure the root of destiny,
Thus attaining lofty eminence.
Rejoicing before the Most High,
Even ten thousand kalpas are but a beginning.
The towering Mysterious Capital Mountain,
Revered by the ten directions as the One Sovereign.
The soaring Heavenly Treasure Terrace,
Its radiance flames like the flowing sun.
Resplendent jade-forest blossoms,
Vermilion fruits gleam in brilliance.
Ever mindful to consume primordial essence,
Refine the fluid to solidify form and substance.
Golden light scatters in the Purple Tenuity,
Graceful and free, the Great Vehicle soars.

**Three Bows**
Your servants prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Most High and Boundless Dao.
Your servants prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
Your servants prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks**
Your servants, [Names], in all humility reaffirm and address:
The Most High and Boundless Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning,
The Most High Lord of the Dao,
The Celestial Venerables of the Boundless Dao in the Ten Directions,
The Perfect Great Emperor and Heavenly Thearch,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
The Heavenly Master and Lord of the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center,
The Supreme Ministers and Prime Ministers, the Four Offices and Five Emperors,
The responsive and perceptive spirits of Heaven and Earth, and all true numina.

Your servants have heard:
Before the Dao’s transformation divided, it was the primordial body of the Undifferentiated;
The mysterious workings do not govern, entrusting the True Unity to non-action.
Thereupon, the two images divided and the numinous arose,
The three powers established their positions.
Purity and turbidity matched the qualities of Qian and Kun,
Obscurity and brightness manifested the distinction of day and night.
The spirits of yin and yang each administered their offices.
Thus, we constructed these halls to replace the layered nests.
Having taken the celestial gates as our model,
We thereby presided over the tally of hidden merits.
Thus, Qian Heaven and Dui Marsh each have their overseeing governance;
Li Fire and Xun Wind mutually reveal decline and prosperity.
To follow them is to surely accord with uprightness and fortune;
To oppose them is to invite regret and blame.
From ancient times to the present, all have followed this Way.

The fast’s sponsor, [Name], having chosen this site for construction,
Feared transgressions and violations.
The ways of spirits are difficult to fathom,
Common understanding cannot plumb them.
Now that the work of earth and timber is complete,
We shall perform the rites of incense and lamps.
We confess our sins and seek grace,
Dispelling calamities and repenting transgressions.
Greatly expanding the fast’s offerings,
We reach upward to the Perfected.
For this reason, we array the Dharma altar,
Adhering to the ritual codes.
Orchid lamps scatter their light,
Illuminating the Nine Netherworlds below.
Fragrant stalks congeal their smoke,
Communicating with the Three Realms above.
Turning scriptures and practicing the Dao,
We universally perform repentance and prayer.
Perhaps we have offended numinous spirits,
Or harmed the earthly courts.
Perhaps we have taken lives or defiled sacred traces,
Or disturbed dragon deities, violating various prohibitions.
Perhaps through forced labor, we have incurred resentment,
Or by relocating without choosing an auspicious site,
Accumulated transgressions and faults,
Thereby binding ourselves in calamity’s coils.
Perhaps within the Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams,
Or within the Ten Stems and Twelve Branches,
We have violated the punishments of yin and yang,
Or the seventy-two spirits.
Below, this is reported to the Earthly Offices;
Above, it is declared to the Heavenly Courts.
Relying on this repentance and confession,
We beseech the sweeping away of all offenses.
May the fast’s blessings universally extend,
Its virtuous merit widely spread,
Descending the Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands,
Proclaiming to all heavens;
Wielding the majestic power of the Three Treasures,
Commanding the Three Realms.
Rescuing these nightly courts,
Opening all radiant illuminations.
Stabilizing the imperial enterprise within the Ninefold Palace,
Disseminating mysterious blessings to the myriad states.
The five weapons laid to rest,
The hundred grains abundantly harvested.
The fast’s sponsor, [Name], and their household,
Living and deceased, are at peace;
Their clan and kin flourish in prosperity.
Children and grandchildren are loyal and filial,
Their posterity and descendants multiply in splendor.
Sins are expunged from the records of the netherworld,
Their names inscribed among the immortals in the true realm.
The offices of yin and yang,
The inner and outer spirits,
Protect the Dharma and pacify people,
Aid people and benefit beings.
Together they propagate the Dao’s transformation,
Assisting the upright and repelling the perverse.
Extending to the hidden and the manifest,
All together attain the wondrous Dao.
Above, we manifest the Celestial Venerable’s vast salvific grace;
Below, we fulfill your servants’ sincerity in surrendering our lives.

**Initiating the Vows**
First vow: For the sake of the Dao’s four great elements,
Uniting in virtue with the fast’s sponsor.
Seven generations of parents,
Freed from falling into sorrow and suffering,
Ascend to heaven,
Clothed and fed by nature.

Second vow: May the emperor and lords of states,
See the Dao’s transformation flourish and prosper.
Schools and academies teem,
The imperial teachings expand.
Majestic deportment is revered,
Universally observed.
The people praise great peace,
The six barbarians submit as guests.
Evil and perversity self-destruct,
Sages and worthies daily arise.

Third vow: May the Dharma master,
Establish great merit and virtue.
Teachings clearly propagated,
All together attain flying immortality.

Fourth vow: May fellow practitioners of the Dao,
Swiftly attain immortality,
Mutually guiding and delivering one another.

Fifth vow: May the nine relations live in harmony,
Esteeming benevolence and righteousness.
Valuing the Dao and deprecating wealth,
Their conduct a model for all beings.

Sixth vow: May those who diminish themselves in giving,
To Daoists and the hungry and cold,
And all people under heaven,
Each attain their rightful place.

Seventh vow: May crawling and creeping creatures,
All sentient beings,
Universally receive accomplishment.

Eighth vow: May past-life debts be forgiven,
This life’s karmic retributions,
Establish merit to compensate for transgressions.

Ninth vow: May the household flourish,
Ancestral temples have descendants,
Generations produce worthy talents.

Tenth vow: May we revere and receive the masters’ teachings,
Never daring to slacken in the middle,
With equanimity and single-mindedness,
Universally deliver all beings,
Attaining the rank of superior immortals.
Ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
Bow before the Most High,
Forever becoming Perfected Ones,
Riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages.
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

**Closing the Censer**

**Incense Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attendant Incense Spirits,**
may this place where I offer incense
naturally produce golden liquid elixirs, cinnabar mushrooms, and azure lingzhi blossoms.
May the hundred spirits and host of Perfected Ones
gather here before the incense burner.

glancing right, we hold the Bright Pearl.
The Six Perfections crown the pure practice,
while virtue and power renew with the sun.
Lifetimes of accumulated merit respond,
and hearing the scriptures feels like meeting kin.
Heaven-endowed with transcendent talent,
we joyfully chant the subtle and profound texts.
In emptiness, the Great Harmony’s qi,
we exhale and inhale the essence of streaming clouds.
Fetal breathing stills the hundred channels,
in profound solitude, we master the Three Conveniences.
The Mud Pill Palace gleams with luminous radiance,
and we attain the Golden Flower Immortals.
The Demon Kings respectfully receive their charge,
thus enabling our ascent to the heavens.
All begins with fasting and precepts,
layered merit forging karmic ties of old.
Soaring through the Great Void,
we uplift the loftiest adepts.
Guiding the reins to the ten directions,
we pause to rest on the dark radiance’s slope.
Gazing up at the Kalpa Terrace,
looking down upon the purple cloud net.
Carefree in the Supreme Capital,
we sit together upon lotus blossoms.
Through accumulated study, we become Perfected Ones,
serene, with harmonized defense and nourishment.
Forever enjoying boundless life,
why count the myriad aeons?
The Great Dao’s master is profound stillness,
ascending immortals befriend the peerless.
The Noble Scion bestows the numinous talisman,
the Supreme holds the Cavern Scripture.
The relics gleam with golden splendor,
the dragon chariot swiftly arrives to welcome.
The Heavenly Worthy gazes upon the cloud carriage,
floating, soaring through the void.
Fragrant flowers fall like snow,
mist and haze flourish upon the dark beams.

**First Vow:** May the Great Dao abide in tranquil emptiness, serene and still, dwelling in clarity of its own accord.

May all receive its beneficent grace and cultivate with diligent austerity.

**Second Vow:** May the various heavens condense their qi into purity,
their vast expanse high and encompassing, preserving truth and securing the numinous.
May the seasons be harmoniously regulated, the four movements balanced in peace.
May the nation be secure and the people prosperous, the world universally tranquil.
May all be broadly succored, and beneficence extend to all living beings.
May the heavens be preserved for eternity, unshaken through kalpas without end.

**Third Vow:** May the earth’s capacity to bear and sustain be boundless,
stable and unyielding, its seas and abysses unshaken.
May it securely guard the nation and the people flourish in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead rest in peace, beneficence pervading the ten directions.
May crops and grains thrive, and commerce daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant support, and the myriad beings follow in harmony.

**Fourth Vow:** May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, shine in lofty brilliance,
free from eclipses or dimming, their waxing and waning serene and clear.
May their light illumine the heavens, dispelling all darkness.
May they safeguard the kalpic destiny and the world’s destiny know peace.
May their beneficent moisture be universally bestowed, showering grace upon all beings.

**Fifth Vow:** May the stars shine with brilliance equal to the sun,
their revolving radiance illuminating the ten directions.
May each abide in its proper place, their paths straight and true.
May they securely guard the nation, free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be united in tranquility, and the world universally prosper.

**Sixth Vow:** May the four seasons progress in accord with their nodes,
their qi harmonious and balanced, free from disaster or affliction.
May pestilence and poison be extinguished, and the world know universal peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance, the nation prosperous and the people joyful.

**Seventh Vow:** May floating clouds gather their qi and amass their mists,
soaring high in the empty sky, casting their shadow over the profound.
When concealed, they abide in non-action; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the host of perfected beings.
May their beneficence flow to all, fostering the nation and cherishing the people.
May they universally succor all beings, and humanity share in kalpic longevity.

**Eighth Vow:** May wind and rain flow and shower without end,
their bounty universally bestowed, nurturing growth and flourishing.
May the myriad things thrive, the nation’s stores abundant and the people prosperous.

**Ninth Vow:** May the Five Peaks each abide in their proper direction,
their towering majesty encompassing all, ever serving as palaces of immortals.
May they securely guard the imperial destiny, preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none who do not look to them in reverence.

**Tenth Vow:** May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless,
containing and embracing all, nurturing even the smallest beings.
May their depths be gentle and beneficent, moistening all that wriggles and breathes.
May heaven and humanity receive their blessings, their years enduring like kalpic stone.

**Eleventh Vow:** May the emperor’s domain daily flourish,
its four frontiers secure and harmonious, weapons of war laid to rest.
May heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious signs descending in flight.
May teachings be widely disseminated, their majestic transformation overflowing.
May the multitudes rejoice, their joy unending.

**Twelfth Vow:** May all creatures—those that fly and crawl, born and unborn—
universally know safety and be brought to completion.
May all behold the primordial qi and receive the form of yang.
May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and none fail to flourish in fresh brilliance.

May harmony unite with the Dao and attain truth.

We have heard that at the inception of heaven and earth, the transformations of yin and yang gave rise to all things. They fashioned the myriad forms and governed the myriad regions, all bearing the ungoverned work of the Dao and harmonizing with the principle of non-action. Yet when the Great Dao receded, pure transformation ceased to flow. Dwellings replaced nests and caves, and the omens of extravagance arose from earth and wood. Thus, both the manifest and hidden realms transgressed divine prohibitions. Therefore, the rites of repentance and gratitude were established, eliciting the wondrous response of resonance.

For this reason, the **Three Honored Ones** expounded the teachings, and the **Ten Thousand Sages** suspended the statutes. The **Five Talismans** revealed the mechanisms of exorcism and pacification; the **Three Treasures** opened the instructions of repentance and prayer. This servant, having been permitted to partake in the true teachings, has presumptuously assumed this office. It is fitting to assist the state, establish merit, rescue the perilous, and aid the common folk. Whatever words are herein contained, we dare to present them fully.

**Reading the Petition**

Disciples of such-and-such, considering the unsuitability of our dwelling’s construction, contemplate establishing the merit of a purification rite to express expiation and gratitude. May our petition ascend, thereby eliciting wondrous resonance.

On this day, as such-and-such officiates the circumambulation, we, the assembled ritualists, offer the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the Supreme and Most Perfect Dao-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, and look up in reliance upon the Most High Three Honored Ones. May this merit flow to the ancestral temples and altars of the sacred dynasty, to the numinous spirits of the soil and grain. May its radiance ascend to the Ninefold Purity and its blessings extend to the myriad realms. May it safeguard the flourishing fortune of the realm and subtly assist the sagely designs. May the Emperor’s virtue embrace the Two Modes and his illumination equal the Two Luminaries. May no one be left destitute in the wilds, and may the court abound in loyalty and integrity. May the Empress and consorts inherit winds of well-being, and may the inner and outer realms together partake of the transformation of peace.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Most Perfect and True, whose virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

On this day, as such-and-such officiates the circumambulation, we, the assembled ritualists, offer the second pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the Supreme and Most Perfect Scripture-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, and look up in reliance upon the Most High Three Honored Ones. May this merit flow to the household of disciple so-and-so. May the nine generations and seven lineages, the myriad ancestors and ten thousand forebears, transcend the dark night and ascend to behold the light. May they refine their essences in the Southern Palace and be born into the celestial realms. Moreover, may all beings in the three wretched destinies and six paths of rebirth, though differing in kind, together bathe in the fragrance of cultivation and ascend the path of fortune.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Most Perfect and True, whose virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

On this day, as such-and-such officiates the circumambulation, we, the assembled ritualists, offer the third pinch of incense. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, and look up in reliance upon the Most High Three Honored Ones. May this merit flow to the household of the purification rite’s sponsor, so-and-so. May the six affinities and five clans, all kin and relations, avert future calamities, absolve past transgressions, renew their blessed destiny, and prolong their years. May their dwellings be fittingly situated and the dragon spirits securely pacified. Thereafter, may all beings—whether soaring or sinking, animate or inanimate—together receive the mysterious grace and universally partake of the vast beneficence.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Most Perfect and True, whose virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

We have heard that the Great Dao sheds its light, spreading harmony and transformation. It shapes and steeps the primordial qi, giving birth to the Three Powers. Yin and yang alternate in their cycles, kalpas rise and fall in their destined turns. Endowed with spirit and nurtured in form, beings take shape and flow into manifestation. Before transcending the mechanism of change, they are bound to signs of prosperity and decline. Without invoking the supreme sages, blessings are hard to bestow.

We reflect upon the jade books of the Three Caverns, the golden tablets of the Nine Heavens—turtle-scripted phoenix scrolls, dragon-sealed tiger tallies. These can stabilize emperors and kings, safeguarding the kalpas; embodying the boundless Dao, they endure with Heaven. Next, they can restore the celestial canon, altering the course of disasters; pacifying families and protecting nations, aiding beings and bringing peace to people. The netherworld receives their deliverance, and the distressed find means of expiation. When fragrant incense ascends, sincere prayers surely reach. When the true register is presented, the august spirits surely witness.

The disciple [Name], fearing misfortune in their fate and deeply troubled, presents offerings and petitions, praying for manifest protection. We, having received the luminous teachings, exhort and guide the Dharma stream. Following the mystic statutes, we undertake this fast to cultivate blessings, invoking the Three Realms and repenting to the Ten Directions. Pouring forth our sincerity, we turn the scriptures and perform the Dao. Lamps divide like crane flames, dispelling darkness with flowing radiance; incense scatters like dragon smoke, piercing the void to convey our faith.

We humbly pray that the Celestial Worthy and the Supreme Ones bestow their compassionate salvation; that the Golden Towers and Jade Capitals, the thousand perfected ones, extend their protective power. May decrees descend upon the Three Realms, universally proclaiming to all heavens. Bestow blessings, extend grace, deliver the living and ferry the dead. Reconcile grievances, dissolve disasters. Let the five phases avoid harmful clashes, and the three luminaries cease inauspicious conjunctions. Above, resolve the afflictions of celestial bodies and the twelve celestial mansions; below, resolve the calamities of mountains and rivers, the nine palaces, and the eight trigrams’ domains.

For accumulated transgressions and deep misfortunes, layered disasters; for past grievances and old debts, unintended killings and mistaken harms; for the three karmas and six emotions, boundless offenses—through this repentance, we beseech their complete eradication.

We pray that the nation’s destiny be prolonged, the sage’s longevity eternal; that the three luminaries shine brightly, the four seasons harmonize. May weapons of war not rise, beacon fires cease their warnings. May evil demons hide, auspicious omens arrive. Floods, fires, droughts, locusts, wars, and plagues—may none assail our borders, and may perfect peace be preserved.

We further pray that the seven generations of ancestors ascend to Heaven, the nine depths of darkness be released from confrontation. May all beings, flying and crawling, fulfill their natures and dwell in peace. May the earthly prisons and yin tribunals, the three paths and six destinies, all ascend to the shore of blessings, bathed in the wind of the Dao.

Above, may the Celestial Worthy’s vast salvific grace be manifest; below, may it match the sincerity of we, your servants, in our devotion. We reverently present this petition.

**Invoking the Ten Resolutions**
First resolve: For the four great elements of the Dao, in harmony with the virtue of the fast’s sponsor. May the seven generations of parents escape suffering and sorrow, ascend to Heaven’s halls, and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second resolve: For the emperor and sovereign, may the Dao’s transformation flourish. May academies thrive, the imperial teachings expand. May their majesty be awe-inspiring, witnessed by all under Heaven. May the people praise great peace, the four barbarians submit. May evil demons perish, sages and worthies be born daily.

Third resolve: For the Dharma masters, may their merit and virtue be greatly established. May their teachings be clear and far-reaching, all attaining immortality.

Fourth resolve: For fellow practitioners. May they swiftly attain the immortal Dao, mutually guiding and delivering one another.

Fifth resolve: For the nine relations to be harmonious, valuing benevolence and righteousness. May they honor the Dao and despise wealth, their conduct a model for all.

Sixth resolve: For self-denial, bestowing alms upon Daoists and the hungry and cold. May all people under Heaven find their rightful place.

Seventh resolve: For crawling and creeping creatures, all sentient beings. May they all receive fulfillment.

Eighth resolve: For pardoning past lives’ debts. May this life’s karmic retribution be resolved through merit, amending past wrongs.

Ninth resolve: For the prosperity of family and nation. May ancestral temples have descendants, and worthy talents be born in every generation.

Tenth resolve: For honoring the scripture masters. May we never falter, maintaining equanimity and single-mindedness. May we broadly deliver all beings, attaining the highest immortality, ascending to Heaven in broad daylight, paying homage to the Supreme. May we forever become perfected ones, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages, merging in harmony with the True.

**Returning to the Brazier**

To the Fragrant Office Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attendant spirit-officials of incense: May the place where I offer this incense spontaneously generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred numinous perfected ones gather here, assembling before the brazier in the cavernous chamber. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May I encounter those of karmic affinity and realize the fruit of non-action. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions receive this fragrant smoke and swiftly convey the words I have just uttered directly to the August Presence beneath the Jade Towers of the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Golden Portal of the Supreme Limitless Dao.

*Exiting the chamber*

restrains and severs demonic tracks.

We humbly recall that as the Dao’s workings unfold and the Primordial August One bestows transformation, the true and numinous manifest their blessings, and heaven and earth respond with auspicious signs. The two correct qi are rectified in the Upper Mystery, and the three calamities are stilled in the lower realms. Thus are all things harmonized and at peace, and all living beings receive blessings and protection. The household and state are universally tranquil, and the dark and hidden realms are universally benefited. We have long received the mysterious grace, bathed in its vast blessings. We have studied and borne the precious texts, perused the true canons. Following the Supreme’s great compassionate decree and the Heavenly Worthy’s universal deliverance, we aspire to establish modest merit to aid the great transformation. We deliver beings and rescue creatures, relieving distress and aiding the imperiled. We assist the state and serve the times, hoping to offer our sincere devotion. For all our words and petitions, dare we not make them known above?

*Reading the Petition*
As the words declare, we deeply cultivate and reverently serve.

May we beseech the sagely grace to dissolve calamities and misfortunes. With reverence, we prepare fragrant flowers and present the ritual offerings. Our hearts pledge before the Three Realms, our lives surrender to the hosts of heaven. Following the mysterious canons, we undertake the fast and vigil. We purify our minds, still our thoughts, kindle lamps, and burn incense. We perform the rites of the *Fahe Tu* for expiation and thanksgiving, adhering to the litanies of the Great One for supplication. Our sincerity hastens to the Golden Gates, our contemplation reaches the Jade Capital. May we attain resonance and receive manifest protection.

At this noon audience, as we perform the Dao, the assembly of ritualists now offers the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Dao-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Worthies of the Most High. May these merits flow to the imperial destiny and the august lineage, to the ancestral temples and the sagely succession. May the reign transcend the Three and Five, the Dao surpassing Fuxi and Shennong. May the sovereign roam the Purple Pole in spirit, repose in the Crimson Mound and shed his form. Ascending to the ranks of the perfected above, bestowing blessings upon the august lineage below. May the emperor’s longevity equal the Eight Seas, his radiance illumine the Two Effulgences. May Yao’s clouds broadly cover, Shun’s sun ever brighten. May the six palaces embody the rule of gentleness and compliance, the hundred officials uphold loyalty and steadfastness. May all directions be pure and prosperous, the four seas tranquil and orderly.

Now, as we burn incense, we take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtues of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

At this noon audience, as we perform the Dao, the assembly of ritualists now offers the second pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Scripture-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Worthies of the Most High. May these merits flow to the family of the fast’s sponsor, to their karmic bonds through kalpas, their accumulated generations of kin. May the ninefold darkness of lingering attachments and the sevenfold ancestors’ spiritual forms ascend to the sagely hosts in the heavens, escaping the long night’s entanglements. May their transgressions be forever erased, their immortal ranks attained.

Now, as we burn incense, we take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtues of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

At this noon audience, as we perform the Dao, the assembly of ritualists now offers the third pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Teacher-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Worthies of the Most High. May these merits flow to the sponsor’s household. May past faults be absolved, calamities and misfortunes cease. May the living and deceased flourish, their kin secure and peaceful. Even in the cold realms of the earth-prison, may all receive deliverance. May the Three Paths and Nine Nights all behold the light. May the world enjoy harmony and well-being, the land know no disasters or pestilence. May those dwelling in mountains and valleys attain the Dao and ascend to perfection.

Now, as we burn incense, we take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtues of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Each visualizes the nine-hued perfect image, swallows saliva, and recites the secret incantation to command demons. Stepping into the void, circling and weaving—
cloud-net steps ascend, celestial winds suddenly blow.
Sleeves flutter past the Dipper’s handle, whisk in hand they bow to the Banner of Stars.
Lions bear cinnabar tassels, qilin lead jade-green chariots.
Soaring through the eight poles, how often do spring branches bloom?
Green wings tower in crimson headbands, azure mists entwine feathered robes.
At dawn they hasten to the knot of solar virtue, by night they arrive at the moon’s radiant gate.
They grasp and play with the fires of the celestial sphere, then conceal and stir the earth’s mechanisms.
The Jade Chamber cannot detain them—they soar back toward the nine heavens.

Long ago in the Hall of Extended Grace, at midnight the Nine August Ones descended.
Six Perfected divided left and right, yellow mist coiled through the galleries.
Within the vast palace, the divine lords were revered; immortal soldiers guarded the Daoist sanctuary.
Now the filial descendant continues this vow, face-to-face with the numinous light in an instant.

We have heard that when the Most High unfurled the charts, the myriad spirits received blessings.
When the Perfected expounded their grace, all beings flourished in glory.
The proper lodgings were measured by celestial reckoning, and calamities were stilled by earthly records.
Divine winds brought tranquility, and the hidden and manifest revived.

Moved by the urgency of disasters and decline, we earnestly seek purification through repentance.
We present offerings of incense, flowers, and ritual tokens, along with brocade and patterned silks.
We pledge our sincerity and offer our hearts, beseeching heaven to grant life.

Following the ritual codes, we have prepared the altar.
Burning incense and lighting lamps, we illuminate the Three Realms—
above, the boundless realms of the myriad heavens and the halls of eternal joy;
below, the deepest recesses of the nine earths and the darkest prisons of hell.

May all karmic grievances of eons be universally absolved.
May the nine lineages receive deliverance and attain purity.

Then, may the disasters of stars, planets, sun, and moon—even the dark luminaries—be resolved above;

**Supreme Vows**
May the Emperor enjoy boundless longevity, his reign enduring and prosperous.

May the Empress and inner court embody the virtue of earth’s receptivity.
May the Crown Prince and imperial kinsmen strengthen the sagely enterprise.
May civil and military officials, near and far, fulfill their duties with integrity.
May the hundred offices be rightly ordered, the nine virtues duly observed.
May heaven be clear and earth serene, the nation prosperous and the people harmonious.
May sun and moon shine doubly bright, clouds and mists display five hues.
May weapons be sheathed, grain and harvests abundant.
May the Yellow River yield its ninefold charts, and mountains resound with ten thousand years.

**For Ourselves**
May we perfect the six virtues and realize the three expedients.
May we dwell in valleys and cold retreats, attaining the fruit of perfection.

**Vows**
First vow: May the Great Dao abide in tranquil emptiness, serene and still, dwelling in clarity.
May it widely open the gates of the Dharma, guiding the stubborn and foolish.
May all receive its beneficence and cultivate themselves with diligence.
May those who study together universally ascend to the void,
preserving harmony with heaven, abiding forever without sorrow.

Second vow: May the myriad heavens condense qi and become pure.
May the vast expanse protect and secure the true and numinous.
May climates be harmonious, the four seasons balanced.
May nations be secure and people prosperous, the world at peace.
May all be universally aided, and all living beings receive grace.
May heaven endure eternally, unshaken for countless kalpas.

Third vow: May the earth bear and sustain without end.
May it remain stable and unshaken, seas and abysses uncollapsed.
May it protect and secure households and nations, the multitudes thriving in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead at peace, grace extending to the ten directions.
May crops flourish, enterprises prosper daily.
May all receive its abundant support, all beings following in harmony.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, shine brightly.
May they know no eclipses or dimming, remaining serene and clear.
May their light illuminate the heavens, dispelling all darkness.
May they safeguard the kalpic destiny, the world’s reign peaceful.
May they universally bestow moisture and grace, showering blessings upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations equal the sun in brilliance.
May their revolving light shine radiantly, illuminating the ten directions.
May each remain in its proper place, their paths straight and true.
May they protect and secure households and nations, free from disaster.
May the four seas be united, the world flourishing.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons follow their cycles in due order.
May climates be harmonious, free from calamity.
May epidemics vanish, the world at peace.
May the five grains ripen abundantly, nations wealthy and people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds gather qi and condense mist.
May they soar high and become pure, shading the mysterious.
When concealed, they embody non-action; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the host of Perfected.
May grace flow universally, benefiting nations and cherishing people.
May all beings be universally aided, sharing the kalpic age.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without end.
May they universally bestow their bounty, nurturing growth.
May all things flourish, nations store wealth and people prosper.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks each remain in their proper place.
May they tower majestically, forever serving as immortal palaces.
May they secure the nation’s destiny, preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none failing to revere them.

Tenth vow: May rivers and seas be vast and boundless.
May they contain and embrace all, nurturing even the smallest beings.
May their depths be gentle and gracious, moistening all that wriggles and breathes.
May heavenly fires be blessed, and years endure like kalpic stone.

Eleventh vow: May emperors and kings see their lands flourish day by day.
May the Four Guardians remain in harmony, weapons of war never raised.
May heaven and humanity sing in chorus, auspicious omens descend in flight.
May teachings spread in abundance, majestic transformation overflow.
May the myriad people rejoice, their joy unending.

Twelfth vow: May all that flies and crawls, born or unborn,

May they all behold the primordial qi, receiving the form of yang.
May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and uplifted, none failing to flourish in brilliance.
