chunks.original_text: 无上玄元太上道君，召出臣等身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言散花玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域，真官正神。 以今奉为入意祈恩玉阙，进拜丹书。 愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中。 即使紫精郁勃，玉阙开明。 五老辅根，万帝摄真。 体圆珠映，乘景骖宸。 金光焕赫，御炁上清。 令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道无形无名虚无自然金阙玉陛下。 各称法位 上清玄都大洞三景弟子、无上三洞法师，奉行黄箓大斋降诞法事，某岳先生某帝真人臣某等，同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，高上大道金阙玄元天皇大帝太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，十方已得道大圣众至真诸君丈人，三十六天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝太帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，南上好生君，文昌主仙君，长生领籍司命韩君丈人，太平下教二十四真人，三界应感一切真灵。 臣等伏闻，太虚无象，以道为万象之根； 万象禀生，以道为通生之本。 由是玄黄叙列，光景昭宣。 日阙月城，高辟九清之上； 至真元圣，端居八景之中。 孚巨泽而济人天，播神功而镇邦国。 所以五篇灵奥，赏五帝而廓五方； 三洞弘深，出三清而福三界。 巍乎至极，历劫所尊。 某等夙奉玄经，豫参真妙。 思凭道力，上答昌期。 当重离耀彩之辰，祈万圣垂祥之锡。 况承词旨，敢不上闻。 皇帝青词，谨当宣奏。 读词 按如词言，理宜关奏。 是用按重玄秘范，开众妙福庭。 烧香然灯，转经行道。 宅神恬漠，抗志希微。 共励精诚，以希祯佑。 以今落景行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流宗社尊灵、列圣昭穆。 八霞宝舆，凌碧汉以登真； 万景飙轮，辗绛霄而证道。 凝神紫殿，垂佑皇图。 超连陆以无为，迈羲融而永祚。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今落景行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流皇帝。 伏冀福澄八海，拥群瑞以朝宗； 寿耸五山，集千祥而拱极。 纳勋华於术内，吞轩昊於彀中。 妃后六宫，匡扶睿德。 诸王百揆，翼赞天休。 万国和宁，五兵韬戢。 三农衍溢，品位舒荣。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今落景行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真师宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流皇太子。 伏冀青宫纳佑，皇极贻休。 龙楼增明雨之辉，鸡戟耀重光之瑞。 福崇昆阆，寿永椿龄。 孝德忠规，光敷万宇。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 礼方 忏悔
chunks.translated_text:
The Most High Mysterious Origin, Supreme Lord of the Dao, summons forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officials, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Word and Flower, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Daily Incense Officers—thirty-two of each—forth they come. As they emerge, they array themselves in solemn attire and open the gates of the Mysterious Altar to the Heavenly Thearch and Divine Lord. They shall summon the local earth gods and territorial true officials.

Today, in reverent offering for the intent of supplication and grace at the Jade Palace, we present our cinnabar script. May the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into our bodies. Thus shall the purple essence surge and flourish, the Jade Palace shine resplendent. The Five Elders shall nurture the root, the Ten Thousand Thearchs gather the true. Our forms shall mirror the luminous pearl, riding the light and harnessing the imperial chariot. Golden radiance blazes forth, guiding the qi to ascend to the Upper Clarity. May our entreaties swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless, Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Golden Portal and Jade Steps of the Great Dao.

Each declares their dharma rank:
Disciples of the Three Luminaries of the Great Cavern of the Mysterious Capital of the Upper Clarity, Supreme Masters of the Three Caverns, we, the Yellow Register Grand Fast Masters of the Descendant’s Birth Rites of [such-and-such] Peak, Master [Name], and the Perfected Minister [Name], with one heart, reverently address the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Honored One, the Boundless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Highest Great Dao, the Golden Portal Mysterious Origin Heavenly Thearch Emperor, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, the Great Sage Perfected Hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the True Lords and Elders, the Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Void Thearch, the Jade Emperor and Great Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern True, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Portal, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity, Upper Palace, Numinous Treasure, Perfected Radiant August Lord of the Dao, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the Southern Lord of Life, the Lord Immortal of Literary Florescence, the Longevity Registrar and Minister of Destiny, Lord Elder Han, the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Peaceful Lesser Teaching, and all responsive and efficacious true numina of the Three Realms.

We prostrate ourselves and have heard: the Great Void is without form, and the Dao is the root of the ten thousand forms; the ten thousand forms receive life, and the Dao is the foundation of their mutual generation. Thus do the Mysterious and Yellow unfold in order, their light and brilliance manifest and proclaimed. The sun’s palace and moon’s city stand high above the Nine Clarities; the utmost true and primordial sages dwell steadfast within the Eight Luminaries. They nurture the vast and benefit the heavens and humans, spreading divine merit to guard the states and kingdoms. Therefore, the five sacred and profound chapters reward the Five Thearchs and expand the Five Directions; the Three Caverns, vast and deep, emerge from the Three Clarities to bless the Three Realms. Lofty beyond measure, revered through kalpas uncounted.

We have long revered the mysterious scriptures and early partaken of the true and wondrous. We aspire to rely on the power of the Dao to respond to this flourishing era. On this day of resplendent radiance, we pray for the myriad sages to bestow auspicious blessings. Moreover, in accordance with the imperial edict, how dare we not make this known above? The emperor’s blue-green memorial shall now be respectfully proclaimed.

The memorial is read.
As the words of the memorial dictate, it is fitting to present this petition. Thus do we follow the profound and secret model, opening the courtyard of myriad blessings. We burn incense and light lamps, recite scriptures, and perform the Dao. The household spirits remain tranquil, our aspirations lofty and subtle. Together we cultivate sincere devotion, seeking auspicious protection.

Today, as we perform the evening circumambulation, the assembled ritualists offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme, Utmost True Treasure of the Dao.

We surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, heads to the earth, and reverently rely upon the Three Honored Ones of the Supreme. May this merit flow to the august spirits of the ancestral temple and the illustrious ancestors of successive generations. May the Eight Radiant Jade Chariots ascend the azure heavens to attain perfection; may the myriad luminous whirlwinds traverse the crimson empyrean to realize the Dao. May the Purple Palace gather our spirits, bestowing protection upon the imperial domain. May it transcend the Six Directions in non-action, surpassing the eras of Fu Xi and Shen Nong to perpetuate the imperial blessings.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the great sagely hosts, the virtues of the utmost true, who after attaining the Dao ascend into the formless. Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Today, as we perform the evening circumambulation, the assembled ritualists offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme, Utmost True Treasure of the Scriptures.

We surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, heads to the earth, and reverently rely upon the Three Honored Ones of the Supreme. May this merit flow to the emperor. We humbly pray that blessings fill the Eight Seas, gathering myriad auspices to pay homage; that longevity towers like the Five Peaks, assembling a thousand blessings to support the imperial pole. May he receive the glory of the Zhou within his arts, and encompass the vastness of the Xia and Shang within his grasp. May the empress and consorts of the Six Palaces uphold his sagely virtue; may the myriad princes and hundred ministers assist and augment the heavenly blessings. May the ten thousand states live in harmony, the five weapons sheathed and still. May the Three Nurturers flourish abundantly, and all ranks and positions expand in glory.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the great sagely hosts, the virtues of the utmost true, who after attaining the Dao ascend into the formless. Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Today, as we perform the evening circumambulation, the assembled ritualists offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme, Utmost True Treasure of the Masters.

We surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, heads to the earth, and reverently rely upon the Three Honored Ones of the Supreme. May this merit flow to the imperial heir apparent. We humbly pray that the Eastern Palace receive protection, and the imperial pole bequeath blessings. May the Dragon Tower’s brilliance increase like the radiance of rain, and the halberd’s splendor double the auspicious light. May fortune exalt him to the heights of Kunlun, and longevity extend like the age of the camphor tree. May his filial virtue and loyal conduct illuminate the ten thousand regions.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the great sagely hosts, the virtues of the utmost true, who after attaining the Dao ascend into the formless. Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

The directions are saluted.
Repentance.

chunks.original_text: 三启 三礼 大道洞玄虚，有念无不契。 炼质入仙真，遂成金刚体。 超度三界难，地狱五苦解。 悉归太上经，静念稽首礼。 臣等至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 臣等至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 臣等至心稽首礼，玄中大法师。 重称法位 具位臣某等谨重上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，十方无极大道道德众圣，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师天师君，上相上宰、四极真王，长生大圣，主仙众真，南宫领校，三界尊灵。 臣等伏闻，元洞玉历，大有金书。 开光至极之初，泛景太无之上。 灵风集妙，真道融精。 出长生度世之篇，有腾驾升玄之要。 法音乍阐，四万劫以方传； 绛府重宣，五亿天而共仰。 故得九皇师禀，历世宗修，佐国安邦，垂祥致福。 某等希真属念，尊道披元。 祈景贶於厖洪，伫精诚之通感。 当前星诞瑞之节，依上情启福之仪。 然灯烧香，转经行道。 冥心十极，驰欵诸天。 所祈万圣，倾光众尊。 流鉴延恩，紫阙贻贶。 皇朝社稷隆昌，宗祧安镇。 洪基克固，绵劫常存。 皇帝寿越蓬壶，福齐穹昊。 尧蓂舜历，与乌兔以无穷； 禹迹周封，而华夷而顺化。 皇妃王子，翼奉帝猷。 率土普天，敷扬睿渥。 殊庭纳欵，绝域归宾。 岁有丰登，俗臻康乐。 皇太子文明温穆，宣慈惠和。 耀忠孝於离方，群方仰德； 茂谦恭於震域，九域胆风。 永赞圣功，允昌大宝。 洎乎显晦，旁及飞沉。 俱跻仁寿之庭，同洽雍熙之运。 上明天尊广济之泽，下副臣等归命之诚。 谨启。 发愿 一愿大道流行，普天怀德。 二愿一切有生，咸皆悟道。 三愿九夜悲魂，一时解脱。 四愿孤魂无依，咸得受生。 五愿天下太平，五谷丰熟。 六愿臣忠子孝，君仁父慈。 七愿四海通同，冤亲和释。 八愿潜胞处卵，咸得生成。 九愿积疾新痾，旋即痊愈。 十愿孤露众生，丰衣足食。 复炉 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣上章之所，自然生金液丹碧芝英。 百灵众真，交会在此，洞案炉前。 令臣体耀金辉，斩伐胞根。 七玄拔擢，百关备仙。 解除死籍，宴坐泥丸。 东华纪字，策景虚玄。 十方仙童玉女，接侍香烟，传臣向来所启之言，速达径御太上无极大道无形无名虚无自然金阙玉陛下。 出户 太上黄箓斋仪卷之十二竟
chunks.translated_text:
Three Invocations, Three Bows

The Great Dao pervades the profound void,
With mindfulness, none fails to align.
Refining the essence to join the immortals,
Thus forming the vajra body.
Transcending the three realms’ tribulations,
Dissolving the five hells’ sufferings.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures—
In stillness, we bow our heads in reverence.

We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reverently addressing the sacred ranks:
We, your humble servants, now solemnly invoke the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning; the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Supreme Lord Lao; the boundless hosts of sagely and virtuous beings of the Ten Directions; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Heavenly Master, Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm; the Supreme Ministers and Prime Counsellors; the True Kings of the Four Poles; the Great Sage of Longevity; the Lords of Immortal Multitudes; the Registrars of the Southern Palace; and the revered spirits of the Three Realms.

We humbly recall: the Primordial Jade Calendar of the Mystic Void, the Golden Scriptures of the Great Existence. At the dawn of radiant enlightenment, upon the vast expanse of supreme nothingness, the divine winds gathered in subtlety, and the true Dao fused with essence. There emerged the chapters of *Eternal Life and Salvation of the World*, containing the essentials of soaring ascent and transcendence. The Dharma’s resonance first resounded, transmitted through forty thousand kalpas; the Crimson Palace repeatedly proclaimed it, revered by five hundred million heavens. Thus, the Nine August Masters received it, practicing and venerating it through the ages, aiding the state and pacifying the realm, bestowing auspicious blessings and conferring fortune.

We, aspiring to truth and holding the Dao in reverence, unfold the primordial. We pray for boundless blessings, awaiting the communion of sincere devotion. On this propitious day of stellar brilliance, we follow the rites of supplication to invoke felicity. Lighting lamps and burning incense, we recite the scriptures and circumambulate the Dao. With minds fixed upon the Ten Poles, we send forth our earnest pleas to the heavens. We beseech the myriad sages to incline their radiance, and the hosts of venerables to extend their grace. May their discerning gaze bestow favor, and the Purple Palace grant blessings.

May the imperial dynasty’s altars flourish and endure, the ancestral temples stand secure. May the grand foundation be firmly established, enduring through eternal kalpas. May the Emperor’s longevity surpass Penglai, his fortune equal the boundless heavens. May his reign mirror the calendars of Yao and Shun, endless as the sun and moon; may his domain encompass the traces of Yu and the enclosures of Zhou, bringing harmony to Hua and Yi alike. May the imperial consorts and princes assist in upholding the imperial way. May all within the four seas and under heaven receive and propagate his sagely grace. May distant courts submit in reverence, and remote lands become tributary guests. May the years yield abundant harvests, and the people attain peace and joy.

May the imperial heir apparent be cultured, gentle, and kind, radiating benevolence and harmony. May his loyalty and filial piety shine in the southern quarter, his virtue admired by all; may his humility and reverence flourish in the eastern realm, his noble example inspiring the nine domains. May he forever assist in the sagely enterprise, ensuring the prosperity of the great treasure. Extending to all, whether manifest or hidden, high or low, may all ascend to the garden of benevolence and longevity, and together partake in the era of harmony and prosperity.

Above, may the radiant Celestial Worthy’s boundless grace be manifest; below, may it fulfill our humble servants’ sincerity in taking refuge.

Respectfully invoked.

Vows:
First vow: May the Great Dao flow freely, and all under heaven embrace virtue.
Second vow: May all sentient beings awaken to the Dao.
Third vow: May the sorrowful souls of the nine nights attain liberation at once.
Fourth vow: May the forsaken spirits without refuge all receive rebirth.
Fifth vow: May the world know peace, and the five grains ripen in abundance.
Sixth vow: May ministers be loyal and children filial, rulers benevolent and fathers kind.
Seventh vow: May the four seas be united, and enmities resolved in harmony.
Eighth vow: May those in wombs and eggs all be born and thrive.
Ninth vow: May chronic and recent illnesses swiftly be healed.
Tenth vow: May the destitute and orphaned be clothed and fed.

Replenishing the incense burner:
Incense Official Messengers, Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all attendant spirit officials—may this place where we present our petition naturally generate golden elixir, cinnabar, and jade mushrooms. May the hosts of a hundred spirits and immortals gather here before the mystic altar. May our bodies radiate golden splendor, severing the roots of the womb’s bonds. May the seven mysteries be uplifted, and the hundred passages perfected for immortality. May the registers of death be erased, and our seats established in the mud-pill palace. May our names be recorded in the Eastern Flowery Realm, and our spirits ascend to the void’s mystery. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the incense smoke, conveying our supplications swiftly to the Celestial Worthy of the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Formless and Nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, before the Golden Portal and Jade Steps.

Exiting the chamber.
Thus concludes the twelfth scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

chunks.original_text: 太上黄箓斋仪卷之十三 唐广成先生杜光庭集 特　勑为臣下消灾清旦行道 入户 各礼师，存念如法 卫灵 青阳虚映，曜日回灵。 神虎辟邪， 飞天流铃。 摧奸灭试，万魔束形。 九微回道，八威摄精。 千真校录， 三元荡清。 左啸中黄，右策六丁。 七转八合，周旋天经。 圣化巍巍， 三道顺行。 庆云流布，合景黄庭。 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上玄元太上道君召出臣身，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言散花玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域、真官正神。 以今奉为入意祈恩玉阙，进拜丹书。 愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中，使紫精郁勃，玉关开明。 五老辅根，万帝摄真。 体圆珠映，乘景骖宸。 金光焕赫，御炁上清。 令臣所启，速远径御太上无极大道无形无名虚无自然金阙玉陛下、神霄九宸上帝御前。 请称法位 上清玄都大洞三景弟子、无上三洞法师、奉行黄箓大斋消灾法事，某岳先生某帝真人臣谨同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，高上大道金阙玄元天皇大帝太上老君，高上玉皇，十方已得道大圣众至真诸君丈人，三十六天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝大帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，三界官属一切真灵。 臣等伏闻，道用无方，玄慈下济。 延祥致福，佐国度人。 五符宣制御之威，三洞广护持之力。 除灾解厄，灭罪延生。 亿劫常存，古今咸仰。 所以龙书凤札，河图申宥过之文； 绿籍朱编，太一垂忏灾之品。 励精诚於下土，契昭感於上清。 惟善是从，有祈必应。 况承词旨，敢不上闻。 皇帝青词，谨当宣奏。 读词 按如词言，所宜关奏。 皇帝承天布化，体道临人。 惧一物之失宜，欲万方之皆泰。 遐开寿域，以纳群生。 以某官灾运所缠，用希消解。 备香花而展礼，质龙彩以驰心。 注仰玄关，允祈鸿福。 以今清旦行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流宗祧列圣，社稷尊灵。 承景贶以登真，上朝金阙； 演殊祯而护国，下固瑶图。 驾鸾鹤以逍遥，比乾坤而遐永。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流皇帝。 伏觊八溟浩荡，与凤历以常存； 群岳巍峨，比龙仪而克固。 庄椿等寿，舜日齐明。 皇后嫔妃，播贞猷於万宇； 诸王太子，扶睿德於千龄。 百揆有伦，庶官咸理。
chunks.translated_text:
**Thirteenth Scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*
Compiled by Tang Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting
By Special Edict for the Minister’s Disaster-Dispelling Dawn Dao-Procession**

Entering the chamber.
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits Invocation**
Azure yang illumines the void, the sun’s radiance revolves in numinous splendor.
Divine tigers repel evil, flying celestials stream with ringing bells.
Crush treachery and annihilate trials—ten thousand demons bind their forms.
Ninefold subtleties turn the Dao’s course; eightfold majesties seize essences.
A thousand perfected audit the registers; the Three Primes scour and purify.
To the left, the Central Yellow roars; to the right, the Six Dings are spurred.
Seven revolutions, eight unions—revolving through the celestial canon.
Sacred transformations towering, the Three Ways proceed in harmony.
Auspicious clouds flow and spread, merging with the Yellow Court’s luminous scene.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
The Supreme Mysterious Origin, the Most High Dao Lord, summons forth from this minister’s body:
The Three and Five Merit Officers, the Attendant Envoys of Left and Right,
The Incense-Bearing Golden Lads, the Petal-Scattering Jade Maidens,
The Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, the Day-Officers of Incense—
Each thirty-two in number—emerge.
Emerging, they solemnly attire and open the gates of the Mystic Altar’s Heavenly Emperor Divine Lords,
Summoning the local earth gods and territorial true officials.
On this day, we offer prayers for the intent of supplication and grace at the Jade Portal,
Presenting the cinnabar scriptures.
May the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and Numinous Treasure’s wondrous light descend,
Flowing into our bodies, causing purple essence to flourish and the Jade Pass to brighten.
May the Five Elders assist our roots, the Ten Thousand Thearchs seize our true nature.
Our forms round as pearls reflecting light, riding the luminous chariot to the celestial court.
Golden splendor blazes resplendent, guiding qi to ascend to the Upper Clarity.
May our supplications swiftly reach the Celestial Worthy of the Supreme Boundless Great Dao,
The Formless and Nameless, the Void and Spontaneous,
Before the Golden Portal and Jade Steps of the Nine Celestial Thearchs’ Divine Palace.

**Proclaiming the Dharma Titles**
Disciple of the Three Luminaries of the Great Cavern of the Mysterious Capital of the Upper Clarity,
Supreme Master of the Three Caverns,
Practitioner of the Great Yellow Register Fast for Disaster-Dispelling Rites,
This Mountain’s Master, This Thearch’s Perfected Minister [Name],
With utmost sincerity, jointly reverently addresses the Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous,
The Supreme Boundless Great Dao Lord of the Most High Dao,
The Supreme August Thearch of the Golden Portal and Mysterious Origin,
The Most High Jade Emperor,
The Great Sage Perfected Hosts of the Ten Directions Who Have Attained the Dao,
The Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperor Lords,
The Jade Clarity Thearch,
The Jade Emperor Great Thearch,
The Eastern Flowery, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected,
The Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Portal, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace,
The Purple Tenuity Upper Palace’s Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
The Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
All divine officials and true numina of the Three Realms.

We, your ministers, have heard that the Dao’s efficacy is boundless,
Its dark compassion descending to succor.
It extends blessings and bestows fortune, aiding the state and delivering the people.
The Five Talismans proclaim the majesty of its command;
The Three Caverns expand the power of its protection.
It dispels disasters and resolves calamities, erases sins and prolongs life.
Through countless kalpas it endures; from ancient times to the present, all revere it.
Thus the dragon-script and phoenix-charms, the River Chart’s texts of pardon for transgressions;
The green registers and vermilion records, the Supreme Unity’s repentance rites for averting calamities.
Exerting utmost sincerity in the lower realms, we harmonize with the luminous responses of the Upper Clarity.
Only goodness is followed; every prayer is answered.
Moreover, in accordance with the imperial decree, how dare we not report above?

**The Emperor’s Green Petition**
To be solemnly proclaimed.
As stated in the petition, it is fitting to memorialize.
The Emperor, receiving Heaven’s mandate to spread transformation and embodying the Dao to govern the people,
Fears even a single being may suffer misfortune, desiring all directions to attain peace.
He widely opens the realm of longevity to embrace all living beings.
As [Official Title] is afflicted by baleful influences, we seek their dissolution.
We prepare fragrant flowers to perform rites, presenting dragon-brocade to convey our hearts.
Gazing reverently toward the Mysterious Pass, we earnestly pray for vast blessings.

**This dawn’s Dao-procession, the assembled dharma hosts,**
Offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating our heads to the earth,
Reverently relying on the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit flow to our ancestral lineage and all the sagely hosts,
To the altars of soil and grain and the august numina.
May we receive luminous blessings to ascend and attain perfection, ascending to the Golden Portal;
May we manifest wondrous auspices to protect the state, firmly securing the jade chart below.
Riding simurghs and cranes in carefree wandering, may we endure as long as Heaven and Earth.

Thus we burn incense, from our return to the masters, the great sages, the host of perfected,
To the virtues of those who have attained the Dao and ascended into the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao’s true nature.

**This dawn’s Dao-procession, the assembled dharma hosts,**
Offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating our heads to the earth,
Reverently relying on the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the Emperor.
We humbly hope the eight seas remain vast and boundless, enduring with the phoenix-era;
The myriad peaks stand towering and majestic, as steadfast as the dragon’s dignity.
May his years equal the pine and cypress, his days as bright as the sun of Shun.
May the Empress, consorts, and concubines spread their virtuous ways across the ten thousand realms;
May the princes and heirs to the throne uphold their sagely virtues for a thousand ages.
May the hundred offices follow proper order, all officials govern with competence.
chunks.overlap_context:
ill palace. May our names be recorded in the Eastern Flowery Realm, and our spirits ascend to the void’s mystery. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the incense smoke, conveying our supplications swiftly to the Celestial Worthy of the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Formless and Nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, before the Golden Portal and Jade Steps.

Exiting the chamber.
Thus concludes the twelfth scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

chunks.original_text: 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真师宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊，愿以是功德，归流天上天下，三界十方。 道炁资熏，万灵昭泰。 玄风长育，群品安贞。 九幽息冥昧之悲，六趣罢轮回之苦。 某官神功密佑，惠力遐沾。 灾厄怨仇，随忏析而荡涤； 延年注福，承斋谢以增新。 九祖生天，六亲蒙佑。 怀生禀化，同沐玄恩。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 礼方 忏悔
chunks.translated_text:
Now we therefore burn incense, devoting ourselves to the Great Sage Host of Masterly Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true, and who, having attained the Dao, ascend into formlessness. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

At this pure dawn, performing the Dao-rites, we invite the assembly of dharma-practitioners to offer this three-pinch incense. May its fragrant smoke rise to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating our heads to the earth, reverently relying on the Three Honored Ones of the Most High. May this merit flow to the heavens above and the earth below, to the Three Realms and the ten directions.

May the qi of the Dao nourish and suffuse, illuminating the myriad spirits with peace. May the Mysterious Wind long nurture, and all beings dwell in tranquility. May the Nine Dark Realms cease their gloomy sorrows, and the Six Paths end the suffering of rebirth. May the hidden power of this official’s spiritual merit and the far-reaching grace of kindness pervade all. Calamities, misfortunes, and enmities shall be washed away by repentance and prayer; longevity and blessings shall be renewed through fasting and gratitude.

May the nine generations of ancestors ascend to heaven, and the six relations receive protection. May all beings who embrace life and receive transformation together bathe in the Mysterious Grace.

Now we therefore burn incense, devoting ourselves to the Great Sage Host of Masterly Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true, and who, having attained the Dao, ascend into formlessness. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

We perform the rites, repent, and confess.

chunks.original_text: 三启 乐法以为妻，爱经如珠玉。 持戒制六情，念道遣所欲。 淡薄正气停，萧然神静默。 天魔并敬护，世世享大福。 三礼 臣等至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 臣等至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 臣等至心稽首礼，玄中大法师。 重称法位 上清玄都大洞三景弟子、无上三洞法师，奉行黄箓大斋消灾法事，某岳先生某帝真人臣谨重伸上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，十方无极大道道德众圣，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师天师君，上相上宰、上保上傅、四司五帝日一界官属一切尊灵。 臣等伏闻，清浊栽成，圆方定位。 神功生化，吹万莫穷。
chunks.translated_text:
Three Invocations:
May the Dharma be taken as one’s wife,
And scriptures cherished like pearls and jade.
Holding precepts to restrain the six passions,
Mindful of the Dao to dispel desires.
Serene and pure, the upright qi abides;
Empty and still, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
And through all lives, great blessings are enjoyed.

Three Prostrations:
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

Reiterating the Dharma Titles:
Disciples of the Three Luminaries of the Great Cavern of the Mysterious Capital, Supreme Masters of the Three Caverns, conducting the Yellow Register Great Fast for Disaster Dispelling Rituals—your servant, the Perfected Lord of Such-and-Such Peak, So-and-So Emperor, humbly and respectfully reaffirms and presents this petition to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning; the Most High Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the Boundless Great Dao and Host of Sages of Virtue in the Ten Directions; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Heavenly Master, Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center; the High Ministers, High Chancellors, High Protectors, High Tutors; the Officials of the Four Offices, Five Emperors, Sun, and One Realm; and all the Venerable Spirits.

We, your servants, prostrate and hear:
The clear and turbid were planted and formed,
The round and square fixed in their places.
The divine work gives life and transforms,
Blowing through the myriad things without end.

chunks.original_text: 鼓之以玄风，沐之以灵泽，成之以妙甩，统之以圣人。 故能总天下之机，成一天下之务。 配两仪而称大，出庶物以居尊。 有功不宰，则与日月齐华； 弘道无为，则与乾坤共永。 况复列封一致，六合为家。 惠养必均，洪铁靡膈。 皇帝推诚抚御，体道君临。 辟仁寿之庭，经华胥之化。 以为某官方缠灾否，深轸天慈。 涣发德音，恭修福会。 备十华之质信； 披三洞之典仪。 坐宣室以冥心，望玉虚而稽首。 觊凭蠲洁，以致感通。 臣等夙察明科，仰遵玄旨。 敷坛列纂，法地象天。 以皇帝所赍，金龙纹缯、香花油烛，依洞玄品格，修无上妙斋。 腾欵十天，告盟三界。 伏冀玉清众圣，无极高尊。 俯鉴精虔，大弘恩宥。 勑四司五帝、北极南宫。 承四极明文，奉九龙符命。 为某官於天府地司之内，符图箓籍之中，解释冤仇，和平债讼。 原销罪对，荡涤愆瑕。 除星辰临照之灾，祛年运凶妨之厄。 积生往世，无量罪因。 以今忏祈，咸蒙除荡。 即使九玄受福，举族沾荣。 年算遐长，禄秩增广。 千灾殄息，万善成臻。 显天尊拯化之恩，副圣主忧勤之愿。 然乞帝图隆永，圣寿延洪。 率土普天，俱承道果。 二仪昭泰，三景辉华。 九谷滋丰，五兵韬戢。 龙神警卫，疫毒无侵。 怀生息愁叹之音，在野有讴歌之乐。 飞沉遂性，动植舒荣。 九夜开光，三涂罢对。 见大道无方之应，契圣明有感之祈。 普及幽遐，俱升福岸。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等归命之诚。 谨启以闻。 发念 一念为道，四大合德。 七世父母，免堕忧苦。 上升天堂，衣食自然。 二念帝王国主，道化兴行，庠序济济，皇教恢弘。 威仪翼翼，普天所瞻。 民称太平，四夷宾伏。 妖恶自灭，圣贤日生。 三念法师，功德大建。 教化明达，俱获飞仙。 四念同志学人。 早得仙道，更相开度。 五念九亲和睦，好尚仁义。 贵道贱财，行为物范。 六念损己，布施道士及饥寒者。 天下人民，各得其所。 七念蠕动跂行，一切众生，咸蒙成就。 八念赦贷前生，今世罪对，立功补过。 九念家国隆盛，宗庙有人，世生贤才。 十念尊受经师，不敢中怠平等。 一心广度，克获上仙。 白日登天，拜见太上。 求成真人，云车羽驾。 和与道合真。 复炉
chunks.translated_text:
The Daoist wind is drummed forth, the numinous moisture bathes all,
Perfected through wondrous transformation, governed by the sage.
Thus can the mechanisms of all under heaven be unified,
And the affairs of all under heaven be accomplished as one.
Matching the Two Modes in greatness, emerging from the myriad beings to occupy the honored place.
With merit unpossessed, they shine as brightly as sun and moon;
In magnifying the Dao through non-action, they endure as long as heaven and earth.
Moreover, with unified enfeoffment and the Six Harmonies as home,
Benevolent nurturance is surely equitable, and great iron knows no barriers.
The Emperor, in sincerity and care, governs by embodying the Dao.
He opens the courtyard of benevolence and longevity, weaving the transformation of Huaxu.
Yet now, as certain officials are beset by calamity and misfortune,
His celestial compassion is deeply stirred.
He issues virtuous decrees and reverently conducts the assembly of blessings,
Preparing the tenfold splendor of sincere offerings,
Unfurling the ritual canons of the Three Caverns.
Seated in the Hall of Audience, he meditates in profound stillness,
Gazing toward the Jade Void and bowing in reverence,
Hoping to rely on purity and cleanliness to achieve resonance and communion.

We, your servants, having long studied the luminous statutes and reverently followed the mysterious decree,
Have arrayed the altar and set forth the sacred texts, modeling earth and emulating heaven.
With the Emperor’s offerings—golden dragon-patterned silks, incense, flowers, oil, and candles—
We follow the standards of the Cavernous Mystery to perform the supreme and wondrous fast.
We ascend petitions to the Ten Heavens and pledge oaths to the Three Realms.
Humbly we pray that the host of sages of the Jade Purity and the boundless exalted ones
May look down with favor upon our earnest devotion and greatly extend their grace and forgiveness.
They shall command the Four Offices, Five Emperors, Northern Culmen, and Southern Palace
To receive the luminous edicts of the Four Poles and uphold the mandates of the Nine Dragons.
For these officials, within the celestial bureaus and earthly administrations,
Among the talismanic charts and registers of destiny,
May they untangle grievances, harmonize debts and disputes,
Absolve transgressions, and wash away faults.
May they dispel the disasters of stellar conjunctions and the misfortunes of inauspicious years,
Eradicating the accumulated sins of past lives without measure.
Through this repentance and prayer, may all be cleansed and dissolved,
So that the Nine Ancestral Realms receive blessings and the entire clan be graced with honor.
May their years be long and distant, their ranks and emoluments ever-increasing.
May a thousand calamities cease and ten thousand virtues be perfected.
Thus shall the transforming grace of the Heavenly Worthy be manifest,
And the earnest wishes of the sagely sovereign be fulfilled.

We further beseech that the imperial destiny be ever-prosperous,
The sagely lifespan prolonged and vast.
May all within the realm universally partake of the fruits of the Dao.
May the Two Modes shine in peace, the Three Radiances gleam in splendor.
May the Nine Grains flourish in abundance, the Five Armies sheathe their weapons.
May dragon spirits stand guard, and pestilence be kept at bay.
May the sighs of the suffering cease, and the fields resound with songs of joy.
May all beings, winged or crawling, fulfill their natures,
And all things, moving or still, flourish in glory.
May the Nine Nights reveal their light, and the Three Paths close their gates.
May the boundless responses of the Great Dao be witnessed,
And the sagely and enlightened prayers be answered.
May all, near and far, ascend the shore of blessings.
Above, may the great compassion of the Heavenly Worthy be made clear;
Below, may the sincerity of our devotion be matched.
Respectfully we present this petition for your hearing.

We now raise our thoughts:
First thought: For the Dao, the Four Great Elements unite in virtue.
May the seven generations of parents be freed from suffering and sorrow,
Ascend to the heavenly halls, and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second thought: For the Emperor and lords of the realm,
May the Daoist transformation flourish,
The schools thrive in abundance, and the imperial teachings expand in grandeur.
May their majesty and decorum be revered by all under heaven.
May the people proclaim great peace, and the four barbarians submit in awe.
May evil and malevolence vanish of themselves, and sages and worthies arise daily.

Third thought: For the Dharma Masters,
May their merit and virtue be greatly established,
Their teachings enlightened and far-reaching,
And all attain the flight of immortality.

Fourth thought: For fellow students of the Dao,
May they swiftly attain the immortal way and mutually enlighten one another.

Fifth thought: For the harmony of the nine relations,
May they esteem virtue and renounce wealth,
Their conduct a model for all things.

Sixth thought: For self-denial,
May alms be given to Daoist priests and the hungry and cold.
May all people under heaven find their rightful place.

Seventh thought: For the crawling and creeping, all sentient beings,
May all be perfected and accomplished.

Eighth thought: For the absolution of past-life and present sins,
May merits be established to atone for transgressions.

Ninth thought: For the prosperity of family and state,
May ancestral temples be maintained and worthy talents arise in every generation.

Tenth thought: For the reverence of scriptural masters,
May none grow lax or unequal in their devotion.
With a single mind and boundless compassion,
May they attain the rank of immortals,
Ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
And pay homage to the Most High.
Seeking to become perfected beings,
Riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages,
In harmony with the Dao, they shall merge with the true.

chunks.original_text: 赴感如神，随方靡倦。 丹诚上达，岂间於高卑； 玄泽下临，不遗於巨细。 况复配天纵圣，运道垂裳。 德贯神明，功侔造化。 推恩数惠，同膏露以齐均； 申令宣威，与雷霆而并震。 驰心属念，必洽天休。 以某官运履灾蒙，愿希销解。 冥怀玄极，稽首清都。 爰敷斋告之仪，伫契福祥之应。 香花龙彩，备按明科。 列欵缄词，所宜关奏。 钦承明旨，敢不上闻。 皇帝青词，谨当宣奏。 读词 按如词言，诚祈腾奏。 臣等以皇帝所赍法信，恭设坛场。 日域月门，象十华而设位； 龙文凤篆，陈八会之天书。 固可以攘荡氛邪，廓销灾滞。 广延祯贶，用息晦蒙。 以今中分行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊仪、宗祧先圣。 登真玉阙，蜕影琳宫。 骖八凤於云衢，驭六龙於星路。 仰朝万圣，俯揖千真。 流巨贶於神孙，启遐年於宝祚。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今中分行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流皇帝。 伏觊圣逾轩昊，明比羲舒。 历草抽阶，显示晦明之数； 神羊卫屏，潜祛邪佞之人。 福岳弥高，寿山增峻。 皇后妃御，六宫宣翊赞之功； 太子诸王，宗佑表繁昌之固。 朝多英俊，野绝逋遗。 蜂岑螺驭之宾，梯航入贡； 神兽天香之使，飞翥来庭。 万宇同文，九围顺化。

Swift as spirit in response, tireless across all directions.
Cinnabar sincerity ascends unobstructed, undivided by high or low;
Mysterious grace descends in full, unspared to great or small.
Moreover, matched with Heaven’s sagely mandate, the Dao’s governance extends like trailing robes.
Virtue/power penetrates the divine luminaries, merit rivals Creation’s work.
Extending kindness and bestowing favors, level as sweet dew and rain;
Issuing commands and displaying might, resounding with thunder’s force.
With racing heart and focused intent, one must align with Heaven’s blessing.
As this official treads through calamity and obscurity, he humbly seeks dissolution and release.
In profound reverence for the Mysterious Ultimate, he bows his head to the Pure Capital.
Thus unfolds the rites of fasting and proclamation, awaiting the fulfillment of felicitous omens.
Incense and flowers, dragon-hued radiance—all prepared according to the luminous statutes.
Petitions are arrayed, sealed words ready for submission.
Reverently heeding the enlightened decree, how dare he not make this known above?

*The Emperor’s Blue Petition*
Duly proclaimed as written, the sincere prayer is borne aloft.

We, your servants, with the ritual offerings entrusted by the Emperor, reverently establish the altar.
Sun domains and moon gates—positions set to mirror the Ten Flowers;
Dragon scripts and phoenix seals—Heavenly Books of the Eight Assemblies displayed.
Thus may baleful vapors be swept away, obstructions dispelled.
Auspicious blessings widely extended, to still the darkness of ignorance.

*At this midpoint of the Dao-procession*
The ritual assembly is summoned, and the first pinch of incense is offered.
May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer sustenance to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
We, your servants, surrender body and life, prostrate in full submission, gazing upward to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the august dignity of the altars of state, the ancestral temples, and the sagely forebears.
Ascending to the Jade Gates of Perfection, shedding their forms in the Jasper Palaces.
Harnessing eight phoenixes upon cloud thoroughfares, driving six dragons along stellar paths.
Gazing up to the myriad sages, bowing down to the thousand perfected.
Bestowing vast blessings upon divine descendants, inaugurating distant ages for the jeweled throne.

*Now, burning incense*
We take refuge in the Great Sagely Host of Masters, the Perfected and Virtuous Ones,
Who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless.
Harmonized with the Dao, merged with the True.

*At this midpoint of the Dao-procession*
The ritual assembly is summoned, and the second pinch of incense is offered.
May this incense smoke ascend directly to offer sustenance to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
We, your servants, surrender body and life, prostrate in full submission, gazing upward to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the Emperor.
We humbly pray that his sagacity surpass that of Xuanyuan and the radiant Fuxi,
That through the sprouting of grasses upon the palace steps, the cycles of light and dark be revealed;
That the divine ram guard the screen, silently expelling the wicked and treacherous.
May the mountain of fortune rise ever higher, the peak of longevity grow ever steeper.
For the Empress, consorts, and palace ladies—may the six palaces proclaim their assisting virtue;
For the Crown Prince and the various princes—may ancestral protection manifest their enduring prosperity.
May the court abound with talent, the countryside know no fugitives.
Envoys from distant lands, like bees swarming peaks or snails tracing trails, ascend by ladder and boat to offer tribute;
Divine beasts and celestial incense-bearers take flight to grace the court.
May the myriad realms share a single script, the nine regions submit to transformation.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense and take refuge in the Master, the Venerable Assembly, and the virtue of the Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

On this day, at the midpoint of the ritual, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer this triple-pinched incense. May its fragrant smoke rise to the heavens, ascending directly to make offering to the Supreme Perfected Master.

We prostrate ourselves, body and life, touching our heads to the earth, and take refuge in the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow forth to [Name of Official], extending his salary and years, calming misfortune and decline.

In the Southern Palace, the vermilion register shall inscribe his name anew; in the Northern Bureau, the black writ shall erase all records of transgression. The Nine Mysteries shall open the path to deliverance, and the fragrance of manifold blessings shall suffuse him.

Extending to the three realms—both hidden and manifest—and the ten directions, vast and boundless, may the Dao’s influence spread afar, and the power of the Sages universally bestow grace. May all be freed from the brevity of life’s span and fully attain the joy of longevity.

May the gates of the Yellow Springs shine bright, the dark prisons fall silent, and all who receive this blessed favor ascend to the realm of the Dao.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense and take refuge in the Master, the Venerable Assembly, and the virtue of the Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

The rite is complete; we repent.

chunks.original_text: 三启 三礼 郁郁家国盛，济济经道兴。 天人同其愿，缥缈入大乘。 因心立福田，靡靡法轮升。 七祖生天堂，我身白日腾。 臣等至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 臣等至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 臣等至心稽首礼，玄中大法师。 重称法位 上清玄都大洞三景弟子、无上三洞大法师，臣某谨重上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，十方无极大道道德众圣，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师天师君，上相上宰、上保上傅、四司五帝，三界官属一切尊灵。 臣等伏闻，道运宣行，真经布化。 明科妙训，开悟於人天； 灵册奇文，敷扬於幽滞。 所以三乘三洞，拯弱丧以知归； 龙篆凤书，佐邦家而致福。 冥心契感，虚室通真。 咸在至诚，以崇祯贶。 钦惟大道，潜赞帝功。 皇帝以某官运履晦蒙，恩深轸念。 将期销解，用保清宁。 奉龙璧香花、纹缯法信，爰崇斋直，是启坛场。 臣等叨备玄司，恭承明命。 辄依科式，虔告真灵。 烧香然灯，照烛幽夜。 上映福堂之上，下开冥昧之庭。 为某官悔谢存亡，和平冤对。 若干日夜，行道转经。 忏九世七玄，前生今代。 幽明负犯，生死愆瑕。 恶对罪根，宿冤往债。 及九宫八卦，三命五行。 暗曜明星，无边灾咎。 因今祈谢，咸乞荡除。 即使玄祖超升，积瑕原宥。 凶随忏解，吉逐愿来。 百福资熏，千灾荡涤。 增新禄祚，延益年龄。 永奉圣朝，上酬帝力。 下愿二仪贞观，三景辉华。 五纬循常，八风调顺，宝图隆固，圣算遐延。 超帝道而迈皇风，澄九围而清万国。 六宫百揆，中外宣功。 太子诸王，贤明佐圣。 岁无疵疠，俗有讴歌。 天下太平，群生遂性。 重冥寒夜，动植飞沉。 俱承斋谢之缘，并悟玄通之道。 上明天尊广济之泽，下副臣等忏谢之诚。 谨启以闻。 发愿 一愿大道，淡泊虚无。 安闲空寂，澄清自居。 广开法门，教导顽夫。 皆蒙惠泽，精苦自修。 预以同学，普得升虚。 与天相保，长存无忧。 二愿诸天，结炁澄清。 高虚广覆，保真固灵。 炁候调节，四运和平。 国安民丰，普天闲宁。 广济一切，惠达有生。 保天长存，亿劫不倾。 三愿土地，覆载无穷。 安平不陷，海沦不崩。 保镇家国，兆民兴从。 养生安死，惠周十方。 禾稼滋植，营运日丰。 咸得厚载，万类皆从。 四愿日月，二景高明。 无有薄蚀，亏盈安静。 光照诸天，洞消暗冥。 保固劫运，世祚和平。 普加润泽，惠洒众生。 五愿星辰，与日齐光。 转烛照耀，朗映十方。 各安其位，经纬直行。 保镇家国，无有灾伤。 四海宁一，普天兴昌。 六愿四时，随节推迁。 景气和调，无有灾患。 疫毒消灭，普天安平。 五谷丰熟，国富民欢。 七愿浮云，结炁聚烟。 飞空高澄，荫覆玄玄。 隐则无为，散则弥天。 神仙同居，结友众真。 惠流一切，兴国爱民。 普济群生，人同劫年。 八愿风雨，流洒无穷。 普加施泄，受其发扬。 万物滋生，国储民丰。 九愿五岳，各安其方。 巍巍包藏，长为仙宫。 安镇国祚，保天无终。 护度一切，莫不仰宗。 十愿江海，荡荡无极。 含容恢廓，无细不植。 渊奥柔惠，润加蠕息。 天人获庆，年同劫石。 十一愿帝王，国土日昌。 四镇安睦，兵革不扬。 天人歌唱，吉应来翔。 敷教济济，威化扬扬。 兆庶称庆，长乐未央。 十二愿蝖飞蠢动，已生未生。
chunks.translated_text:
Three Invocations, Three Bows

Prosperous is the realm, flourishing the state;
Majestic the scriptures, the Dao’s teachings rise.
Heaven and humankind share one aspiration,
In misty vastness, they enter the Great Vehicle.
From the heart, the field of blessings is established,
The Wheel of Dharma ascends, boundless and grand.
Seven generations ascend to celestial halls,
While this body soars in the light of day.

We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reiterating the Dharma Titles:
Disciple of the Three Luminaries of the Great Cavern of the Mystic Capital, Supreme Master of the Three Caverns,
Your servant [Name] respectfully invokes once more the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning;
The Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
The Supreme Lord Lao;
The hosts of sagely and virtuous beings of the Boundless Dao and Power in the ten directions;
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
The Heavenly Master, Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
The High Ministers, High Chancellors, High Protectors, High Tutors;
The Four Directors and Five Emperors;
All the divine officials and revered spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that the Dao’s workings unfold,
And the true scriptures spread their transforming influence.
The luminous precepts and wondrous teachings
Awaken those in the heavens and the human realm;
The sacred registers and marvelous texts
Are proclaimed to those in darkness and stagnation.
Thus, the Three Vehicles and Three Caverns
Guide the lost and grieving to return;
The dragon scripts and phoenix writings
Assist the state and bring forth blessings.
With profound sincerity and responsive resonance,
The empty chamber connects to the true.
All rests in utmost devotion,
To honor and receive divine grace.

Reverently considering the Great Dao,
It silently aids the Emperor’s work.
The Emperor, in his official capacity, encounters obscurity and adversity,
Yet his compassionate concern runs deep.
To dispel and resolve these, he seeks to preserve purity and peace.
Offering dragon jades, incense, flowers, and patterned silks as ritual tokens,
He establishes a fast and erects an altar.
We, your servants, undeservingly hold office in the Mystic Bureau,
And reverently receive the enlightened command.
Following the ritual codes and forms,
We earnestly invoke the true spirits.
Burning incense and lighting lamps,
We illuminate the darkest nights.
Above, they shine upon the halls of blessings;
Below, they open the courts of the unseen and benighted.
For [Name], we repent and offer gratitude for the living and the dead,
Reconciling karmic adversaries.
For so many days and nights,
We perform the Dao and recite the scriptures.
We repent for the nine generations and seven lineages,
For past lives and the present existence.
For transgressions in the unseen and manifest realms,
For faults and flaws in life and death.
For malevolent karmic ties and the roots of sin,
For past debts and ancient enmities.
For the nine palaces and eight trigrams,
For the three destinies and five phases.
For the dark and bright stars,
For boundless calamities and misfortunes.
Through this prayer and repentance,
We beseech their complete eradication.
May the ancestral spirits ascend,
And accumulated faults be pardoned.
May misfortune dissolve with repentance,
And fortune follow wishes to arrive.
May a hundred blessings suffuse,
And a thousand disasters be cleansed.
May official emoluments and blessings be renewed,
And years of life extended.
Ever serving the sagely court,
Above, repaying the Emperor’s grace;
Below, may the two forces maintain their purity,
And the three luminaries radiate splendor.
May the five planets follow their courses,
And the eight winds harmonize.
May the precious chart stand firm,
And the sagely reign endure.
Surpassing the ways of emperors and kings,
Pacifying the nine regions and purifying the myriad states.
May the six palaces and hundred offices
Proclaim virtue within and beyond.
May the Crown Prince and the various princes
Assist with wisdom and sagacity.
May the years be free of pestilence,
And the people sing in praise.
May the world know great peace,
And all beings fulfill their nature.
In the depths of the darkest nights,
Whether moving or still, flying or sinking,
May all share in the merit of this repentance and gratitude,
And together awaken to the Dao of mystic communion.
Above, may the Heavenly Venerable’s vast grace of deliverance be manifest;
Below, may our repentance and gratitude be sincere.
Respectfully, we make this invocation known.

**Vows**

First Vow:
May the Great Dao be serene and formless,
Abiding in tranquility and emptiness,
In clarity and stillness, dwelling in purity.
May the gates of the Dharma be widely opened,
To instruct the stubborn and foolish.
May all receive its beneficent grace,
And through diligent cultivation,
Join the ranks of fellow learners,
Together ascending to the void,
Preserving harmony with heaven,
And abiding in eternal peace.

Second Vow:
May the various heavens
Condense their qi and attain clarity.
In the vast expanse, they shelter and protect,
Preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the qi and seasons be harmonized,
And the four movements be at peace.
May the state be secure and the people prosperous,
And all under heaven enjoy tranquility.
May all beings be universally delivered,
And the grace extend to all that lives.
May the heavens be preserved,
And endure for countless kalpas unshaken.

Third Vow:
May the earth
Bear its boundless load.
May it remain stable and unshaken,
And the seas not collapse.
May it protect and secure the state,
And the myriad people flourish.
May it nurture life and bring peace in death,
Extending its grace to the ten directions.
May crops and plants thrive,
And enterprises daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant support,
And the myriad beings follow.

Fourth Vow:
May the sun and moon,
The two luminaries, shine brightly.
Free from eclipses and obscurations,
Their waxing and waning be serene.
May their light illuminate the heavens,
Dispelling all darkness.
May they safeguard the kalpas,
And the world’s destiny know peace.
May their beneficence be universally bestowed,
And all beings receive their grace.

Fifth Vow:
May the stars
Shine with the brilliance of the sun.
Revolving and illuminating,
They brightly reflect the ten directions.
May each remain in its proper place,
Following their celestial paths.
May they protect and secure the state,
Free from calamity and harm.
May the four seas be at peace,
And all under heaven prosper.

Sixth Vow:
May the four seasons
Follow their cycles in due order.
May the climates be harmonious,
Free from disasters and afflictions.
May plagues and poisons vanish,
And all under heaven know peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance,
And the state be rich, the people joyful.

Seventh Vow:
May the floating clouds
Condense their qi and gather their mists.
Soaring high and settling,
They shade the profound and mysterious.
In concealment, they act without effort;
When dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together,
Forming friendships with the hosts of perfected beings.
May their grace flow to all,
Bringing prosperity to the state and love to the people.
May all beings be universally delivered,
And humanity endure through the kalpas.

Eighth Vow:
May wind and rain
Flow and descend without end.
Universally bestowed,
They nourish and bring forth growth.
May the myriad things flourish,
And the state’s stores and people’s wealth abound.

Ninth Vow:
May the Five Peaks
Each remain in its proper place.
Towering and encompassing,
They stand as eternal abodes of immortals.
May they secure the state’s destiny,
And protect the heavens without end.
May they deliver and shield all,
And all look up to them in reverence.

Tenth Vow:
May the rivers and seas
Flow boundlessly and without limit.
Vast and embracing,
No creature is too small to nurture.
Deep and gentle, they bestow moisture,
Nourishing all that wriggles and breathes.
May heaven and humankind receive blessings,
And their years endure like the kalpas and stones.

Eleventh Vow:
May the Emperor’s realm
Daily prosper.
May the four frontiers be at peace,
And weapons of war not be raised.
May heaven and humankind sing in praise,
And auspicious omens come in flight.
May teachings be widely spread,
And virtuous influence widely proclaimed.
May the myriad people rejoice,
And eternal joy know no end.

Twelfth Vow:
May all creatures—
Those that fly and crawl, born and unborn—
Be included.

May the gates of the Yellow Springs shine bright, the dark prisons fall silent, and all who receive this blessed favor ascend to the realm of the Dao.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense and take refuge in the Master, the Venerable Assembly, and the virtue of the Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

chunks.original_text: 太上黄箓斋仪卷之十五 唐广成先生杜光庭集 特　勑为臣下消灾落景行道 入户 卫灵 五星高曜，瑞炁飞浮。 元始集神， 天地交周。 玉符宝节，啸命微幽。 掷火扬威，奸凶无留。 万魔振伏， 纷葩却消。 摧怪伐恶，道炁同流。 神光照夜，阴翳俱收。 万神降格。 扇景乘飙。 群生咸遂，惠遍神州。 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上玄元太上道君、召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言散花玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域、真官正神。 以今奉为入意祈恩玉阙，进拜丹书。 愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中，即使紫精郁勃，玉关开明。 五老辅根，万帝摄真。 体圆珠映，乘景骖宸。 金光焕赫，御炁上清。 令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道无形无名虚无自然金阙玉陛下、神霄九宸上帝御前。 各称法位 上清玄都太洞三景弟子、无上三洞法师，奉行黄箓大斋消灾法事，某岳先生某帝真人臣某等同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，高上大道金阙玄元天皇大帝太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，十方已得道大圣众至真诸君丈人，三十六天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝大帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台三界官属，一切真灵。 臣等夙以鸿因，获逢玄化。 三洞布弘慈之训，普福人天；
chunks.translated_text:
**The Fifteenth Scroll of the *Yellow Register Fast Rites***
*Compiled by Tang Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting*
*By Special Decree for the Minister’s Disaster-Dispelling and Twilight Dao-Procession*

**Entering the Chamber**

The Five Stars blaze on high,
Auspicious *qi* soars and drifts.
The Primal Beginning gathers the gods,
Heaven and Earth unite in circuit.
Jade talismans and precious seals,
Whisper commands to the subtle and hidden.
Flames cast forth majesty,
No treachery or evil lingers.
The Ten Thousand Demons tremble and submit,
Their noxious blooms wither away.
Monsters are crushed, wickedness felled,
The *qi* of the Dao flows as one.
Divine radiance illumines the night,
Darkness and shadows are wholly gathered.
The Ten Thousand Gods descend in attendance,
Fanning the light as they ride the whirlwind.
All living beings attain their fulfillment,
Grace pervades the divine lands.

**Strike the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

The Supreme Mysterious Origin, the Most High Dao Lord,
Summons forth from within this minister’s body:
The Three-and-Five Merit Scribes,
The Attendant Officials of Left and Right,
The Incense-Bearing Golden Lads,
The Petition-Conveying, Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens,
The Five Thearchs’ Direct Talisman-Officers,
The Incense-Officers of the Day—
Each in their thirty-two ranks, emerge.
As they depart, arrayed in solemn vestments,
They unlock the gates of the Mystic Altar’s Heavenly Thearchs,
And summon the local earth gods, territorial spirits,
And true officials of this realm.
On this day, in service of the intent to beseech grace at the Jade Threshold,
We present our prostrations before the Cinnabar Writs.
May the numinous light of the Jade Purity’s Dao-*qi* and Numinous Treasure
Descend and flow into our bodies,
That purple essence may flourish in abundance,
And the Jade Pass be opened and illumined.
May the Five Elders fortify our roots,
The Ten Thousand Thearchs guard our true nature.
Our bodies, like pearls, reflect the round,
Riding the light as we mount the celestial court.
Golden radiance blazes resplendent,
As we harness the *qi* to ascend to the Upper Clarity.
May the words we have uttered
Swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme,
The Boundless Dao of the Formless and Nameless,
The Void and Spontaneous,
Before the Jade Threshold of the Golden Portals,
In the court of the Nine Celestial Thearchs of Divine Empyrean.

**Each Declare Their Dharma Rank**

We, disciples of the Three Luminaries of the Supreme Clarity’s Mystic Capital and Grand Grotto,
Supreme Masters of the Three Caverns,
Conducting the great *Yellow Register Fast* for disaster-dispelling rites,
The Master of [such-and-such] Peak, the Perfected of [such-and-such] Thearch, your ministers [Names],
With one heart, reverently address the
Void and Spontaneous Primal Beginning Heavenly Worthy,
The Boundless Dao, the Most High Great Dao Lord,
The Supreme Great Dao, the Golden Portals Mysterious Origin Heavenly Thearch, the Great Emperor, the Most High Lord Lao,
The Jade Thearch of the August Heaven,
The Ten Directions’ Attained Great Sage Perfected Lords and Venerable Masters,
The Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearchs,
The Jade Clarity Thearch,
The Jade Emperor and Great Emperor,
The Eastern Flower, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern True, and Mystic Capital’s Jade Capital, Golden Portals, Seven Treasures, and Mystic Terrace,
The officials and retinues of the Three Realms,
And all true numina.

We, your ministers, by long-standing karmic affinity,
Have been blessed to encounter the mysterious transformation.
The Three Caverns spread the teachings of vast compassion,
Bestowing universal blessings upon humans and heavens.

chunks.original_text: 四明开广济之科，显资邦国。 是以玉书演奥，金简诠功。 惟感必通，有祈咸应。 况乎事形帝命，念属宸襟。 恩重君臣，诚希福佑。 是敢考洞玄之典式，按灵宝之文仪，率励法流，精修斋直。 虔奉词旨，敢不上闻。 皇帝青词，谨当宣奏。 读词 按如词言，理宜关奏。 皇帝以某官五行倚伏，有否塞之期； 三命运行，有兴衰之理。 值兹厄会，深轸睿慈。 备内府之香花，凭上清之科品。 俾崇斋福，恭启坛场。 质龙彩以盟心，资兰炷而驰恳。 八鸾十鹤，期肸蠁以来仪； 凤磬龙烟，必虚徐而上达。 以今落景行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流圣朝宗庙、社稷尊灵，宴景太虚，凝神丹阙。 羽旗翠葆，陪万圣以朝元； 玉叶金枝，越千龄而受福。 祚隆周卜，地广尧封。 八表咸宁，群生常泰。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今落景行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流皇帝。 伏冀镇元灵策，会玉斗之威神； 丹箓宝章，召琼宫之寮属。 增崇帝祚，延永圣年。 与辰极以齐安，共日华而同照。 皇后，龟台并列，鹤寿弥长。 太子诸王，拥洪休而奉圣； 六宫百辟，扶皇极以承荣。 万宇咸康，普天均福。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今落景行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真师宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流十极九冥，诸天诸地。 玄风所扇，道化所覃。 幽显俱荣，人天同福。 某官九玄七世，乘善贶以登真； 外族内姻，荷神功而契道。 积瑕消荡，众厄蠲除。 年禄遐长，福善臻萃。
chunks.translated_text:
The Four Luminaries unfold the rites of vast salvation,
Manifesting blessings for state and realm.
Thus do jade scriptures expound profound mysteries,
And golden tablets enumerate merits.
Where there is devotion, there is response;
Where there is prayer, there is answer.
Moreover, this matter bears the Mandate of the Thearch,
And the thoughts of the imperial heart.
The grace between sovereign and subject is profound,
The sincerity for blessings and protection is earnest.
Therefore, we dare to consult the canons of the Cavernous Mystery,
Follow the ritual texts of the Numinous Treasure,
Lead the assembly in the Dharma current,
And diligently perform the fast and vigil.
Reverently upholding the imperial decree,
We dare not but make this known above.

The Emperor’s blue-green memorial shall now be respectfully proclaimed.
As the words declare, so shall the matter be reported.

The Emperor, by virtue of his Five Phases’ waxing and waning,
Faces a time of obstruction and adversity;
The Three Destiny’s revolutions bear the principle of rise and decline.
Encountering this inauspicious conjunction,
His sagely compassion is deeply moved.
With the incense and flowers of the inner treasury,
And the rites and ranks of the Supreme Clarity,
He establishes the fast to invoke blessings,
Reverently opening the altar precincts.
Pledging his heart with the brocade of the dragon’s essence,
And conveying his entreaty with the orchid’s burning stalk.
May the eight simurghs and ten cranes hasten to attend,
And the phoenix chimes and dragon smoke ascend unhurriedly on high.

At this hour of the setting sun, as the Dao is practiced,
The Dharma assembly now offers the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke rise to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme, Perfect, and True Treasure of the Dao.

We, your ministers, surrender body and life,
Prostrate ourselves in full submission,
And look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to the ancestral temples and altars of the sagely dynasty,
To the numinous spirits of the soil and grain,
To the tranquil vastness of the Great Void,
And the numinous palaces of cinnabar.
May feathered banners and jade canopies attend the myriad sages in audience at the Origin;
May jade leaves and golden branches transcend a thousand ages to receive blessings.
May the imperial destiny flourish like the Zhou,
And the realm expand like the lands of Yao.
May the eight directions know peace,
And all beings enjoy perpetual prosperity.

Thus do we now burn incense,
Taking refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of Venerable Masters,
In the virtue of the Perfected and True,
Who, having attained the Dao,
Ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

At this hour of the setting sun, as the Dao is practiced,
The Dharma assembly now offers the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke rise to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme, Perfect, and True Treasure of the Scriptures.

We, your ministers, surrender body and life,
Prostrate ourselves in full submission,
And look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to the Emperor.
We humbly pray that the numinous talismans of the Primordial One be activated,
And the might of the Jade Dipper assembled;
That the cinnabar registers and precious charts summon the hosts of the Jasper Palace.
May the imperial destiny be exalted,
And the sagely years prolonged,
Abiding in peace with the Pole Star,
Shining in radiance with the sun’s splendor.

May the Empress, arrayed beside the Tortoise Terrace,
Enjoy the longevity of the crane.
May the Crown Prince and the various princes,
Embrace great felicity and serve the sagely;
May the six palaces and hundred officials,
Uphold the imperial pole and receive glory.
May all realms know well-being,
And the entire heavens share in blessings.

Thus do we now burn incense,
Taking refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of Venerable Masters,
In the virtue of the Perfected and True,
Who, having attained the Dao,
Ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

At this hour of the setting sun, as the Dao is practiced,
The Dharma assembly now offers the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke rise to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme, Perfect, and True Treasure of the Masters.

We, your ministers, surrender body and life,
Prostrate ourselves in full submission,
And look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to the Ten Poles and Nine Netherworlds,
To all heavens and all earths.
Where the mysterious wind blows,
Where the Dao’s transformation extends,
May the hidden and manifest alike flourish,
And humans and heavens share in blessings.

May the official’s nine ancestors and seven generations,
Ride the grace of goodness to ascend as Perfected;
May his outer kin and inner relatives,
Receive the divine efficacy and align with the Dao.
May accumulated transgressions be dissolved,
And all calamities dispelled.
May his years and emoluments be long,
And blessings and goodness gather in abundance.

chunks.translated_text:
Now, therefore, we kindle incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Host of Masters, in their Perfect and True virtue. Having attained the Dao, they ascend into the formless. In harmony, we unite with the True Dao.

**Ritual of the Four Directions**
**Confession**
**Threefold Invocation**

The Great Dao abides in the Mysterious Void,
All thoughts find resonance without fail.
Refining the body to enter the Immortal Real,
We attain the adamantine form.
Transcending the Three Realms’ trials,
The Five Pains of hell are dissolved.
All returns to the Supreme Scriptures;
In silent devotion, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your ministers, with utmost sincerity bow in reverence to the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao.
We, your ministers, with utmost sincerity bow in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your ministers, with utmost sincerity bow in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Titles**
We, your ministers, humbly reaffirm our address to the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning; the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Venerable and Perfect Host of the Boundless Dao and Virtue in the Ten Directions; the Celestial Thearchs and Heavenly Emperors; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Heavenly Master and Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center; the Jade Assistants and High Ministers; the Four Directors and Five Emperors; and all divine officials and numinous spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your ministers, prostrate ourselves and declare:
The transformations of the Dao are subtle and profound, exalted above the Nine Purities;
Its divine efficacy shines forth, flowing through the Eight Extremities.
Like echo and shadow, they correspond;
Through resonance and response, all are answered.
When mortal sentiments ascend, the mysterious blessings must flow.
How much more when issuing from the imperial heart,
Manifest in the sovereign’s thoughts?
We await the blessings that follow the moment,
To manifest the true resonance of the divine.
The Host of the Great Dao and Venerable Ones
Will surely bestow their gracious favor.

The Emperor, through this official, has received the dual images of spirit and matter,
And coalesced the qi of the Three Powers.
Yin and yang differ in ascent and descent;
Fortune and misfortune follow the principles of change.
Facing this time of adversity,
He commands with solemn urgency.
Thus, we are bidden to present our utmost sincerity,
To offer this fast and make our supplication.
The blue memorial ascends to the throne,
And the heavens respond with their protective benevolence;
The vermilion petition rises to be heard,
And the myriad sages descend with their radiant blessings.
We command the Four Directors and Five Emperors,
And summon the Three Realms and Ten Directions.
Open the Upper Palace of Purple Yang,
And descend the Nine Dragon Talismanic Mandate.

For this official, dissolve past karmic debts and deep transgressions,
Erase the records of sin and guilt,
And remove the registers of suffering and delay.
Bestow the blessing of longevity,
And reverse the decree of brevity.
The Three Lifespans and Five Phases,
The celestial patterns and earthly records—
All calamities and misfortunes,
Are hereby dispelled.
May his emoluments be renewed,
And his years and lifespan increased.
May his spirit and qi flourish,
And all decline and fault be eradicated.
May his nine ancestors and seven generations
Ascend to heaven and receive blessings.

Above, may the Heavenly Origin shine brightly,
And the earthly foundation remain secure.
May the Three Luminaries be resplendent as jade and pearls,
And the Eight Directions be free of malevolent winds and pestilent qi.
May the sacred chart stand firm,
And the sage’s longevity be vast.
May the Generals of the Square Eyes hurl their fire bells to sweep away mists and vapors;
May the Long-Browed Censors wield their purple brushes to record auspicious omens.
May the Empress and imperial consorts
Ever receive radiant protection;
May the princes and crown princes
Together tread upon extraordinary blessings.
May the enlightened court abound with upright ministers,
And the frontier regions know no beacon fires of war.
May the Jade Candle be harmonious,
And the Jade Storehouses overflow.
May the myriad people rejoice in well-being,
And the realm be tranquil and serene.

Extending to the lords of yin and yang,
The dragon spirits of rivers and mountains—
May they assist in the flourishing age,
And manifest the transformations of the Dao.
The Three Paths and Nine Nights,
The Six Realms of diverse destinies—
May all together receive the merit of this fast,
And attain the shore of blessings.

May the great compassion of the Heavenly Venerable
Fully respond to the Emperor’s reverent devotion.

**Supplication**
We humbly present our address.

**Vows**
First, may Heaven and Earth be bright and pure.
Second, may the cosmic signs be clear and mysterious.
Third, may the sagely ruler enjoy myriad years.
Fourth, may his transformative influence reach the Eight Boundaries.
Fifth, may sweet dew descend from heaven.
Sixth, may the earth emit auspicious vapors.
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their proper course.
Eighth, may the myriad beings thrive in wholeness.
Ninth, may families abound in filial piety and fraternal duty.
Tenth, may the state flourish with talent and virtue.
Eleventh, may the merit of this fast spread widely.
Twelfth, may auspicious signs daily increase.

**Replenishing the Censer**
Incense Officials, Envoys, the Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all Attending Numinous Officials—
At this place where we face the Origin,
May golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise.
May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones
Gather here before the censer in the cavernous chamber.
May our bodies radiate golden splendor,
Severing the roots of the womb’s bonds,
Uplifting the seven generations,
And preparing the hundred passages for immortality.
May the registers of death be dissolved,
And the Mud Pill Palace be seated in darkness.
May the Eastern Florescence record our names,
And the luminous tally ascend to the Mysterious Void.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the Ten Directions
Receive the incense smoke,
And swiftly convey our supplications
To the Celestial Venerable of the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao,
Before the Throne of the Formless and Nameless,
The Spontaneous and Natural,
In the Golden Towers and Jade Palaces,
In the presence of the Nine Celestial Thearchs of the Divine Empyrean.

**Exiting the Chamber**
Here concludes the fifteenth scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

chunks.original_text: 太上黄箓斋仪卷之十六 唐广成先生杜光庭集 特　勑为臣下迁拔清旦行道 入户 各礼师，存念如法 卫灵 青阳虚映，曜日回灵。 神虎辟邪， 飞天流铃。 摧奸灭试，万魔束形。 九微回道，八威摄精。 千真校录， 三元荡清。 左啸中黄，右策六丁。 七转八合，周旋天经。 圣化巍巍， 三道顺行。 庆云流布，合景黄庭。 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上三天玄元始三炁太上道君，召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言散花玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域，真官正神，急上关启。 臣今奉为入意以今清旦行道，愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中，即使玄坛清净，内外成真，天无氛秽，地绝妖尘。 琳琅振响，十方肃清。 万魔不干，真诚上彻。 令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道至真玉皇上帝御前。 各称法位 上清玄都弟子臣某等同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，高上大道金阙玄元天皇大帝太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，十方已得道大圣众至真诸君丈人，十方自然灵宝天尊，随机赴感救苦天尊，三十六天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝太帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，三界应感一切真灵。 臣等伏闻，至道延慈，玄功济物。 敷扬景化，拯护幽明。

**Sixteenth Scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*
Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting
By Special Decree: For the Subordinate’s Promotion and Elevation—Morning Daoist Observances**

**Entering the Chamber**
Each pays homage to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
Azure radiance illumines the void, the sun’s essence revolves in numinous splendor.
Divine tigers repel evil, flying immortals ring celestial bells.
Rebellious spirits are crushed, myriad demons bound in submission.
Ninefold subtle Dao turns back, eightfold might seizes their essence.
A thousand perfected ones review the records, the Three Primes purge all defilement.
To the left, the Central Yellow is invoked; to the right, the Six Dings are summoned.
Seven cycles, eight unions—revolving through the celestial scriptures.
The sagely transformation towers sublime, the Three Ways flow in harmony.
Auspicious clouds spread forth, merging with the luminous Yellow Court.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

O Most Supreme Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Dao Lord of the Great Dao:
Summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the left and right attendant messengers, the incense-bearing Golden Lads, the word-transmitting and flower-scattering Jade Maidens, and the thirty-two Fragrant Officials of the Five Thearchs on duty this day. Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to open the gates of the Mysterious Altar’s Celestial Thearchs. Let them swiftly summon the local earth deities and territorial true officials to ascend and open the gates.

This servant now humbly offers this morning’s Daoist observances for the petitioner’s intent, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend, flowing into our bodies. May the Mysterious Altar be purified, inner and outer realms perfected as true, the heavens freed from impurity, and the earth cleansed of demonic dust. Let the chiming of jade resound, the Ten Directions grow solemn and clear. May the myriad demons not intrude, and our sincere prayers ascend unobstructed. Let this servant’s supplications swiftly reach the imperial throne of the Supreme and Boundless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Thearch of the August Heaven.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**

With unified sincerity, we, disciples of the Mysterious Capital, humbly petition the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Spontaneous and Natural, the Boundless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the August Thearch of the Golden Towers and Mysterious Primordial Heavenly Emperor, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the perfected and sagely hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, the Heavenly Worthies who respond to conditions and deliver from suffering, the thirty-six Celestial Thearchs, the Jade Void Thearch, the Jade Thearch and Supreme Thearch, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Towers, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Illuminated August Lord of the Numinous Treasure, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Realm, and all responsive numina of the Three Realms.

We prostrate ourselves, having heard that the Perfect Dao extends its compassion, its mysterious efficacy aiding all beings. It unfolds its luminous transformation, shielding and succoring both the manifest and the hidden.

chunks.original_text: 所以飞天神人，禀玉匮明真之训； 上智童子，请瑶坛三箓之科。 宣布法音，开度群品。 仁周家国，惠洽古今。 皇帝轸念勋贤，悯伤冥漠。 某官缅痛泉扃，冥怀幽壤。 某等虔修胜福，敷列坛场。 冀回至圣之慈，以拯冥关之苦。 况奉词旨，敢不上闻。 读词 按如词言，理宜关奏。 臣等谨依九清妙旨，三箓简文。 法天地之仪，陈忏祈之礼。 上通三境，下极九幽。 烧香然灯，转经行道。 银缸散彩，冀开长夜之光； 仙唱流音，伫降自天之福。 以今清旦行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊灵、宗祧列圣，超登真品，游宴福庭。 保佑阳图，遐延祚历。 乾坤共永，海岳常宁。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流皇帝。 伏冀玄涛碧海，比圣寿以无涯； 群岳下洲，与皇图而共固。 后妃嫔御，常洽祯休。 太子诸王，弥新福祚。 文臣武列，中外职寮。 齐忠贞协赞之心，启仁寿雍熙之化。 天元澄朗，地纪晏宁。 谷稼常登，，干戈永戢。 旁周万宇。 普及群生。 道力所覃，升沉俱泰。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真师宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流某官即时冥界。 伏冀斋功上达一圣力下通。 开玉匮之琅函，勑九龙之符命。 超迁灵识，径上南宫。 经流火之庭，炼除滓秽； 入明霞之殿，佩服阳华。 擢品福乡，断消鬼录。 九玄七祖，受化生天； 五族六亲，延祥纳佑。 冤仇洗涤，债讼和平。 六趣三涂，皆沾巨福。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德得道之后，升入#1无形。 和与道合真。 礼方 忏悔

Thus do the flying celestial transcendents receive the teachings of the Jade Coffer’s Illuminated Perfected; the youths of supreme wisdom entreat the rites of the Jade Altar’s Three Registers. Proclaiming the Dharma’s resonance, they open deliverance for all ranks. Their benevolence encompasses state and household, their grace suffuses past and present.

The Emperor, mindful of meritorious worthies, pities the suffering of the dark and silent realms. The [deceased] official, grieving beyond the gates of the nether springs, cherishes remembrance in the hidden earth. We, in reverent cultivation of supreme merit, array the altar precincts, hoping to invoke the compassion of the Most Sagely and relieve the torments of the underworld’s barriers. Moreover, in obedience to the imperial edict, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the petition states, it is fitting to submit this plea.

We, your servants, reverently follow the wondrous decrees of the Nine Heavens and the scriptures of the Three Registers. Modeling our rites upon the patterns of Heaven and Earth, we present the liturgy of repentance and supplication. Above, we reach the Three Realms; below, we extend to the Nine Netherworlds. We burn incense and kindle lamps, recite scriptures and circumambulate the Dao. Silver braziers scatter radiance, hoping to illumine the endless night’s gloom; immortal hymns flow in melody, awaiting the descent of blessings from Heaven.

**This morning’s ritual procession now begins.**
The Dharma assembly, having invoked the first pinch of incense, declares:
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Dao-Treasure.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and reverently rely upon the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits flow to the august spirits of the altars of state, the ancestral line of sagely forebears, that they may ascend to the ranks of the Perfected and wander in the gardens of felicity. May they protect and bless the imperial domain, prolonging its reign for distant ages. May Heaven and Earth endure together, seas and mountains ever at peace.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Host of Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

**This morning’s ritual procession now begins.**
The Dharma assembly, having invoked the second pinch of incense, declares:
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Scripture-Treasure.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and reverently rely upon the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits flow to the Emperor. We humbly pray that the azure waves of the vast sea may compare to his sagely longevity without end; that the myriad peaks and lands may stand firm with the imperial enterprise. May the empress, consorts, and attendants ever enjoy auspicious blessings; may the crown prince and princes perpetually renew their felicitous destiny. May civil ministers and military officers, all officials within and without, unite in loyal devotion, fostering a reign of benevolence, longevity, harmony, and prosperity. May the celestial element be serene and bright, the terrestrial order tranquil and secure. May grain harvests ever be abundant, weapons forever stilled. May blessings extend to all quarters, universally reaching all beings. Wherever the power of the Dao prevails, may the exalted and the lowly alike know peace.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Host of Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

**This morning’s ritual procession now begins.**
The Dharma assembly, having invoked the third pinch of incense, declares:
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Master-Treasure.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and reverently rely upon the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits flow to the [deceased] official in the nether realms at this very moment. We humbly pray that the merit of this fast may ascend above, and the power of the Sagely One descend below. May the jade coffer’s sacred texts be opened, the Nine Dragons’ talismanic decrees be issued. May his numinous consciousness transcend and ascend directly to the Southern Palace. Passing through the courtyard of fire, may he refine and purge all impurities; entering the hall of luminous rosy clouds, may he don the radiant vestments of yang’s splendor. May he be elevated to the blessed realms, his name stricken from the ghostly registers. May the nine generations of ancestors and the seven lineages be transformed and reborn in Heaven; may the five clans and six relations receive blessings and protection. May grievances be cleansed, debts and disputes resolved. May the six destinies and three paths all partake of boundless fortune.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Host of Perfected Ones, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

**Completing the Rites**
