Within the snares of the worldly net, amid the mechanisms of transformation—
the six passions stir and disturb,
the three karmas entangle and constrain.
Sinking and drifting, adrift and submerged,
such has been the unceasing plight from ancient times to the present.

Unless one is endowed with the qi of the Dao from birth,
or heaven-bestowed with immortal talent,
one cannot shatter the chariot of misfortune by ascending the ranks of blessings,
nor traverse the cloud-lined thoroughfare to transcend the earthly realm.
In this fleeting, floating world,
who can escape the wheel of rebirth?

This official, since his birth into this life and through countless kalpas past,
has accumulated transgressions,
his sins amassing like a string of beads.

As a military officer, he may have drilled troops and commanded armies,
punished the wicked and suppressed rebels,
or in the midst of mowing down and eradicating,
found jade and stone indistinguishable.
Though his service to the times may have been tied to establishing merit,
his reliance on killing and his pursuit of victory
have inevitably incurred guilt.

Moreover, in the course of feasts and rewards,
there must be slaughter and roasting.
In enforcing the laws to punish the wicked,
there must be the execution of penal codes.
Thus, in cases of accidental or mistaken killing,
transgressions and violations are unavoidable.

Or when soldiers march through camps and fortifications,
encroaching upon and desecrating ancient tombs,
offending and provoking dragon spirits,
digging and excavating hills and plains,
defiling and polluting springs and streams,
trampling sacred lands,
and defiling numinous traces—
these acts may stem from unresolved past debts
or unredressed former grievances.

Or when, in the course of official duties,
he has wielded authority with personal bias,
his judgments in life bearing the stain of guilt,
and in death facing karmic retribution—
in the dark, hidden prisons of the underworld,
there is no means of repentance or redemption.

As a civil official, when administering affairs,
he may have acted willfully and indulged his inclinations,
weighing punishments and discerning cases
without regard for compassion or mercy,
enforcing the law and upholding regulations
without thought of pardon or leniency.
In matters of granting or withholding, encouraging or discouraging,
he may have erred in balancing severity and leniency.
In levying and collecting taxes,
he may have harmed through harshness and urgency,
provoking the resentment of people and the grievance of all things.
These offenses, once firmly established,
may stem from past debts or former grievances,
or from defying heaven and betraying earth,
yet he has never offered repentance or atonement.
Accumulated in the courts of the underworld,
since the time of his death,
karmic retribution has befallen him,
with no means of deliverance or redemption.

The Emperor, mindful of his past merits
and grieving for his journey to the netherworld,
has examined the standards of the Purple Yang,
and unfolded the statutes of repentance and deliverance.
He has solemnly established the magnificent altar,
and reverently implored the boundless grace of the heavens.

We humbly beseech the host of saints and sages of the myriad heavens,
and the Three Supreme Venerables,
to turn their limitless mercy
and bestow the great compassion of their grace.
May they command the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus,
the Five Emperors and Four Offices,
the Thirty-Six Prisons of Mount Tai and Fengdu,
to reconcile grievances and dissolve karmic retribution,
to erase and cast away the records of sins.
By the edict of great pardon,
may he be released from the depths of darkness,
receive transformation in the Southern Palace,
and be born upon the path of blessings.
May nine generations and seven lineages
together partake in this radiant protection.

May all beings in the Three Paths and Six Realms,
of every rank and kind,
whether moving or still, flying or submerged,
ascend to the shore of blessings.
May the Three Luminaries display auspicious signs,
and the Four Seasons attain perfect harmony.
May the sacred lifespan be long and enduring,
and the nation’s fortune prosperous and eternal.
May weapons be laid to rest,
and plagues and poisons vanish.
May the hundred grains ever flourish,
and all under heaven enjoy peace and prosperity.

Thus, the great compassion of the Most High Heavenly Venerable
shall be manifest above,
and the sincerity of our devotion in seeking refuge
shall be fulfilled below.

We reverently present this petition for your hearing.

**Invocation of Intentions**

First intention: For the four great elements of the Dao,
and the host of the retreat’s virtuous patrons—
may the seven generations of parents
be freed from sorrow and suffering,
ascend to the heavenly halls,
and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second intention: For the Emperor and the lords of the realm—
may the Dao’s transformation flourish and prosper.
May the schools and academies thrive,
and the imperial teachings expand in grandeur.
May their majesty and decorum be reverent and awe-inspiring,
admired by all under heaven.
May the people praise the Great Peace,
and the four barbarians submit in deference.
May evil and malevolence self-destruct,
and the worthy and sagely be born daily.

Third intention: For the Dharma Master—
may his merit and virtue be greatly established,
his teachings enlightened and far-reaching,
and may he, together with all, attain transcendence as an immortal.

Fourth intention: For fellow aspirants and disciples—
may they swiftly attain the Dao of immortality,
and mutually guide and deliver one another.

Fifth intention: For the harmony of the nine relations—
may they esteem benevolence and righteousness,
value the Dao and despise wealth,
and their conduct serve as a model for all things.

Sixth intention: For self-denial—
may alms be given to Daoist priests and the hungry and cold.
May all people under heaven
each find their rightful place.

Seventh intention: For the crawling and creeping,
all sentient beings—
may they all attain fulfillment.

Eighth intention: For the remission of past lives’ sins
and this life’s karmic retribution—
may merits be established to compensate for transgressions.

Ninth intention: For the prosperity of the family—
may the ancestral temple be maintained,
and worthy talents be born in every generation.

Tenth intention: For the reverence of scripture masters—
may they never falter in diligence,
and with a mind of perfect equality,
widely deliver all beings,
and attain transcendence as immortals.
May they ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
and pay homage to the Most High.
May they forever become perfected beings,
riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages,
in harmony and union with the true Dao.

**Replenishing the Crucible**

May the hundred numinous perfected beings gather here before the incense burner. May I, in learning the Dao, attain the Dao; in learning immortality, attain immortality. May the patron of this retreat receive blessings, and may both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions, attending the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly convey all that I have just petitioned directly to the Most High, the Boundless Dao, the Perfectly True Jade Emperor of the Supreme Ultimate before the Celestial Throne.

*End of the Sixteenth Scroll of the* **Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High**

*Seventeenth Scroll of the* **Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High**
*Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang, by Imperial Decree, for the Subordinate’s Promotion and Merit-Transference through the Performance of the Dao*

*Entering the Chamber*
Each pays homage to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
Cinnabar numina, vermilion flames—
radiant clouds ignite the winds.
The crimson wheel turns with刚 force,
celestial light surging through the eight directions.
Its might bursts forth, encompassing all,
transforming myriad realms.
Molten gold scatters, demons vanish without trace.
Evil is dispelled, malevolence shattered—
illuminating the primal work.
Golden talismans summon and command,
treading clouds, spurring dragons.
Songs of celebration resound,
flowers scatter across the vast heavens.
Spirits transmute in hidden motion,
the four extremities secure and prosperous.
Prostrate before the Celestial Throne,
none dare be irreverent.

*Strike the Dharma Drum twenty-four times*

The Most High Lord of the Dao of the Three Heavens, the Primordial Three Qi of the Mysterious Origin—
summon forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Envoys, the Golden Youths Attending Incense, the Jade Maidens Transmitting Words, and the Fragrance Officials of the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans and Direct Days—thirty-two each—to emerge.
Let them, in solemn array, report to the Divine Lords of the Mysterious Altar of the Celestial Emperor, and urgently command the local earth deities and true officials of this realm to ascend and make their report.

I now, on behalf of the intent of this rite, perform the audience with the Primordial. May I beseech the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure to descend, flowing into our bodies, thereby rendering the Mysterious Altar pure and both inner and outer realms perfected as true. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth purged of demonic dust. May the jade chimes resound, the ten directions solemn and clear. May the myriad demons not intrude, and our sincerity ascend unobstructed. May all that I have petitioned swiftly reach the Celestial Throne of the Most High, the Boundless Dao, the Perfectly True Jade Emperor of the Supreme Ultimate.

*Each declares their Dharma rank*

Supreme Clarity, Mysterious Capital Disciples, your humble servants [Names] and all others, with unified sincerity, reverently petition the Vacuous and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Boundless Dao, the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, the Highest Lord of the Golden Portals of the Mysterious Origin, the Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Ultimate, the Most High Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heavens, the Great Sage Hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Heavenly Worthy Who Responds to Cries and Saves from Suffering, the Perfectly True Lords and Venerable Ones, the Thirty-Six Celestial Emperors, the Jade Clarity Emperor, the Supreme Jade Emperor, the Eastern Flower, Southern Culmen, Western Numen, Northern Perfected, the Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Portals, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure’s Perfectly True Radiant August Lord of the Dao, the Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, and all responsive numina of the Three Realms.

Your humble servants have heard that the Perfect Dao illumines the primordial, establishing transformation before Heaven. Though round and square differ in endowment, the hidden and manifest follow distinct paths.

The establishment of standards is no mere lure for goodness, nor the display of punishments a deterrent to those who would ascend through merit. The host of numinous sovereigns and administrators, arrayed in their offices and duties, leave nothing unattended, no matter how vast or minute, no detail too trifling to address. Thus is it intended that within the Three Realms and among all beings, each may strive to cultivate the heart and cease from evil, forsaking wrongdoing entirely. The scriptural teachings descend as guidance, demonstrating the rites of repentance and prayer. Illustrious maxims are clearly recorded, observed and revered from ancient times to the present.

We, your humble servants, have been graced by wondrous transformation and entrusted with offices of the Mysterious. Our aspiration is to aid the state in achieving merit and to deliver beings while benefiting all things. Now, having received these sacred instructions, how dare we not bring them before the throne?

We read the imperial words: The Emperor, reverently gazing upon the Mysterious Compassion, holds the Daoist canons in deepest awe. Moved by concern for the unseen and the obscure, he seeks to bestow auspicious blessings. Examining the statutes for the promotion of the truly worthy and consulting the ranks of repentance recorded in the *Yellow Register*, he ensures the peace of departed spirits. Thus, edicts are issued, silk and coin bestowed in solemn abundance, incense and flowers offered to purify and sanctify.

We, your humble servants, in strict adherence to the Mysterious Decree, array the imperial altar. To the four quarters and eight directions, we model Heaven and emulate Earth. We present our sincere words to the Three Realms, offering prayers of gratitude to the hosts of Heaven. May our crimson hearts be wholly poured forth to secure boundless fortune.

Today, at the midpoint of the ritual, we, the assembled Dharma assembly, now offer the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the Supreme and Perfectly True Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, gazing upward to the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits ascend to support the sacred spirits of the altars of soil and grain, their dignity enduring as long as Heaven’s pattern; may the ancestral temples and former sages share in the constancy of the Dao’s transformation. May the radiance of the Ten Flowers of Splendor shine forth, and the ascent to Perfection bring eternal joy. May great treasures of blessings descend, and vast foundations of fortune flow. May the prosperity surpass that of the Zhou and Han, and the duration of rule extend beyond that of the Xia and Shang.

Now, we burn incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Masters, the host of Perfectly True Ones, whose virtue, having attained the Dao, ascended beyond form. Harmonious and united with the Dao, they are truly Realized.

Today, at the midpoint of the ritual, we, the assembled Dharma assembly, now offer the second pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the Supreme and Perfectly True Treasure of the Scriptures.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, gazing upward to the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits flow to the Emperor. We humbly pray that the sun’s brilliance may rise and spread, broadening his wisdom and clarity; that the Pole Star may soar in splendor, exalting his sacred longevity. May his virtue and power surpass that of Fuxi and the Flame Emperor, and his benevolence and sagacity crown the achievements of the Great Yu and Shaohao. May the myriad states rest in his heart, and the nine regions follow his transformation. May the Empress, consorts, and attendants reverently uphold the compassion of Yao; may the Crown Prince and the various princes radiantly disseminate the grace of Shun. May the dukes, ministers, civil and military officials, each fulfill their loyal and steadfast duties, eternally sustaining the flourishing destiny of the realm.

chunks.original_text: 一失生津，永乖贤域。 绵绵长夜，万劫无期。 是以游观八门，天尊启济生之品； 轸伤三界，道君宣度死之科。 欲使共陟福庭，同超欲海。 真经妙旨，匡国化人。 皇帝轸念亡灵，显颁纶诏。 按三清之格，开九奏之坛。 油烛香花，质心众圣。 纹缯法信，腾欵诸天。 烧香然灯，转经行道。 洗心涤虑，拜手祈真。 所期八景神光，下照幽阴之府； 九龙符命，径临积夜之庭。 拔度魂仪，升离泉曲。 赦除某官前生今世，无量劫来。 积过深尤，前冤往债。 或己身所犯，或祖世贻殃。 罪目多端，不可忆识。 或违忤天地，负越神明。 侵害於人，损伤於物。 殁受报对，动历岁年。 非仗玄功，无由解释。 因今大斋功德，忏拔之缘。 万罪千愆，咸乞除荡。 即使神魂清静，罪恼销平。 离苦生夭，参真悟道。 至于九玄七世，往逝幽灵。 共沐胜功，俱登福路。 垂祥介佑，利及见存。 上愿二象清宁，三光融朗。 风云叶序，妖恶沉零。 帝祚无疆，圣躬万寿。 三农蕃稔，睹分岐合颖之苗； 四海梯航，有天兽奇香之贡。 后妃嫔御，太子诸王，匡翊紫宸，保宁皇极。 公卿臣佐，文武忠良，敷赞九重，辑和八表。 干戈弢戢，亿兆乐康。 洎乎水陆龙神，飞沉庶类。 斋功所被，惠泽所覃。 海外寰中，齐臻寿域。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等忏谢之诚。 谨启以闻。 发愿 一愿大道，淡泊虚无。 安闲空寂，澄清自居。 广开法门，教导顽夫。 皆蒙惠泽，精苦是修。 预以同学，普得升虚。 与天相保，长存无忧。 二愿诸天，结炁澄清。 高虚广覆，保真固灵。 气候调节，四运和平。 国安民丰，普天闲宁。 广济一切，惠逮有生。 保劫长存，亿劫不倾。 三愿土地，覆载无穷。 安平不陷，海沦不崩。 保镇家国，兆民兴从。 养生安死，惠周十方。 禾稼滋植，营运日丰。 咸得厚载，万类皆从。 四愿日月，二景高明。 无有薄蚀，亏盈安清。 光照诸天，洞消暗冥。 保固劫运，世祚和平。 普加润泽，惠洒众生。 五愿星辰，与日齐光。 转烛照耀，朗映十方。 各安其位，经纬直行。 保镇家国，无有灾伤。 四海宁一，普天兴昌。 六愿四时，随节推迁。 景气和调，无有灾患。 疫毒消灭，普天安平。 五谷丰熟，国富民欢。 七愿浮云，结炁聚烟。 飞空高澄，荫覆玄玄。 隐则无为，散则弥天。 神仙同居，结友众真。 惠流一切，兴国爱民。 普济群生，人同劫年。 八愿风雨，流洒无穷。 普加施泄，受其发扬。 万物滋生，国储民丰。 九愿五岳，各安其方。 巍巍包藏，长为仙宫。 安镇国祚，保天无终。 护度一切，莫不仰宗。 十愿江海，荡荡太极。 含容恢廓，无细不植。 渊奥柔惠，润加蠕息。 天人获庆，年同劫石。 十一愿帝王，国土日昌。 四镇安睦，兵革不扬。 天人歌唱，吉日来翔。 敷教济济，威化洋洋。 兆民称庆，长乐未央。 十二愿蝖飞蠢动，已生未生。 咸蒙安全，普得生成。 皆见元炁，受阳之形。 草木果林，经冬不零。 一切济度，靡不鲜荣。 和与道合真 复炉
chunks.translated_text:
A single lapse in vital essence severs one forever from the realm of the worthy.
Through endless nights unbroken, ten thousand kalpas stretch without end.
Thus, as the Celestial Venerable surveys the Eight Gates, He reveals the scriptures of salvation for the living;
Moved by compassion for the Three Realms, the Lord of the Dao proclaims the ordinances for deliverance from death.
That all may together ascend the courts of fortune and transcend the sea of desire.
The true scriptures and their wondrous purport rectify the state and transform the people.
The Emperor, mindful of the departed souls, publicly issues his sacred edict.
In accordance with the statutes of the Three Clarities, he opens the altar of the Nine Memorials.
With oil lamps, candles, incense, and flowers, he offers his sincerity to the host of sages.
With silk and ritual tokens, he presents his supplications to the myriad heavens.
Burning incense, kindling lamps, reciting scriptures, and pacing the Dao,
He purifies his heart and cleanses his thoughts, prostrating himself to entreat the Perfected.
He hopes that the divine radiance of the Eight Luminaries will descend to illuminate the dark prisons of the netherworld,
And that the talismanic commands of the Nine Dragons will swiftly arrive at the courts of accumulated night.
To deliver the souls in ceremony, raising them from the winding springs of the Yellow Springs.
To absolve and release [Name] Official, for transgressions across past lives and the present existence,
For boundless kalpas of accumulated faults and grievous errors, for past enmities and debts owed,
Whether committed by oneself or bequeathed by ancestors,
The offenses are manifold, beyond memory or reckoning.
Some defy Heaven and Earth, betraying the divine spirits;
Some harm others or injure creatures.
In death, they suffer retribution, enduring it for years on end.
Without the mysterious power of the Dao, there is no means of release.
Now, by the merit of this great fast and the cause of repentance and deliverance,
May the ten thousand sins and thousand transgressions all be eradicated and washed away.
May the divine souls be purified and serene, their sins and afflictions dissolved and pacified.
May they depart suffering, escape premature death, and attain realization of the Dao alongside the Perfected.
Moreover, for the nine generations of ancestors and the seven lineages of the departed,
May they together bathe in this sublime merit and ascend the path of fortune.
May auspicious protection and blessings extend to the living.
Above, may the Two Images be clear and tranquil, the Three Luminaries harmonious and bright.
May wind and clouds follow their proper order, and malevolent forces sink and vanish.
May the imperial reign be boundless, and the Sacred Personage enjoy ten thousand years of life.
May the three agricultural seasons yield abundant harvests, with sprouting grain and ripening ears;
May the four seas be linked by ships and roads, with tribute of celestial beasts and rare fragrances.
May the empress, consorts, and imperial concubines, the crown prince and the various princes,
Support and assist the purple court, safeguarding the imperial ultimate.
May the dukes, ministers, and aides, the loyal and virtuous civil and military officials,
Assist the ninefold throne and harmonize the eight directions.
May weapons be sheathed and silenced, and the myriad peoples enjoy peace and prosperity.
Extending to the dragons of water and land, and all creatures that fly or dwell below,
May the merit of this fast reach them, and its beneficence spread far and wide.
Throughout the seas and the world within, may all attain the realm of longevity.
Above, may the great compassion of the Radiant Celestial Venerable be manifest;
Below, may the sincerity of our repentance and gratitude be fulfilled.

We humbly present this entreaty.

**Vows**

First Vow: May the Great Dao be serene and void, tranquil and empty.
May it dwell in stillness and clarity, opening wide the gates of the Dharma,
Instructing the stubborn and guiding them with beneficence,
That all may cultivate with diligence and, joining the ranks of fellow learners,
Together ascend the void, preserving harmony with Heaven,
And abide in eternal peace without sorrow.

Second Vow: May the myriad heavens condense their qi and become pure.
May the high void broadly cover, preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the climate be harmonious, the four seasons balanced and peaceful.
May the state be secure and the people prosperous, the world at rest and tranquil.
May all be universally saved, and beneficence extend to all living beings.
May the kalpa be preserved long, enduring for countless kalpas without decline.

Third Vow: May the earth, in its boundless embrace,
Be stable and unshaken, the seas calm and uncollapsed.
May it safeguard and secure the state and the people,
Nurturing life and comforting the dead, its beneficence pervading the ten directions.
May crops flourish and commerce thrive day by day.
May all receive its abundant support, and the myriad beings follow in harmony.

Fourth Vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, shine brightly on high.
Without eclipse or dimming, may they remain constant and clear.
May their light illuminate the heavens, dispelling all darkness.
May they safeguard the kalpa and the world, ensuring peace and harmony.
May their beneficence and moisture universally bestow blessings upon all beings.

Fifth Vow: May the stars shine with brilliance equal to the sun.
May their revolving light illuminate the ten directions.
May each remain in its proper place, moving in straight paths.
May they safeguard the state and the people, free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be united in peace, and the world flourish in prosperity.

Sixth Vow: May the four seasons progress in due order.
May the climate be harmonious and temperate, free from disaster or affliction.
May plagues and poisons vanish, and the world enjoy peace and tranquility.
May the five grains ripen abundantly, the state be wealthy, and the people joyful.

Seventh Vow: May floating clouds gather their qi and condense into mist.
Soaring high and clear, they shade the mysterious and profound.
In concealment, they are quiescent; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the host of Perfected.
May beneficence flow to all, fostering the state and cherishing the people.
May all beings be universally saved, and humanity endure for kalpas to come.

Eighth Vow: May wind and rain flow and scatter without end.
May they universally bestow their bounty, nurturing growth and flourishing.
May the myriad things thrive, the state’s stores be full, and the people prosper.

Ninth Vow: May the Five Peaks each remain in their proper place,
Lofty and vast, long serving as palaces of immortals.
May they secure the imperial reign and safeguard Heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none failing to revere them.

Tenth Vow: May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless,
Containing and embracing all, nurturing even the smallest beings.
Profound and gentle, may they moisten and nourish all that wriggles and breathes.
May Heaven and humanity receive blessings, their years enduring like the kalpa’s stone.

Eleventh Vow: May the Emperor’s domain flourish day by day.
May the four frontiers be peaceful and harmonious, weapons of war stilled.
May Heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious days dawning.
May teachings be disseminated and governance flourish,
The myriad people rejoicing without end.

Twelfth Vow: May all creatures that fly or crawl, born or unborn,
All be secure and universally attain life and growth.
May they all perceive the primordial qi and receive the forms of yang.
May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and none fail to flourish in splendor.

May harmony and the Dao unite with the true,
And the furnace be restored.

chunks.original_text: 无上三天玄元始三炁太上老君，召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域、真官正神，急上关启。 臣今奉为入意以今晚朝行道，愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中。 即使玄坛清争，内外成真。 天无氛秽，地绝妖尘。 琳琅振响，十方肃清。 万魔不干，真诚上彻。 令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道至真玉皇上帝御前。 各称法位 上清玄都弟子臣某等，谨同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，高上大道金阙玄元天皇大帝太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，十方已得道大圣众，至真自然灵宝天尊，随机赴感救苦天尊，至真诸君丈人，三十六天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝太帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，五老上帝，三元君，天地水三官。 考校罪福，应感真灵。 臣等伏闻，善恶无形，惟人所兆。

Monsters are crushed, wickedness felled, as the Dao’s qi flows as one.
Divine radiance illumines the night, shadows and darkness wholly withdrawn.
The myriad immortals descend in state, riding the winds on spreading light.
All beings attain fulfillment, grace pervades the divine realm.
The dharma drum resounds twenty-four times.

chunks.translated_text:
Response and retribution never err, as echo follows sound. Past and present cycle endlessly, fortune and misfortune strike in turn. Thus the Northern Palace presides over death, the Southern Prosperity governs life. The numinous luminaries of Heaven and Earth weigh merit and record transgressions. Their vast loom weaves all things, leaving not even the slightest thread unaccounted. How could one fail to tremble and take heed, striving in reverence to uphold the Mysterious Precepts?

Therefore, the Most Perfect Great Dao and the Supreme Dharma King have bequeathed the ritual of repentance and gratitude through the precious scriptures, and the golden tablets bear the intent of confession and supplication. With a single heart, one confesses and repents, and ten thousand sins are absolved and dissolved.

The Emperor mourns the departed souls, grieving for those lost in the dark night. He seeks to extend surpassing blessings to rescue those beyond the Yellow Springs. Imperial edicts descend, and reverent fasts are observed. Now, in obedience to the imperial decree, how dare we not make this known above?

Reciting the words—
Following the text as spoken, its meaning runs deep with deliverance. We, your servants, consult the *Purple Yang Jade Tablets* and the *Yellow Register Scriptures*, modeling Earth upon Heaven, arraying the altar and setting forth the sacred texts. Solemnly we establish the Ten Radiant Positions and arrange the rites of the Four Poles. We prepare the ritual offerings of patterned silks, incense, flowers, oil, and candles, turning the scriptures and pacing the Dao, confessing and offering repentance to the myriad heavens.

May the true sages turn their radiance back upon us, bestowing blessings universally upon both the living and the dead. On this day, as the sun sets and the ritual procession begins, we, the assembled Dharma assembly, now raise the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Dao.

We, your servants, surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying upon the Three August Ones of the Most High. May these merits flow back to our ancestral halls and the august spirits of the altars and soil. May the imperial lineage of Tang ascend in luminous purity, bestowing auspicious heirs. May the phoenix calendar extend its grandeur, enduring with Heaven and Earth without end. May the celestial origins shine brightly, and the earthly records remain at peace. May all nations gather in harmony, and all beings fulfill their nature.

Examine and assess transgressions and blessings, respond to the true numina of karmic resonance. This servant and company prostrate and hear: good and evil bear no form, but arise solely from human initiative.

chunks.translated_text:
**Threefold Invocation**

The Great Dao pervades the Mysterious Void,
With devotion, none fails to align.
Refining the essence, one enters the Immortal True,
And attains the Vajra body.
Transcending the Three Realms’ trials,
The Five Sufferings of Hell dissolve.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures;
In stillness, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**

We, your servants, wholeheartedly prostrate and bow to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, wholeheartedly prostrate and bow to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, wholeheartedly prostrate and bow to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Rank**

We, disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mysterious Capital, your servants [Name] and others, with utmost sincerity, jointly invoke:
The Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin;
The Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
The Supreme Lord Lao;
The Most Perfect, Spontaneous, Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy;
The Heavenly Worthy Who Responds to Cries and Saves from Suffering;
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
The Heavenly Master and Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Realm;
The Supreme Ministers and Prime Ministers;
The Five Elderly Lords of the Supreme;
The Lords of the Three Primes;
The Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water;
And all the responsive and efficacious venerable spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that the Great Sages unfolded the cosmic plan, and the Primordial Sovereign guided the course of destiny. The celestial gates nurture all life, while the earthly records shape all things. Among all beings, humans are the most spiritually endowed, standing above all other creatures. Yet as yin and yang alternate, the nature and consciousness of beings ebb and flow. In conduct, there arise distinctions of good and evil; in movement and stillness, outcomes of fortune and misfortune are determined. Through sin and blessing, one ascends or descends; through life and death, one is separated or united. Therefore, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy and the Heavenly Great Sage, in their boundless compassion, issued the decree of salvation and opened the gate of protection. They commanded the Five Emperors and Four Controllers to extend their mechanisms of deliverance, and the hosts of the Three Primes and all the Sages to respond and govern. The Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water revealed the principles of judgment, while the clerks of the yin and yang bureaus proclaimed the rites of retribution. Their intent was to enable all to ascend the steps of blessing and together transcend the net of sin. Yet the deluded remain hard to awaken, and the turbid hard to purify. Transgressions and errors accumulate without end.

This official, from past lives to the present, through countless kalpas, has undergone the revolutions of rebirth. Whether through the constructions of the six senses or the deeds of the three karmas, the offenses are manifold and beyond recollection. At times, leading armies and commanding multitudes, he waged campaigns in all directions. At others, upholding the law and maintaining order, he regulated and restrained others. Sometimes punishing the wicked and suppressing the violent, he wielded the axe to assert authority. Or protecting the weak and curbing the strong, he dispensed rewards and meted out punishments. At times, undertaking construction and earthworks, he offended the dragon spirits. Or hosting banquets and feasting guests, he slaughtered living beings. Sometimes angling for the hidden or fowling the roosting, he galloped in the hunt. Or adjudicating legal codes, he judged cases with partiality. At times, swayed by love and hate, joy and anger, he indulged his whims. The sorrows of the living and the grievances of the dead accumulated as unrepented sins in the dark underworld. The Three Officials record the names of the guilty, and the Five Emperors tally the accounts of retribution. In the shadowy night prisons, to whom can one turn for deliverance?

The Emperor, moved by compassion for the suffering souls, wishes to elevate and deliver them. Following the regulations and standards, he has solemnly established the altar. Divine lamps scatter their radiance through the Nine Netherworlds, and incense wafts its fragrance across the Three Realms. We universally repent sins before all the heavens and pray for grace throughout the Ten Directions. We humbly beseech the Supreme Sages and High Worthies to shine their merciful light in pity; may the Three Officials and Five Emperors let their vast blessings flow abundantly. Bestow boundless grace and magnify the great acts of compassion. May all sins, without exception, be washed away. Even those in the Four Extremes and the Ten Immortals shall be discerned and illuminated. Draw them forth from the depths of the Dark Prison and guide them to the Courts of Flowing Fire. Purify their forms and souls, and bathe their spirits. May they ascend to the Realm of Eternal Joy and soar to the Upper Palaces. Realize the Dao and partake in the True, forever escaping the dark night.

May all past grievances and debts be resolved with devotion. May accumulated sins and residual calamities dissolve in an instant. May descendants enjoy blessings, and may distant ancestors ascend. May all beings—whether moving or still, flying or submerged—within the suffering realms touched by this ritual’s merit, together partake in auspicious fortune.

**Supreme Vows**

May the sun and moon shine with steadfast clarity, and may Heaven and Earth stand firm in peace. May the stars and constellations be auspicious, and may wind and rain be timely. May the great enterprise flourish, and may the Sacred Person enjoy myriad years. May the imperial lineage, like the branches of Heaven, forever shade the Eight Extremes; may civil virtue and martial prowess encompass the Nine Provinces in transformation. May weapons be sheathed, and may the harvests be abundant. Within and beyond the realm, may all attain benevolence and longevity.

Above, may the great compassion of the Heavenly Worthy be manifest; below, may the sincerity of our devotion be fulfilled.

**Vows**

First, may the Great Dao spread and flow, and may all under Heaven embrace virtue.
Second, may all sentient beings awaken to the Dao.
Third, may the sorrowful souls of the Nine Nights all attain liberation.
Fourth, may the lonely and unattached spirits all receive rebirth.
Fifth, may the world know great peace, and may the five grains be abundant.
Sixth, may ministers be loyal and children filial, may rulers be benevolent and fathers kind.
Seventh, may the Four Seas be united, and may the six relations be harmonious.
Eighth, may the hidden in wombs and the sheltered in eggs all attain birth and growth.
Ninth, may chronic and acute illnesses swiftly be cured.
Tenth, may the destitute and exposed among the living be clothed and fed.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**

Incense Official Messengers, Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all the Attendant Spirit Officials: At this place where we face the Origin, may the golden liquid elixir and the azure mushroom naturally arise. May the hosts of the Hundred Spirits and all the Perfected gather here before the incense burner and the altar of fragrant fire. May we who study the Dao attain the Dao, and those who seek immortality attain immortality. May the patrons of this ritual receive blessings, and may both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the Ten Directions, guarding the orchid incense, swiftly transmit our recent invocations directly to the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Emperor.

**Exiting the Chamber**

Here concludes the eighteenth scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

**Entering the Chamber**

**Guardian Spirits Invocation**
Azure yang illumines the void, radiance returning to the numinous.
Divine tigers repel evil,
Flying immortals stream with bells.
Crush treachery, annihilate trials—
Ten thousand demons bind their forms.
Ninefold subtleties revolve the Dao,
Eightfold mights seize essences.
A thousand Perfected audit records,
The Three Origins purge all defilement.
To the left, the Central Yellow roars;
To the right, the Six Dings are commanded.
Seven revolutions, eight unions—
Traversing the celestial scriptures.
Majestic transformations tower,
The Three Ways proceed in harmony.
Auspicious clouds flow forth,
Merging with the Yellow Court’s luminous scene.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
O Most Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Three *Qi*’s Supreme Dao Lord, summon forth from within this minister’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-two each—to emerge.
Let them, in solemn array, report to the Mysterious Altar’s Celestial Thearch and Divine Lords, urgently commanding this land’s local deities and true officials to ascend and receive the report.
This minister now, on behalf of the stated intent, performs the dawn’s *qi*-uniting and Dao-pursuing rites. May the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and Numinous Treasure’s wondrous radiance descend, flowing into our bodies.
Thus shall the Mysterious Altar be purified, inner and outer made true.
Heaven freed of miasmic filth,
Earth cut off from demonic dust.
Jade chimes resound—
The Ten Directions grow solemn and clear.
No myriad demons shall intrude,
True sincerity ascends.
May this minister’s petition swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Emperor.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**
We, disciples of the Mysterious Capital of Supreme Clarity, jointly and sincerely petition the Self-So, Natural Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Boundless Great Dao’s Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Lofty Great Dao’s Golden Watchtower Mysterious Primordial Heavenly Thearch, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the Ten Directions’ Attained Great Sage Perfected Lords and Masters, the Thirty-Six Celestial Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Watchtower, Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace’s Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the Thirty-Six Divisions’ Venerable Scriptures, the Mysterious Center’s Great Dharma Masters, and all responsive and perceptive true numina of the Three Realms.
We prostrate and hear: the Great Dao’s proclamation spreads, the Three Powers establish their stations. Emperors set the ultimate standard, the Four Great Ones share equal reverence.

Though sagely rule emulates Heaven, it must draw upon unseen aid; when times are harmonious and customs prosperous, it is truly by the work of numinous power. Therefore, we reverently observe the constant rites of suburban sacrifice and prepare the grand ceremonies of auspicious purification. Bearing Heaven and serving Earth, we manifestly honor the Supreme Mystery.

Now, as calamitous fate converges and adversity takes shape, we must pray for auspicious blessings to usher in peace and prosperity. So-and-so, such-and-such an official, deeply concerned for the sovereign and earnestly devoted to governing the realm, devoutly conducts purification rites and vigil, hoping to move the true numina. We, unworthy as we are in our offices of the Mysterious Bureau, deem it our duty to submit this memorial. Humbly receiving the imperial decree, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the petition states, the matter concerns the altars of state and the fate of the realm. We feel the virtue of nurturing completion and bear the grace of encompassing sustenance. Without knocking at the Gate of Mystery, one cannot hope for radiant protection. Therefore, with solemn reverence and earnest devotion, we establish the imperial altar. Our hearts soar toward the Azure Vault, our prayers ascend to the Pure Capital.

At this dawn’s ritual, the assembly of Dharma-initiates and we raise the first incense pinch. May this fragrant smoke ascend to offer reverence to the Most High and Perfect Dao Treasure. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High. May this merit flow to the august numina of the altars of state and the ancestral shrines of former sages, merging with the Mysterious Ultimate and feasting in the Cinnabar Terrace of Effulgent Light. In the Golden Watchtower and Jade Capital, we present the sagely designs to the Primordial Beginning; in the Jeweled Charts and Sacred Records, we extend great blessings to the divine descendants. When transformation prevails, seas will be calm and rivers clear; as blessings flow, Heaven will endure and Earth will last.

Now, we burn incense in devotion to the Great Sage Assembly of Master and Honored Ones, the virtue of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into formlessness, harmonizing with the true Dao.

At this dawn’s ritual, the assembly of Dharma-initiates and we raise the second incense pinch. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to offer reverence to the Most High and Perfect Scripture Treasure. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Most High Venerable Scriptures. May this merit, above all, wish the emperor’s auspicious radiance to coalesce at the imperial throne and blessings to gather upon his sagely person. May he shine with the brightness of sun and moon, illuminating the ten thousand dwellings; may he emulate the virtue of Heaven and Earth, nurturing and sheltering all living beings. May the empress, consorts, and concubines gloriously uphold the great treasure; may the heir apparent and imperial princes harmoniously assist in the grand enterprise. May the ministers, officials, meritorious generals, and wise counselors—both civil and martial—together bring peace to the realm and its seas.

chunks.original_text: 苟申素悃，必达尊灵。 窃惟造化之初，逮于兹日。 后非民无以布化，民非后无以镇宁。 惟后配天，惟王立极。 何尝不感资造化，依仗神功。 然后能奕叶流芳，传休继世。 粤自玄古，有国有家。 克遵清静之规，乃感玄元之泽。 皇帝承天握纪，应历披元。 恭俭惠和，忧勤庶政。 日慎一日，夕惕昼乾而运属晦蒙，尚婴灾否。 非凭至道，康济何由。 某官某乙夙着鸿勋，益勤丹恳。 致君忧国，莫敢遑宁。 是用精备香花，丰严信币。 披心三境，拜手诸天。 式罄明诚，仰希祯佑。 伏冀丹章上御，玄渥下临，垂变化之威神，保遐长之祚历。 诏命九天，兵骑八极。 风雷扫氛雾而廓乾坤，殄灾凶而安社稷。 使奸妖荡涤，日月贞明。 彗孛风驱，干戈冰释。 叛臣孽党，革面悛心。 疫毒邪精，云收电扫。 熙熙夷夏，咸遵道德之风； 穆穆寰区，共悦圣明之化。 某官某乙禄等嵩衡，年齐椿桂。 永虔忠孝，以奉君亲。 皇帝圣寿巍峨，同北极南山之固； 瑶图延远，配天长地久之期。 蠢动幽明，俱升寿域。 上明天尊大慈之化，下副臣众等归命之诚。 谨启以闻。 发念 一念为道，四大合德。 斋主七世，兔脱忧苦。 上升天堂，衣食自然。 二念帝王国主，道化兴隆。 庠序济济，皇教恢弘。 威仪翼翼，普天所瞻。 民称太平，四夷宾伏。 妖恶自灭，圣贤日生。 三念法师，功德大建。 教化明达，俱获飞仙。 四念同志学人。 早得仙道，更相开度。 五念九亲和睦，好尚仁义。 贵道贱财，行为物范。 六念损己布施，道士及饥寒者。 天下人民，各得其所。 七念蠕动跂行。 一切众生，咸蒙成就。 八念赦贳前生。 今世罪对，立功补过。 九念家国隆盛。 宗庙有人，世生贤才。 十念尊受师经。 不敢中怠，平等一心。 广度一切，克获上仙。 白日登天，拜见太上。 永成真人，云车羽驾。 和与道合真 复炉
chunks.translated_text:
Should we express our unadorned sincerity, it shall surely reach the august spirits.

We reflect that from the inception of creation to this very day, the sovereign cannot spread transformation without the people, nor can the people attain tranquility without the sovereign. The sovereign aligns with Heaven, and the king establishes the ultimate standard. How could they not draw upon the power of creation and rely upon divine efficacy? Only then can they transmit glory through generations and perpetuate blessings across the ages.

Since the primordial past, states and households have endured. Those who faithfully adhere to the principles of purity and quiescence are graced by the profound blessings of the Mysterious Origin. The Emperor, upholding Heaven’s mandate and grasping the cosmic order, has assumed the throne in accordance with destiny. Reverent, frugal, benevolent, and harmonious, he labors diligently over all affairs of state, ever more vigilant with each passing day. Yet even as he governs with ceaseless diligence, darkness and adversity still afflict the realm. Without recourse to the Supreme Dao, how could peace and deliverance be achieved?

The official [Name], long renowned for his great merit, redoubles his earnest devotion. Devoted to the sovereign and the state, he knows no rest. Thus, with utmost reverence, he prepares fragrant flowers, abundant offerings, and solemn pledges of faith. Laying bare his heart before the Three Realms, he bows in homage to the heavens. He exhausts his luminous sincerity, humbly beseeching auspicious protection.

May his crimson petition ascend, and the profound grace of the Mysterious descend. May the awe-inspiring power of transformation be bestowed, preserving the Emperor’s distant and enduring reign. Let the decree command the Nine Heavens, and the celestial hosts patrol the Eight Extremities. May wind and thunder sweep away the miasmic vapors, clearing the cosmos, and annihilate calamities to secure the altars of state. Let treacherous omens be purged, the sun and moon shine with steadfast clarity, and comets and baleful stars be driven away. May weapons of war melt like ice, rebellious ministers and their factions reform their hearts, and epidemic plagues and malevolent spirits vanish like clouds dispersed by lightning.

May the Hua and Yi peoples alike joyfully follow the winds of virtue, and the entire realm delight in the radiance of sagely governance. May the official [Name] enjoy emoluments as lofty as Mount Song and Mount Heng, and years as enduring as the pine and cassia. May he forever uphold loyalty and filial piety in service to his sovereign and parents. May the Emperor’s sagely longevity rise like the North Star and Mount Tai, his illustrious reign extend as far as the heavens and earth endure. May all beings, seen and unseen, ascend to the realm of longevity.

Thus, the transformative compassion of the Most High Heavenly Worthy is made manifest, and the sincerity of your servants’ devotion is answered.

With reverence, we make this declaration.

**Invocation of Intentions**

First intention: For the Dao, the Four Great Elements unite in virtue. May the seven generations of the retreat’s sponsor be freed from sorrow and suffering, ascend to the heavenly halls, and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second intention: For the Emperor and rulers of states, may the Dao’s transformation flourish. May schools and academies thrive, the imperial teachings expand, and solemn decorum be universally observed. May the people praise great peace, the four barbarians submit in reverence, evil vanish of itself, and sages and worthies arise daily.

Third intention: For the Dharma Master, may great merit be established. May teachings be luminous and enlightened, and all attain transcendence.

Fourth intention: For fellow practitioners of the Dao, may they swiftly attain immortality and mutually guide one another.

Fifth intention: For the nine relations to live in harmony, esteeming benevolence and righteousness, prizing the Dao and despising wealth, serving as models for all.

Sixth intention: For those who humble themselves to bestow alms, Daoists and the hungry and cold. May all people under heaven find their rightful place.

Seventh intention: For crawling and creeping creatures, all sentient beings, may they all achieve fulfillment.

Eighth intention: For the pardon of past lives’ transgressions. May this life’s karmic retribution be redressed through meritorious deeds.

Ninth intention: For the prosperity of family and state. May ancestral temples be maintained, and worthy talents arise in every generation.

Tenth intention: For revering the master and the scriptures. May we never falter in devotion, cultivating equanimity and single-mindedness. May all beings be broadly delivered, attaining the rank of immortals, ascending to heaven in broad daylight, and paying homage to the Most High. May we forever become perfected beings, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the Real.

chunks.original_text: 以定高卑，以兴邦国。 君为元首，统制幽明。 代阴阳亭育之权，司亿兆惨舒之柄。 顺天体道，大庇寰区。 其或运履晦蒙，物罹迍否。 一夫不获，庶类贻忧。 某官某乙诚切匡时，志深祷福。 将祈嘉佑，资奉圣朝。 臣等职在敷弘，所宜关奏。 况承词旨，敢不上闻。 读词 按如词言，义深弘救。 是用按遵玄式，严启皇坛。 备通真降圣之仪，考三箓九清之格。 香花效恳，信币达诚。 沥丹悃於人寰，伫玄休於天府。 以今中分行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊灵、宗祧先圣，升神三境，飞步十华。 贻巨贶而福宏图，介殊祯而昌宝历。 火鼠冰蚕之野，正朔无遗； 鸡林儿树之卿，讴歌并洽。 超周年世，迈禹封疆。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今中分行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，上祝皇帝。 伏觊福流玄极，惠洽紫宸。 八海澄波，广同睿渥。 十山耸翠，高等圣年。 调玉烛於四时，布琼枝於万叶。 后妃嫔御、太子诸王，启迪洪休，共扶皇极。 文阶武秩，良辅元勋，宣七德而静九围，奉三无而康四海。 五兵韬戢，百谷丰登。 瑞牒祥符，盈编溢册。 普天率土，俱契雍熙。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，保天长存。 和与道合真。 以今中分行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真师宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三师。 愿以是功德，归流混茫之内、道域之中、上极三清、下穷九垒阴阳主宰，天地职司。 弘天尊拯护之慈，宣众圣包容之德。 涤除氛沴，荡灭灾凶。 潜福帝图，永安国祚。 致太平之化，开仁寿之庭。 某官某乙克广福祥，弥新寿禄。 惟深渥泽，长赞圣明。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 礼方 忏悔

By this the high and low are fixed, and kingdoms rise.
The sovereign is the head, governing both the unseen and the manifest.
Exercising the power of yin and yang to nurture all things,
holding the reins of joy and sorrow for the myriad people.
Accordant with Heaven, embodying the Dao, sheltering the realm entire.
Yet should the times grow dark and murky, and all things suffer adversity,
if even one man remains unblessed, the multitude shares in sorrow.

We, the officials [Name] and [Name], earnestly seek to rectify the age,
our hearts deeply devoted to praying for blessings.
We now beseech auspicious favor to aid and sustain the sacred dynasty.
As our duty lies in propagating and magnifying the Dao, we must submit this petition.
Having received the imperial command, how dare we not make it known?

**Reading the Petition**
As the words herein bear profound meaning of vast salvation,
we now follow the mystic rites and solemnly open the imperial altar.
We prepare the ceremonies for the descent of the perfected and the advent of the sagely,
examining the forms of the Three Registers and the Nine Purities.
With fragrant flowers we offer our sincerity, and with tokens of faith we convey our devotion.
We pour forth our crimson sincerity in the mortal realm, awaiting the mysterious blessings of the celestial palace.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May these merits flow to the august spirits of the altars of state and the ancestral temples,
ascending to the Three Realms, treading the Ten Flowers.
Bestowing great blessings to enrich the grand design,
granting extraordinary omens to prosper the sacred lineage.
In the lands of fire-mice and ice-silkworms, may no corner lack the imperial calendar;
among the ministers of Cock Forest and Child Tree, may songs of praise resound in harmony.
Surpassing the millennial reigns of old, exceeding the boundaries of Yu’s domain.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May these merits ascend as prayers for the Emperor.
We humbly hope that blessings flow to the mysterious extremity, and grace suffuses the purple imperial chambers.
May the eight seas settle into tranquil waves, their vastness equaling the sovereign’s benevolence.
May the ten mountains rise in verdant splendor, their heights matching the sagely years.
Harmonizing the jade candle of the four seasons, spreading jeweled branches through ten thousand generations.
May the empress, consorts, and imperial concubines, the crown prince and the various princes,
all receive vast blessings and together uphold the imperial throne.
May the civil ranks and military posts, the worthy ministers and meritorious officials,
proclaim the seven virtues to pacify the nine regions, upholding the Three Absences to bring peace to the four seas.
May the five weapons be sheathed, and the hundred grains flourish.
May auspicious portents fill the records, overflowing the pages.
May all under heaven, in perfect accord, enjoy harmony and prosperity.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, preserve the heavens and endure forever.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Masters of the Most High.
May these merits flow to the boundless expanse, within the domains of the Dao,
to the utmost Three Purities above, and the deepest Nine Ramparts below,
to the lords of yin and yang, the administrators of Heaven and Earth.
May the vast compassion of the Heavenly Worthies extend their salvation,
and the encompassing virtue of the Sagely Hosts manifest their embrace.
Washing away pestilence and calamity, eradicating disasters and misfortunes.
Secretly blessing the imperial enterprise, eternally securing the nation’s destiny.
Bringing forth the transformation of Great Peace, opening the court of benevolence and longevity.
May the officials [Name] and [Name] widely spread blessings and felicity,
renewing their longevity and emoluments.
May they ever deeply partake of the sovereign’s grace, long aiding his sagely brilliance.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

**Ritual Concludes**
**Confession**

chunks.original_text: 三启颂 郁郁家国盛，济济经道兴。 天人同其愿，缥缈入大乘。 因心立福田，靡靡法轮升。 七祖生天堂，我身白日腾。 三礼 臣等至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 臣等至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 臣等至心稽首礼，玄中大法师。 重称法位 上清玄都弟子臣某谨重伸上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，至真无上三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，上相上宰、四司五帝，三界官属一切真灵。 臣等获以宿因，躬逢道运。 玉书金札，降自天关。 龟册虎符，行於世域。 师资付授，得以禀修。 而身远云泉，迹迷尘海。 功未匡於邦国，道未及於飞升。 惟励丹襟，冀酬玄造。 况立功行教，佐国为先。 凡有诚祈，敢忘遵副。 某官某乙以时逢灾否，忧国疚怀。 虔备信仪，精修斋直。 按太极九清之旨，依金明三洞之文。 烧香然灯，转经行道。 窃惟无为大教，以昭感为先； 不测神功，以精诚为本。 罄精诚於下土，必昭感於上玄。 伏惟太上三尊，十方众圣。 诸天诸地，应感真灵。 开大宥之恩，降无涯之泽。 释除宗祧先圣，爰及皇躬，积过深尤，无边愆咎。 使神源澄静，道惠融明。 地纪天元，息灾祥之数； 八宏万国，扇和乐之风。 二象安宁，三光朗彻。 兵锋偃戢，疫毒销沈。 鸷暴摧亡，龙神辑睦。 天兵骑乘，诛剪奸妖。 孽党凶徒，应时殄戮。 风雨调顺，稼穑蕃滋。 动植殊形，飞潜异禀。 三涂苦爽，六趣幽关。 承忏请之缘，遂逍遥之志。 勿为疵疠，常保安贞。 八溟无逆浪之虞，万派顺朝宗之势。 普兼显晦，共睹升平。 一切生灵，咸臻道化。 上明天尊广济之泽，下副臣众等归命之诚。 谨启以闻。 发愿 一愿大道，淡泊虚无。 安闲空寂，澄清自居。 广开法门，教导顽夫。 皆蒙惠泽，精苦是修。 预以同学，普得升虚。 与天相保，长存无忧。 二愿诸天，结炁澄清。 高虚广覆，保真固灵。 炁候调节，四运和平。 国安民丰，普天闲宁。 广济一切，惠逮有生。 保天长存，亿劫不倾。 三愿土地，覆载无穷。 安平不陷，海沦不崩。 保镇家国，兆民兴从。 养生安死，惠周十方。 禾稼滋植，营运日丰。 咸得厚载，万类皆从。 四愿日月，二景高明。 无有勃蚀，亏盈安清。 光照诸天，洞消暗冥。 保固劫运，世祚和平。 普加润惠，泽洒众生。 五愿星辰，与日月齐光。 转烛照耀，映朗十方。 各安其位，经纬直行。 保镇家国，无有灾伤。 四海宁一，普天兴昌。 六愿四时，随节推迁。 景炁和调，无有灾患。 疫毒消灭，普天安平。 五谷丰熟，国富民欢。 七愿浮云，结炁聚烟。 飞空高澄，荫覆玄玄。 隐则无为，散则弥天。 神仙同居，结友众真。 惠流一切，兴国爱民。 普济群生，人同劫年。 八愿风雨，流洒无穷。 普加施泄，受其发扬。 万物滋生，国储民丰。 九愿五岳，各安其方。 巍巍包藏，长为仙宫。 安镇国祚，保天无终。 护度一切，莫不仰宗。 十愿江海，荡荡无极。 含容恢廓，无细不植。 渊奥柔惠，润加蠕息。 天人获庆，年同劫石。 十一愿帝王，国主日昌。 四镇安睦，兵革不扬。 天人歌唱，吉应来翔。 敷教济济，威化洋洋。 兆庶称庆，长乐未央。 十二愿蝖飞蠢动，已生未生。 咸蒙安全，普得生成。 皆见元炁，受阳之形。 草木果林，经冬不零。 一切济度，靡不鲜荣。
chunks.translated_text:
**Threefold Invocation Hymn**
Abundant flourishes the house and state,
Majestic thrives the Dao’s transmission.
Heaven and humankind share one aspiration,
In subtle vastness entering the Great Vehicle.
From the heart’s resolve the field of blessings is established,
The Dharma-wheel ascends in boundless ascent.
Seven generations ascend to celestial halls,
My own body soars in the white sun’s radiance.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Titles**
Disciple of the Supreme Mystery and Mysterious Capital, your servant [Name],
with due reverence, once more addresses and invokes:
the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Origin;
the Supreme Great Dao Lord; the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Perfect and Most High Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center;
the High Ministers and Prime Chancellors, the Four Directors and Five Emperors,
all divine officials and spirits of the Three Realms.

By karmic conditions of former lives, we have personally encountered the turning of the Dao’s fortune.
Jade tablets and golden writs descend from the celestial gates,
tortoise-shell registers and tiger tallies circulate through the world’s domains.
Through the transmission of master and disciple, we have received and cultivated the teachings.
Yet our bodies dwell far from cloudy springs, our traces lost in the dusty sea.
Our merits have not yet aided the state, our Dao has not yet attained ascension.
We can but rouse our cinnabar resolve, hoping to repay the mysterious creation.

Moreover, in establishing merit and propagating the teachings, aiding the state takes precedence.
In all sincere supplications, how dare we fail to comply?
Officials [Name] and [Name], encountering times of calamity and adversity,
grieve for the nation in their hearts.
With devout preparation of offerings and utmost sincerity, they diligently perform the fast and vigil.
Following the decrees of the Supreme Ultimate and Ninefold Purity,
adhering to the texts of the Golden Clarity and Three Caverns,
they burn incense, light lamps, recite scriptures, and perform the Dao-circuits.

We humbly consider that the Great Teaching of Non-Action takes luminous response as foremost;
the unfathomable divine efficacy takes utmost sincerity as its foundation.
Exhausting sincerity in the earthly realm, it must evoke response from the Supreme Mystery.
We prostrate ourselves in reverence before the Three Supreme Worthies,
the hosts of saints in the ten directions,
the deities of all heavens and earths,
the responsive and efficacious divine spirits.
May they open the grace of great pardon, bestow boundless blessings.
Release and absolve the ancestral temples and former sages,
extending to the imperial person,
the accumulated transgressions and deep faults,
the limitless errors and offenses.
May the divine source be serene and pure, the Dao’s kindness luminous and radiant.
May the earth’s records and heaven’s origins halt the reckoning of disasters and blessings;
may the eight vast realms and ten thousand states spread the winds of harmony and joy.
May the two images be at peace, the three luminaries bright and clear.
May weapons be sheathed and stilled, pestilence and poison dissolved and submerged.
May fierce and violent beings be vanquished, dragons and spirits reconciled in harmony.
May the celestial armies and their mounts punish and eradicate wicked demons.
May the rebellious factions and malevolent followers be annihilated in due time.
May wind and rain be harmonious and timely, crops and grains abundant and flourishing.
May all creatures of diverse forms, flying and submerged beings of varied endowments,
the suffering souls of the three paths, the imprisoned spirits of the six destinies,
by the condition of this confession and supplication, attain their desire for freedom.
May they not be afflicted by plagues, ever preserving safety and integrity.
May the eight seas be free from perilous waves, the ten thousand streams flow in perfect accord.
May the manifest and hidden alike universally witness the advent of Great Peace.
May all living beings together attain the transformation of the Dao.

Above, may the Heavenly Worthy’s vast salvific blessings be made manifest;
below, may they correspond to the sincerity of we, your servants, who take refuge in the mandate.
We respectfully present this invocation for your hearing.

**Vows**
First vow: May the Great Dao be serene in quiescence and emptiness,
abiding in tranquility and stillness, dwelling in clarity and purity.
May it widely open the gates of the Dharma, instructing the obstinate.
May all receive its beneficent blessings, cultivating with diligence and austerity.
May those who study together universally ascend to the void,
preserving harmony with heaven, enduring without care.

Second vow: May the myriad heavens condense qi and attain clarity,
their lofty vastness broadly sheltering, preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the seasons of qi be harmoniously regulated, the four movements at peace.
May the state be secure and the people prosperous, the world universally at rest.
May all be broadly saved, blessings extending to all living beings.
May heaven be preserved for eternity, enduring through kalpas without decline.

Third vow: May the earth bear and sustain without end,
stable and unshaken, seas and abysses uncollapsed.
May it protect and secure the house and state, the multitudes flourishing in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead at peace, blessings encompassing the ten directions.
May crops and grains flourish and grow, enterprises daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant sustenance, the myriad beings universally accord.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, be lofty and bright,
free from eclipses or dimming, their waxing and waning serene and clear.
May their light illumine all heavens, dispelling darkness and obscurity.
May they preserve the kalpas’ destiny, the world’s mandate at peace.
May they universally bestow moistening blessings, showering grace upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations shine with the brilliance of the sun and moon,
their revolving torches illuminating, casting radiance through the ten directions.
May each abide in its proper place, their paths straight and true.
May they protect and secure the house and state, free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be at peace as one, the world universally flourish.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons progress in accord with their nodes,
their qi harmonious and regulated, free from disasters or afflictions.
May pestilence and poison be eradicated, the world universally at peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance, the state prosperous and the people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds condense qi and gather mist,
soaring high and clear in the sky, casting shade over the profound mystery.
When concealed, they are non-active; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the hosts of perfected beings.
May blessings flow universally, aiding the state and cherishing the people.
May all beings be universally saved, their years equal to the kalpas.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without end,
universally bestowing their release, receiving their flourishing.
May the myriad things flourish and grow, the state’s stores and people’s wealth abundant.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks each abide in their proper direction,
their towering majesty encompassing and sheltering, ever serving as immortal palaces.
May they secure the state’s destiny, preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none who do not revere and honor them.

Tenth vow: May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless,
containing and embracing with magnanimity, nurturing even the smallest beings.
Profound and gentle, their moisture bestowing blessings upon all creatures.
May heaven and humankind receive felicity, their years equal to the kalpas’ stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor and lord of the state daily prosper,
the four frontiers at peace, weapons and warfare stilled.
May heaven and humankind sing in praise, auspicious omens alighting.
May the teachings be widely disseminated, majestic transformations overflowing.
May the multitudes rejoice in celebration, enduring joy without end.

Twelfth vow: May crawling and flying creatures, born and unborn alike,
universally receive safety, universally attain generation and growth.
May all perceive the primordial qi, receiving the forms of yang.
May grasses and trees, fruits and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and saved, none who do not flourish in brilliance.

Harmony unites with the true Dao.

Return to the furnace. O Fragrance-Official Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Fragrance Spirits, may this place of my audience with the Primordial cause golden liquid elixir and azure mushroom blossoms to arise spontaneously. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones gather here before the incense burner. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the state receive felicity, and both the hidden and manifest realms partake in grace.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend upon the orchid-scented smoke. Convey my supplications just uttered swiftly and directly to the presence of the Most High, Boundless, and Great Dao—the Perfect and True Jade Sovereign of the August Heaven.

*Beginning of the Twenty-First Scroll of the Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High*
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang, the Broadly Accomplished

For ministers to eliminate disasters and perform the *Luo Jing* Daoist rites for the state:

Entering the chamber.
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

Guarding the Spirits:
The five stars shine brightly, auspicious qi soars and floats.
The Primordial Origin gathers the gods, heaven and earth unite in harmony.
Jade talismans and precious seals command the subtle and hidden.
Fire is cast and might displayed—no treachery or evil lingers.
The ten thousand demons tremble and submit, their malevolence dissolved.

chunks.original_text: 无上三天玄元始三炁太上道君，召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域、真官正神急上关启。 臣今奉为入意，以今烧香行道，愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中。 即使玄坛清净，内外成真。 天无氛秽，地绝妖尘。 琳琅振响，十方肃清。 万魔不干，真诚上彻。 令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道至真玉皇上帝御前。 各称法位 上清玄都弟子臣某等，同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，高上大道金阙玄元皇大帝太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，十方已得道大圣众至真诸君丈人，三十六天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝大帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，三界官属一切真灵。 臣等伏闻，三统肇分，万邦棋布。 非帝王无以抚御，非道德无以镇宁。

chunks.original_text: 三皇体道，以君临五帝，宣德而成化。 由是民怀朴厚，俗致淳和。 六炁均调，四时平泰。 其后阴阳差爽，九六相乘。 炎黄有征伐之兴，尧汤有水旱之变。 率资盛德，旁赖神功。 天地万灵，咸加幽赞。 既逢否，宜祷真灵。 用遵修奉之科，庶降厖洪之福。 况承词旨，敢不上闻。 读词 按如词言，仪形家国。 某官某乙诚深匡赞，翘仰尊灵。 赍备信仪，虔修斋直。 依三元品格，灵宝明科。 烧香然灯，转经行道。 历诸天而告谢，周万圣以归依。 冀达上玄，广流祯贶。 以今晚朝行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊灵、宗祧先圣，升神紫阙，流福皇图。 友五帝於琼宫，优游自适； 贻千祥於宝胤，隆盛无穷。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今晚朝，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，上祝皇帝。 伏冀九天宝历，增圣寿於无疆； 八海琼波，广宏休於不极。 明逾两曜，临照无私。 德并二仪，含弘益大。 后妃嫔御，柔范布於九围； 太子诸王，懿光於万叶。 文武卿佐，中外职僚。 敷畅帝猷，振扬鸿化。 洎乎鸢郊雁塞，异域殊封。 常洽雍熙，克臻道化。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，保天长存。 和与道合真。 以今晚朝行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真师宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，旁周三界，普及群方。 同播玄功，共宣洪泽。 运三天之正炁，荡涤奸凶； 召八极之神兵，殄平妖沴。 允昌大业，克固宏基。 某官某乙神介休祯，天资祚寿。 永虔忠孝，常奉圣明。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 礼方 忏悔
chunks.translated_text:
The Three Sovereigns embodied the Dao, ruling as lords over the Five Emperors, proclaiming virtue to perfect transformation. Thus the people cherished simplicity and sincerity, and customs attained pure harmony. The six qi were balanced and harmonious, the four seasons peaceful and prosperous. Thereafter, yin and yang fell into discord, the nine and six clashed in opposition. The Flame and Yellow Emperors saw the rise of military campaigns; Yao and Tang encountered the calamities of flood and drought. They relied upon the abundance of virtue, and leaned upon the numinous power of the gods. The myriad spirits of heaven and earth all lent their hidden assistance. When encountering adversity, it is fitting to pray to the true numina. Following the rites of reverent offering, may boundless blessings descend. Moreover, in accordance with the imperial decree, how dare we not report this above? The prayer is read.

According to the words of the prayer, the ritual concerns the state and the household. Official So-and-so, with utmost sincerity, aids and supports, yearning in reverence for the august numina. Presenting offerings of faith, he devoutly performs the fast and vigil. In accordance with the Three Primordials’ rank and the Numinous Treasure’s luminous statutes, he burns incense, lights lamps, recites scriptures, and performs the Dao-circumambulation. Traversing the myriad heavens to offer thanks, he circumambulates the ten thousand sages in homage. May it reach the Supreme Mystery, widely bestowing auspicious blessings.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Dao. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits flow to the august numina of the altars of soil and grain, the ancestral temples and former sages, ascending their spirits to the Purple Palaces, bestowing blessings upon the imperial domain. May they befriend the Five Emperors in the Jasper Palace, freely roaming in ease; may they bequeath a thousand auspicious signs to the imperial heirs, flourishing without end.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Scriptures. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits extend upward to bless the Emperor. We humbly pray that the precious calendar of the Nine Heavens may augment the sagely longevity without bound; that the jasper waves of the Eight Seas may widely expand boundless prosperity. May his brilliance surpass the sun and moon, illuminating all without partiality. May his virtue parallel the Two Modes, embracing and nurturing all things. May the Empress, consorts, and concubines spread their gentle virtue throughout the nine regions; may the Crown Prince and the various princes radiate their illustrious splendor through ten thousand generations. May the civil and military ministers, the officials within and without, propagate and disseminate the imperial designs, vigorously promoting the grand transformation. Extending to the distant frontiers and foreign lands, may all realms constantly enjoy harmony and peace, attaining the perfection of the Dao.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao preserved the heavens and endured eternally, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Master. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits extend throughout the Three Realms, universally reaching all directions. Together may they spread the mysterious merit, jointly proclaiming the vast blessings. Invoking the upright qi of the Three Heavens, may they cleanse and eliminate the treacherous and malevolent; summoning the divine soldiers of the Eight Poles, may they annihilate and pacify demonic afflictions. May the great enterprise flourish, the grand foundation be firmly established. May Official So-and-so be divinely aided with auspicious blessings, his heavenly endowment of longevity enduring. May he forever revere loyalty and filial piety, constantly serving the sagely brilliance.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

The rites are concluded.
Confession and repentance.
