Tenth vow: May rivers and seas flow boundless and without limit. Embracing and vast, they nurture all, no matter how small. Profound and gentle, their kindness moistens all that wriggles and breathes. May heaven and humanity receive blessings, their years enduring like the kalpa’s stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor and lords of the realm prosper daily. May the Four Guardians remain in harmony, weapons of war never raised. May heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious omens descending in flight. May teachings spread in abundance, majestic transformation flourishing. May all the people rejoice, their joy unending.

Twelfth vow: May all that flies and crawls, born or unborn, universally enjoy safety and secure existence. May all behold the primordial qi, receiving the forms of yang. Again, to the Fragrance Officials, Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all the attendant spirit officials of the incense altar: May this place where I perform the Dao naturally generate liquid-gold elixirs, cinnabar, and jade mushrooms. May the hosts of a hundred spirits and perfected beings gather here before the incense altar and brazier. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the rising incense, swiftly conveying the words I have just uttered directly to the Jade Emperor’s court of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao, the Void and Spontaneous.

chunks.original_text: 太上黄箓斋仪卷之三十九 唐广成先生杜光庭集 迁拔落景行道 入户 各礼师，存念如法 卫灵 五星高曜，瑞气飞浮。 元始集神， 天地交周。 玉符宝节，啸命微幽。 掷火扬威，奸凶无留。 万魔振伏， 纷葩却消。 摧怪伐恶，道炁周流。 神光照夜，阴翳俱收。 万神降格， 扇景乘飙。 群生咸遂，惠遍神州。 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上三天玄元始三炁太上道君，召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言散花玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域、真官正神。 以今落景烧香行道入意，愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上元极大道虚无自然金阙玉陛下。 各称法位 具位臣某谨同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，太上老君，无上玄老，十方已得道大圣众至真诸君丈人，三十六天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝大帝、东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，三界官属一切真灵。 臣等获以福阶，遭逢道运。 金书演教，玉简开图。 佩服灵文，遵承妙训。 窃惟虚皇立极，太上悬科。 惠及幽明，恩沾生死。 北酆夜府，神光垂照烛之慈； 南霍仙庭，真格示超升之品。 粤自亿劫，以及兹辰。 灵泽洒其尘劳，法舟济其沦溺。 拯生度死，佐国利人。 妙楗玄枢，人天蒙佑。 臣等思弘秘赜，迁护存亡。 凡有所祈，理宜关奏。 况奉词旨，敢不上闻。 读词 按如词言，事形广济。 斋主某诚深修奉，志切追崇。 拯幽夜之庭，痛穷泉之苦。 虔诚斋荐，冀获感通。 臣等按灵宝尊经，明真上品。 启琅函玉匮，拯幽夜沉沦。 依飞天神人，说罪福缘； 对披度科典，开设坛场。 缯烛香花，质心效信。 列词腾款，关告诸天。 所期福被阴冥，惠覃家国。 以今落景行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流宗庙先灵，超神三境。 帝王国主，比德二仪。 凤历延洪，龙图遐永。 天元朗晏，地纪安宁。 风雨顺时，生灵康泰。

**The Thirty-Ninth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites**
*Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting*

**Transferring the Departed and Conducting the Falling Twilight Rite**
Entering the chamber—Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Invoking the Protective Spirits**
The Five Stars shine brightly, auspicious qi soars and drifts.
The Primordial One gathers the spirits, Heaven and Earth unite in harmony.
Jade talismans and precious seals summon the subtle and hidden.
Fire is cast, might is displayed—no treachery or evil lingers.
The ten thousand demons tremble and submit, their malevolence disperses like scattered petals.
Monsters are crushed, wickedness is vanquished, the Dao’s qi circulates freely.
Divine light illumines the night, shadows and darkness are wholly gathered.
The myriad spirits descend in reverence, riding the winds upon the spreading radiance.
All beings attain fulfillment, grace pervades the divine lands.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
The Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Dao Lord:
Summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Envoys, the Attendant Incense Golden Youth, the Message-Conveying and Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants and Incense Officials of the Day—thirty-two each.
Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to report to the Heavenly Thearchs and Divine Lords of the Mystic Altar.
Let them invoke the local earth gods and territorial true officials.
With this falling twilight, as incense is burned and the Dao is practiced, may the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend, flowing into this servant’s body.
May what this servant has declared swiftly reach the Jade Emperor’s court of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao, the Void and Spontaneous.

**Each States Their Dharma Rank**
The humble servant [Name], in unison with all present, respectfully petitions the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Non-Ultimate Great Dao’s Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao, the Supreme Mystic Elder, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Highest Emperor, the Jade Emperor Great Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern True, and the Mystic Capital Jade Capital Golden Palace Seven-Treasured Mystic Terrace Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace’s Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm, and all the divine officials of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have been blessed to ascend this sacred path, encountering the turning of the Dao’s fortune.
Golden scriptures expound the teachings, jade tablets reveal the charts.
We wear the numinous texts and uphold the wondrous instructions.
We reflect that the August Void established the ultimate, the Supreme suspended the ordinances.
Grace extends to the hidden and manifest, mercy suffuses the living and the dead.
In the Northern Feng nightly courts, divine light bestows the compassion of illumination;
In the Southern Huo immortal precincts, true standards display the ranks of transcendence.
From kalpas beyond measure to this very hour,
Numinous blessings wash away the dust of toil, the Dharma boat ferries the drowned and lost.
Rescuing the living, delivering the dead, aiding the state and benefiting the people.
The wondrous pivot and mystic axis bring protection to humans and heavens.

We, your servants, aspire to propagate the profound and abstruse, to transfer and protect the living and the departed.
Whatever is prayed for, by principle, should be reported.
Moreover, as we receive these sacred commands, how dare we not make them known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the petition states, the matters at hand are vast in their salvation.
The fast’s sponsor, [Name], sincerely cultivates and reverently upholds, earnestly seeking to honor the departed.
To rescue the courts of the night’s darkness, to grieve the suffering of the nether springs.
With devout sincerity in this fast and offering, may resonance be attained.

We, your servants, follow the Numinous Treasure’s revered scriptures and the Perfected’s highest ranks.
We open the jade caskets and numinous coffers to deliver the night’s darkness and the drowned.
Relying on the flying heavenly divine beings, we proclaim the karmic bonds of sin and fortune;
Facing the revealed ordinances of deliverance, we establish the altar grounds.
Silken candles and fragrant flowers express the sincerity of our hearts.
We present the petition and transmit the requests, reporting to the myriad heavens.
We hope that blessings will cover the yin and the hidden, grace will extend to families and the state.

With this falling twilight, as the Dao is practiced, we, the assembled Dharma hosts, now offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full devotion, reverently relying on the Supreme Three Worthies.
May these merits flow to the ancestral temples and former spirits, transcending the three realms.
May the emperor and lords of the realm emulate the virtue of the Two Modes.
May the phoenix calendar extend its vastness, the dragon charts endure eternally.
May the celestial origin be bright and serene, the earthly records secure and peaceful.
May wind and rain come in due season, all living beings enjoy health and prosperity.

chunks.original_text: 三启颂 乐法以为妻，爱经如珠玉。 持戒制六情，念道遣所欲。 澹泊正气停，萧然神静默。 天魔并敬护，世世受大福。 郁郁家国盛，济济经道兴。 天人同其愿，缥缈入大乘。 因心立福田，靡靡法轮升。 七祖生天堂，我身白日腾。 大道洞玄虚，有念无不契。 炼质入仙真，遂成金刚体。 超度三界难，地狱五苦解。 悉归太上经，静念稽首礼。 三礼 臣等至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 臣等至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 臣等至心稽首礼，玄中大法师。 重称法位 具位臣某等，重伸上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，十方无极大道道德众圣天尊至真，大帝天帝，天师君，上相上宰、四司五帝，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，三界应感一切真灵。 臣等获以凡微，参奉大法。 三乘演化，至道开光。 龙篆凤书，天章玉诀。 咸蒙禀受，克遂遵行。 未能匿景幽林，栖神世表。 以希高举，谢绝尘寰。 而与俗沉浮，混同常品。 愆非旋积，修奉不专。 徒以弘赞教仪，敷扬妙训。 度人济物，佐国立功。 冀罄丹诚，仰助玄化。 普令一切，咸入法门。 开庆存亡，拯护幽显。 今斋主某誊词列款，赍信效心。 依按典仪，奉修斋直。 露恳三光之下，投诚万圣之前。 然九幽神灯，照三涂罪苦。 破彼昏暗，开诸光明。 行道转经，虔诚忏悔。 仰虑亡灵神识，无数劫来。 舍身受身，循环报质。 或生天上。 或诞人间。 或处中华。 或居异域。 或贵或贱，或富或贫。 或不悟善因。 或不逢正法。 或执信邪妄，轻毁正真。 或妬贤明，诽谤良善。 或邪行曲径，冒利贪财。 绝人种亲，离人恩爱。 伤残物命，淫祀杀生。 危人自安，害他利己。 十恶三业，兴造罪根。 肆意任情，繁奢无度。 或钓川弋宿，焚林竭山。 刑法非宜，杀伤乖理。 或为臣不忠，秽慢三光，呵忿雷雨。 不敬天地，不畏神明。 积行所为，罪条无量。 或前冤未解，宿债未原。 往报未祛，深殃未忏，身殁之后，流曳三官。 痛毒备婴，魂神幽闭。 在穷泉之下，地狱之中。 一沉永夜，生道断绝。 动经亿劫，开度无由。 或受幽囚，或充考掠。 负山运石，摙汲溟波。 走电驱雷，辛勤无息。 冥冥受报，望返何期。 自非大道开恩，天尊愍护。 负斯痛恼，忏拔无阶。 以今一念至诚，洗心归向。 无边之苦，并乞赦除。 伏冀历劫种亲，亿曾魂爽。 垂兹胜福，咸得生天。 坟冢安全，注讼宁息。 九泉罢考，幽夜光明。 六道四生，含灵抱识。 俱登福岸，齐契正真。 上愿道化兴行，二仪贞静。 三光朗曜，帝业遐昌。 文轨大同，烽烟罢戢。 干戈疫毒，水火旱蝗。 无挠黎元，无侵境域。 俗臻富寿，化洽和平。 斋主某家眷属六亲，常承玄佑。 千灾殄息，万善资熏。 所启所祈，克蒙御达。 所首所谢，皆获感通。 上明天尊慈施之泽，下副臣等忏谢之诚。 谨启以闻。 发愿 一愿大道流行，普天怀德。 二愿一切有生，咸皆悟道。 三愿九夜悲魂，一时解脱。 四愿孤魂无依，咸得受生。 五愿天下太平，五谷丰熟。 六愿臣忠子孝，君仁父慈。 七愿四海通同，冤亲和释。 八愿潜胞处卵，咸得生成。 九愿积疾新痾，旋即痊愈。 十愿孤露众生，丰衣足食。 复炉 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣行道之所，自然生金液丹碧芝英。
chunks.translated_text:
**Threefold Invocation Hymn**

The Law is my bride, the sutras my pearls and jade.
I hold the precepts to curb the six passions,
mindful of the Dao to cast off desire.
In stillness, the upright qi abides;
in serenity, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and guard—
life after life, they receive great fortune.
The household and kingdom flourish in splendor,
the Dao and its teachings thrive in majesty.
Heaven and humankind share this vow,
soaring into the Great Vehicle.
By the heart’s resolve, the field of merit is sown;
the Wheel of Dharma ascends in boundless motion.
Seven generations of ancestors rise to heaven,
while this body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the profound void—
with thought, none fails to harmonize.
Refining the form to join the immortals,
one attains the adamantine body.
Transcending the three realms’ trials,
the five hells’ torments are dissolved.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures;
in silent devotion, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the thirty-six revered scriptures.
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Ranks**
We, your humble servants, [Names], now reverently address
the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin;
the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Ten Directions’ Boundless Great Dao, the Host of Virtuous and Perfected Heavenly Worthies;
the Great Thearchs and Heavenly Emperors;
the Heavenly Masters and Lords;
the Supreme Ministers and Prime Ministers;
the Four Offices and Five Emperors;
the thirty-six revered scriptures;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
and all responsive and perceptive numinous spirits of the three realms.

We, though base and insignificant, have been permitted to partake in the Great Dharma.
The Three Vehicles unfold their transformations,
the supreme Dao radiates its light.
Dragon-script and phoenix-writ,
celestial chapters and jade precepts—
all have we received and pledged to uphold.
Yet we have not hidden in secluded forests,
nor dwelled in realms beyond the world,
aspiring to ascend on high,
renouncing the dusty realm.
Instead, we drift with the mundane,
mingling with the common throng.
Transgressions accumulate unceasingly,
devotion falters in constancy.
Still, we strive to propagate the teachings’ rites,
to expound the wondrous instructions,
to ferry beings and deliver creatures,
to aid the state and establish merit.
We offer our sincere devotion,
hoping to assist the mysterious transformation,
that all may enter the Dharma-gate,
opening blessings for the living and the dead,
safeguarding the hidden and the manifest.

Now, the patron of this rite, [Name], has set forth their vows and pledges,
presenting their sincerity as offering.
Following the canonical rites,
we undertake this fast and vigil.
Beneath the Three Luminaries, we humbly plead;
before the myriad sages, we prostrate in devotion.
We kindle the Nine Dark Lamps,
illuminating the three paths’ sins and sufferings,
dispelling their gloom,
ushering in radiant light.
We perform the Dao, recite the scriptures,
and repent with utmost sincerity.

We reflect that the departed spirits,
through countless kalpas,
have cast off bodies and assumed new forms,
cycling through rebirth.
Some are born in heaven,
some descend among humankind,
some dwell in the Central Kingdom,
others in distant lands.
Some are noble, some base,
some rich, some poor.
Some fail to awaken to good causes,
some never encounter the true Dharma.
Some cling to falsehoods, scorning the true;
some envy the worthy, slandering the good.
Some tread crooked paths, coveting gain;
some sever human bonds, forsaking love.
Some harm living creatures,
offering wanton sacrifices and taking life.
Some endanger others for their own safety,
harming others for personal gain.
The ten evils and three karmic deeds
plant the roots of sin.
Indulging desire, unrestrained,
they wallow in excess.
Some angle in rivers or hunt at night,
burn forests or drain mountains.
Some impose unjust punishments,
inflicting harm against reason.
Some, as ministers, are disloyal;
some defile the Three Luminaries,
cursing thunder and rain.
Some disrespect heaven and earth,
fearing no divine judgment.
The sins they commit
are beyond measure.
Some bear unresolved grudges,
unsettled debts from past lives.
Unresolved retributions,
deep afflictions unrepented—
after death, they drift into the Three Offices,
enduring agony,
their souls imprisoned in darkness.
Beneath the Yellow Springs,
within hell’s depths,
they sink into eternal night,
the path of life severed.
For eons, they suffer,
with no means of deliverance.
Some endure confinement,
some face interrogation and torture.
They bear mountains, haul stones,
draw from the boundless sea.
Driven by lightning, chased by thunder,
they toil without rest.
In darkness, they receive their due—
when will they return?
Without the Great Dao’s mercy,
the Heavenly Worthy’s compassion,
this torment would know no end,
no path to repentance and liberation.

Now, with a single thought of utmost sincerity,
we purify our hearts and turn toward the Dao.
May all boundless suffering
be pardoned and absolved.
We humbly pray that the departed,
through countless kalpas and generations,
may receive this sublime merit,
all ascending to heaven.
May their tombs remain secure,
lawsuits cease.
May the Nine Springs’ torments end,
the dark night brighten.
May the six paths and four births,
all beings with consciousness,
together reach the shore of fortune,
attaining the true and real.

May the Dao’s transformation flourish,
the Two Modes remain steadfast.
May the Three Luminaries shine brightly,
the imperial enterprise prosper afar.
May cultural unity prevail,
warfare and strife cease.
May weapons, plagues, floods, fires, droughts, and locusts
no longer afflict the people,
no longer invade the realm.
May the people enjoy wealth and longevity,
the world know peace and harmony.
May the patron’s household and kin
ever receive the mysterious protection,
a thousand disasters dispelled,
ten thousand virtues nurtured.
May all prayers and supplications
be answered and conveyed,
all repentances and thanksgivings
be felt and reciprocated.
Above, may the Heavenly Worthy’s compassionate grace descend;
below, may our repentant sincerity be met.

**Vows**
First, may the Great Dao spread far and wide,
all under heaven embracing its virtue.
Second, may all sentient beings
awaken to the Dao.
Third, may the sorrowful souls of the Nine Nights
find liberation at once.
Fourth, may the lonely, unattached spirits
all receive rebirth.
Fifth, may the world know peace,
the five grains ripen in abundance.
Sixth, may ministers be loyal, children filial,
rulers benevolent, fathers kind.
Seventh, may the four seas unite,
enemies and kin reconcile.
Eighth, may the hidden and the unborn
all come to life and thrive.
Ninth, may chronic and acute illnesses
swiftly heal.
Tenth, may the destitute and orphaned
abound in clothing and food.

**Reigniting the Incense Burner**
Incense Officials and Envoys,
Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
Attendant Incense Spirits—
may this place of our Daoist practice
naturally yield golden elixir, cinnabar,
and azure mushrooms.

gather here in assembly,
before the grotto’s incense burner.
May I, who study the Dao, attain the Dao;
may I, who seek immortality, attain immortality.

receive this fragrant smoke,
and swiftly convey the words I have just uttered
directly to the Jade Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao,
before the Golden Gates of the Infinite.

Here begins Scroll Forty of the *Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Supreme*
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang Guangcheng

*Dissolving the Three Times, Circulating the Dao, Presenting the Petition*
*Sealing the Altar, Overnight Invocation—all as prescribed in the Lingbao scriptures*

The assembled officials take their places before the Dark Master and stand in formation.

*Chanting the Dao*
The *Hymn of Huaxia* is sung, leading the procession to the Earth Gate.

*Entering the Chamber*
Circling the altar, beginning from the East, the five directions are honored with incense.
Incense is offered at the Master’s table.
Incense is offered with the secret mantra.
Incense is offered at each station.
Each bows to the Master, visualizing as prescribed.

*Guarding the Spirits*
At dawn’s radiant clarity, purple mist rides the sky.
The star altar shines resplendent,
transforming into a cloud palace.
Sun’s essence and moon’s spirit
flank the Li and Kan trigrams.
Golden perfected ones summon with a whistle,
spirit tigers ward off Feng.
On this auspicious day, the ritual proceeds,
the Eight Mighties drum in attendance.
Jade blossoms unfurl, rainbow banners swirl.
Heavenly light descends in gaze,
the Dao’s qi flourishes in abundance.
All beings receive universal deliverance,
boundless blessings flow without end.

*Striking the Dharma Drum twenty-four times*

Supreme Mysterious Origin, Supreme Lord of the Dao,
summon forth from within this servant’s body:
the Three and Five Merit Officers,
the Left and Right Envoys,
the Golden Lads who attend incense,
the Jade Maidens who transmit words,
the Five Thearchs’ Direct Messengers,
and the Incense Officials of the Day—
thirty-two of each—
to emerge in full regalia.
Let them swiftly report to the local earth gods and territorial deities,
the true officials and rightful spirits of this place,
that I now, on behalf of the petitioner’s intent,
pray for the descent of the wondrous qi of the Lingbao’s spontaneous divine vitality,
to flow into our bodies,
so that the words I have uttered
may swiftly reach the Jade Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao,
before the Golden Gates of the Void and Spontaneous.

*Each declares their dharma rank*

Your humble servant, [Name], in full sincerity, together with all present, respectfully petitions:
the Spontaneous and Vast Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning,
the Supreme Lord of the Infinite Dao,
the Supreme Lord Lao,
the Jade Emperor of the August Heaven,
the host of great sages who have attained the Dao in the ten directions,
the perfected lords and venerable masters,
the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs,
the Jade Clarity Thearch,
the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital,
the Golden Waves of the Seven Treasures,
the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace,
the Lingbao Perfected Sovereign of Luminous Augustness,
the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures,
the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
and all the true spirits of the three realms’ officialdom.

We prostrate ourselves and recall:
when the great transformation first divided,
all beings received their endowment.
Yin and yang rise and fall,
determining life and death;
rewards and punishments, seen and unseen,
manifest sin and fortune.
From ancient times to the present, nothing has erred;
great and small alike are justly measured.
The supreme Dao proclaims its compassionate salvific decrees,
while the Lingbao scriptures prescribe rites of repentance and prayer.
Relying on this retreat’s offerings,
we seek to deliver the dim and benighted.
Having been entrusted with this office,
we have glimpsed the profound mysteries.
Whatever we now declare,
how dare we not make known above?

*Reading the Petition*
As the words of the petition state, we devote ourselves deeply to cultivation and reverence.

Tenth, may the destitute and orphaned

Incense Officials and Envoys,

Their afflictions extend to descendants, calamity flowing to later generations. In the endless dark of the netherworld, there is no path to liberation. Following the scriptural ordinances, we humbly seek their deliverance. Through the earnest observance of this retreat and the rites of repentance, we beseech mercy, offering our sincere devotion and praying for the gaze of the Mysterious One.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves in reverence, and turn in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones. May the merit of this act flow to [Name]’s family—thirty-six generations, nine ancestors, seven lineages—and to all departed spirits and hidden souls. May the radiance of the divine descend to illuminate the ninefold darkness, and may the power of the Dao suffuse all, ending the trials in every prison. May enmities dissolve, sins be absolved, souls bathed in the Pool of Flowing Fire, and rebirth granted within the Palace of Southern Florescence. May celestial robes adorn their forms and the dew of wisdom purify their hearts. May they forever sever evil ties and forever ascend to the realm of blessings.

Now, as incense is kindled, we take refuge in the great sagely assembly, the perfected virtues of the Most High, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the realm of Non-Action, harmonizing with the True Dao.

We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves in reverence, and turn in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones. May the merit of this act flow to the state, to the august rites of the Nine Temples, and to the ancestral sages of the imperial line. May the merit of this act bring fortune to [Name]’s family, that they may forever enjoy blessings and auspiciousness, all attaining purity and good fortune. Now, as incense is kindled, we take refuge in the great sagely assembly, the perfected virtues of the Most High, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the realm of Non-Action, harmonizing with the True Dao.

chunks.original_text: 东方 臣等至心归命东方无极大道太上老君，太上丈人，元始天尊，东乡神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 忏悔已后做此 臣等今故烧香，奉为某乙修建灵宝解考妙斋，转经行道，忏悔亿曾万祖，及三十六世已来，爰及亡灵，若亡若存无边之罪。 或行违正道，谄佞无端。 嫉妬贤能，浊乱神道。 酷虐无度，杀戮任心。 负誓违盟，魇蛊谋议。 殃罪结固，积若丘山。 责重考深，未蒙原解。 魂神执击，在木官东岳刑捣狱中，铜柱铁床金锤之考。 昼夜痛毒，食息无宁。 注讼生人，求乞赦拔。 冥冥长夜，解释无由。 以今行道结斋，祈恩忏涤。 伏冀大慈开宥，道力垂光。 告下东府之中，捣官门下。 解存亡殃考，迁拔魂神，受福天堂。 生神上境，幽明咸泰。 仰荷玄恩，得道之后，升入无为。 和与道合真。 南方 臣等至心归命南方无极大道太上老君，太上丈人，元始天尊，南乡神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 臣等今故烧香，奉为某乙修建灵宝解考妙斋，转经行道，忏悔亿曾万祖，及三十六世、九祖七玄，下及亡灵，若存若亡无边之罪。 或任心楚毒，杀害无辜。 结誓违盟，魇害於物。

To the East, we wholeheartedly take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the East, the Most High Lord Lao, the Venerable Celestial Elder, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Eastern Realm. With three bows, we reverently repent and offer thanks. After this repentance, we now kindle incense, dedicating it to so-and-so’s establishment of the wondrous retreat for the *Lingbao* Rite of Deliverance from Torment, wherein we recite scriptures and perform the Dao-circumambulation, repenting for the boundless sins of our countless ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: straying from the true Dao, flattery and deceit without end; envy of the worthy and capable, defiling and disrupting the divine Dao; cruelty and violence without measure, slaughter driven by whim; betrayal of oaths and covenants, plotting with curses and hexes. Such transgressions have congealed and accumulated like mountains, their weight crushing, their punishments profound. Yet they remain unforgiven. The souls of the guilty are seized and struck, confined within the Wooden Bureau’s Eastern Peak’s Punishment and Torture Prison, subjected to the torments of copper pillars, iron beds, and golden hammers. Day and night, they endure agony, their suffering unrelenting, their rest and sustenance denied. They afflict the living with lawsuits, pleading for deliverance. Yet in the endless dark of night, no release is found.

Now, through this Dao-circumambulation and retreat, we pray for mercy and repentance to cleanse these sins. We humbly implore the great compassion to grant forgiveness, the power of the Dao to bestow its light. May a decree descend within the Eastern Bureau, at the gates of the Torture Office. May the torments of the living and dead be dissolved, their souls delivered and uplifted, receiving blessings in the Heavenly Halls. May the living ascend to the divine realms above, and the dark and light realms alike know peace. Bearing the mysterious grace, having attained the Dao, may they ascend into Non-Action, harmonizing with the True Dao.

Their souls are seized and struck, confined within the Fire Bureau’s Southern Marchmount’s Punishment-Pounding Hell, enduring the torment of furnace and charcoal, scorched and broken by cruel punishments. Day and night, they are tortured and flogged, their pain and poison unbearable. The misfortune extends to their descendants, flowing endlessly without cease. In the boundless dark of the long night, there is no means of deliverance. Today, through repentance and the washing of hearts, through the establishment of the retreat and the performance of the Dao-circumambulation, we humbly implore the Three Worthies to witness and protect, the Great Saints to bestow compassion. We beseech the Fire Bureau of the Southern Palace and the wardens of the Punishment-Pounding Gate to absolve their accumulated sins and release the imprisoned souls. May they emerge from the Hell of Mount Huo, reborn within the Crimson Palace of Cavernous Yang. May their descendants receive blessings, forever bearing the grace of the divine. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into Non-Action, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

we offer the Three Bows, each with utmost sincerity, confessing and giving thanks.

We, the assembled, dedicate body and spirit, submitting ourselves in devotion.
Now, by burning incense and performing the Dao-procession,
we establish the Supreme Lingbao Fast of Deliverance from Punishment for so-and-so,
confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—
and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.
Some have offended the Great Sages of the Heavens, the Host of the Great Dao,
the Three Luminaries and Five Phases, the Sacred Host of the Void,
the spirits of wind, clouds, thunder, and rain, and all divine beings.
Some have violated the Five Peaks and myriad mountains, the Thirty-Six Earths,
the hills and water palaces, the officials of the underworld.
Some have defied sages and worthies, transgressed against benevolence and righteousness.
Some have desecrated ancient and modern sacred sites, contravened the Four Great Elements and Five Constants.
Each action has bound karmic causes, each has incurred retribution.
The Ten Evils have been fully committed, the Five Heinous Crimes repeatedly performed.
In life, no virtuous deeds; in death, only evil consequences.
Sunk in the Five Sufferings, dragged through the Three Wretched Paths.
Exiled souls endure hard labor, never granted pardon.

Now, by establishing this fast and performing the Dao-procession, we confess and uproot the roots of sin.
We humbly implore the Three Supreme Ones to open the streams of great compassion,
to send down the Mandate of the Nine Dragons.
We proclaim to all realms and the infernal courts of the judges:
Release the souls from eternal night.
Bathe them in the Crimson Mound’s courts, clothe them in the robes of the Cavern Yang’s palace.
Let them be born on the shores of blessed fortune, bestowing grace upon descendants.
May auspicious blessings draw near, the living and dead dwell in peace.
Should our plea be granted, we shall look up in profound gratitude for mysterious grace.
After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the realm of Non-Action,
harmonizing with the Dao to unite with the True.

Each shall meditate on the Nine-Colored Perfect Image,
swallow the saliva, recite the secret demon-subduing incantation,
pace the void, circumambulate.
The Supreme Ultimate divides into height and depth,
the light and pure ascend to belong to Heaven.

chunks.original_text: 人能修至道，身乃作真仙。 行溢三千数，时丁四万年。 丹台开宝笈，金口为流传。 大梵三天主，虚皇五老尊。 尚难窥徽妙，岂复入名言。 宝座临金殿，霞冠照玉轩。 万真朝帝所，飞舄蹑云根。 华夏吟哦远，人声自抑扬。 冲虚归道德，曲折合宫商。 殿阁沉檀散，楼台月露凉。 至诚何以祝，多稼永丰穰。 三礼 臣等至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 臣等至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 臣等至心稽首礼，玄中大法师。 重称法位 具位臣，某谨重诚上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上道君，太上老君。 臣等获以凡微，承奉科戒。 遵行圣旨，职在救人。 济拔存亡，普令安泰。 凡有陈告，敢不上闻。 今有某官斋信奉词，披诚露恳。 请修斋直，谢罪乞恩。 臣依典按仪，考寻玄式。 窃闻先人为善，则福及子孙； 为恶，则殃流后世。 罪福报对，如影随形。 非备忏祈，无由洗涤。 某家九玄七祖，后逝先亡。 无数劫来，恐犯诸罪目。 或犯三元所禁百八十条。 或犯玉匮罪源一十四品，六情所构，三业所为，十恶众非，积在阴府。 或目耽五色，不识正真。 耳滞五声，不闻至理。 口贪五味，食啖伤生。 身处五缠，染欲伤性。 或上违天道，犯日月星辰。 下犯地冥，及山川丘庙。 中悖人事，亏仁义之和。 为子为臣，不忠不孝。 为君为父，不道不慈。 口是心非，妬贤嫉善。 侵害人物，凌侮孤贫。 离亲合疏，崇邪背正。 剥刻财利，侵夺功名。 竭泽焚林，钓潜弋宿。 飞鹰走狗，烹杀无边。 或九族相残，六亲相暴。 言无义让，行必侵欺。 或为职为官，贪财为志。 谓上虐下，以取威名。 楚挞无辜，诛杀非罪。 或誓盟咒诅，牵引神祇。 或土木兴功，毁伤坟庙。 任心肆意，罪结祸深。 魂系三涂，幽闭长夜。 千痛万考，亿劫难原。 杳杳天堂，法桥路断。 冥冥地狱，出离无由，遂使衅注生人，灾缠后嗣。 所为踬滞，动遇凶衰。 因今沥恳披心，归依忏谢。 冥祈三宝，稽首诸天。 伏冀大圣垂慈，普赐哀宥。 勑四司五帝、三界威神，告下地府九幽、考官僚属，原赦亿曾万祖，一切魂灵。 释罪除愆，和冤解咎。 开重牢幽狱，放赦苦魂，剑树摧锋，刀山偃刃。 寒乡冥夜，尽睹光明。 莹质南丹，升神碧落。 逍遥八景，参乘十天。 捣官等迁秩太真，飞行金阙。 某家灾殃殄息，善贶来臻。 登寿福之阶，享安贞之报。 洎乎四生六趣，有识有情。 同赖勋修，并升道岸。 三光玄曜，六气均和。 帝祚遐长，天下咸泰。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等忏谢之诚。 谨启以闻。 发愿 一愿乾坤明素。 二愿气象清玄。 三愿圣人万寿。 四愿化洽八埏。 五愿天垂甘露。 六愿地发祥烟。 七愿四时应节。 八愿万物生全。 九愿家多孝悌。 十愿国富才贤。 十一愿醮官获福。 十二愿学道成仙。 复炉 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣行香之所，自然生金液丹碧芝英。 百灵众真，交会在此，香火炉前。 令臣学道得道，求仙得仙。 斋主受福，存殁沾恩。 令臣所启之言，速达径御太上无极大道虚无自然金阙玉陛下。 言功口章 具位臣某等，稽首上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，灵宝官属一切真灵。 臣等获奉正真，参修秘妙。 思弘斋福，以济生灵。 臣以某月某日为某官以某事，奉修灵宝解考大斋，忏谢存亡，解销冤考。
chunks.translated_text:
One who cultivates the Perfect Dao,
the body becomes a true immortal.
Their deeds surpass the three thousand,
their time spans forty thousand years.
The cinnabar terrace opens its treasure scrolls,
the golden mouth transmits the flow.
The Great Brahmā, Lord of the Three Heavens,
the Void Sovereign, the Five Venerable Ones—
even they cannot fathom its subtlety,
how then could it be captured in words?
The jeweled throne descends in the golden hall,
the rosy coronet illumines the jade pavilion.
Myriad perfected ones pay homage at the imperial court,
their flying sandals treading the roots of clouds.
The melodies of Hua and Xia resound afar,
the cadence of human voices rises and falls.
In emptiness they return to virtue and power,
their turns and twists harmonizing with the celestial tones.
The halls are steeped in sandalwood’s fragrance,
the towers cool beneath the moon’s dew.
How shall utmost sincerity be offered in prayer?
May the harvests forever flourish in abundance.

**Threefold Reverence**
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Titles**
We, your humble servants, [names], reverently reaffirm our sincerity and humbly address the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, the Most High Dao Lord, and the Most High Lord Lao.
We, of lowly and insignificant station,
have received and upheld the precepts and ordinances.
Following the sacred decree,
our duty lies in delivering sentient beings.
We rescue and liberate the living and the dead,
that all may dwell in peace.
Whatever we declare,
we dare not withhold from your august hearing.

Now, there is [name], an official and devout believer,
who lays bare his sincerity and reveals his earnest plea.
He requests to perform a fast and vigil,
to repent of sins and beseech grace.
In accordance with the canons and ritual forms,
we have examined the mystic protocols.
We have heard that when ancestors do good,
blessings extend to their descendants;
when they do evil,
calamities flow to later generations.
The retribution of sin and fortune
follows like a shadow.
Without thorough repentance and prayer,
there is no means of cleansing.

The nine generations and seven ancestors of [name]’s family,
the recently departed and those long gone—
through countless kalpas,
they may have committed various transgressions:
violating the one hundred eighty prohibitions of the Three Primes,
or the fourteen categories of offenses in the Jade Treasury,
arising from the six senses,
the three karmas,
the ten evils,
and myriad wrongs,
all accumulated in the nether courts.

Perhaps their eyes were ensnared by the five colors,
unable to perceive the true and real;
their ears clung to the five sounds,
unable to hear the supreme principle;
their mouths craved the five flavors,
consuming and harming life;
their bodies were bound by the five entanglements,
tainted by desire and harming their nature.

Perhaps they offended the celestial Dao above,
violating the sun, moon, and stars;
or transgressed against the earthly darkness below,
and the mountains, rivers, hills, and temples;
or disrupted human affairs in the middle,
undermining the harmony of benevolence and righteousness.

As children and subjects, they were disloyal and unfilial;
as rulers and fathers, they were unprincipled and unkind.
Their words belied their hearts,
they envied the worthy and resented the good.
They harmed others and seized their possessions,
bullied the orphaned and impoverished.
They estranged kin and befriended the distant,
revered the perverse and turned from the upright.
They exploited wealth and usurped merit,
drained marshes and burned forests,
angled for the hidden and shot the roosting.
They flew hawks and coursed hounds,
slaughtering without end.

Or perhaps they caused strife among the nine clans,
violence among the six relations.
Their words lacked propriety and deference,
their actions were always invasive and deceitful.
As officials, they coveted wealth,
oppressed their superiors and tyrannized their subordinates,
seeking prestige through cruelty.
They flogged the innocent,
executed the guiltless.

Or they made oaths and curses,
invoking gods and spirits;
or undertook construction projects,
damaging graves and temples.
They followed their whims and indulged their desires,
entangling themselves in deep sin and calamity.
Their souls are bound to the three paths,
confined in eternal night.
They endure a thousand torments and ten thousand trials,
their suffering spanning countless kalpas.
The distant heavens are dim,
the bridge of the Dharma broken.
The dark hells below offer no escape,
thus bringing misfortune upon the living
and disasters upon their descendants.
Their endeavors falter,
their movements meet with misfortune.

Now, we pour out our hearts in earnest plea,
returning in repentance and prayer.
We implore the Three Treasures,
prostrating before all the heavens.
We humbly beseech the Great Sage to bestow mercy,
to universally grant pardon and forgiveness.
May the edict be issued to the Four Controllers, the Five Emperors,
and the mighty deities of the Three Realms,
to proclaim below to the Nine Dark Realms of the netherworld,
the judges and their subordinates,
to absolve and pardon the countless ancestors and myriad souls.
Release their sins and remove their transgressions,
reconcile grievances and dissolve faults.
Open the heavy prisons and dark dungeons,
liberate the suffering souls.
The sword trees lose their blades,
the knife mountains lay down their edges.
The frigid realms and eternal night
are filled with light.
Their refined essences ascend to the Southern Cinnabar,
their spirits rise to the Azure Vault.
They roam the Eight Scenic Realms,
ride the Ten Heavens.
The officials of the netherworld are promoted to Great Perfected,
soaring to the Golden Gates.
The calamities of [name]’s family cease,
blessings and grace draw near.
They ascend the steps of longevity and fortune,
enjoying the rewards of peace and integrity.

May all sentient beings of the four births and six destinies,
the conscious and the feeling,
through this merit,
together ascend the shore of the Dao.
May the three luminaries shine in mystery,
the six qi harmonize.
May the imperial reign be long,
and the world dwell in peace.
Above, may the great compassion of the Celestial Venerable be manifest;
below, may the sincerity of our repentance be answered.

**Vows**
First, may heaven and earth be bright and pure.
Second, may the atmosphere be clear and mysterious.
Third, may the sage enjoy ten thousand years of life.
Fourth, may transformation extend to the eight limits.
Fifth, may sweet dew descend from heaven.
Sixth, may the earth emit auspicious vapors.
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their course.
Eighth, may all things grow in perfection.
Ninth, may families abound in filial piety and fraternal love.
Tenth, may the nation flourish with talent and virtue.
Eleventh, may the officiating officials obtain blessings.
Twelfth, may those who study the Dao attain immortality.

**Reactivating the Incense Burner**
Incense Official Messengers,
Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
Attendant Spirit Officials of the Incense—
may this place where we offer incense
naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms.
May the hundred spirits and myriad perfected ones
gather here before the incense burner.
May we who study the Dao attain the Dao,
those who seek immortality become immortals.
May the officiant receive blessings,
the living and the dead partake in grace.
May the words we have declared
swiftly reach the august presence of the Supreme Boundless Great Dao,
the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning,
in the Golden Gates and Jade Palace of the Void and Spontaneity.

**Verbal Petition**
We, your humble servants [names],
prostrate and humbly address the Supreme Boundless Great Dao,
the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning,
the Most High Great Dao Lord,
the Most High Lord Lao,
the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures,
the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm,
and all the spirit officials of the Numinous Treasure.
Having received the Orthodox and True,
we participate in the cultivation of secret wonders.
We aspire to expand the blessings of the fast,
to deliver living beings.

On the [day] of the [month],
for [name], on account of [matter],
we have conducted the Great Fast of the Numinous Treasure for Liberation from Torment,
repenting for the living and the dead,
dissolving grievances and torments.

chunks.original_text: 烧香然灯，照耀诸天。 诵咏灵音，行道礼忏。 解亿曾万祖，囚谪罪魂。 乞免离十苦八难，转入信根，若干日，若干夜行道转经。 今功圆事竟，谨迁立斋所，请兵马骑乘及灵宝官属、监斋卫真诸吏、监临卫护有功勤者，谒言真宫，进品上仙，加爵帝秩。 令臣等功圆行满，腾景九天。 日月同晖，三宝齐耀。 惟蒙上圣，鉴映丹心。 臣等或进止犯科，不合仪式。 未悟之罪，一乞原除。 五体真官，随功迁赏。 受秩事讫，与臣等同升。 谨启以闻，伏须告报。 臣等诚惶诚恐，稽首再礼以闻。 臣姓某属某郡县某观 太清玄元无上三天无极大道太上老君，太上丈人，天帝君，九老仙都君，九炁丈人，百千万重道炁、千二百官君，太清玉陛下。 某年太岁某月某朔某日某於某处拜上 法事毕，散送三师等，如灵宝仪。 若一中行道，不须宿启。 如一日两夜或日数稍多，即依灵宝科文，启齐署职，宣禁说戒。 言功后，还戒复职。 事事如法，不得率尔而行。 太上黄箓斋仪卷之四十竟 太上黄箓斋仪卷之四十一
chunks.translated_text:
**Incense Offering and Lamp Lighting**
We kindle incense and light lamps,
illuminating all heavens.
We chant the numinous sounds,
circumambulate in the Dao, and perform rites of repentance.
We liberate the bound spirits of countless generations of ancestors,
the imprisoned and exiled souls of the condemned.
We beseech deliverance from the Ten Sufferings and Eight Adversities,
guiding them to plant the roots of faith.
For so many days, so many nights,
we have circumambulated and recited the scriptures.

Now that the merit is complete and the affairs concluded,
we reverently dismantle the fast’s altar.
We summon the divine hosts—
the cavalry and mounts,
the spirit officials of the Numinous Treasure,
the inspectors and guardians of the fast,
and all those who diligently monitored and protected the rites—
to ascend to the True Palaces,
to be promoted as superior immortals,
and to receive ranks among the celestial hierarchy.

May we, your servants,
having fulfilled our merit and completed our practices,
ascend in radiance to the Nine Heavens.
May the sun and moon shine together,
may the Three Treasures gleam as one.
We humbly implore the Most High Saints
to witness and reflect upon our sincere hearts.

Should we, your servants,
in our movements or pauses,
have transgressed the statutes or failed to conform to the rites,
we beg forgiveness for these unwitting offenses.
May the Fivefold True Officials
be promoted and rewarded according to their merit.
Upon the completion of their duties,
may they ascend together with us.

We reverently submit this petition,
awaiting your august response.
With utmost reverence and awe,
we prostrate again and make this known.

Your humble servants, [names],
of [prefecture], [county], [abbey],
respectfully address
the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao of the Three Heavens of Primordial Beginning,
the Most High Lord Lao,
the Celestial Venerable,
the Heavenly Thearch,
the Nine Elder Immortal Lords of the Grotto-Heavens,
the Ninefold Qi Venerable,
the myriad layers of Dao-qi,
the Twelve Hundred Official Lords,
and the Jade Sovereign of the Great Clarity.

On the [day] of the [month] in the year of [cyclical sign],
at [location],
we humbly submit this petition.

Upon the conclusion of the rites,
we dismiss the Three Masters and others,
in accordance with the Numinous Treasure liturgy.

If the circumambulation spans only a single session,
no prior petition is required.
If it extends for a day and two nights or longer,
then, following the Numinous Treasure statutes,
petition the fast’s officers,
proclaim the prohibitions,
and expound the precepts.
After the merit-recitation,
restore the precepts and resume duties.
All matters must be conducted strictly according to the rites,
without careless deviation.

chunks.translated_text:
**Collected by Master Du Guangting of the Tang Dynasty**

**On Repentance**

To conduct the Dao and establish the fast, order is fundamental. Even slight disorder disrupts the proper form. When perception falters, ritual deportment and musical offerings falter in their reverence. Not only does this invite censure from the celestial courts, but it also risks ridicule from fellow practitioners.

Should wind and rain approach during rites at the open altar, or in the swelter of summer or the biting cold of winter; if dawn or dusk arrives untimely, or unexpected disturbances arise—halting the proceedings abruptly would cause panic and disorder, while adhering strictly to the statutes would delay and inconvenience. In such cases, the chief cantor may lead the assembly in *stepping the void* before the altar, invoking the divine. If the disturbance is severe, simplify the rites to their essence: the *Three Petitions* and *Great Thanksgiving* will suffice. Adapt to the moment, lest rigidity become one’s undoing.

**Twenty Directions’ General Repentance**

The assembled officers face north as the chief cantor intones:
*"We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Ten Directions’ Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Ten Poles’ Heavenly Lords, the Three Luminaries and Five Peaks, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Sacred Scriptures, and all divine immortals and spirit-officials."*

After bowing, each repents with reverence. As the cantor invokes each direction, all bow once:
*"We humbly recall: the Dao acts through non-action, and virtue governs without dominion. It encompasses the myriad dharmas as the greatest within the realm and spans the nine schools to open the gate of all mysteries. The principles of good and evil are distinct, and the statutes of sin and blessing clearly manifest. Thus, the Vermilion Register of the Southern Palace records ascent as the reward for goodness, while the Black Book of the Northern Bureau inscribes death as the reckoning for transgression. These serve to punish and encourage, rescuing the benighted. Only after clarifying the origins of the teaching can one align with the intent of non-action.*

*Now, on behalf of the sponsor of this Great Yellow Register Fast, the official [Name], who cherishes loyalty and filial piety, and whose gratitude to sovereign and kin runs deep, we initiate this rite of incense and devotion to repay the kindness of nurture. With fragrant offerings, ritual gifts, dragon-jade, and patterned silks, we take refuge in the Ten Directions’ Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the perfected deities of the Sun, Moon, and Stars, the True Lords of the Sacred Mountains and Grotto-Heavens, the Five Peaks, the Water Palaces’ revered spirits, the Three Treasures’ officials, the Ten Directions and Three Realms, and all true numina. We beseech the grace of celebration and bestowal, the descent of great compassion’s blessings.*

*May the sponsor’s [Name] household—ancestors of a hundred thousand generations, the wandering souls in the cold courts of eternal night—all be liberated. May the three affinal and five consanguineous kin, all relations and dependents, have their misfortunes erased from the Nine Yin and their blessings born in the Three Luminaries. May calamities cease, and longevity extend. May the Emperor’s sagacity surpass that of Fuxi and Shennong, his years equaling heaven and earth. May the Crown Prince and regional lords long assist in this flourishing era. May the Empress, consorts, and concubines forever uphold the sacred enterprise. May the myriad officials and feudal lords devote themselves to its support. May the four seas and ten thousand lands be transformed by unified culture. May weapons fall silent and wind and rain follow their course. May the sun and moon retain their purity, and the stars their proper motion. May Fengdu’s judgments be stayed, and all creatures dwell in safety. May we all embody the lineage of clarity and stillness, and together realize the Dao of the subtle and formless. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true."*

**Twenty Directions’ Sequential Repentance**

The assembled officers move left, stand facing east, and the chief cantor intones:
*"We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Eastern Direction’s Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine immortals and spirit-officials of the Eastern Realm."*

After bowing, each repents with reverence.
*"Eastern Direction..."*

Now, the sponsor of this grand Yellow Register Retreat, [Name], acting for state and family, establishes the retreat and practices the Dao. With utmost sincerity, they take refuge in the Black Emperor True Lord of Northern Marchmount Hengshan, the Flying Immortals, the True Persons of the renowned mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials who have attained the Dao. We humbly pray that blessings extend to the imperial palace, preserving peace and prosperity. May the dragon’s chart and marchmount’s stability endure, and the phoenix’s records align with heaven’s order. For the sponsor’s family, may their nine generations of ancestors ascend beyond the dark realms of Youdu; may their six relations enjoy radiant peace, basking in the sacred sun’s brilliance. May sins be extinguished and disasters dispelled, with longevity and emoluments everlasting. After attaining the Dao, may they ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to unite with the True.

**Central Marchmount**
We, your humble servants, have heard that as the revered of the four wilds and the chief of all mountains, the lofty Songshan stands supreme among the marchmounts, its towering heights reaching heaven. With thirty-six peaks rising and falling, its verdant hues span Gong and Luo; stretching for myriad miles, its azure expanse upholds the vault of heaven. It governs the lives of beings and oversees the judgment of sins and blessings.

Now, the sponsor of this grand Yellow Register Retreat, [Name], acting for state and family, seeks grace and repents transgressions. With utmost sincerity, they take refuge in the Yellow Emperor True Lord of Central Marchmount Songshan, the Flying Immortals, the True Persons of the renowned mountains and grotto-heavens, and all the divine officials who have attained the Dao. We humbly pray that ancestral blessings flourish, bringing peace to the realm. May the grand chart and marchmount’s stability endure, and the sacred lifespan align with heaven’s order. For the sponsor’s family, may their seven generations of ancestral spirits dwell in the jade grotto; may their six relations and kin be inscribed in the resplendent registers. May disasters be eradicated and longevity with emoluments ever increase. After attaining the Dao, may they ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to unite with the True.

**Water Palace**
We, your humble servants, have heard that the highest virtue lies in merit, governing the Kan Palace to accumulate power; the most yielding nature flows through the Xun Sea to still its waves. It draws its numen from the primordial chaos and extends its sageliness beyond heaven and earth. Floating the sky and bathing the sun, its boundless source defies measure; spanning the earth and steaming clouds, its vast expanse eludes comprehension. Below, it opens the dragon gods’ palace and divides the bureaus of sin and blessing. Its governance is impartial, sustaining both the hidden and the manifest.

Now, the sponsor of this grand Yellow Register Retreat, [Name], acting for family and state, repents transgressions and seeks grace. With utmost sincerity, they take refuge in the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley, the Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang, the divine officials of the twelve river sources and water palaces. We humbly pray that blessings from the nine heavens flow to all nations. May turtle-script and dragon-seals herald auspicious omens in the age of Yao; may seas be calm and rivers clear, matching the sacred era’s longevity. For the sponsor’s family, may the nine generations of ancestral spirits erase their names from the water palace’s ledgers of sin; may their five relations and six kin be recorded in the immortal registers of Peng Palace. May disasters naturally cease and emoluments ever grow. May all creatures, winged and swimming, together receive the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, may they ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to unite with the True.

**Sacred Scriptures**
We, your humble servants, have heard that the Great Dao divides its light, first expounding the wordless teaching; the Heavenly Worthy spreads transformation, gradually bestowing the written works. Thus, qi coalesces into chapters, and clouds congeal into seals. Each character spans a zhang, radiating eight-cornered numinous rays; their traces scatter across the heavens, harmonizing with the five assemblies’ tones. The twelve hundred precepts, twelve thousand rules of deportment, thirty-six divisions of sacred scriptures, and three thousand six hundred canons and statutes—cultivating them leads to immortality and transcendence as a divine immortal; upholding them aids the state, guides the sovereign, pacifies the people, and benefits all beings. They encompass all methods and universally deliver sentient beings.

Now, the sponsor of this grand Yellow Register Retreat, [Name], acting for family and state, repents transgressions and seeks grace. With utmost sincerity, they take refuge in the Most True and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Sacred Scriptures, the natural scriptural precepts, the orthodox Dharma of the ten directions, the secret treasuries of all heavens, the true writs and precious talismans, the scripture-attending divine lords, ministers, and officials, and all the divine bureaus of ritual and dharma protection. We humbly pray that blessings descend from the nine heavens, bestowing prosperity upon all nations. May the sacred body be harmonious and flourishing, and the precious mandate enduring. For the sponsor’s family, may the nine generations of ancestral spirits be inscribed on the cinnabar tablets; may their six relations and kin be ranked in the purple registers. May disasters be eradicated and blessings with longevity ever expand. May the three paths and nine nights together bathe in the divine merit. After attaining the Dao, may they ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to unite with the True.

*The Forty-Third Scroll of the Most High Yellow Register Fast Rites*
Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting

*Rites of Repentance to the Five Directions for Disaster Relief Among Officials and Commoners*
When ascending the altar during extreme cold, intense heat, or sudden wind and rain, lest one’s demeanor be improper or actions hasty, this repentance rite may be employed for simplicity and essentials.

**First, Pay Homage to the Directions**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions’ Boundless Realms, the Great Sage Hosts Who Have Attained the Dao, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Masters, and the Divine Officials of the Ten Realms’ Immortal Lands.
*Three prostrations, each with reverent repentance.*

**Next, the Repentance**
We humbly recall that the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Poles recline in effortless majesty above the Void of Non-Being, while the Five Elder Thearchs unfurl their charts within the Great Desert. They propagate the Dao and virtue to transform all regions, and dispense kindness and compassion to govern all beings. Whatever is entreated, they unfailingly respond.
Now, we, the sponsors of this grand Yellow Register Fast, certain officials and persons, bear profound gratitude for ruler and kin, and deep loyalty to family and state. To honor blessings and prosperity, we have established this altar and precinct. Following the prescribed rites and presenting the ritual offerings, we take refuge in the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions’ Boundless Realms, the Great Sage Hosts Who Have Attained the Dao, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Masters, and the Divine Officials of the Ten Realms’ Immortal Lands.
We specially beseech the bestowal of their ungoverning benevolence and the diffusion of their impartial grace. May auspicious omens descend upon the ancestral temples and the imperial line’s fortune be prolonged. May the myriad states enjoy peace, and the five weapons be stilled.
Next, we pray for the nine generations and seven ancestors of the sponsor’s family to transcend the Crimson Palace. May the five clans and six relations be inscribed upon the cinnabar tablets. May a thousand disasters cease, and a hundred blessings be renewed. May all living beings together attain the shelter of the Dao. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the Dao in truth.

**The Three Luminaries**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Perfected Great Sages of the Sun, Moon, and Stellar Palaces, and the Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries’ Immortal Hosts.
*Three prostrations, each with reverent repentance and gratitude.*

We humbly recall that the celestial bodies hang in brilliance, illuminating the earth below. The Three Luminaries bestow their radiance, and all beings take form. The Solar Emperor and Lunar Sovereign oversee the registers of life and death, while the Stellar Palaces and Dipper Pivot jointly govern the records of sin and fortune.
Now, we, the sponsors of this grand Yellow Register Fast, certain officials and persons, with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Perfected Great Sages of the Sun, Moon, and Stellar Palaces, and the Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries’ Immortal Hosts.
We specially beseech the bestowal of their great abundance and the diffusion of their impartial virtue. May the imperial enterprise flourish and blessings descend upon the sagely court. May longevity be extended without bound, and universal peace achieved across the ten thousand realms.
Next, we pray for the nine generations of the sponsor’s family to be delivered, and a hundred blessings to converge. May their emoluments and years be renewed, and disasters and misfortunes forever cease. Through the three paths and nine nights, may their consciousness connect with the radiance of conjoined pearls and jade disks. May all moving and quiescent beings, all containing spirit, receive the gift of illumination and life.
After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the Dao in truth.

**The Five Peaks**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the True Lords of the Five Peaks, and the Divine Officials of the Grotto-Heavens and Sacred Mountains Who Have Attained the Dao.
*Three prostrations, each with reverent repentance and gratitude.*

We humbly recall that when the Two Modes parted, the Five Peaks divided their majesty. Below, they stabilize the earth; above, they support the celestial canopy. The sacred mountains and numinous grottoes govern spirits and gods. The underworld bureaus and immortal courts administer sin and fortune.
Now, we, the sponsors of this grand Yellow Register Fast, certain officials and persons, with utmost sincerity take refuge in the True Lords of the Five Peaks, and the Divine Officials of the Grotto-Heavens and Sacred Mountains Who Have Attained the Dao.
We specially beseech their illumination of our sincere devotion and the descent of vast blessings. First, may the imperial destiny be strengthened and the imperial plan secretly protected. May the phoenix’s reign endure for myriad millennia, and the crane’s years equal those of Mount Song and Mount Hua.
Next, may the nine generations and seven ancestors of the sponsor’s family, whose consciousness lingers in dark prisons, have their records expunged from Mount Tai’s ledgers and find the path to freedom in the immortal grottoes. May the living kin—both inner and outer relations—have their emoluments and longevity increased, and misfortunes and disasters eradicated. May their sinful records be stricken from the Five Peaks, and their names inscribed in the immortal registers of the Nine Heavens. May all moving and quiescent beings together attain liberation.
After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the Dao in truth.

**The Water Realms**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley, the Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang, and the Divine Officials of the Twelve River Sources’ Water Realms.
*Three prostrations, each with reverent repentance and gratitude.*

We humbly recall that the Eight Seas support the heavens, floating the Ten Continents beyond the world, while the Nine Jiang harness the sun, dividing the Six Directions within the earthly realm. The cosmos relies on their power of conveyance, and all beings depend on their nurturing virtue. They conceal grotto-heavens within, governing all living beings. Having charge over the sources of sin and fortune, they should be entreated with utmost devotion.
Now, we, the sponsors of this grand Yellow Register Fast, certain officials and persons, with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley, the Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang, and the Divine Officials of the Twelve River Sources’ Water Realms.
We specially beseech the unfolding of their supreme benevolence and the diffusion of their numinous and enduring grace. May auspicious omens be received at the imperial palace, and the River Chart be restored. May the imperial person’s longevity be increased, and the seas and mountains be pacified. May terrifying waves subside, and all classes of beings enjoy peace.
Next, we pray for the nine ancestors and seven generations of the sponsor’s family to be reborn in heaven and attain the Dao. May they depart the dark courts of the Yellow Springs and ascend to the square isles and round peaks of the immortal realms. May the living kin together partake of splendid blessings. May fortune and prosperity descend, and disasters and transgressions be cleansed. May all virtues daily renew, and all beings together prosper.
After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless. Harmony unites with the Dao in truth.

**The Sacred Scriptures**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Three Supreme Worthies of the Most High, the Hosts of Sages of the Ten Directions, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Revered Scriptures, and the True Writings and Sacred Talismans.
*Three prostrations, each with reverent repentance and gratitude.*

chunks.original_text: 安宅行道方忏 先众官列位於玄师前，立定 唱道 入户 旋行，上五方香东方为始 上御案香 上本位香 各礼师，存念如法 卫灵 晨精朗曜，紫烟御空。 星坛焕映， 变化云宫。 日魂月魄，离坎翼中。 金真啸命，龙虎辟酆。 吉日行事， 八威鼓从。 玉华罗敷，徘徊飞虹。 天光下盻，道炁丰隆。 含灵普济， 庆流无穷。 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上三天玄元始三炁太上老君，召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域、真官正神入意。 愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流入臣等身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道虚无自然金阙玉陛下。 各称法位 具位臣某等，谨同诚上启虚无自然元始天尊，无极大道太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，十方已得道大圣众、至真诸君丈人，三十二天帝君，玉虚上帝，玉帝大帝，东华南极西灵北真玄都玉京金阙七宝玄台紫微上宫灵宝至真明皇道君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，三界官属、洞府真仙、太始五帝、灵宝威神、天上地下、一切真灵。 臣等伏闻，大道融真，元皇御运。 五文开教，三洞宣行。 天尊垂广济之科，太上播无疆之泽。 陶钧庶品，拯度群生。 臣亿劫良因，被沐玄化。 龙书凤纪，玉札琼篇。 得以禀修，用祈升度。 而告盟之始，约匡救为先。 凡有所陈，不容寝绝。 况奉词旨，敢不上闻。 读词 按如词言，情诚丹切。 理宜开度，以副玄慈。 窃惟五太之前，三灵分化。 洎于下古，未杂浇漓。 冬穴下巢，怀道抱德。 各安所适，玄会无为。 自数兆阴阳，象垂栋宇。 吉凶善恶，倚伏相乘。 顺之则代享祯祥，违之则人罹灾沴。 圣人弘训，愍济为心。 忏罪祈恩，俾崇斋直。 臣等谨相携率，依按典仪。 式建坛场，以祈福佑。 以今某分行道，请法众等，运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真道宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊灵、宗祧上圣。 清都莹质，紫极延祥。 福被宸居，庆传帝业。 比嵩衡而作固，与日月以齐明。 太子诸王，承匡圣业。 贤臣良辅，克赞谋猷。 万国梯航，群生昭泰。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今某分行道，请法众等，运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真经宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流某家九祖七玄，先灵幽爽。 栖神绛苑，炼魄丹台。 袭气每以登真，御云峤而托化。 福资来裔，泽及存亡。 克荷玄休，常承元吉。 今故烧香，归依师尊大圣众，至真之德，得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 以今某分行道，请法众等，运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟腾空，径上供养无上至真师宝。 臣等归身归命，首体投地，仰依太上三尊。 愿以是功德，归流斋主某家。 眷属宗亲，同兹祯贶。 福延寿永，祸灭灾销。 洎乎居宅龙神，阴阳将吏。 迁功贸赏，加爵增勋。 纳吉佑於中宫，荡灾凶於外域。
chunks.translated_text:
**Rite for Pacifying the Dwelling and Circulating the Dao**

The assembled officials first take their positions before the Mysterious Master and stand in formation. They chant the *Dao*, enter the chamber, and circumambulate, beginning with the offering of incense to the Five Directions in the east. They then present incense at the imperial altar and at their respective stations, each bowing to the Master while visualizing as prescribed.

*Guardian Spirits*, radiant and luminous at dawn,
Purple mists ascend through empty space.
Stellar altars gleam resplendent,
Transforming into cloud-palaces.
The solar essence and lunar spirit,
Winged between *Li* and *Kan*.
Golden Perfected issue their commands,
Dragons and tigers dispel Fengdu’s shades.
On this auspicious day, the rite proceeds,
Eight Mighty Ones drum in attendance.
Jade blossoms unfold, rainbow banners swirl,
Heavenly light descends, the Dao’s *qi* flourishes.
All beings receive universal deliverance,
Joy flows without end.

**Twenty-four strikes of the ritual drum.**

O Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, Three *Qi* of the Supreme Venerable Lord Lao: Summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Attendant Officials of Left and Right, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youth, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maiden, and the Thirty-Two Fragrant Officials of the Five Thearchs and the Direct Day. Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to open the gates of the Mysterious Altar and invoke the Celestial Lords and Divine Sovereigns. May the deities of this land and its boundaries, the true officials and upright spirits, attend in mind.

We pray that the wondrous light of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-*qi* and Numinous Treasure descend and flow into our bodies, that our petitions swiftly ascend to the presence of the Supreme, Boundless, and Great Dao—before the Jade Threshold of the Formless and Spontaneous Golden Gate.

**Each declares their ritual rank:**

We, your humble servants, in unison and sincerity, reverently address the Formless and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Boundless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Supreme Venerable Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the August Heaven, the Great Sage Assemblies and Perfected Lords of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Thirty-Two Heavenly Lords, the Jade Clarity Emperor, the Great Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, the Seven Jeweled Mysterious Terrace of the Jade Capital and Golden Gates in the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure Perfected Sovereign of Luminous Augustness, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the officials of the Three Realms, the Perfected Immortals of the Grotto-Heavens, the Five Primordial Thearchs, the Numinous Treasure’s Mighty Spirits, and all true numina above and below.

We have heard that the Great Dao fuses with the true, and the Primordial August One governs the course of destiny. The Five Scriptures unfold the teachings, and the Three Caverns proclaim their practice. The Heavenly Worthy bestows the ordinances of boundless deliverance; the Supreme One spreads limitless grace. All beings are shaped and refined, all lives rescued and uplifted. We, having accumulated good causes over countless kalpas, have been bathed in the mysterious transformation. Dragon scripts and phoenix records, jade tablets and jasper scrolls—we have been privileged to receive and cultivate them, seeking ascent and deliverance. Yet at the outset of our vows, we pledge salvation as our foremost duty. No petition may be withheld or denied. How much more so when commanded by sacred decree—dare we not make this known above?

**The petition is read.**

As the words express, our sincerity is earnest and our devotion profound. It is fitting that deliverance be granted, that the mysterious compassion be fulfilled.

We reflect that before the Five Ultimates, the Three Spirits divided their transformations. In the lower antiquity, customs remained uncorrupted. Dwellings were carved into cliffs and nests built in trees; all embraced the Dao and held fast to virtue. Each found contentment in their place, harmonizing in effortless non-action. But when the myriad signs of yin and yang appeared, and the symbols of beams and rafters arose, fortune and misfortune, good and evil, intertwined in mutual succession. Those who followed the natural order enjoyed generations of blessings; those who defied it suffered calamities and afflictions. The sages, moved by compassion, made salvation their heart’s work. Through repentance of sins and prayer for grace, they exalted the rectitude of the retreat. We now humbly join together, adhering to the canonical rites. We establish the altar and seek blessings and protection.

Today, as we proceed with the rite, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, reverently relying on the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the august spirits of the altars of state and the ancestral shrines. May the Celestial Capital gleam with radiant purity, and the Purple Culmen extend its blessings. May fortune grace the imperial residence, and felicity transmit the imperial enterprise. May it stand as firm as Mount Song and Mount Heng, and shine as brightly as the sun and moon. May the Crown Prince and the various princes inherit and uphold the sagely enterprise. May worthy ministers and good counselors ably assist in planning and strategy. May the myriad states come as if by bridge and boat, and all beings enjoy peace and prosperity.

For this purpose, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Assemblies, the virtues of the Perfected Ones. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

Today, as we proceed with the rite, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the second pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, reverently relying on the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the nine ancestors and seven generations of the sponsor’s family, and to the departed spirits in the hidden realms. May they dwell in the Crimson Garden and refine their souls on the Cinnabar Terrace. May they don the *qi* of immortality and ascend to the cloudy peaks, entrusting themselves to transformation. May fortune bless their descendants, and grace extend to both the living and the dead. May they ever bear the mysterious felicity and constantly receive primal auspiciousness.

For this purpose, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Assemblies, the virtues of the Perfected Ones. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

Today, as we proceed with the rite, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the third pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, reverently relying on the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the sponsor’s household, their kin and relatives, bringing them shared blessings. May their fortune extend and their lives endure; may misfortunes vanish and calamities dissolve. May the dragon spirits of the dwelling, the yin and yang officers, and the terrestrial officials receive promotions in rank and rewards for merit, their titles and honors augmented. May they bring auspicious protection to the central palace and dispel disasters and misfortunes from the outer realms.

*Here ends Scroll Forty-Three of the Rituals of the Great Register Retreat of the Most High*

**Ritual Orientation**
With utmost sincerity, we prostrate ourselves and submit our lives to the Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East, the Azure Emperor of the Nine Qi Celestial Lord, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the eastern quarter. Thrice we bow, each time offering reverent repentance and gratitude. Hereafter, follow this pattern for each direction.

**East**
We, your servants, offer this rite on behalf of the sponsor, so-and-so, humbly giving thanks to the Boundless Supreme Perfected Azure Emperor of the Nine Qi of the East, the Seven Star Lords of the Azure Dragon and Eastern Dipper—Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket—the Wood Virtue Deities of Jia-Yi and Yin-Mao, the Lesser Yang Qi of the Nine Yi Elder Lord, the Spring Sovereign Gou Mang of Grand White, and the Stellar Officials of Jupiter, the Wood Palace.

We reflect with awe that the dwelling place may have offended or transgressed against the divine, violated prohibitions, and thereby invited misfortune. Now, therefore, we kindle incense and submit our lives to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy. We perform this fast and practice the Dao, seeking to repent our faults and entreat blessings.

May our transgressions be absolved and blessings bestowed. May the qi of central earth be harmonized, and all disasters and misfortunes dissolved. May sins be expiated, calamities stilled, and both the living and the dead enjoy peace. May fortune and longevity be renewed, the entire household flourish in integrity, and all beings—moving and still—receive glory. May our prayers be granted, and may we ever bear the profound grace of the Mystery.

Having attained the Dao, we ascend into formlessness. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

chunks.original_text: 禄延寿永，祸灭福生。 蒙如所启，仰荷玄恩。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 下方 臣等奉为斋主某仰谢，下方无极世界神仙正真，高皇土府、九宫真人，四司五帝、十二仙君，灵洞川泽、五岳尊神，下谢阴阳所运八卦九官、五行二宅后土至真、地下侯伯四正诸神、八部禁忌守宅将军、五土官属五土子孙及将军太岁豹尾黄旛、奏书博士刑德众神、七十二位内外神灵。 仰虑居宅之所，犯触神明。 违越禁忌，延致灾殃。 今故烧香，皈命灵宝天尊。 修斋行道，谢过祈恩。 乞一忏罪灭，万善咸臻。 犯触之咎，并乞销平。 举家康泰，居止安宁。 禄寿增延，存亡同福。 蒙如所启，仰荷玄恩。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 步虚，旋远 三礼 臣等至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 臣等至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 臣等至心稽道礼，玄中大法师。 重称法位 具位臣某等谨重伸上启太上无极大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，十方已得道大圣众至真，太帝天帝，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，土府太皇，地下五帝，三天大法师，正一真人，三五官属、应感真灵。 伏闻，玄化宣行，道风还布。 惠周三界，恩溥群生。 盟威悬佐国之科，灵宝着忏祈之品。 凡有祈向，克获感通。 弟子某以迹处尘寰，未参幽妙。 而卜筑之所，居止非宜。 窃虑犯件真灵，违越禁忌。 乖八宅五行之候，亏阴阳刑德之方。 既切忧疑，领申忏谢。 是用肃严坛墠，精按典仪。 虔备香花，恭修斋直。 归心十极，忏罪诸天。 依正一法文，天师具格。 谒请三五官属、天君吏兵，禳却凶邪，解销灾磬。 臣谨为某上请无上高仓君，都曹正炁君，素车白马君、考召君、运炁解患守宅君、天上咎逆君、广司君、北城韶命化喻谋议君、天心刺史从事平天君、无上太和君、收神上明君、上元士君、盖天大将军元上天君、赤天仓气君、四胡君、制地君、天昌君、五镇大将军。 主为某家，解除三丘五墓、地下众精、月食土气、百病恶逆、盗贼耗害、刑杀凶殃之气，五瘟百病、刑祷精邪、四方破射、五部兵猎、户庙咒诅、众考诸妖之属，及五行复注之气，留停藏匿之神。 积世流殃，行年灾厄。 十二刑害，中外疆□。 一切凶神，咸从销解。 其有运材摙石，动土兴工。 犯天地正神，乖阴阳真气。 侵伤土府，违忤神明。 幽显既殊，常情罔测。 因今悔谢，并乞荡除。 即使正炁宣行，龙神镇守。 灾殃珍绝，福善来臻。 居止安宁，动静和泰。 亲缘族属，同沐利贞。 七祖生天，三途清晏。 九幽罢对，长夜开光。 冤债和平，谋议潜息。 伏尸故气，滞魄幽魂。 俱荷福缘，各蒙开度。 舍邪归正，契道通真。 帝祚遐长，生灵昭畅。 普天全济，蠢动沾荣。 上明天尊广济之泽，下副臣等忏谢之诚。 护启以闻。 发愿 一愿乾坤明素，二愿气象清玄，三愿圣人万寿，四愿化洽八埏，五愿天垂甘露，六愿地发祥烟，七愿四时应候，八愿万物生全，九愿家多孝悌，十愿国富才贤，十一愿斋功广被，十二愿善瑞日臻。 复炉 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣行香之所，自然生金液丹碧芝英。 百灵众真，交会在此，香火炉前。 令臣学道得道，求仙得仙。 斋主受福，幽显沾恩。 十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，令臣所启之言，速达径御太上无极大道金阙陛下。

chunks.original_text: 违越禁忌，扰动龙神。 或五行刑克，四杀侵凌。 怪梦纷乱，居止不宁。 今故烧香行道，谢罪希恩。 伏冀罪瑕除荡，冤债和平。 存亡开泰，眷属咸安。 龙神复位，寿禄增延。 三涂蒙福，动植沾荣。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 三光 如修灵宝，止忏十方。 如修黄箓，加三光等忏。 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙修斋行道，仰谢日月星宫至真大圣、三光神仙诸灵官。 仰虑居宅修造之所，犯触神明。 负违禁忌，秽慢三光。 不顺星辰日月行运之期，结成过咎，延致灾衰。 今故烧香行道，谢过希恩。 伏冀灵光下烛，万罪消平。 存亡开泰，眷属安宁。 龙神复位，福祚增延。 幽关昭朗，动植舒荣。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 五岳 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙修斋行道，仰谢五岳真君，名山洞府、得道神仙诸灵官。 仰虑居宅修造之所，犯触神明。 负违天禁地忌，在五帝五岳之司。 结成过咎，未获原除。 今故烧香行道，谢过希恩。 伏冀一忏罪灭，万善咸臻。 犯触之罪，并赐销平。 存亡开泰，眷属安宁。 灾衰除荡，寿禄增延。 龙神镇守。 动植沾荣。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 水府 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙修斋行道，仰谢扶桑大帝，旸谷神王，三河四海、九江水帝，十二河源水府神仙诸灵官。 仰虑居宅，修造之所，犯触神明。 侵伤水脉，闭塞泉源。 违上善之性，亏下润之功。 轻忤真圣，秽触江河。 结成罪咎，在水府之中。 历代缠绵，未蒙解释。 今故烧香行道，谢罪希恩。 伏冀尊灵鉴佑，荡涤罪瑕。 触犯之目，并赐销平。 存亡开泰，眷属安宁。 灾衰超度，寿禄增延。 龙神复位，动植沾荣。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 经宝 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙修斋行道，仰谢至真无上三十六部尊经、真文宝符、三洞正法十方秘藏、侍卫经典一切灵司。 仰虑居宅修造之所，犯触真灵。 黩秽灵蹝，侵伤福地。 或三宝遗迹，经教所行，有卫法灵司、侍真官属。 在所居之地，非常俗所知。 因有犯违，结成罪咎。 在三宝之府，未获原除。 今故烧香行道，谢过希恩。 伏冀万圣开光，高尊鉴宥。 触犯之罪，咸赐荡除。 福善来臻，寿禄增益。 存亡开泰，眷属安宁。 动植蒙恩，龙神复位，旁资六趣，遐及三涂。 圣泽所覃，幽明全济。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 太上黄箓斋仪卷之四十五竟 太上黄箓斋仪卷之四十六
