We have transgressed the prohibitions, disturbing the Dragon Spirits. Or by the clash of the Five Phases, the Four Destructive Forces have encroached. Strange dreams arise in confusion, and our dwelling knows no peace. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, offering repentance and seeking grace. We humbly pray that our transgressions be swept away, grievances be reconciled, the living and the dead be blessed with prosperity, and our kin be granted safety. May the Dragon Spirits return to their rightful places, and our lifespan and fortune be extended. May the Three Paths receive blessings, and all beings—moving and still—share in glory. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Three Luminaries**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Most Perfect and Great Saints of the Sun, Moon, and Stellar Palaces, the Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the divine spirits, violated the prohibitions, and defiled the Three Luminaries. Unaligned with the celestial cycles of stars, sun, and moon, we have accumulated faults, inviting misfortune and decline. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that the divine radiance shine upon us, dissolving ten thousand sins. May the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, the Dragon Spirits return to their posts, and our fortune and longevity be extended. May the dark gates be illuminated, and all beings—moving and still—flourish. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Five Peaks**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Perfected Lords of the Five Peaks, the Divine Immortals of the sacred mountains and grotto-heavens. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the divine spirits, transgressing the celestial prohibitions and earthly taboos under the jurisdiction of the Five Emperors and Five Peaks. Faults have accumulated, yet remain unforgiven. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that a single repentance erase our sins, and ten thousand virtues be fulfilled. May the offenses be dissolved, the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, misfortune be swept away, and our lifespan and fortune be extended. May the Dragon Spirits guard their posts, and all beings—moving and still—share in glory. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Water Realms**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley, the Water Emperors of the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the Nine Jiang, the Twelve River Sources, and the Divine Immortals of the Water Realms. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the divine spirits, harmed the water veins, and blocked the springs. We have violated the nature of supreme goodness, diminished the nurturing power below, slighted the Perfected Saints, and defiled the rivers. Faults have accumulated within the Water Realms, entangling us across generations, yet remaining unresolved. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that the august spirits look upon us with mercy, washing away our transgressions. May all offenses be dissolved, the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, misfortune be transcended, and our lifespan and fortune be extended. May the Dragon Spirits return to their posts, and all beings—moving and still—share in glory. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Sacred Scriptures**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Most Perfect and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Sacred Scriptures, the True Writs and Treasure Talismans, the Orthodox Teachings of the Three Caverns, the Ten Directions’ Secret Treasures, and all the divine officials who guard the scriptures. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the Perfected Spirits, defiled sacred grounds, or trespassed upon the traces of the Three Treasures, where the teachings have spread, and where divine officials and Perfected attendants reside—places unknown to the profane. Such transgressions have accumulated faults within the Treasury of the Three Treasures, yet remain unforgiven. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that the myriad sages illuminate our path, and the august ones grant us pardon. May all offenses be dissolved, blessings and goodness come forth, and our lifespan and fortune be enriched. May the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, all beings receive grace, the Dragon Spirits return to their posts, the Six Paths be aided, and the Three Paths be reached. May the sagely grace extend to all, both hidden and manifest, bringing complete deliverance. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

chunks.original_text: 唐广成先生杜光庭集 荷恩感瑞五段忏方 陛坛之时，或盛寒盛暑及风雨之变，恐失礼容，宜用此忏，以从简易。 先都唱十方总忏 臣等至心皈命十方无极太上灵宝天尊，已得道大圣众、至真诸君丈人，十乡神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 忏悔 臣等伏闻，变化无方，至道表随机之应； 精诚有感，灵真垂赴念之功。 妙矣重玄，潜回景贶。 宜申昭谢，以答垂休。 今皇帝以大道延慈，真仙鉴佑。 虔申斋洁，仰报玄恩。 奉修无上黄箓道场，三日三夜。 谨赍香花法信，油烛纹缯，皈命十方元极太上灵宝天尊，十极天君，十乡神仙诸灵官。 伏冀万圣倾光，三尊降鉴。 介休祥於宗庙，致延寿於皇图。 地广禹封，祚隆周卜。 皇帝道光轩燧，德迈羲融。 与曜魄以齐尊，共蓬壶而等寿。 后妃嫔御，光赞宸居。 太子诸王，辅宁大业。 华夷昭泰，亿兆欢康。 景纬循常，风雨调顺。 干戈不作，稼穑蕃登。 洎乎水陆飞沉，三涂六趣。 俱臻寿域，咸乐雍熙。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 三光 臣等至心皈命日月星宫至真大圣，三光神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 臣等伏闻二象分华，三光垂曜。 日宫月域，司暝晦而有常； 五纬六府，统照临而不素。 是彰罪福，以御人天。 今皇帝以大道垂休，神功感应。 思崇斋福，上答真灵。 至心皈命日月星宫至真大圣，三光神仙诸灵官。 伏觊大宥宣恩，无私表贶。 纳祯祥於帝阙，隆祚历於皇基。 超迈姬周，延洪炎汉。 皇帝廓升平之景化，辟尧禹之宏图。 寿等五山，德侔三古。 六宫百揆，常弘协赞之功； 八极九图，俱洽安贞之福。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 五岳 臣等至心皈命五岳真君，名山洞府、得道神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 臣等伏闻，九土斯分，五山作镇。 捧乾枢而上列，高拱星辰； 压坤轴以低临，旁罗川渎。 爰司善恶，以统死生。 今皇帝以大道垂休，神功应感。 思弘斋福，上答真灵。 至心皈命五岳真君，名山洞府，得道神仙诸灵官。 伏冀玄鉴遐通，洪休广被。 宗祧先圣，承景贶以登真； 社稷尊灵，洽殊祥於永祚。 皇帝明均两曜，寿等崇山。 超玄古以无为，统万方而咸化。 后妃嫔主，太子诸王，题丹箓之仙名，享清都之寿纪。 普天有识，率土含生。 徧及幽明，同臻福果。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 水府 臣等至心皈命扶桑大帝，旸谷神王，三河四海九江水帝，十二河源水府神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 臣等伏闻，三能既着，流巽海以无涯； 七善攸彰，习坎宫而斯广。 包吞万派，涵荡九天。 以统生灵，以司罪福。 今皇帝凝神三境，属想九清。 大道垂休，神功感应。 思弘斋福，以答真灵。 至心皈命扶桑大帝，旸谷神王，三河四海九江水帝，十二河源水府神仙诸灵官。 伏冀广辟殊祯，洪流景佑。 宗祧社稷，与八海以常宁，圣寿皇图，比十山而共固。 六宫妃后，百辟庶寮。 克茂忠贞，长承福祚。 青宫朱邸，内屏外藩。 俱弘道德之风，永洽升平之化。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 经宝 臣等至心皈命无上三十六部尊经，真文宝符。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 臣等伏闻，亿劫之前，至真弘化。 冲澹示无言之本，希夷成不宰之功。 洎乎二象肇胎，殊途是启。 八会之文既立，六体之用争驰。

**Compiled by Master Du Guangting of the Tang Dynasty**
**Fivefold Repentance Rite for Grace and Auspicious Signs**

When ascending the altar during extreme cold, intense heat, or inclement weather—lest one’s demeanor be deemed improper—this repentance rite may be employed for simplicity.

**First: General Repentance to the Ten Directions**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy** of the Ten Boundless Directions, the **Perfected Saints Who Have Attained the Dao**, the **Supreme Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms’ Immortal Hosts**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

**Repentance**
We humbly acknowledge that the **Dao/Way** transforms without limit, manifesting responses in accord with the moment; that sincerity evokes resonance, and the numinous Perfected bestow the merit of answering prayers. Profound indeed is the **Mystery upon Mystery**, subtly returning radiant blessings. We now offer solemn thanks to reciprocate this grace.

The Emperor, extending the **Great Dao** in compassion and receiving the protection of the **True Immortals**, devoutly presents purity and reverence to repay the **Mysterious Favor**. For three days and nights, we reverently conduct this **Supreme Yellow Register Daoist Altar**, offering incense, flowers, ritual gifts, oil lamps, and patterned silks. We take refuge in the **Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Primordial Ultimate**, the **Heavenly Lords of the Ten Poles**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms’ Immortal Hosts**.

May the **Myriad Saints** incline their radiance, and the **Three Venerables** descend their gaze. May auspicious blessings grace the ancestral temples, and longevity extend to the imperial domain. May the land expand beyond Yu’s borders, and the dynasty’s fortune surpass the Zhou’s divination. May the Emperor’s **Dao/Way** outshine the light of **Xuan Yuan** and **Fu Xi**, his virtue surpassing theirs. May he share equal honor with the sun and moon, and equal longevity with **Mount Penglai**. May the Empress, consorts, and concubines illuminate the imperial residence; may the Crown Prince and princes secure the great enterprise. May Hua and Yi alike flourish, and the myriad peoples rejoice in well-being. May celestial patterns remain constant, winds and rains harmonious. May weapons fall silent, and harvests abound. Extending to the denizens of water and land, the **Three Paths and Six Realms**, may all attain the realm of longevity and together delight in harmony. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Three Luminaries**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Perfected Great Saints of the Sun, Moon, and Star Palaces**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries’ Immortal Hosts**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Two Images** divided their splendor, and the **Three Luminaries** cast their radiance. The sun’s palace and moon’s domain govern day and night with constancy; the **Five Planets and Six Mansions** oversee illumination without fail. They manifest karmic consequences, governing humans and heavens. The Emperor, bestowing the **Great Dao’s** grace and invoking divine response through numinous merit, seeks to exalt the blessings of purity in repayment to the **True Spirits**. With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the **Perfected Great Saints of the Sun, Moon, and Star Palaces**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries’ Immortal Hosts**.

May boundless pardon and impartial favor be proclaimed. May auspicious omens fill the imperial palace, and the dynasty’s fortune endure. May it surpass the **Ji** and **Zhou**, and extend the glory of the **Han**. May the Emperor’s civilizing influence equal the **Ascendant Peace**, and his grand design rival **Yao** and **Yu**. May his lifespan match the **Five Peaks**, his virtue equal the **Three Antiquities**. May the six palaces and hundred ministers perpetually enhance his governance; may the eight frontiers and nine domains all enjoy stability and prosperity. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Five Peaks**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Perfected Immortals of the Famous Mountains and Grotto-Heavens**, and their **Divine Officials**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Nine Lands** are thus divided, and the **Five Peaks** stand as guardians. They uphold the **Pivot of Heaven** above, arrayed among the stars; they press upon the **Axis of Earth** below, encircling rivers and streams. They govern good and evil, overseeing life and death. The Emperor, bestowing the **Great Dao’s** grace and invoking divine response through numinous merit, seeks to magnify the blessings of purity in repayment to the **True Spirits**. With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Perfected Immortals of the Famous Mountains and Grotto-Heavens**, and their **Divine Officials**.

May their **Mysterious Gaze** extend afar, and their **Vast Grace** be universally bestowed. May the ancestral temples and former sages receive radiant blessings to ascend as Perfected; may the altars of soil and grain and their revered spirits enjoy enduring auspicious fortune. May the Emperor’s wisdom equal the **Two Luminaries**, his lifespan match the **Lofty Peaks**. May he surpass the **Mysterious Antiquity** in non-action, governing all directions with transformation. May the Empress, consorts, Crown Prince, and princes inscribe their names in the **Cinnabar Registers of Immortals**, enjoying the longevity of the **Pure Capital**. May all under heaven with awareness, and all within the realm with life, universally attain the fruits of blessing, both hidden and manifest. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Water Realms**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, the **Divine Officials of the Twelve River Sources’ Water Realms**, and their **Immortal Hosts**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Three Powers** are thus established, and the **Xun** winds flow into the boundless sea; that the **Seven Virtues** are manifest, and the **Kan** palace is vast. They embrace the myriad streams, cradling the **Nine Heavens**. They govern living beings and oversee karmic consequences. The Emperor, concentrating his spirit upon the **Three Realms** and directing his thoughts to the **Nine Purities**, invokes the **Great Dao’s** grace and divine response through numinous merit. Seeking to magnify the blessings of purity, he repays the **True Spirits**. With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, the **Divine Officials of the Twelve River Sources’ Water Realms**, and their **Immortal Hosts**.

May extraordinary auspices be widely bestowed, and vast currents bring radiant protection. May the ancestral temples and altars of soil and grain, together with the **Eight Seas**, remain eternally at peace; may the sacred longevity of the imperial domain stand as firm as the **Ten Mountains**. May the six palaces’ consorts and concubines, and the hundred officials, flourish in loyalty and integrity, perpetually receiving blessed fortune. May the Eastern Palace and princely residences, the inner screens and outer defenses, all propagate the **Wind of Dao and Virtue**, eternally enjoying the transformation of **Ascendant Peace**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Sacred Scriptures**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Thirty-Six Divisions of the Supreme Scriptures**, the **True Writs and Sacred Talismans**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that before the **Kalpas of Eons**, the **Supreme Perfected** propagated transformation. They revealed the **Root of Non-Speech** through tranquility, and accomplished the **Non-Governing** through subtlety. When the **Two Images** first took form, diverse paths emerged. The **Eight Assemblies’** texts were established, and the **Six Forms’** functions vied in application.

chunks.original_text: 唐广成先生杜光庭集 人臣为国五段忏悔 十方 臣等至心皈命十方无极太上灵宝天尊，已得道大圣众、至真诸君丈人，十乡神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏悔。 臣等伏闻，十极诸天，三千道域。 环拱太虚之内，包罗三界之庭。 运妙化於上玄，洒灵恩於下土。 洪惟景福，孚佑邦家。 今谨有奉修黄箓大斋某官，上为皇帝，按依玄格，敷列皇坛。 请福希恩，修斋行道。 谨赍香花龙彩、质信效心，皈命十方无极太上灵宝天尊，已得道大圣众、至真诸君丈人，十乡神仙诸灵官。 今故立斋，烧香然灯，朗耀诸天。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊灵、宗祧先圣。 九光鹤盖，登三境以逍遥； 八羽龙轩，游十天而放旷。 洪流巨福，密佑圣图。 皇帝体道凝旒，仪乾布化。 御飞龙而抚物，岳固宏基； 执大象以承天，山齐圣寿。 后妃嫔主，柔赞帝谟。 太子诸王，孝扶宸极。 公卿文武，中外职寮。 畅和平道德之风，成礼乐雍熙之理。 时调五烛，岁稔琼储。 百揆有伦，五兵常戢。 龙神警卫，疫毒销沉。 四灵效瑞以来仪，七正循常而合度。 洎诸幽显，普及飞潜。 咸承抚御之仁，并契华胥之俗。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 三光 臣等至心皈命日月星宫至真大圣，三光神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏谢。 臣等伏闻，天地分灵，阴阳构象。 显日月星辰之位，定昏明隐见之殊。 七政三宫，允执死生之要一，文昌斗极，仍司罪福之权。 宜罄修崇，以资邦国。 今谨有奉修黄箓大斋某官，上为皇帝，赍持法信。 敷列坛场，请福希恩。 修斋行道，皈命日月星宫至真大圣，三光神仙诸灵官。 今故立斋，烧香然灯，朗耀诸天。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊灵、宗祧先圣。 霓幢羽旆，超升南极之宫； 证通冲真，游宴上清之境。 潜贻巨贶，孚佑皇基。 皇帝曜魄齐尊，玄枢荐寿。 御帝车而布政，握璇轴以调时。 皇后嫔妃，耀贞规於女使； 诸王太子，浚灵派於星津。 宰辅忠贞，藩垣辑睦。 永熙百度，以泰万方。 宾声教以骏奔，奉琛琦而麋至。 三光有序，五纬无愆。 岁叶丰登，俗臻康乐。 飞沉动植，含识有情。 普及幽明，同升寿域。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 五岳 臣等至心皈命五岳真君，飞仙真人，名山洞府得道神仙诸灵官。 三礼，各虔诚忏悔。 臣等伏闻，混沌既辟，群岳裁形。 捧碧落以上征，压黄舆而下镇。 大则长离广野，舍海外之烟霞； 次则衡华云亭，总寰中之秀异。 神仙所宅，邦国是依。 式陈焚祝之仪，以广休明之福。 今谨有奉修黄箓大斋某官，上为皇帝赍持法信，敷列坛场。 请福希恩，修斋行道。 皈命五岳真君，飞仙真人，名山洞府、得道神仙诸灵官。 今故立斋，烧香然灯，玄耀诸天。 愿以是功德，归流社稷尊灵、宗祧先圣。 超七域阶修之果，证三天飞举之功。 莹神流火之庭，御景明霞之殿。 永隆鸿福，钦赞龙图。 皇帝五岳齐宁，三山比寿。 明尧天之日月，辟禹迹之封疆。 俭德迈於焚裘，仁煦逾於解网。 后妃嫔御，匡翼紫宸。 太子诸王，敷弘景化。 公卿辅弼，宣至道以无为； 亿兆华夷，乐太平而遂性。 天光澄正，地纪竟闲。 九稼惟丰，五兵常戢。 幽扃夜府，异品殊伦。 咸承妙道之慈，尽契长生之域。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。

**Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting**
**Fivefold Confession of Ministers Serving the State**

**The Ten Directions**
We, your ministers, wholeheartedly take refuge in the **Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy** of the Ten Directions, the **Perfected Great Sages** who have attained the Dao, the **Most Real Lords and Elders**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms**. With three bows, we each sincerely confess and repent.

We have heard that the **Ten Poles of the Heavens** and the **Three Thousand Dao Realms** encircle the Great Void within, encompassing the courts of the **Three Realms**. They manifest wondrous transformation in the **Upper Mystery** and bestow numinous grace upon the **Lower Lands**. How vast is this radiant fortune, faithfully protecting the state and its households!

Today, we humbly offer the **Great Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [such-and-such] official, dedicating it to the Emperor. Following the **Mysterious Pattern**, we array the imperial altar, beseeching blessings and grace, performing the fast and practicing the Dao. With reverence, we present incense, flowers, dragon-brocade offerings, and pledges of sincerity, taking refuge in the **Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy** of the Ten Directions, the **Perfected Great Sages** who have attained the Dao, the **Most Real Lords and Elders**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms**. Now, we establish this fast, burning incense and kindling lamps to brightly illuminate the myriad heavens.

May these merits flow to the **August Spirits of the Altars of Soil and Grain**, the **Ancestral Shrines**, and the **Former Sages**. May the **Nine Radiant Cranes and Canopies** ascend to the **Three Realms** in carefree wandering; may the **Eight-Feathered Dragon Chariots** roam the **Ten Heavens** in boundless freedom. May vast blessings and mighty fortune secretly protect the **Sacred Chart**. May the Emperor embody the Dao and concentrate his regalia, his virtue like Heaven spreading transformation. Riding the **Flying Dragon** to govern all things, may the mountains solidify his grand foundation; wielding the **Great Image** to uphold Heaven, may his sacred longevity equal the peaks.

May the Empress, consorts, and princesses gently assist in the imperial plans. May the Crown Prince and the various princes filially support the imperial throne. May the civil and military officials, both central and regional, propagate the winds of **Peace and Dao-Virtue**, perfecting the principles of **Ritual and Music in Harmonious Prosperity**. May the seasons regulate the **Five Candles**, and the years yield **Jade-like Stores**. May the **Hundred Offices** follow their proper order, and the **Five Armies** remain ever at rest. May the **Dragon Spirits** stand guard, and pestilence and poison dissolve. May the **Four Numinous Beasts** present auspicious omens, and the **Seven Regulators** follow their constant courses in perfect measure.

Extending to all—whether hidden or manifest, flying or submerged—may all receive the benevolence of his governance and together emulate the customs of **Huaxu**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Three Luminaries**
We, your ministers, wholeheartedly take refuge in the **Most Real Great Sages** of the **Palaces of the Sun, Moon, and Stars**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries**. With three bows, we each sincerely confess and give thanks.

We have heard that when Heaven and Earth divided their numina, Yin and Yang formed their images. The positions of the **Sun, Moon, and Stars** were established, determining the distinctions of dusk and dawn, concealment and visibility. The **Seven Governors and Three Palaces** faithfully hold the essentials of life and death; the **Wenchang and Dipper Poles** still wield the authority over sin and fortune. It is fitting to exhaust our reverence in cultivation to aid the state and nation.

Today, we humbly offer the **Great Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [such-and-such] official, dedicating it to the Emperor, presenting ritual pledges. We array the altar, beseeching blessings and grace, performing the fast and practicing the Dao, taking refuge in the **Most Real Great Sages** of the **Palaces of the Sun, Moon, and Stars**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries**. Now, we establish this fast, burning incense and kindling lamps to brightly illuminate the myriad heavens.

May these merits flow to the **August Spirits of the Altars of Soil and Grain**, the **Ancestral Shrines**, and the **Former Sages**. May **Rainbow Banners and Feathered Streamers** transcend to the **Palace of the Southern Culmen**; may they **Verify and Penetrate the Mysterious Real**, roaming and feasting in the **Upper Clarity**. May hidden blessings and mighty gifts faithfully protect the imperial foundation.

May the Emperor’s luminous spirit equal the honored, his **Mysterious Pivot** prolonging his years. Riding the **Imperial Chariot** to administer governance, may he grasp the **Jade Axle** to regulate the seasons. May the Empress and consorts illuminate the **Virtuous Standards** among the women’s quarters; may the various princes and the Crown Prince deepen the **Numinous Streams** at the **Starry Ford**. May the chief ministers remain loyal and steadfast, the **Fiefdom Walls** harmonious and peaceful. May the **Hundred Institutions** forever flourish, bringing peace to the **Myriad Regions**. May they swiftly spread the **Virtuous Teachings** and receive **Tribute of Gems** in abundance. May the **Three Luminaries** maintain their order, the **Five Wefts** commit no errors. May the years yield **Bountiful Harvests**, and the people attain **Health and Joy**.

Extending to all—whether flying or submerged, sentient or insentient—may all, whether hidden or manifest, together ascend to the **Realm of Longevity**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Five Peaks**
We, your ministers, wholeheartedly take refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Flying Immortals**, the **Perfected**, and the **Divine Officials of the Named Mountains and Grotto-Heavens** who have attained the Dao. With three bows, we each sincerely confess and repent.

We have heard that when **Hundun** was split open, the **Myriad Peaks** took shape. They support the **Azure Vault** in their ascent and press down upon the **Yellow Chariot** in their descent. The greatest, like **Changli**, stretch across vast wilds, housing the mists and clouds beyond the seas; the next, like **Heng and Hua**, tower as cloud-pavilions, gathering the finest essences of the world. They are the abodes of **Immortals** and the reliance of states and nations. We now present the rites of **Incense and Prayer** to broaden the blessings of **Radiant Fortune**.

Today, we humbly offer the **Great Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [such-and-such] official, dedicating it to the Emperor, presenting ritual pledges and arraying the altar. Beseeching blessings and grace, we perform the fast and practice the Dao, taking refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Flying Immortals**, the **Perfected**, and the **Divine Officials of the Named Mountains and Grotto-Heavens** who have attained the Dao. Now, we establish this fast, burning incense and kindling lamps to mystically illuminate the myriad heavens.

May these merits flow to the **August Spirits of the Altars of Soil and Grain**, the **Ancestral Shrines**, and the **Former Sages**. May they transcend the fruits of the **Seven Stages of Cultivation** and verify the **Flying Ascent of the Three Heavens**. May they refine their spirits in the **Courts of Flowing Fire** and ride the **Palaces of Radiant Clouds**.

May boundless fortune forever flourish, reverently aiding the **Dragon Chart**. May the Emperor’s **Five Peaks** be equally tranquil, his longevity matching the **Three Isles**. May his brightness rival the **Sun and Moon of Yao’s Heaven**, and his domain expand the **Frontiers of Yu’s Realm**. May his **Frugal Virtue** surpass that of **Fenqiu**, and his **Benevolent Warmth** exceed that of **Jie’s Net**. May the Empress, consorts, and attendants assist the **Purple Throne**. May the Crown Prince and the various princes propagate the **Radiant Transformation**. May the ministers and officials proclaim the **Supreme Dao in Non-Action**; may the **Myriad Peoples of Hua and Yi** delight in **Great Peace** and fulfill their natures.

May the **Heavenly Lights** be clear and upright, the **Earthly Records** entirely at rest. May the **Nine Grains** be ever abundant, the **Five Armies** forever at rest. Whether in the **Hidden Gates of Night** or among **Exotic Beings of Distinct Kinds**, may all receive the compassion of the **Wondrous Dao** and fully enter the **Realm of Longevity**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

To the **Water Realms**, we, your servants, wholeheartedly prostrate and submit to the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, and the **Twelve River Sources**, along with the **Divine Immortals and Spirit Officials of the Water Realms**. With triple reverence, we each offer sincere repentance and gratitude.

We humbly acknowledge that, embodying the **Dao** and drawing upon the numinous, the **power of Water** is indeed paramount. Receiving the **Primordial Yang** to nurture and transform, it pervades all forms; originating from the **First Qi** to generate and complete, it encompasses all beings. Thus, the **Nine Seas and Eight Oceans** display the majesty of floating heaven and nourishing the sun; even a single leaf or slender stem bears the grace of moistening blessings and bestowed glory. Through its **mysterious merit and wondrous efficacy**, it brings fortune to the state and the household.

Today, we reverently conduct the **Grand Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [Title] the Emperor, adhering to the **mystic rites** and establishing the **imperial altar**. We beseech blessings and grace, performing the fast and practicing the **Dao**. We prostrate and submit to the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, and the **Twelve River Sources**, along with the **Divine Immortals and Spirit Officials of the Water Realms**. For this fast, we now kindle incense and light lamps, illuminating all heavens.

May these **merits and virtues** flow to the **august spirits of the altars and temples**, the **ancestral sages of the imperial lineage**, who wander the boundless and unite with the **subtle and formless**. May they receive **secret instructions** on the **Mystic Continent** and obtain the **divine pearl** from the **Red Waters**.

May the Emperor’s **azure waves bestow fortune**, and the **blue seas grant equal years**. May all regions rejoice in the **vast and boundless grace**, and the **ten thousand states** follow the **tributary currents**. May the Empress, consorts, and attendants spread **sagely favor** within the **Jade Palace**; may the Crown Prince and the various princes dredge the **source of the Silver River**. May the ministers and officials, both civil and military, extend the **nurturing and embellishing principles**, and broaden the **serene and clarifying transformation**. May the **Nine Rivers** offer strategies, and the **Warm Luo** reveal its chart. May Heaven and Earth manifest auspicious signs, and the **black-haired people** receive blessings. May all beings, near and far, even those in the **hidden depths**, together attain the **wind of virtue and Dao**, and forever enjoy the **gift of peace and stability**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

---

To the **Scriptures**, we, your servants, wholeheartedly prostrate and submit to the **Most True and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures**, the **True Writ and Treasure Talismans**. With triple reverence, we each offer sincere repentance and gratitude.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Dao in Non-Action** is the root, and the **true lineage** is emptiness and quiescence. Its **wondrous nourishment** is wordless, its **subtle and imperceptible** nature beyond measure. Thus, it initiates the **vast and expansive teaching**, revealing the **secret and profound merit**. Here, the **Eight Assemblies of Numinous Writ** and the **Nine-Ray Cloud Script** take form: dragons coil and phoenixes dance, first congealing within the **Great Vastness**; jade tablets and jasper scrolls are then inscribed within the **layered terraces**. The **thirty-six divisions** are vast, and the **myriad thousands of categories** are numerous. **Compiled by Master Du Guangting of the Tang Dynasty: Methods for Expiation and Repentance**
**General Repentance**

We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so, who follows the rites of expiation and examination, conducts the fast, and practices the Dao, repenting for the boundless transgressions committed by thirty-six generations of ancestors, from the myriad past forebears to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These offenses, accumulated through the ages, have:

**Offended above** the great sages of the myriad heavens, the host of honored ones of the Great Dao, the Three Luminaries and Five Phases, the deities governing the void, wind, clouds, thunder, and rain.
**Offended below** the Five Marchmounts and all mountains, the thirty-six earthly realms, the mounds and water palaces, and the underworld officials.
**Offended within** the Eight Trigrams and Nine Palaces, the yin-yang bureaus, the ancient and modern numinous sages, and the worthies of former ages.

They have violated the Five Constants and transgressed against the Four Great Elements. Their names are inscribed in the ledgers of sin, and calamities are bound at the gates of darkness. Their lifespans were cut short, failing to fulfill Heaven’s allotted span. After their bodies perished, they remained detained in the earthly courts, confined as suffering souls in the deepest prisons. They have endured every torment, undergone every trial, shuttled through the Three Wretched Paths, and drifted through the Five Destinies. Subjected to cruel punishments and exhausting labors, their forms are broken and emaciated beyond endurance. Their offenses and misfortunes linger unending, with no hope of absolution.

Today, in accordance with the ranks of the transcendent immortals, we repent our sins and seek mercy. We burn incense, light lamps, conduct the fast, and practice the Dao, surrendering our lives to the Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Ten Directions, the perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the true lords and venerable ones, and the divine officials of the ten celestial realms.

We humbly implore the Three Honored Ones and the great sages of the myriad heavens to open the fount of great compassion and bestow boundless grace. May they command the flying celestial beings to bear the Nine Dragon Talismanic Decrees, proclaiming to the courts of the Ten Directions and the officials of the underworld hells: absolve the boundless sins accumulated through the ages. Open the Nine Dark Hells and release the souls of the long night. Bathe them in the Crimson Mound’s courts, clothe them in the regalia of the Cavernous Yang’s precincts. May they be reborn in the blessed realms of the divine, and may blessings flow to their descendants. May auspicious protection ever attend them, and may the living and the dead alike find peace. May this uphold the nation’s fortune and extend to all beings. May all attain the mysterious bliss and forever ascend to the true ranks. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**East**
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so, who conducts the great fast of expiation and examination, recites the scriptures, and practices the Dao, surrendering our lives to the Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the eastern celestial realm. We repent for the boundless transgressions committed by so-and-so’s thirty-six generations of ancestors, from the myriad past forebears to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These sins, accumulated through the ages, include:

Acts contrary to kindness and nurturance, lacking benevolence and humanity; disloyalty to lords and teachers, failing in filial piety; harming the good and upright, offending the divine; violating the Five Constants and indulging in all manner of evil; curses and malevolent prayers, killing the innocent. Their punishments are severe, their calamities profound, yet they have not received absolution. Their souls are seized and beaten, confined in the Wood Bureau’s Eastern Marchmount’s pounding hell, suffering the torments of sword trees, blade mountains, wind, and thunder. Day and night, they endure excruciating trials beyond endurance. Their misfortunes afflict their descendants, and their woes flow endlessly to later generations. In the endless dark of night, there is no means of deliverance.

Today, we repent, seek mercy, conduct the fast, and practice the Dao. We humbly implore the great compassion to show mercy, and the myriad sages to turn their radiance toward us. May they proclaim to the courts of the Eastern Bureau and the officials of the underworld: untangle the knots of enmity, absolve the souls of their sins. May they be entrusted to the courts of blessings, ascend to the pure realms. May the living enjoy peace and prosperity, forever bearing the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**South**
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so, who conducts the supreme wondrous fast of expiation and examination, recites the scriptures, and practices the Dao, surrendering our lives to the Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the South, the Three Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the southern celestial realm. We repent for the boundless transgressions committed by so-and-so’s thirty-six generations of ancestors, from the myriad past forebears to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These sins, accumulated through the ages, include:

Following cruel impulses to kill the innocent; making vows and pacts to inflict harm upon beings; lewd and improper conduct, oppressing the chaste and good; transgressing rites and decorum, indulging in evil deeds; offending Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, and all divine beings. Their punishments are severe, their calamities profound, yet they have not received absolution. Their souls are seized and beaten, confined in the Fire Bureau’s Southern Marchmount’s pounding hell, suffering the torments of furnace and charcoal, their forms burned and broken. Day and night, they endure excruciating trials beyond endurance. Their misfortunes afflict their descendants, flowing endlessly onward. In the endless dark of night, there is no means of deliverance.

Today, we repent, seek mercy, conduct the fast, and practice the Dao. We humbly hope the Three Honored Ones will look upon us with mercy, and the host of sages will cast their radiance upon us. May they proclaim to the Fire Bureau’s Southern Marchmount’s pounding hell: absolve the accumulated sins, pardon the souls of the dark. May they emerge from the Huo Mountain hells and ascend to the Crimson Cavern’s Yang Palace. May the living receive protection, forever bearing the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

chunks.original_text: 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙奉修无上解考妙斋，转经行道，皈命西方无极太上灵宝天尊，七炁天君，西乡神仙诸灵官。 忏悔某三十六世以来，亿曾万祖，爰及亡灵、眷属亲缘，生世所行，无边之罪。 或不行义让，谄佞无端。 嫉妬贤能，浊乱神道。 酷虐无度，杀戮任心。 负誓违盟，魇蛊谋议。 殃罪结固，积若丘山。 责重考深，未蒙原解。 魂神执系，在金官华山地狱之中，受铜柱铁床金锤之考。 昼夜毒痛，食息无宁。 注讼生人，缠绵未解。 冥冥长夜，解脱无由。 以今行道结斋，祈恩忏拔。 伏觊天尊慈佑，大道回光。 赐告西府之中，考官门下，解除殃注，迁拔魂神。 受福天堂，生神仙界。 幽明咸泰，永荷玄恩。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 北方 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙奉修无上解考妙斋，转经行道，皈命北方无极太上灵宝天尊，五炁天君，北方神仙诸灵官。 忏悔某乙三十六代以来、亿曾万祖，爰及亡灵、眷属亲缘，生世所行，无边之罪。 或上违天道，下犯地司。 秽触三光，轻凌四大。 怨恚风雨，牵引鬼神。 肆毒於人，残害於物。 魂神执对，在水宫恒山地狱之中，受寒冰夜庭冰河之苦。 肌肉冻裂，万痛切身。 延注子孙，流殃未已。 冥冥长夜，解拔无由。 以今行道立斋，祈恩谢过。 伏冀诸天鉴护，万圣垂恩。 勑告北府之中，考官门下。 赦除罪咎，迁拔苦魂。 出长夜寒庭，离三涂五苦。 升神净域，福佑见存。 族眷安宁，存亡俱泰。 蒙如所愿，仰荷玄恩。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 东北方 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙奉修无上解考妙斋，转经行道，皈命东北方无极太上灵宝天尊，梵炁天君，东北方神仙诸灵官。 忏悔某三十六世以来，亿曾万祖，爰及亡灵、眷属亲绿，生世所行，无边之罪。 或为子不孝，为臣不忠，为父不慈，为君不道。 妬贤嫉善，背正崇邪。 口是心非，自欺形影。 五逆徧造，众恶备行。 枉害无辜，伤杀非理。 从生入死，怨彻天灵。 咒诅神明，魇害巫蛊。 殃深责重，幽击在地府刑捣狱中。 考掠万般，形魂毁瘁。 冥冥长夜，解拔无由。 以今忏罪乞恩，修斋行道。 伏觊十天降宥，万圣开恩。 勑告东北方刑捣狱中，考官门下。 解除罪对，原赦穷魂。 离幽闭之乡，出重槛之苦。 浴神丹霍，腾景朱陵。 注讼永除，子孙宁泰。 蒙如所启，仰荷玄恩。 得道之后，升入无形。 和与道合真。 东南方 臣等今故烧香，归身归神归命，奉为某乙奉修无上解考妙斋，转经行道，皈命东南方无极太上灵宝天尊，梵炁天君，东南乡神仙诸灵官。 忏悔某家亿曾万祖，爰及亡灵、眷属亲缘，及三十六世以来，生世所行，无边之罪。 或恣为强暴，凌虐於人。 轻侮孤穷，憎嫌老病。 彰人之恶，掩人善功。 斗乱亲疏，抑伏贫弱。 图谋非道，讪谤贤良。 破人成功，嫉人胜己。 伤杀非理，纵毒任心。 引天地日月星辰，以为质证。 罪深责重，魂系地府考官狱中。 水火风刀，昼夜考掠。 更相注逮，解拔无由。 以今忏谢乞恩，修斋行道。 伏冀十方大圣、五帝高尊，勑告东南方刑捣狱中，考官门下。 拔赎幽爽，盥沐形魂。 万罪蠲销，宿殃除荡。 冤仇解释，债讼和平。 福利见存，神生善域。

Retribution remains unfulfilled, calamity deepens, and punishment grows heavier. Now, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we repent and uproot the roots of sin. We prostrate ourselves, beseeching the august assembly of saints to open their mercy and grant pardon. We implore the underworld officials of Fengdu, the Nine Dark Prisons, and the halls of judgment to absolve the boundless karmic causes of past kalpas. May the destitute souls be delivered, freed from the depths of darkness, to roam the true realms and dwell in the land of blessings. May descendants enjoy peace and prosperity, and may the living and the dead alike find serenity. Should our plea be granted, we shall reverently bear the profound grace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

The Three Luminaries:

We take refuge in the palaces of the sun, moon, and stars, the perfected and great sages, the divine immortals and all spirit-officials of the Three Luminaries. We repent for the boundless sins of so-and-so’s family—across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. They may have been unrighteous rulers, disloyal ministers, unkind fathers, or unfilial sons. They violated the celestial patterns and earthly principles, as well as the sun, moon, and stars, accumulating deep stains of evil. Their hidden sins and manifest transgressions were inscribed in the ledgers of wickedness. Upon death, their souls were seized by ghostly officials and confined in the eternal night’s halls of judgment. Beaten and bound in heavy fetters, they had no means of expiation. Now, through repentance and the seeking of grace, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we prostrate ourselves, hoping the great sages of the heavens and the august assembly of the Three Luminaries will command the underworld prisons and halls of judgment to absolve their accumulated sins and reconcile their enmities. May their debts and disputes be settled, and may the living and the dead find peace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

The Five Peaks:
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this supreme and wondrous fast for the liberation of so-and-so, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We repent for the boundless sins of so-and-so’s family—across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. We implore the officials of the Five Peaks’ prisons and halls of judgment to dissolve their enmities, wash away their sins, and eradicate all evil. The Sacred Scriptures:

They may have slighted or desecrated texts, defiled sacred writs, slandered the holy scriptures, or leaked secret texts. Their calamities coiled endlessly, never repented. Their souls were seized and beaten, confined in the Nine Dark Prisons. They endured torture and were bound in dark fetters. Through the eternal night, they had no means of deliverance. Now, through repentance and the seeking of grace, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we prostrate ourselves, hoping the spirit-officials will memorialize the throne and extend their merciful blessings. We implore the officials of the underworld prisons and halls of judgment to dissolve their karmic retributions and reconcile their enmities. May they transcend the gates of the Yellow Springs and ascend the path of blessings. May their descendants be secure and prosperous, and may the Nine Nights and Three Paths alike receive radiant protection. Should our plea be granted, we shall reverently bear the profound grace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

*Concluding the forty-eighth scroll of the* **Ritual of the Yellow Register Fast of the Most High**.

chunks.original_text: 太上黄箓斋仪卷之四十九 唐广成先生杜光庭删 言功拜表 修斋日数既毕，或用其日子时，或明日清旦。 众官相率列位於玄师前，立班讫 唱道 入户 各礼师，存念如法 卫灵 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾， 木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 □ 镇星四据，家国利亨。 刊名玉简， 录字帝房。 乘飙扇景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方，五云覆盖， 招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙翁。 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上三天玄元始三炁太上道君，召出臣身中三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十二人出。 出者，严装关启玄坛天帝神君，当召此间土地里域、真官正神急上关启。 臣今奉为入意以今正尔烧香，愿得玉清道炁灵宝妙光下降，流,入臣等身中。 即使玄坛清净，内外成真。 天无氛秽，地绝妖尘。 琳琅振响，十方肃清。 万魔不干，真诚上彻。 令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道至真玉皇上帝御前。 各称法位 上清玄都大洞三景弟子，奉行黄箓大斋，言功拜表，设醮投龙，还宫法事。 臣某等今故烧香，愿以是功德，上为宗庙先灵、今朝皇帝、文武官属、卿辅庶寮，及弟子某九世七玄、见存眷属，臣等三师九祖、天下之人、一切众生、幽途暗爽，归身归神归命，十方无极太上灵宝天尊。 乞原赦前代今生，生死重罪，免离三恶之道，十苦八难九厄之中。 身得道真，飞行虚空。 白日升天，待卫道君。 逍遥无上金阙七宝自然宫殿，永与道合。 所启玄感，上御至真无极道前。 礼十方 忏悔
chunks.translated_text:
**Forty-Ninth Scroll of the Ritual of the Yellow Register Fast of the Most High**
*Edited by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting*

**Reporting Merits and Presenting Memorials**

When the days of the fast are complete, either at midnight of the final day or at dawn the following morning, the assembled officials shall arrange themselves in ranks before the Mystic Master. Once the formation is set, they shall chant the *Dao* and enter the chamber. Each shall bow to the Master, maintaining visualization as prescribed.

**Invocation of the Five Stars’ Protective Radiance**
The Five Stars array their illumination, resplendent across the five directions.
The Water Star averts calamity,
The Wood Power brings prosperity.
Mars dispels misfortune,
Venus repels warfare.
[Missing character] The Earth Star’s fourfold governance ensures the state’s flourishing.
Inscribed upon jade tablets, names recorded in the Celestial Palace,
They ride the whirlwind, wielding light, soaring through the Great Void.
Emerging from and entering the unseen, they wander and feast in the ten directions.
Five-colored clouds overspread them, summoning spirits and commanding winds.
They dispatch the myriad numina, upholding the Transcendent Elder above.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

O Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, First Three *Qi*, Supreme Dao Lord, we summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Two Fragrant Officials of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Register for this day. Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn vestments, to open the gates of the Mystic Altar’s Celestial Thearchs. Let the local earth gods and territorial true officials swiftly ascend to receive this summons.

We now reverently offer incense on behalf of the petitioner’s intent, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into our bodies. May the Mystic Altar be purified, within and without, to attain perfection. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth purged of demonic dust. May the jade chimes resound, the ten directions grow hushed and clear. May the myriad demons not intrude, and our sincerity ascend unobstructed. May our plea swiftly reach the presence of the Most High, Boundless, Perfect, and True Jade Emperor of the Supreme Dao.

**Each declares their dharma rank:**
Disciples of the Three Luminaries of the Great Cavern of the Mystic Capital, conducting the Great Yellow Register Fast, reporting merits and presenting memorials, performing the rite of offering and casting the dragon tablets, and concluding the return-to-palace liturgy.

We now burn incense, dedicating these merits above for the ancestral spirits of the imperial ancestral temple, the reigning emperor, the civil and military officials, the ministers and all functionaries, as well as for the petitioner’s nine generations and seven degrees of kin, living family members, our own three masters and nine ancestors, all people under heaven, every sentient being, and those lost in the dark paths of the unseen realms. We surrender body, spirit, and destiny to the Ten Directions’ Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy.

We beseech forgiveness for the heavy sins of past lives and this existence, deliverance from the Three Evil Paths, and relief from the ten sufferings, eight adversities, and nine calamities. May our bodies attain the true Dao and traverse the empty sky. May we ascend to heaven in broad daylight, awaiting attendance upon the Dao Lord. May we roam freely in the Supreme Golden Palaces of the Seven Treasures’ spontaneous halls, forever harmonizing with the Dao.

May our mystical entreaty ascend before the Perfect and Boundless True Dao.

**Homage to the Ten Directions**
**Confession of Transgressions**

chunks.original_text: 三启颂 乐法以为妻，爱经如珠玉。 持戒制六情，念道遣所欲。 淡泊正气停，萧然神静默。 天魔并敬护，世世受大福。 郁郁家国盛，济济经道兴。 天人同其愿，缥缈天大乘。 因心立福田，靡靡法轮升。 七祖生天堂，我身白日腾。 大道洞玄虚，有念无不契。 炼质入仙真，遂成金刚体。 超度三界难，地狱五苦解。 悉归太上经，静念稽首礼。 三礼 至心稽首礼，太上无极大道。 至心稽首礼，三十六部尊经。 至心稽道礼，玄中大法师。 旋行，收真文，从东南西北中方，各於本方案上，炷香，熏真文。 众官齐声宣真文毕、令弟子执真文於香上熏之。 法师叩齿十二通，咒曰 元始上天，三光高明。 回景照耀，四方朗清。 运度所冲，激阳流星。 五分错越，三统失宁。 五斗总辰，七宿明灵。 真君大魁，厥讳玉精。 夫人皇妃，字曰育婴。 总御玄关，回转诸天。 今有某灾，玄告不祥。 请以真文，赤书上呈。 散发谢愆，披露丹诚。 乞垂玄鉴，回复天经。 气不横越，灾不横生。 焚烧灵文，散烟玉庭。 上景监度，普告万灵。 气清三关，灾灭九冥。 阴阳调和，国土太平。 请以金龙，风火驿传。 此咒出赤书玉诀，若三元八节，常修黄箓及迁拔等，即书岁星辅肝等文，当用此咒。 如或禳制鬼疫，即书东山神咒，文别有咒。 或禳百六洪灾，即书下制东河文。 如学士修身，即书东方九炁等。 若有星宿失度及九曜为灾，即依此咒矣。 玉诀云：凡有祈禳，不先叩齿而咒者，为外魔所干，关启无感矣。 又云，若灾星在东，露文九日，金龙镇之。 西七、南三、北五、中十二日，皆随大道气数也。 灾星东方，谓在角亢七宿也。 他可知焉。 毕以此真文，随表焚之。
chunks.translated_text:
**Threefold Invocation Hymn**

The Law is my beloved wife,
the scriptures treasured as jade bright.
Holding fast the precepts, I restrain the six passions;
mindful of the Dao, I cast aside all desire.
Serene and pure, my upright qi abides;
tranquil and still, my spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and guard me,
life after life I receive boundless fortune.
My household and kingdom flourish in abundance,
the scriptures and Dao thrive in majestic splendor.
Heaven and humankind share this one aspiration,
soaring aloft in the vastness of the Great Vehicle.
From the heart I establish my field of merit,
as the Wheel of Dharma ascends in gentle ascent.
My seven ancestors ascend to the heavenly halls,
while my own body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the mysterious void—
with thought, nothing fails to align.
Refining my form, I enter the immortal truth,
and attain the adamantine body.
I transcend the trials of the Three Realms,
the five torments of hell are released.
All return to the scriptures of the Most High;
in silent contemplation, I bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
With utmost sincerity, I bow in reverence to the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High.
With utmost sincerity, I bow in reverence to the thirty-six revered scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, I bow in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Ritual Circumambulation**
Gathering the true writ, from the east, south, west, north, and center, each at their respective altars, incense is lit to fumigate the true writ. All officials chant the true writ in unison, and the disciple holds the true writ over the incense to fumigate it.

The Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and recites the incantation:
*"Primordial Beginning of the Upper Heavens,
the Three Luminaries shine in lofty brilliance.
Turning light to illuminate,
the four directions gleam in clarity.
Guiding the flow of destiny,
sparking yang like streaming stars.
The five phases clash in discord,
the three constellations lose their peace.
The Five Celestial Palaces gather the stars,
the Seven Luminaries radiate their numen.
True Lord, Great Chief,
whose hidden name is Jade Essence.
The Lady, Heavenly Consort,
is called Nurturer of Infants.
Together they govern the Mysterious Pass,
revolving all heavens.
Now, with certain calamities,
ominous portents have been mystically revealed.
I present this true writ,
inscribed in red, to ascend above.
Disheveling my hair, I confess my transgressions,
baring my crimson sincerity.
I beseech your mysterious scrutiny,
to restore the celestial scriptures.
Let qi not flow amiss,
let disasters not arise untimely.
Burning the sacred writ,
its smoke scatters in the Jade Court.
The Upper Radiance oversees and delivers,
proclaiming to the myriad spirits.
Qi purifies the Three Passes,
disasters vanish in the Nine Nether realms.
Yin and yang harmonize,
the land enjoys great peace.
I entreat the Golden Dragon,
to swiftly transmit this by wind and fire."*

This incantation derives from the *Red Writ of Jade Secrets*. During the Three Primes and Eight Festivals, when performing the Yellow Register rites or rituals of deliverance, inscribe the text of the Year Star’s assistance to the liver, and use this incantation. If exorcising demonic epidemics, inscribe the Eastern Mountain Divine Incantation, which has its own separate incantation. To avert the hundred-and-six great calamities, inscribe the text to subdue the Eastern River. For scholars cultivating the self, inscribe the Nine Qi of the East. If stars or constellations stray from their courses and the Nine Luminaries bring disaster, follow this incantation.

The *Jade Secrets* state: *"In all prayers and exorcisms, if one does not first strike the teeth before reciting the incantation, external demons will intrude, and the gates of response will remain unopened."* It further states: *"If the baleful star is in the east, expose the writ for nine days, and the Golden Dragon will pacify it. For seven days in the west, three in the south, five in the north, and twelve in the center—all follow the qi and numerology of the Great Dao. The baleful star in the east refers to its presence among the Horn and Neck constellations; the rest may be inferred accordingly."* Conclude by burning this true writ along with the memorial.

Amidst the dispersing azure smoke of incense.

Upon the conclusion of the incantation, all officials bow again, each following this precedent.

Solemnly invoking their dharma-positions, the disciples of the Upper Clarity and Mystic Capital, your servants [Name] and others, reverently and repeatedly address the Most High, Boundless, and Great Dao—the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin; the Most High Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the Supreme Mystic Elder; the Ten Directions’ Numinous Treasure Celestial Venerables; the Great Sage Assemblies who have attained the Dao; the Perfected Lords and Masters; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Center; the Celestial Master Lord; the Supreme Ministers and Prime Councilors; the Four Offices and Five Emperors; the Eastern Marchmount’s Minister of Fate and True Lord of Life; the Western Ultimate’s Sovereign of All Perfected Ones; the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lower Teaching; the Numinous Palaces of the Five Marchmounts; the Grotto-Realms of Famous Mountains; and all responsive and efficacious numina of the Three Realms.

By karmic affinity with the Dao, your servants have personally encountered the true transformation. The Celestial Venerable expounded the Dharma, and the Three Caverns proclaimed its practice. Sacred instructions and numinous charts bring salvation to households and peace to the realm. Having been granted participation in the wondrous and true, we were permitted to receive and cultivate it. Yet first, we must establish merit to universally benefit both the hidden and the manifest. It is fitting to magnify the sagely teachings and broadly deliver heaven and humanity. None who sincerely submit shall be rejected or forsaken. Now, in obedience to the edict, how dare we not report above?

Reading the memorial:
Following the memorial’s sincerity, we have joined together in mutual support. Consulting the codes of the numinous immortals and perusing the texts of the Yellow Register, we act on behalf of [Name] at the [Name] Abbey in [State and County], establishing the ritual forms of the Mystic Rite and modeling the Two Modes. We present the lamps, candles, incense, flowers, golden dragons, and silken banners—pledges of our destined lives—to attest and verify our cinnabar sincerity. Beginning at the midnight hour of [Day], we initiate the fast. Burning incense and pacing the Dao, we repent and give thanks to the Mystic Perfected. Kindling lamps to continue the light, we illuminate the Three Realms, reaching downward through the Nine Earths and upward to all heavens. We deliver the living and rescue the dead, universally benefiting household and state. For [Number] days and nights, we pace the Dao and recite the scriptures. At the eleventh hour of [Day], the merit is perfected and the task accomplished. The lotus lamps dim their flames, and the jade chimes gather their sound. The immortal chariots return to the Upper Mysteries, and the Dharma’s flow disperses through the lower realms. Golden dragons ascend in radiance to report the fast’s merit. The sagely grace extends compassion, opening deliverance to the hidden and the lost. Rewarding merit and bestowing honors, it universally reaches the numinous offices.

Within our bodies, the inner and outer Perfected Officials we bear, the soldiers and scribes of the Three Caverns, the stellar lodges and Nine Palaces, the Five Emperors, the Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the troops and cavalry, the attendant incense-bearing Golden Lads, the flower-scattering Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans who transmit and report, and the Flying Dragon Cavalry—all have labored with merit. Now, they shall be separately honored. On yellow silk and vermilion memorials, their merits are proclaimed and promotions recommended.

Your servants’ mastery of the Dharma remains incomplete, constrained by the measures of reverence and humility.

chunks.original_text: 进止犯科，不合仪式。 恐为四司所纠，五帝所执。 千愆万过，乞蒙赦贷。 哀原未悟，不见罪罚。 臣等建斋之始，奉请智慧上品、十戒法事既竟，谒还天宫。 臣所修斋，功成事竟。 重明功德，拜黄缯朱表一通。 在臣玉案之上，请省表文。 表文以黄熟素五尺，朱界朱书，每行二十四字。 生字不在下，死字不在上。 第一行尽书法位，至顿首字。 上言，独占一行。 太上无极大道君，第三行。 表后以闻，去臣姓，三行。 圣号，去臣姓，三行。 年月，去圣号，三行。 一如章法不得涂改。 注乙谴责，尤重慎之。 读表 取表於香上，熏之，即读。 法位起，再拜讫，复长跪。 和声正气。 读至弟子名，皆令再拜。 至臣诚惶诚恐处起，再拜。 又至年月日某处，拜上又再拜。 都毕，展於玉案上。 正对御前。 以龙头书刀镇圣号之左。 朱笔镇右讫，却长跪。 三捻香，叩齿三通，遣表，勑曰 谨遣臣等身中，五体真官。 官一小吏，十二书佐。 重勑功曹使者，飞龙骑吏，严装显服，冠带垂缨，磨砚点笔，簪剑理录。 为臣及时，操黄素朱表，上诣天曹，随表进对。 若有谬误，文字脱漏，言词倒错，不相次比者。 传言书佐，习事小吏，操龙头书刀，长毛利笔，随误正定。 无令上官典者，有所遣却。 闭气升章，径上三天无极大道太上御前，慎勿稽停。 左君历关，右吏次启。 诸官君历第，以次分别。 当令臣所请者下，所召者到，所理者愈，所诛者灭，所宣者通，所迁者达，所愿者应，所求者得。 若有下官，故气邀截臣表文，不使上达者。 收付所在近狱，依律定罪，以明天宪。 臣等伏待，玄恩报应。 法师於案后，临目，向天门，曲躬存。 令身中吏兵及三元将军、功曹骑乘，罗列前后，身乘羽车、龙驭，在紫气中，冉冉而升。 上诣三天门下。 先谒三天法师，入玄都宫门之左。 呈表讫已。 捧函径入三天门。 赍章、呈章等，从事一十二人，伺候上省。 览毕，即出三天门，御羽车与骑乘而回所。 经历天宫、道路次第，一如三五天拜章诀。 此不具载。 次内官叩齿十二通，咒曰 臣奏表事讫，向所出身中功曹使者、三五真官并还臣身中。 从众妙门而入，在左还左，在右还右。 直使功曹、主领捡押，还复本位，无令错互。 须召又到，一如故事。 叩齿二通，咽液二过。 存三五上章，官吏各复身中。 再拜，卷表於词文之前内函中。 封印讫，并真文通於香案上。 洞案捧之，监斋押之。 幢节前引，弟子随之。 至天门之上，焚之。 法师於本位，向天门，存真官捧真文表等，随青烟朱焰，上升天门 焚词颂 众生多障难，大道甚矜怜。 救度留科戒，咸令忏罪缘。 愆辜编地府，衅结已闻天。 发露祈真佑，精诚仰圣贤。 虔恭礼三宝，愿当奏延年。 焚词归上界，奏名玉帝前。 三捻上香，执山简文。 叩齿九通，读之香熏三过，乃读 今谨有某州县乡里大道，弟子某官姓名年若干岁。 命属某帝，名系某岳。 谨为国为家，存亡眷属及某事； 随意言之於某州县宫观住宅，修建黄箓大斋若干日夜。 行道事讫，投简灵山。 愿神愿仙，长生度世。 飞行上清，五岳真人，至神至灵。 乞削罪籍，上名九天。 请诣灵山，金龙驿传。 国号某年某太岁某月某朔某日，三洞法师臣某於某灵山洞府，告文读讫。
chunks.translated_text:
Advancing or halting in violation of statutes, failing to conform to ritual propriety—we fear being impeached by the Four Offices or seized by the Five Emperors. For a thousand transgressions and ten thousand faults, we beseech pardon and forgiveness. Though our ignorance remains unenlightened, may no punishment be visited upon us.

At the commencement of this retreat, we reverently invited the Wisdom of the Highest Grade and performed the Ten Precepts Dharma rites, which now being concluded, we escort them back to the Heavenly Palace. The retreat we have conducted is now complete in merit and accomplishment. To further clarify these merits, we present a memorial on yellow silk with vermilion script.

Upon our jade table, we request the inspection of the memorial text. The text is inscribed on five feet of fine yellow silk, with vermilion borders and vermilion script, each line containing twenty-four characters. No "living" character appears at the bottom of a line, nor any "dead" character at the top. The first line records the Dharma rank in full, concluding with the phrase "bowing my head." The opening address occupies its own line. "The Most High and Boundless Dao Lord" appears on the third line. After "the memorial is hereby presented," omit the supplicant’s surname for three lines. After the sacred title, again omit the surname for three lines. The date follows, separated from the sacred title by three lines. All must adhere strictly to the prescribed format, with no emendations—lest corrections incur reprimand, a matter of utmost gravity.

**Reading the Memorial**
Take the memorial from the incense burner, fumigate it, and begin reading. At the mention of the Dharma rank, bow twice, then resume the kneeling posture. Maintain a harmonious voice and upright qi. When the disciple’s name is read, bow twice again. From the phrase "your servant, in trembling awe," bow twice more. At the date and place, bow once more, then bow twice again. When finished, spread the memorial upon the jade table, aligning it directly before the Celestial Presence. Secure it with a dragon-headed writing knife to the left of the sacred title and a vermilion brush to the right, then resume the kneeling posture. Light three pinches of incense, strike the teeth three times, and dispatch the memorial, issuing the decree:

We solemnly dispatch the Perfected Officials of the Five Constituents within our bodies, each accompanied by one minor clerk and twelve scribal assistants. We further command the Merit Officers, the Flying Dragon Cavalry, and the Courier Envoys to attire themselves in full regalia—crowns, sashes, pendants, inkstones, brushes, and girded swords—to prepare the records. Without delay, they shall bear this yellow-silk vermilion memorial to the Heavenly Bureaus and present it in audience. Should any errors occur—omissions, misplaced characters, disordered phrases, or improper sequencing—the transmitting scribes, attendant clerks, and their dragon-headed writing knives and long-haired brushes shall correct them on the spot. Let no supervising official have cause to return it.

Holding the breath, ascend the memorial directly to the presence of the Most High and Boundless Dao Lord of the Three Heavens. Proceed without delay. The Left Lord shall pass through the gates, the Right Clerk shall announce in proper order. Each official shall proceed according to rank. May what we have requested descend, what we have summoned arrive, what we have healed be cured, what we have condemned be destroyed, what we have proclaimed be transmitted, what we have promoted advance, what we have wished be fulfilled, and what we have sought be obtained. Should any subordinate official dare obstruct or intercept this memorial, preventing its ascent, they shall be seized and delivered to the nearest prison, their crimes adjudicated according to celestial law to uphold the heavenly statutes.

We prostrate ourselves, awaiting the response of mysterious grace.

The Dharma Master, standing behind the table, closes his eyes and faces the Heavenly Gate, bowing deeply in visualization. The officials and soldiers within his body, along with the Generals of the Three Primes and the Merit Officers with their mounts, array themselves before and behind him. His body ascends in a feathered carriage, a dragon-drawn chariot, rising gently within the purple qi to the gate of the Three Heavens. First, he pays homage to the Dharma Masters of the Three Heavens, then enters the left gate of the Mysterious Capital Palace. After presenting the memorial, he bears the case directly into the Three Heavens Gate. Twelve attendants—those bearing the memorial, presenting it, and awaiting its review—stand in readiness. Upon completion, he exits the Three Heavens Gate, mounts his feathered carriage with his retinue, and returns. The passage through the heavenly palaces and celestial roads follows the same sequence as the memorial rites of the Three and Five Heavens—details of which are not repeated here.

Next, the inner officials strike their teeth twelve times and recite the incantation:
The memorial having been presented, the Merit Officers, Courier Envoys, and Perfected Officials of the Three and Five Heavens who emerged from our body shall now return—entering through the Gate of Myriad Mysteries, those on the left returning to the left, those on the right to the right. The Directing Merit Officers and overseers shall resume their original positions, ensuring no confusion. When summoned again, they shall arrive as before.

Strike the teeth twice, swallow the saliva twice. Visualize the officials of the Three and Five Heavens memorial rites returning to their places within the body. Bow twice, then roll the memorial into its case, sealing it with the true writ. Place it upon the incense table. The Cavern Tablet Officer shall bear it, the Retreat Supervisor shall escort it, with banners and regalia leading the way, the disciples following. At the Heavenly Gate, it is burned.

The Dharma Master, from his position, faces the Heavenly Gate and visualizes the Perfected Officials bearing the true-writ memorial ascending with the azure smoke and vermilion flames into the Heavenly Gate.

**Burning the Memorial with Invocation**
Beings are beset by obstacles and hardships,
The Great Dao shows profound compassion.
Salvation and deliverance abide in precepts and rites,
All are enabled to repent their karmic entanglements.
Transgressions are recorded in the earthly prisons,
Offenses have reached the ears of Heaven.
We confess our faults and pray for true protection,
Our sincerity reverently directed to the sages.
Devoutly we worship the Three Treasures,
Praying to present our memorial for longevity.
The burning words ascend to the upper realms,
Names presented before the Jade Emperor.

Light three pinches of incense, hold the Mountain Memorial Text, strike the teeth nine times, fumigate the text thrice, then read:

We, the humble Dharma disciple [official title, name, age], born under the governance of [Celestial Emperor], named in the register of [Marchmount], now residing in [prefecture, county, village], respectfully conduct this Yellow Register Grand Retreat of [number] days and nights at [prefecture, county, temple, abode] for the sake of the state, the household, the living and deceased kin, and [specific intention]. The Daoist rites now concluded, we cast this memorial upon the Sacred Mountain. May the divine and immortal ones, the perfected of the Five Marchmounts, most numinous and efficacious, erase our names from the ledgers of sin and inscribe them in the Nine Heavens. We beseech the Sacred Mountain to dispatch a golden dragon courier.

In the reign year [name], the [year] of the [Celestial Stem-Branch], the [month], the [day] of the [lunar phase], the Three Caverns Dharma Master [name], at the [Sacred Mountain Cavern Abode], hereby concludes this proclamation.

chunks.translated_text:
All officials bow twice again. The disciples are then instructed to hold the memorial tablet above the incense smoke, while the Dharma Master strikes his teeth nine times and recites the incantation:

"Mystic and luminous, the Primordial Beginning oversees the true.
The Five Elders of the Supreme Emperor, crimson script on vermilion writ.
Heaven and Earth’s origin, governing the Three Luminaries.
Gathering qi to summon the assembly, hastening the ascent of immortals.
The exalted talisman’s decree, proclaimed throughout the ten directions.
Sun, moon, and stars; the Five Marchmounts and sacred peaks.
Above in the heavens, below on the earth, the great spirits of the unseen.
Overseeing life and the Register of Destiny, the Southern Three Gates.
Receive the jade tablet, inscribe names in the cinnabar scroll.
Erase the records of transgression, elevate them as imperial retainers.
So-and-so (name) entrusts himself to the supreme Dao, establishing merit through this retreat.
Redeeming the nine generations of ancestors, all suffering souls.
The Daoist rites now concluded, we respectfully approach the Sacred Mountain.
We beseech the casting of this jade tablet, the erasure of sinful names,
that all may attain liberation, without enmity or kinship.
Departing the Three Evil Realms, souls ascend to the Nine Heavens.
Deliverance in life and death, eternal existence through kalpas.
Today’s supplication is heard by the myriad perfected.
We entreat the dragon tablet to seal the pact with the true officials.
May our plea be conveyed by the golden dragon courier."

As the officials bow twice, all repeat the invocation aloud. The phrase *"golden dragon courier"* and the four-character memorial tablet inscription are each recited three times.

The tablet is made of *hu* wood, twelve inches in length, two inches and four *fen* in width, and two *fen* in thickness. It is bordered in vermilion, divided into five columns: four for the memorial text and one for the date. The text is written meticulously in red, without corrections or emendations.

Each tablet is borne by a dragon, three inches and six *fen* in length. For the Son of Heaven, the dragon is of gold; for dukes and marquises, of secondary gold; for scholars and commoners, silver gilded with gold suffices.

Upon completion of the incantation, the mountain and water tablets are sealed with blue paper, bound with silk, and stamped with the seal of the Nine Elders’ Immortal Capital. The earth tablet is sealed with yellow paper and green thread.

According to ancient ritual, a jade *bi* head is placed within the Dragon-Casting Ceremony, marking the sealed tablet. The Dharma Master respectfully presents it to the designated cavern abode:
- For mountains: *[Name] Mountain Cavern Abode*
- For waters: *[Name] Spring Water Palace*
- For earth: *[Name] Sacred Altar Earth Palace*

The Three Caverns Dharma Master [Name] seals the proclamation.

---

**Reading of the Water Tablet Proclamation:**
"Now, with reverence, [prefecture, county, village], official so-and-so (name), aged [number], humbly conducts this Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat of [number] days and nights at [location] for the sake of the state, the household, and all living and deceased kin. We pray for blessings, grace, and the augmentation of fortune and longevity.

The Daoist rites now concluded, we cast this memorial upon the Water Palace. May the divine and immortal ones, the Three Origins in unity, the Water Emperors of the Nine Palaces, the Twelve River Sources, the Jiang, Hai, Huai, and Ji rivers, and the great spirits of the unseen, erase our names from the ledgers of sin and inscribe them in the Nine Heavens. We beseech the Water Palace to dispatch a golden dragon courier.

In the reign year [name], the [year] of the [Celestial Stem-Branch], the [month], the [day], the Three Caverns Dharma Master [name], at the [location] Sacred Spring Water Palace, hereby concludes this proclamation."

The disciples are then instructed to hold the tablet above the incense smoke, while the Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and recites the incantation:

"Primordial Beginning, Five Elders, Supreme Emperor, exalted and revered,
the perfected of the ten directions, the numinous immortals of Mount Taihua,
crimson writ proclaiming the decree—no hidden realm remains unheard.
Ascending the Nine Heavens, we beseech the descent of the jade script.
Sun, moon, and Three Stars; the Northern Dipper’s Seven Origins.
We petition the Five Marchmounts, the sacred peaks of the four directions.
Below, we address the rivers and seas, the Twelve Fountainheads.
The Nine River Water Emperors, the great spirits of the unseen,
today’s supplication is laid bare before the myriad wishes.
The disciples conduct this retreat and perform the Daoist rites for all living and deceased.
We redeem the seven generations of ancestors, severing the roots of past transgressions.
We respectfully cast this jade tablet, beseeching its ascent to the heavens.
Inscribe our names in the Water Palace, that the departed may ascend to the heavens.
Deliverance in life and death, heard by the myriad spirits.
We entreat the dragon tablet to pledge our oath to the Water Emperors.
Grant our plea as proclaimed, conveyed by the golden dragon courier."

All officials bow twice again, and the incantation concludes. The sealing and inscription follow the previous method.

---

**Reading of the Earth Tablet Proclamation:**
"Now, with reverence, [prefecture, county, village], official so-and-so (name), humbly conducts this Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat of [number] days and nights at [location] for the sake of the state, the household, and all living and deceased kin. We pray for blessings, grace, and the augmentation of fortune and longevity.

The Daoist rites now concluded, we cast this memorial upon the Sacred Altar. The Yellow Thearch of the Nine Earths, the Yellow Spirits of *wu* and *ji*, the Five Emperors of the Earth Palace—we beseech the erasure of sinful names. We petition the Central Palace to inscribe the tablet in the Great Mystery. With golden clasps and white credentials, we entreat the golden dragon courier.

In the reign year [name], the [month], the [day], the Three Caverns Dharma Master [name], at the [location] Sacred Altar Earth Palace, hereby concludes this proclamation."

The disciples are then instructed to hold the tablet above the incense smoke, while the Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and recites the incantation:

"Heaven and Earth unfold, the myriad qi divide and manifest.
The Three Origins in harmony, the ten directions radiant and clear.
The Five Elder Supreme Emperors, governing death and overseeing life.
Crimson script on vermilion writ, the essence of the Primordial Beginning.
Proclaimed throughout the world, the august spirits of the Nine Earths.
Today’s supplication is heard, the myriad immortals decree life.
The disciples conduct this retreat and perform the Daoist rites for all living and deceased.
Our wishes, our immortals—we beseech the casting of jade names.
The Supreme Thearch of the Earth Palace, erase our sinful names.
Present the tablet to the Upper Palace, inscribe it in the Register of Flourishing Clarity.
Bodies ascend in flight, in unity with the numinous of Heaven and Earth.
The nine generations of kin, though bones decay, are renewed in glory.
Souls ascend to the Southern Palace, transformed in the immortal courts.
Today’s decree is heard by the myriad spirits.
We entreat the golden clasp and white tablet to attest our utmost sincerity.
Grant our plea as proclaimed, conveyed by the golden dragon courier."

All officials bow twice again.

---

**Recitation of the Dragon-Casting Hymn:**
"Praying to the true, ascending the Purple Palace,
proclaiming the decree at the Sacred Altar.
Jade maidens chant in Sanskrit resonance,
golden lads offer incense smoke.
Names inscribed, traversing the Nine Earths,
characters arrayed, ascending the Three Heavens.
Eternal life without end,
attaining the exalted immortality of the highest."

All officials bow twice again.

The overseers of the fast’s affairs, the golden youths attending incense, the jade maidens scattering blossoms, the direct envoys of the Five Emperors, the messengers bearing petitions, the flying dragon couriers.

Within our bodies, the inner and outer true immortals we bear, the officials of the Numinous Treasure, the guardian generals of the palace—along with the local earth gods and territorial deities, the divinities of the Three Realms, all those who supervise, protect, and transmit commands, or who have labored diligently in honoring and safeguarding the fast—are now fully arrayed. chunks.original_text: 谨奉请此间土地、里域真官，降临西席。 次上香 上汤 上茶 上酒 次长跪，启白 臣等谨上启十方大圣，天地灵仙，日月帝君，四司五帝，三台北斗，岳渎真官，灵宝众真，三官主者，三界内外，应感真灵。 伏愿普降洪慈，分辉照鉴。 臣宿承余庆，得诞今生。 叨佩灵文，禀修玄教。 功轻尘露，过重丘山。 诚宜束身，以自修检。 而法许开度，佐国立功。 凡有归心，理难抑绝。 今有大道弟子某官某乙，为家为国，赍信投词。 请建黄箓大斋，若干日夜。 以某月某日亥时，功圆事毕。 拔度幽夜，关奏上真。 解厄销灾，祈恩谢过。 功德成就，障难不生。 皆赖法箓吏兵，内外官属，至真众圣，应感尊灵。 乘此洪休，副其丹恳。 启奏来往，劳历真官。 或荐献失仪，违犯科典。 动静俯仰，干冒神真。 将酬翊卫之恩，请降将来之福。 辄因散席，虔备醮筵。 乞降威灵，俯赐歆纳。 臣及弟子等，不任仰望之至，诚惶诚恐，稽首再礼。 次上香 上汤
chunks.translated_text:
Respectfully we invite:
The local earth gods and domain’s true officials—
May they descend to the western seat.

Next, we offer incense, present the hot water, present the tea, present the wine.
Then, kneeling in reverence, we humbly address:
Your servants respectfully invoke the Ten Directions’ Great Saints, the numinous immortals of Heaven and Earth, the Sovereign Lords of Sun and Moon, the Four Controllers and Five Thearchs, the Three Terraces and Northern Dipper, the true officials of mountains and rivers, the host of numinous treasures, the lords of the Three Offices, and all responsive true spirits within and beyond the Three Realms.
We prostrate ourselves, beseeching your boundless compassion to descend and shine your radiance in witness.

Your servants, inheritors of past blessings, have been born into this present life. We have presumptuously received the sacred texts and followed the teachings of the Mysterious Dao. Our merits are lighter than dust and dew, while our transgressions weigh heavier than mountains. Truly, we should restrain ourselves and cultivate self-discipline. Yet the Dao permits salvation and aids the state in establishing merit. As all who turn their hearts toward it cannot be refused, we now have the Great Dao disciple, the official so-and-so, acting for family and state, presenting his faith and submitting his petition. He requests the establishment of a grand Yellow Register Retreat, lasting so many days and nights, to conclude at the hour of the boar on such-and-such a day of such-and-such a month. Through this, he seeks to deliver the souls of the dark night, submit memorials to the highest perfected, dispel calamities and dissolve misfortune, pray for blessings and give thanks for grace. May merit be accomplished and obstacles not arise—all relying upon the ritual register’s clerks and soldiers, the inner and outer officials, the host of perfected saints, and all responsive numinous spirits. By your great favor, may his sincere prayers be answered.

In the course of these invocations and submissions, should we have erred in offerings or violated ritual codes, or in any movement or stillness offended the divine and true, we now seek to repay the grace of your protection and entreat the bestowal of future blessings. Thus, as the rites conclude, we humbly prepare this offering feast, beseeching your majestic presence to deign to accept and receive it.

Your servants and disciples, unable to bear the weight of our reverent hope, prostrate ourselves in awe and trepidation, bowing again in homage.
Next, we offer incense, present the hot water.

May the unseen and seen alike be graced with glory, and the living and dead alike know prosperity.
