Next, the *Empty Cavern* recitation.
Next, the *Exiting the Chamber Spell*.
Next, standing before the *Mysterious Master*, they perform the *Dedication Hymn*.
Next, they chant the *Supervisor of the Retreat’s Correction of Faults*.
Next, the *Admonition of Faults* is struck.
Next, the *Dharma Ritual* is chanted; when complete, the assembly of officials returns to their positions.
Next, they bow in gratitude, then disperse to the retreat hall as in the usual rite.

The *Circulation of the Dao* is performed thrice daily, following this sequence each time. Only on the first day, after the *Incense Offering*, is there an additional *Prostration to Declare Officials*; and each morning after paying homage to the Master, the *Guardian Spirit Spell* is recited. All else remains the same.

Should they prepare to ascend the altar but encounter wind and rain, urgent alarms, extreme heat or cold, violent thunderstorms, fierce winds, or darkening skies, the rite is suspended.

Next, the *Three Offerings of Incense*: the assembly stands upright in their positions as the *Chief Cantor* chants:
"With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the *Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy* of the Ten Directions, the *Ten Celestial Lords*, the *Three Luminaries and Five Peaks*, the *Three Rivers and Four Seas*, the *Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures*, and all divine immortals and spirit officials."

Next, the *Three Bows*.
Next, each offers sincere repentance; when complete, they visualize and circumambulate, or proceed through the directions in sequence, bowing once to each as in the usual morning audience. Alternatively, a general repentance may be performed.

If pressed for time or delayed in ascending the altar, a general repentance may suffice. After the *Three Offerings of Incense*, they remain in position, facing the altar. One person faces north to confess before the *Three Treasures*. The *Chief Cantor* intones:
"With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the *Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy* of the Ten Directions, the *Ten Celestial Lords*, and all divine immortals and spirit officials of the Ten Realms."

Next, the *Three Bows*.
Next, each offers sincere repentance:
"With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the palaces of the sun, moon, and stars, the *Perfected and Great Saints*, and all divine immortals and spirit officials of the *Three Luminaries*."

Next, the *Three Bows*:
"With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the *True Lords of the Five Peaks*, the grotto-heavens of the sacred mountains, and all divine immortals and spirit officials who have attained the Dao."

Next, the *Three Bows*:
"With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the *Three Rivers and Four Seas*, the *Water Sovereigns of the Nine Rivers*, the *Twelve River Sources*, and all divine immortals and spirit officials of the water palaces."

Next, the *Three Bows*:
"With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the *Three Supreme Ones*, the *Great Saints of the Ten Directions*, and the *True Writ and Sacred Talismans of the Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures*."

Next, the chanting resumes; each offers sincere repentance. When complete, they command the demons and circumambulate, following the method above.

After the daily *Circulation of the Dao*, they return to the retreat hall to rest for a time, then ascend the altar to recite scriptures. The assembly stands before the *Mysterious Master* as the *Chief Cantor* intones:
"All in this Dharma assembly, each with focused mind, take refuge in the *Three Treasures*."

They bow to the *Mysterious Master*, then chant the names of the *Supreme Meritorious Deeds* as they wish.

Next, the *Hymn of China* leads them to ascend the altar.
Next, the *Entering the Chamber Spell*, ascending the *Gate of Heaven*, and offering incense. They stand at their positions.

Next, the *Three Refuges* are chanted; after three repetitions, the *Chief Cantor* intones:
"All in this Dharma assembly, holding tablets before their hearts, sit in proper posture."

The assembly sits, then chants hymns as prescribed.
Next, the *Hymn of Past Lives* is completed, followed by the *Circulation of Incense* and the *Recitation of Scriptures*. When the hymn concludes,
Next, they chant the *Silent Contemplation* as prescribed.
Next, the *Dharma Master* visualizes.
Next, the names of meritorious deeds are recited.
Next, they chant the *Turning of the Dharma Wheel*.
Next, the assembly recites the scriptures; when one scroll is complete, the *Chief Cantor* strikes the chime, and the *Scripture Attendants* gather the texts.

Next, the *Hymn of Sending Forth the Scriptures* is completed, followed by the *Hymn of Rising from the Seat*.
Next, the merits of the scriptures are extolled. One person praises the scriptures, either following ancient verses or using new compositions as appropriate.

Next, the *Hymn of the Leisurely Scriptures* is chanted three times.
Next, they circumambulate, chanting the *Hymns of the Seven Perfected*. These may be seven, eight, five, three, or one in number.

Next, they *Study the Way of Immortality* and exit the altar.
Next, the *Exiting the Chamber Spell*.
Next, before the *Mysterious Master*, they perform the *Dedication Hymn*. When complete, they chant:
"The Dharma ritual is complete; the assembly of officials returns to their positions."

Next, they disperse to the retreat hall as in the usual rite.

During the three-, five-, or seven-day retreat, if conducting the *Rite of the Lamp*, they await the time of *Circulating the Dao* at dusk to exit the altar. The assembly arranges itself at the *Earth Gate* as the *Dharma Master* or an officiant recites the invocations and bows as prescribed. When complete, they chant the *Hymn of Studying the Way of Immortality* and lead the assembly before the *Mysterious Master*.

In the old method, they would circumambulate beneath the lamps to recite the spell. Now, to avoid complexity, they stand at the *Earth Gate*, bowing from afar toward the *Three Supreme Ones* upon the altar, which is also fitting.

When the retreat concludes, at the *Ox Hour* the following day or after the *Hour of the Boar* on the same day, the assembly arranges itself before the *Mysterious Master*. The *Chief Cantor* intones:
"All in this Dharma assembly, each with focused mind, take refuge in the *Three Treasures*."

Next, they chant the *Hymn of Meritorious Deeds*, enter the chamber, ascend the altar, and approach the *Incense Table of the Ten Directions* at their positions.

Next, they chant the *Homage to the Master* and visualize as prescribed.
Next, the *Guardian Spirit Spell*.
Next, the *Dharma Drum* is struck twenty-four times.
Next, the *Incense Offering*.
Next, they chant the *Declaration of Dharma Ranks*.
Next, the *Offering of Incense*:
"With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the *Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy* of the East; the same for the Ten Directions."

Next, the *Confession of Taking Refuge*.
Next, the *Repentance of the Three Karmas*.
Next, the *Three Petitions*:
"With utmost sincerity, we prostrate ourselves before the *Boundless Supreme Dao*."
"With utmost sincerity, we prostrate ourselves before the *Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures*."
"With utmost sincerity, we prostrate ourselves before the *Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center*."

Next, they circumambulate.
Next, the *Five True Writs* of the East, South, West, North, and Center are gathered and proclaimed.

Next, the *Spell of the True Writs*.
Next, the *Dharma Ranks* are declared again.
Next, incense is offered while kneeling.
Next, the *Tablet* is bowed to.
Next, the *Tablet* is displayed.
Next, the *Tablet* is dispatched.
Next, they visualize the spirits, rise, and bow again.
Next, the *Tablet* is sealed.
Next, the *Tablet* is conveyed to the *Gate of Heaven* and burned.
Next, the *Inner Officials* are invoked.
Next, the *Chief Cantor* chants the *Twelve Vows*.
Next, the *Dharma Master* replenishes the incense burner.
Next, the *Bell Attendant* strikes the chime and leads the *Exiting the Hall Hymn*; the assembly responds, exiting the altar.

Next, the *Dharma Master* bows once.
Next, they are led to the *Hall of Silent Repose* to stand in order.
Next, the *Dharma Master* offers incense and makes a declaration.
Next, the *Bell Attendant* leads the *Hymn of the Proceedings*; the assembly responds.

Next, the *Bell Attendant* announces: "The morning practice is complete." The assembly bows together.

chunks.original_text: 次设醮，散如常仪 太上黄箓斋仪卷之五十三竟 太上黄箓斋仪卷之五十四 唐广成先生杜光庭删 镇坛真文玉诀 真文赤书安镇法 出《灵宝玉诀经》 经曰：元始五老，太上大道君，上帝高尊，十方大神，会於南丹洞阳上馆，坐明珠七色宝座。 时有五帝大圣、玄和玉女及诸真人大仙，五万二千五百众，同来诣座。 天洒香花，神龙伎乐。 无鞅数众，紫云四敷，三景齐明。 天元合庆，众真齐驾。 道君轸念，欲度众生，是男是女，好愿至人。 咸使得见灵宝出法，亦有善心来归法门。 由尔前生万劫，已奉至真。 功满德足，致生道世。 值遇法兴，今当为尔，解说疑滞。 十二部经，谓中法洞玄一十二部也。 使尔救度十方，诸天人民。 勤为用心，勿使魔言。

**True Writ for Pacifying the Altar: Jade Formulae**
**Method for Pacifying the Altar with the Vermilion Writ of the True Writ**
*From the* Scripture of the Jade Formulae of the Numinous Treasure.

The Scripture states:
The Primordial Five Elders, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the August Highest Thearch, and the great deities of the ten directions assembled at the Upper Palace of Vermilion Yang in the Southern Cinnabar Grotto. They sat upon seven-jeweled thrones of seven hues. At that time, the Five Thearchic Great Sages, the Jade Maidens of Mystic Harmony, and the various perfected ones and great immortals—fifty-two thousand five hundred in all—came together before the thrones. Heaven rained fragrant blossoms, and divine dragons performed music. Countless hosts spread forth purple clouds on all sides, while the Three Luminaries shone in unison. The Primordial Era rejoiced in harmony, and the assembled perfected ones arrived in shared procession.

The Lord of the Dao, moved by compassion, desired to deliver all beings—whether male or female, those of earnest vows, or those of sincere heart—so that all might behold the emergence of the Numinous Treasure Dharma. Even those drawn to the Dharma Gate by good intentions were once, in the ten thousand kalpas of former lives, already devoted to the Most Perfected. Their merit complete and their virtue fulfilled, they were born into the world of the Dao. Now, encountering the flourishing of the Dharma, it is fitting to resolve their doubts and obstructions for them.

The Twelve Divisions of Scriptures refer to the twelve divisions of the Wondrous Cavern of the Central Dharma. Through these, you shall deliver the people of the ten directions and all heavens. Apply yourselves diligently, and let no demonic words deceive you.

chunks.original_text: 光庭曰：在昔元始天尊，混元既判，三炁开图。 以大道元精真一之气，化为灵宝； 赤书凝结成文，降於五方。 以镇安天地，招真命灵。 故云天地得之以安镇，日月得之以光明。 鬼神得之以开度，人民得之以长生。 真文垂之於世，上销天灾，保镇帝王； 下禳毒害，以度兆民。 制伏神鬼，拯拔沈沦，无所不为也。 经云，无文不光，无文不明，无文不立，无文不成，无文不度，无文不生是也。 又云，赤书玉字，八威龙文。 保制劫运，使天长存。 此灵宝五篇、真文之妙用也。 故能正天分度，调和阴阳。 开度飞爽，保卫帝王。 拯沦济溺，通幽达明。 和冤释咎，却死延生。 生死之苦，无不救之。 当建斋之时，以真文玉字，安镇五方。 解坛事毕，收文焚之。 散灰青烟之中，具如玉诀之法。 或学士修真，自祈度世。 记名仙品，永离鬼宫。 当以三元八节、甲子本命之日，书文玉简，投诸名山，除宿世罪簿。 言名上天，事事三过诸天。 三官九府，记其善功。 上天右别，万神敬护。 五帝侍卫，三界司迎。 千魔万精，不敢妄干。 经曰，志愿坚固。 触向咸成。 七祖父母，上生天官。 生死福庆，影响相酬也。 太上灵宝真文东方青帝君符命第一 东方玉字，二十四字。 学仙之士，以立春日，朱书持之，或投名山。 东方九气，始皇青天。 碧霞郁垒，中有老人。 总校图箓，摄气举仙。 又三十二字，主灾星临照。 朱书青纸，上露庭中九日，持之销灾。 修黄箓，以镇东方。 依后咒文行之。 岁星辅肝，角亢镇真。 氐房心尾，四景回旋。 箕主七辰，正斗明轮。 承气捕非，扫除灾群。 又三十二字，主制鬼魔。 朱书黑纸上，向东北。 持之妖灭鬼伏。 并依咒文行之。 东山神咒，摄召九天。 赤书符命，制会酆山。 束魔送鬼，所诛无蠲。 悉诣木宫，敢有稽延。 又三十二字，主摄东海水帝。 遇大水之灾，及度大水，召龙摄精，黄书青纸上。 依后咒行之。 投文水中，身度其灾。 河伯奉迎。 下制东河，溟海水神。 大劫洪灾，蛟龙负身。 水府开道，通径百千。 上帝赤文，风火无间。 太上灵宝真文南方赤帝君符命第二 南方玉字，三十二字，主神仙图箓。 学仙之士，以立夏甲子本命之日，朱书简文，投於名山，名入仙籍，神仙长生矣。 南方丹天，赤帝玉堂。 中有大神，号曰赤皇。 上灾流烟，三气勃光。 神仙受命，应会太阳。 又三十二字，主摄南方诸星宿。 变易之灾用之，及镇黄箓斋坛。 朱书青纸上，行之天文复位，天灾自消矣。 荧惑辅心，井鬼守房。 柳星张翼，抗御四乡。 轸主七宿，回转天常。 召运促会，正道驿行。 又四十字，主制天魔鬼神。 黄书赤木刺上，行之鬼魔伏灭矣。 赤文命灵，北摄酆山。 速送魔宗，斩灭邪根。 符校所讨，明列罪源。 南山神咒，威伏八方。 群妖灭爽，万试摧亡。 又四十八字，主制水灾。 召南海水帝，蛟龙万精。 黄书青纸上，水官奉迎。 南方水帝，太伯龙王。 神咒流行，普扫不祥。 洪水飞灾，上召蛟龙。 开除水径。 千道万通。 敢有干试，摄送火宫。 赤书所告，莫有不从。 . 太上灵宝真文中央黄帝君符命第三 中央玉字，四十字，主神仙图箓。 学仙之士，以本命甲子、春分、秋分、夏至、冬至之日，朱书服之，或投名山，名入仙籍矣。

Guangting said: In ancient times, when the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning had already divided the Primal Chaos, the Three Qi unfolded the cosmic pattern. From the primordial essence of the Great Dao—the True One’s qi—were transformed the Numinous Treasure. The Red Writ coagulated into script, descending upon the Five Directions to pacify and stabilize heaven and earth, and to summon the perfected and the numinous. Thus it is said: heaven and earth receive it to be pacified and stabilized; sun and moon receive it to shine with radiance; ghosts and spirits receive it to be delivered and enlightened; and the people receive it to attain longevity. The True Writ has been bequeathed to the world: above, it dissolves celestial calamities and safeguards the emperors; below, it wards off poisonous harm and delivers the multitudes. It subdues gods and demons, rescues the sunken and drowning, and accomplishes all without exception. As the scripture says: “Without the Writ, there is no illumination; without the Writ, there is no clarity; without the Writ, there is no establishment; without the Writ, there is no completion; without the Writ, there is no deliverance; without the Writ, there is no life.” It is also said: “The Red Writ of Jade Characters and the Eight Mighty Dragon Script preserve and regulate the kalpic destiny, ensuring the heavens endure forever.” Such are the wondrous functions of the Five Chapters of the Numinous Treasure and the True Writ. Thus they rectify the celestial divisions and harmonize yin and yang; deliver the flying souls and protect the emperors; rescue the drowning and aid the submerged; bridge the hidden and the manifest; reconcile grievances and absolve transgressions; avert death and prolong life. The sufferings of life and death are all saved without exception.

When establishing a retreat, the True Writ and Jade Characters are installed to pacify the Five Directions. Upon the conclusion of the altar rites, the Writ is gathered and burned. The ashes are scattered amidst the azure smoke, all in accordance with the Jade Instructions. Should a scholar-practitioner cultivate the Real and seek deliverance for themselves, inscribing their name in the registers of immortality, they shall forever depart the ghostly realms. On the days of the Three Primes, the Eight Nodes, the jiazi, or their own life-destiny day, they shall inscribe the Writ upon jade tablets and cast them into renowned mountains, thereby erasing the karmic ledgers of past lives. Their names ascend to heaven, and each matter is thrice presented before the heavens. The Three Offices and Nine Bureaus record their meritorious deeds. Above, they are distinguished by the heavens; ten thousand spirits revere and protect them; the Five Emperors attend them; and the Three Realms’ administrators welcome them. A thousand demons and ten thousand spirits dare not rashly intrude. As the scripture says: “With resolve firm and unwavering, all endeavors toward the Dao shall succeed.” Seven generations of ancestors ascend to the celestial palaces, and the blessings of life and death respond in kind.

**First Talisman: The Azure Emperor of the East, Command of the Numinous Treasure True Writ**
The Jade Characters of the East, twenty-four in number. On the day of the Beginning of Spring, scholar-practitioners shall inscribe them in vermilion and carry them, or cast them into renowned mountains. The Nine Qi of the East commence with the August Azure Heaven. Amidst the verdant mists and towering ramparts dwells an Elder who oversees the celestial registers and summons qi to elevate immortals.

Another thirty-two characters govern the advent of baleful stars. Inscribed in vermilion upon azure paper and exposed in the courtyard for nine days, they dissolve calamities when carried. For the cultivation of the Yellow Register, they pacify the East. Proceed according to the following incantation:

The Year Star assists the liver; Horn and Neck stabilize the Real.
Root, Chamber, Heart, and Tail revolve through the four seasons.
Winnowing Basket governs the seven luminaries; the Northern Dipper’s wheel turns bright.
Receiving qi, it captures the false and sweeps away calamitous hosts.

Another thirty-two characters subdue demonic spirits. Inscribed in vermilion upon black paper and faced toward the northeast, they cause demons to vanish and ghosts to submit. Proceed according to the incantation.

The Eastern Mountain’s divine incantation summons the Nine Heavens.
The Red Writ’s talismanic command convenes Fengdu.
Binding demons and dispatching ghosts, all slain shall not escape.
All shall be sent to the Wooden Palace; none dare delay.

Another thirty-two characters govern the summoning of the Eastern Sea’s Water Emperor. In times of great floods or when crossing vast waters, call forth dragons and subdue spirits by inscribing in yellow upon azure paper. Proceed according to the incantation, then cast the Writ into the water to traverse the calamity. The River Earl shall welcome you; below, it commands the Eastern River and the oceanic water spirits. In the great kalpic deluge, dragons shall bear you. The water palaces open paths, a thousand roads and ten thousand passages. The Red Writ of the Most High is unobstructed by wind or fire.

**Second Talisman: The Vermilion Emperor of the South, Command of the Numinous Treasure True Writ**
The Jade Characters of the South, thirty-two in number, govern the registers of divine immortals. On the day of the Beginning of Summer, the jiazi, or their life-destiny day, scholar-practitioners shall inscribe the Writ in vermilion upon tablets and cast them into renowned mountains. Their names shall enter the immortal registers, and they shall attain long life as divine immortals.

The Cinnabar Heaven of the South, the Jade Hall of the Vermilion Emperor. Within dwells a great spirit named the Vermilion Sovereign. Above, calamitous vapors disperse; the Three Qi surge with radiance. Divine immortals receive their mandate, responding to the Great Yang.

Another thirty-two characters govern the summoning of the southern constellations. Employ them to avert calamities of transformation and to pacify the Yellow Register retreat altars. Inscribed in vermilion upon azure paper, they restore the celestial patterns, and heavenly calamities dissolve of themselves.

Mars assists the heart; Well and Ghost guard Chamber.
Willow, Star, Spread, and Wing resist the four quarters.
Chariot governs the seven lodges, revolving the celestial constants.
Summoning and hastening conjunctions, the true path proceeds apace.

Another forty characters govern the subduing of celestial demons and spirits. Inscribed in yellow upon red wooden slips, they cause demons and spirits to submit and vanish. Proceed according to the incantation.

The Red Writ commands the numinous, northward subduing Fengdu.
Swiftly dispatch demonic lineages, severing and extinguishing their perverse roots.
The talismanic tally exacts retribution, clearly enumerating their transgressions.
The Southern Mountain’s divine incantation overawes the eight directions.
Hosts of demons vanish; myriad trials are shattered and destroyed.

Another forty-eight characters govern the subduing of water calamities. Summon the Southern Sea’s Water Emperor and the myriad dragon spirits. Inscribed in yellow upon azure paper, the water officials shall welcome you.

The Southern Sea’s Water Emperor, the Dragon King Great Elder.
The divine incantation flows forth, universally sweeping away inauspiciousness.
Flying calamities of floodwaters summon dragons above.
Waterways are opened, a thousand paths and ten thousand passages.
Dare any resist? They shall be seized and sent to the Fire Palace.
None disobey the Red Writ’s proclamation.

**Third Talisman: The Yellow Emperor of the Center, Command of the Numinous Treasure True Writ**
The Jade Characters of the Center, forty in number, govern the registers of divine immortals. On the jiazi of their life-destiny day, or the days of the spring equinox, autumn equinox, summer solstice, or winter solstice, scholar-practitioners shall inscribe them in vermilion and ingest them, or cast them into renowned mountains. Their names shall enter the immortal registers.

chunks.original_text: 中央总灵，黄上天元。 始生五老，中皇高尊。 黄中总气，统摄无穷。 镇星吐辉，流炼神宫。 勑摄北帝，遏塞鬼门。 剪除不祥，莫有当前。 又四十八字，主摄水灾。 召北海水帝，万精蛟龙。 黄书青纸上，行之。 中山神呎，召龙上云。 制会黄河，九水河源。 不得急纵，善恶悉分。 千妖万奸，上对帝君。 莫有干试，太阳激焚。 赤书玉字，宣告普闻。 太上灵宝真文西方白帝君符命第四 西方玉字，四十八字，主神仙图箓。 学仙之士，以本命甲子、立秋之日，书文服之，白书白刺上，投之名山，名上仙籍矣。 西方素天，白帝七门。 金灵皓映，太华流氛。 白石峨峨，七气氤氲。 上有始生，皇老大神。 总领肺气，主校九天。 检定图箓，制召上仙。 又二十四字，主西方灾星变异。 及镇斋坛，朱书青纸上，行之星宿复位，天灾自消矣。 太白检肺，奎娄守魂。 胃昂毕觜，王制七关。 参总斗魁，受符北元。 又一十六字，主摄六天鬼气，金精万妖。 行此法者，黑书白木刺上，制西方鬼魔，皆自伏灭矣。 赤书玉字，九天正文。 摄召万气，普归帝君。 又四十八字，主摄西海水帝，水中万精。 召云龙，以度水灾。 黄书青纸上，万精立制，水官奉迎。 西方神咒，八威七传。 符水上龙，召山送云。 在此校录，同到帝门。 辅卫上真，斩灭邪源。 若有不祥，截以金关。 赤书符命，风火驿传。 太上灵宝真文北方黑帝君符命第五 北方玉字，四十字，主神仙图箓。 学仙之士，以立冬、本命甲子之日，丹书佩又黑书白刺上，投之名山，名上仙籍矣。 北方玄天，五气俳徊。 中有黑帝，双皇太微。 总领符命，仙炼八威。 青裙羽，龙文凤衣。 上帝所举，制到玉阶。 又三十二字，主妖星照临，及镇斋坛。 朱书青纸上，行之。 北辰辅肾，斗牛卫扉。 女虚危室，豁落四开。 壁总七星，执凶纠非。 却灾扫秽，明道洞辉。 又二十四字，摄天魔，乃北方鬼神。 青书黑纸上，行之鬼魔摧伏矣。 北山神咒，激阳起雷。 流铃焕落，玃天振威。 北酆所部，万妖灭摧。 又二十四字，制水灾。 黄书黑纸上，摄北海水帝，制蛟龙万精矣。 九河倾讫，鸟母群飞。 蛟龙通道，水脉洞开。 赤文玉书，驿龙风驰。 灵宝投真文，及吞服真文。 并拔度九祖，身求神仙，叩齿十二通。 咒曰，玄上高灵，元始尊神。 大圣徘佪，万真临轩。 三景散辉，庆云四陈。 上告玄图，推算九天。 今日启愿，玄刺灵山。 丹书赤字，自然真文。 上告五帝，记名玉篇。 万神监映，日月盟言。 愿度愿生，愿神愿仙。 天地星宿，玄照我身。 三官九府，五岳大神。 普告无穷削除罪根。 元始大明，莫不纳言。 七祖幽魂，受福自然。 三涂五苦，永离八难。 得与三景，同辉紫晨。 轮转不灭身得飞仙。 毕，投刺於绝岩之中，散香於灵山之上。 又叩齿三通。 咒曰，元始告命，仙名已书。 三官九府，罪莫不除。 散香五帝，告盟太虚。 请如所陈，万劫长居。 元始五老，禳星宿客灾，明天分度，登斋安镇真文玉诀 道言，诸天星宿，各有分度。 至於经道错越，更相侵犯。 或有异星见於方境，皆由天气运度否激所之。 灾有所犯，出其分国。 故以天光转照，玄告不祥。 元始垂文，和天安地。 解灾却祸，安国宁人。 志士精心，依法修行。
chunks.translated_text:
**Central Pervading Numinosity, Yellow Supreme of Heavenly Origin.**
At first arose the Five Elders, the August High One of the Center.
The Yellow Center governs the primordial qi, commanding the boundless.
The Star of Stability emits its radiance, refining the divine palace.
It commands and seizes the Northern Emperor, sealing the Ghost Gate.
Severing inauspiciousness, none dare stand before it.
Moreover, forty-eight characters govern the suppression of water calamities.
They summon the Water Emperor of the Northern Sea and the myriad essence-dragons.
Inscribed in yellow on blue-green paper, they are enacted.
The spirit of Mount Zhong exhales, calling dragons to ascend the clouds.
They regulate the confluence of the Yellow River, the nine waterways and their sources.
No reckless release is permitted; good and evil are thoroughly distinguished.
A thousand demons and ten thousand treacheries face the Imperial Lord above.
None dare resist—scorched by the blazing sun’s fury.
The Red Writ’s jade characters proclaim far and wide.

**Fourth Talisman: The White Emperor of the West, Command of the Numinous Treasure True Writ**
The Jade Characters of the West, forty-eight in number, govern the registers of divine immortals. On the jiazi of their life-destiny day or the day of the autumnal equinox, scholar-practitioners shall inscribe them and ingest them, or write them in white on white slips and cast them into renowned mountains. Their names shall enter the immortal registers.

The Western Plain Heaven, the Seven Gates of the White Emperor.
Golden numinosity gleams resplendently; the Great Flower emits its mist.
White stones tower majestically; the seven qi swirl in abundance.
Above abides the Firstborn, the August Elder Great Spirit.
It governs the qi of the lungs, presiding over the reckoning of the Nine Heavens.
It examines and fixes the registers, commanding the summoning of the celestial immortals.
Moreover, twenty-four characters govern the calamitous stars and anomalies of the West.
For pacifying the altar, inscribe them in vermilion on blue-green paper and enact them—
the stellar lodges return to their positions, and celestial disasters dissipate of themselves.
The Great White inspects the lungs; Kui and Lou guard the hun-soul.
Stomach, Pleiades, Net, and Turtle regulate the Seven Passes.
Shen, the Dipper’s handle, and the Dipper’s bowl receive the talisman from the Northern Origin.
Moreover, sixteen characters govern the suppression of the six heavens’ ghostly qi and the myriad metal essence-demons.
Those who enact this method shall inscribe them in black on white wooden slips—
the demonic hordes of the West shall all submit and perish.
The Red Writ’s jade characters are the rectifying script of the Nine Heavens.
They command and summon the myriad qi, universally returning them to the Imperial Lord.
Moreover, forty-eight characters govern the suppression of the Water Emperor of the Western Sea and the myriad essences within the waters.
They summon cloud-dragons to alleviate water calamities.
Inscribed in yellow on blue-green paper, the myriad essences are instantly subdued, and the water officials offer their obeisance.
The divine incantation of the West, eight mights and seven transmissions.
Talismanic water summons dragons; mountains dispatch clouds.
In this reckoning and recording, they arrive together at the Imperial Gate.
Assisting and protecting the perfected, they sever and extinguish the roots of evil.
Should any inauspiciousness arise, it is intercepted by the Golden Pass.
The Red Writ’s talismanic command is transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

**Fifth Talisman: The Black Emperor of the North, Command of the Numinous Treasure True Writ**
The Jade Characters of the North, forty in number, govern the registers of divine immortals. On the day of the winter solstice or the jiazi of their life-destiny day, scholar-practitioners shall inscribe them in cinnabar and wear them, or write them in black on white slips and cast them into renowned mountains. Their names shall enter the immortal registers.

The Northern Mysterious Heaven, the five qi meander.
Within abides the Black Emperor, the Dual August One of the Supreme Subtlety.
It governs the talismanic commands, refining the eight mights of immortality.
Clad in azure skirts and feathered capes, dragon-patterned and phoenix-robed,
it is exalted by the Supreme Emperor, arriving to regulate the Jade Stairs.
Moreover, thirty-two characters govern the baleful stars’ illumination and the pacification of the altar.
Inscribed in vermilion on blue-green paper and enacted,
the Northern Asterism assists the kidneys; Dipper and Oxguard defend the gates.
Maiden, Void, Rooftop, and Encampment open the four directions.
The Wall governs the seven stars, seizing the inauspicious and rectifying transgressions.
Repelling calamities and sweeping away filth, the Dao shines with luminous clarity.
Moreover, twenty-four characters suppress celestial demons—
the ghostly spirits of the North.
Inscribed in blue-green on black paper and enacted, the demonic hordes are shattered and subdued.
The divine incantation of the Northern Mountains stirs the yang to summon thunder.
Flowing bells and falling meteors shake the heavens with awe.
The legions of the Northern Feng are crushed and annihilated.
Moreover, twenty-four characters regulate water calamities.
Inscribed in yellow on black paper, they suppress the Water Emperor of the Northern Sea and command the myriad essence-dragons.
The nine rivers pour forth; the bird mothers take flight in flocks.
The dragons open the waterways; the veins of the waters are thoroughly cleared.
The Red Script’s jade writings are couriered by dragons and borne on the wind.
The Numinous Treasure’s true writ is cast forth, and the true writ is ingested.
Together they deliver the nine generations of ancestors, as one seeks immortality for oneself.
Knock the teeth twelve times.
The incantation states:
*Mysterious Supreme High Numinosity, Venerable Primordial Spirit.
Great Sage meandering, the myriad perfected descend to the throne.
The Three Radiances scatter their brilliance; auspicious clouds array on all sides.
Above, they report to the Mysterious Chart, reckoning the Nine Heavens.
Today, I open my vow, inscribing the numinous mountain with a mystical slip.
Cinnabar script and vermilion characters, the natural true writ.
Above, I report to the Five Emperors, recording my name in the Jade Volume.
The myriad spirits oversee and reflect; sun and moon witness my pledge.
I vow for deliverance, I vow for life, I vow for divinity, I vow for immortality.
Heaven and earth’s stellar lodges mystically illuminate my body.
The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, the Five Marchmounts’ great spirits—
universally proclaim the endless excision of sin’s roots.
The Primordial’s great illumination accepts all words without exception.
The seven generations of ancestral souls receive blessings naturally.
The Three Paths and Five Sufferings, the Eight Difficulties—forever left behind.
Attaining the Three Radiances, I shine with the Purple Dawn.
Revolving without end, my body ascends as a flying immortal.*

Conclude by casting the slip into the depths of a sheer cliff and scattering incense upon the numinous mountain.
Knock the teeth three more times.
The incantation states:
*Primordial proclaims the command: the immortal’s name is already inscribed.
The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus—no sin remains unexpiated.
Scatter incense to the Five Emperors, pledging alliance with the Great Void.
As I have petitioned, may I dwell for ten thousand kalpas.*
The Primordial and Five Elders avert stellar and guest-star calamities,
illuminating the heavens’ divisions and degrees, establishing the fast and pacifying the true writ’s jade formula.

The Dao declares: The stellar lodges of the myriad heavens each have their allotted degrees.
When their paths cross or transgress, they encroach upon one another.
Should an anomalous star appear in a region’s domain,
it arises from the heavens’ qi coursing through adverse cycles.
Calamities strike where they trespass, manifesting in the afflicted land.
Thus, the celestial light shifts its illumination, mystically announcing the inauspicious.
The Primordial bestowed the writ to harmonize heaven and stabilize earth,
dissolving calamities and repelling misfortune, pacifying the state and tranquilizing the people.
Devoted scholars, with concentrated minds, cultivate according to the method.

chunks.original_text: 灾见之日，书真文如其法，露於中庭，向方面，所谓星在东方，角亢七宿，面东咒之，九日露文。 他仿此叩齿十二通，散发仰头。 咒曰，元始上天，三光高明。 回景照耀，四方玄清。 运度所冲，激扬流星。 五分错越，三统失宁。 五斗总辰，七宿明灵。 真君大魁、厥讳玉清。 夫人皇妃，字曰育婴。 总御玄关，回转诸天。 今有客灾，玄告不祥。 请以真文赤书上呈，散发谢愆，披露丹诚。 惟乘玄鉴，回复天经。 气不横越，灾不横生。 焚烧灵文，散烟玉庭。 上景监度，普告万灵。 气清三关，灾灭九冥。 阴阳调和，国土太平。 请以金龙风火驿呈毕，露真文於中庭，金龙镇之。 假令灾在东方，谓角亢七宿也则九日九夜竟，烧文散灰，青烟之中。 凡禳天灾，安国宁民，法法皆随方。 然灯照耀诸天，假令灾在东方，则然九灯，亦可九十灯、九百灯。 用金龙一枚、青缯九十尺，九日九夜行之。 灾在南方，则然三灯，亦可三十灯、三百灯，金龙一枚，绛缯三十尺，三日三夜行之。 灾在中央，则然十二灯、百二十灯、千二百灯。 金龙一枚，黄缯百二十尺，十二日十二夜行之。 中央谓天市，太微紫微宫也灾在西方，则然七灯、七十灯、七百灯。 金龙一枚，白缯七十尺，七日七夜行之。 灾在北方，则然五灯、五十灯、五百灯。 金龙一枚，黑缯五十尺，行之五日五夜。 余依元始灵宝上元科法。 黄箓斋，常修之。 当同此法 元始灵宝五老，摄召北酆鬼魔 赤书上诀 道言，夫受灵宝上法，致神明来降。 存念响达，与天真交游。 宜先分别，鬼魔形象。 遏塞干试，魔精既伏。 存思自感，神明易致。 行此之法，依上真文施行，便向东北，叩齿三十六通，东北为鬼门。 凡有大疾灾疫，妖怪妄兴，当於国城郡邑境土东北之方，按法修斋，施文安镇。 精心行之，鬼魔摧伏，国宁民安闭气九息，而仰咒曰，三元开明，回转天常。 运推数终，百六乘纲。 大劫交会，万妖争行。 北酆不拘，放逸鬼宗。 群魔纵肆，妖闭天光。 上帝有命，普告十方。 演明天度，法教开张。 正道治民，摄除不祥。 有何小妖，群聚为场。 赤书玉文，检摄鬼乡。 北酆三官，明速传行。 千丁束爽，万鬼送形。 流铃交焕，激气太阳。 金虎四邀，天丁捕亡。 大小齐到，不得匪藏。 元始所告，列奏上宫毕。 息气良久，应所致感之者。 当分别其像真灵，思存感效，勿说之，恐败其功。 元始五老，禳大劫洪水，召蛟龙水宫，度灾真文玉诀 道言，夫天地大劫之灾，洪水四出。 荡秽除恶，万无一遗。 当此之时，天地冥合，人民漂流，无复善恶。 唯有志学之士，得灵宝真文大劫小劫之符。 及可乘飞羽而高观，登灵岳而浮翔。 当此之时，神人自当。 使蛟龙为通路，开水径以度尔身，河伯司迎，不挂津梁也。 所明灵文之真妙，岂拘大劫之灾。 或遇此之际，当依其文，施用北向水位所在叩齿五通，开通闭气。 二十五息，存己身心。 中生火，火出头顶，而烧四方山林、草木及己身，都尽形体，皆成灰飞。 翔青烟之中，无复所遗存己归於极阳，不为火所制也思大水浩浩，荡除天下。 己身化为灰，随水而流。 因叩齿二十五通此或分野大水，积阴为灾。 精心之士，依文施行。 亦可拯群生之垫溺，救万物之沦胥矣。
chunks.translated_text:
On the day the calamity appears, inscribe the true writ according to its method and expose it in the central courtyard, facing the afflicted direction. For instance, if the star resides in the east—among the Horn and Neck’s seven lodges—face east and recite the incantation, exposing the writ for nine days. Proceed likewise for other directions. Strike the teeth twelve times, loosen the hair, and lift the head. The incantation reads:

The Primordial of the Upper Heavens, the Three Luminaries’ radiant clarity,
revolves its light to illumine the four directions in profound purity.
Where the celestial cycles clash, meteors surge in streaming brilliance;
the five divisions transgress, the three norms lose their peace.
The Five Ladles govern the stars, the seven lodges gleam with numinous power.
The True Lord, Great Luminary—his sacred name is Jade Purity.
The Lady, Empress of Humankind, is styled Nurturer of Infants.
Together they oversee the Mystic Pass, revolving all the heavens.
Now a guest-calamity arrives, mystically announcing the inauspicious.
We present the true writ in vermilion script, loosen our hair in atonement,
and bare our crimson sincerity.
May the Mystic Mirror witness this: restore the celestial norm,
let qi not stray wantonly, let calamities not arise without cause.
Burn the numinous writ, scatter its smoke in the Jade Court.
The Upper Radiance surveys the degrees, universally notifying the myriad spirits.
Qi purifies the Three Passes, calamities vanish in the Nine Darknesses.
Yin and yang harmonize, the land knows great peace.
Having dispatched this via the Golden Dragon’s wind-and-fire courier,
expose the true writ in the central courtyard, where the Golden Dragon shall guard it.
If the calamity lies in the east—referring to the Horn and Neck’s seven lodges—
complete nine days and nights, then burn the writ and scatter its ashes amid the blue smoke.

For all rites to dispel celestial calamities and pacify state and people, each method follows the afflicted direction.
Light lamps to illumine the myriad heavens: if the calamity lies in the east, light nine lamps—or ninety, or nine hundred.
Use one Golden Dragon and ninety bolts of blue silk, performing the rite for nine days and nights.
If the calamity lies in the south, light three lamps—or thirty, or three hundred—
one Golden Dragon, and thirty bolts of crimson silk, performing the rite for three days and nights.
If the calamity lies in the center, light twelve lamps—or one hundred twenty, or one thousand two hundred—
one Golden Dragon, and one hundred twenty bolts of yellow silk, performing the rite for twelve days and nights.
The center refers to the Celestial Market, the Supreme Subtlety, and the Purple Tenuity Palaces.
If the calamity lies in the west, light seven lamps—or seventy, or seven hundred—
one Golden Dragon, and seventy bolts of white silk, performing the rite for seven days and nights.
If the calamity lies in the north, light five lamps—or fifty, or five hundred—
one Golden Dragon, and fifty bolts of black silk, performing the rite for five days and nights.
The rest follows the *Upper Prime Statutes of the Primordial Numinous Treasure*.
The Yellow Register Fast is regularly practiced in accordance with this method.

The Primordial Numinous Treasure’s Five Elders summon and subdue the demonic hordes of the Northern Feng.
The Vermilion Script’s Upper Writ states:
Those who receive the Numinous Treasure’s supreme method entice divine luminaries to descend.
Through concentrated visualization, their resonance reaches the heavens, enabling communion with celestial perfected.
First distinguish the forms of demonic hordes:
block their trials and tests, subdue their demonic essence.
Through visualization, self-cultivation, and resonance, divine luminaries are readily summoned.
To perform this method, follow the true writ’s instructions.
Face the northeast and strike the teeth thirty-six times—the northeast is the Demon Gate.
For grave illnesses, pestilences, or malevolent apparitions arising wantonly,
perform the fast and writ-installation rites in the northeast of the state, capital, commandery, or territory.
Practice with concentrated mind: demonic hordes will be crushed and subdued, the state pacified, the people tranquilized.
Hold the breath for nine cycles, then lift the head and recite:
The Three Primes unfold clarity, revolving the celestial constant.
As the cycles’ reckoning concludes, the Hundred-Six seizes the net.
At the great kalpa’s convergence, myriad demons contend in motion.
The Northern Feng is unrestrained, releasing its demonic lineage.
Hordes of demons rampage, malevolence obscures the celestial light.
The August Emperor commands, universally notifying the ten directions.
He elucidates the celestial degrees, expands the dharma’s teachings.
The true Dao governs the people, subjugating and dispelling the inauspicious.
What petty demons dare assemble in throngs?
The Vermilion Script’s jade writ restrains and seizes the demonic realm.
The Three Officials of the Northern Feng swiftly transmit the decree.
A thousand warriors bind their vigor, ten thousand demons surrender their forms.
Flowing bells interweave their brilliance, stirring the qi of the Great Yang.
Golden Tigers patrol the four quarters, Celestial Warriors capture the fugitive.
Great and small assemble together, none may hide or evade.
The Primordial’s proclamation is presented to the Upper Palaces.
Hold the breath for a long while, awaiting the resonance of what has been summoned.
Distinguish the true forms of the numinous spirits, visualize and resonate with their efficacy.
Do not speak of this, lest the work be undone.

The Primordial’s Five Elders dispel the great kalpa’s floodwaters,
summon the flood dragons and water palaces, and transmit the true writ’s jade formula for averting calamity.
The Dao declares:
When the great kalpa’s calamity befalls heaven and earth, floodwaters surge from all directions,
scouring filth and eradicating evil, leaving none behind.
At such times, heaven and earth merge in darkness, the people drift without distinction of good or ill.
Only those devoted scholars who obtain the Numinous Treasure’s true writ—
the talismans for great and small kalpas—
may ride feathered wings to ascend and observe from on high, or climb numinous peaks and soar.
At such times, divine beings shall act on their behalf:
command the flood dragons to open waterways, clearing paths for their passage,
while the River Earl oversees their crossing, sparing them the need for bridges or ferries.
The true writ’s numinous subtlety transcends even the great kalpa’s calamity.
Should one encounter such a time, follow the writ’s instructions.
Face the water’s northern position, strike the teeth five times, and open the breath’s closure.
Hold the breath for twenty-five cycles, visualizing one’s body and mind.
Fire arises within, emerging from the crown of the head to burn the four directions’ mountains, forests, grasses, trees, and one’s own body,
reducing all forms to flying ash.
Soar amid the blue smoke, leaving no trace behind.
Return to the Supreme Yang, unconstrained by fire.
Visualize the vast waters surging, scouring the world.
One’s body, transformed to ash, drifts with the current.
Then strike the teeth twenty-five times.
If a region’s floodwaters accumulate yin to form calamity,
devoted scholars who practice according to the writ may also rescue the drowning multitudes,
saving the myriad beings from sinking into ruin.

chunks.original_text: 故夏禹得之，征神召龙，以通百川，成治水之功也咒曰，五行相促，运度机阳。 阴阳否激，结成灾冲。 大劫倾讫，荡秽除氛。 九河受对，洪灾激川。 水母徘徊，鸟马合群。 日月冥会，三景停关。 上选种民，推校玉文。 弃恶遗善，清浊永分。 我参帝简，名列九天。 大灾四会，赤书所蠲。 是日告命万神，咸闻九河水府、溟泠大神，开除水径，通利河津。 蛟龙应符，摄山送云。 负我送我，驰骛四奔。 丹书赤字，元始真文。 金龙驿呈，时刻无间。 立复告御，上对帝尊。 毕，引气二十五咽，须臾当有开通之神，以度兆身。 在山则山浮，在水则水开。 可谓临危而济鲦欻之顷也。
chunks.translated_text:
Thus did the Great Yu obtain it, summoning spirits and calling forth dragons to channel the hundred rivers, accomplishing his work of flood control. The incantation reads:

The Five Phases spur one another,
their revolving measures governed by yang.
Yin and yang clash in obstruction,
congealing into calamitous surges.
The great kalpa’s end is reached,
sweeping away filth and dispelling miasma.
The Nine Rivers receive their reckoning,
as deluge surges through the channels.
The Water Mother lingers,
birds and horses gather in flocks.
Sun and moon meet in darkness,
the Three Luminaries halt at the pass.
The chosen seed-people are selected,
their jade texts compared and examined.
Evil is cast off, good preserved,
the pure and turbid forever parted.
I partake in the Emperor’s decree,
my name inscribed among the Nine Heavens.
When the fourfold great disasters converge,
the Red Writ absolves them all.

On this day, proclaim the command to the myriad spirits,
that all may hear: the Nine Rivers’ water palaces, the vast and abyssal deities,
open the waterways, clear the river fords.
Dragons respond to the talisman,
seizing mountains to send forth clouds.
Bearing me, escorting me,
they gallop in all four directions.
Cinnabar script in vermilion characters,
the Primordial One’s true writ.
Golden dragons swiftly present it,
unceasing in every moment.

Standing, make the report to the throne,
facing the August Honored One above.
When complete, draw in the breath twenty-five times and swallow it.
In an instant, the gods of passage shall arrive
to ferry the practitioner’s body across.
If in the mountains, the mountains shall float;
if in the waters, the waters shall part.
This may be called delivering from peril in the blink of a minnow’s eye.

chunks.original_text: 郡国有水灾之时，亦可建斋。 书文精心，行之矣。 天尊於亿劫之始，运元气真精，化生灵文，以制御劫运，保国宁民。 子宿有福，庆与善因。 缘得值斯文。 上古之人，醇和抱朴。 与道混同，不俟斋戒，行之立应。 代末时浇，人心散坏。 崇正者寡，违真者多。 欲行其法，须依三元简文，立斋行道，精心思念。 冥契玄圣，乃致感通。 不尔者，魔试所干，徒为之耳。 可选精洁之士，绝尘之地，名山灵迹，以期通应矣。 以彰大道济度之慈，太上救物之泽。 弘化之士，其勉之哉。 庚子年，中元日集。 太上黄箓斋仪卷之五十四竟 太上黄箓斋仪卷之五十五
chunks.translated_text:
When prefectures and kingdoms suffer water disasters, one may also establish a fast. Inscribe the texts with utmost care, and perform the rites accordingly.

At the beginning of kalpas without number, the Heavenly Worthy moved the primordial qi and true essence, transforming and giving birth to numinous scriptures to govern the turning of kalpas, protect the state, and pacify the people. Those born under the Zi constellation are blessed, their fortune bound to good causes. Thus do they encounter these texts.

The people of high antiquity were pure and harmonious, embracing simplicity. They merged with the Dao, and without awaiting fasts or precepts, their practice brought immediate response. In this degenerate age, human hearts are scattered and corrupted. Few uphold the true, while many stray from it. Those who wish to practice this method must follow the writs of the Three Primes, establish the fast, perform the Dao, and concentrate their minds with utmost sincerity. Only then may they inwardly align with the mysterious sages and achieve spiritual resonance. Without this, demonic trials will obstruct them, and their efforts will be in vain.

Select those of purity and integrity, in places untouched by worldly dust—sacred mountains and numinous sites—to await the response. Thus shall the great Dao’s compassion in delivering beings and the Most High’s grace in saving all be made manifest.

Let those who propagate this transformation exert themselves!

Compiled on the Zhongyuan day of the Gengzi year.

chunks.original_text: 唐广成先生杜光庭删 投龙璧仪 下元黄箓简文灵仙品曰：拔度罪根，威仪修斋都毕，依赤书玉诀，丹书槿札，金龙青丝缠之，以关灵山五岳。 升度之信，封於绝嵓之中。 一依具法。 下元黄箓简文灵仙品曰：关五帝威仪毕，当以丹书玉札一枚、金龙一枚，青丝缠之，以投三江，以关水帝。 升度之信，一依玉诀具文。 下元黄箓简文灵仙品曰：关水帝毕，以玉札金龙金纽九枚，青丝缠之，埋於坛所，以告盟地官。 一如科云。 上元金箓简文真仙品曰：拔度生死，修斋威仪，以金龙五枚，镇五方真文之上，事毕，投之山水。 下元黄箓简文灵仙品曰：拔度罪根威仪，当以上金，作十金龙，以镇十方。 拔度飞魂，十方方按一枚。 玉匮明真科云：修黄箓宝斋，当以上金三两，铸三龙。 龙各重一两，国家用上金，公侯大臣次金，士庶人银铜涂并可副以玉简，即玉札也提修斋所为，及国号、太岁、月曰、法师姓名、投奠方所，投於名山大洞、灵泉龙穴及斋坛或住宅之中，以告盟天地水三府，使监证斋功。 阙者，考属地官九都曹。 科曰：龙者，乘云气，御阴阳。 合则成体，散则成章。 变化不测，入地升天。 故三十六天，极阳之境，可以驿传信命，通达玄灵者，其惟龙乎。 龙者，阳畜也。 夫天用莫如龙，地用莫如龟，人用莫如马也。 是以上天以龙为驿骑，往来人间矣。 五金之最，坚刚不渝。 天地所宝，通灵合神。 故以上金铸之，取法龙形。 投之洞府，告盟三元也。 洞府真官，所司寮属，告龙信简文，录其善功，以奏言於上圣。 感应之报，犹影之随形。 修尚之士，不可阙也。 科曰：简也者，告也，纪也，札也。 纪世之善，告於上真。 法长一尺二寸，象十二辰。 广二寸四分，法二十四真气。 厚二分，法二仪。 上下正方，法日之方景。 正真通达，无所避让。 国家以玉为之，玉有九德，可以为礼天地。 神祇之信，故用玉焉。 公侯臣庶，通用槿木。 以其洁白，纤致可比玉矣，明尊卑之殊也。 科曰：璧者，礼天地山川之宝也，以玉为之。 投山川，用圆璧一。 其色苍，径三寸，虚其中。 山简为九天之信，做用苍璧。 用以法天也。 投水简，用六出之璧。 其色黑，径三寸，虚其中。 水简为九海水官之信，故用玄璧，水之色也。 六出，水之数也。 投土简，用黄璧。 正方，径二寸，虚其中。 土简为九地之信。 黄者，土之色也。 方者，地之形也。 璧与龙，副於简封之外，以青丝缠之。 科曰：投三简之法，当用金钮九只，以副於简。 三简，用二十七钮也。 金钮代歃血，青丝代割发。 造盟达诚，最为重也。 故以青丝缠钮璧，附於简及龙，而后放之也。 钮，法国家，用金。 臣庶以银涂金，铜涂金可。 钮径九分，圆其外，如环之形也。 科曰：修斋毕，别卜良曰。 或斋洁之辰，醮馔法师众官及斋主弟子。 或泛舟以诣水洞，或梯陆以登山门。 各於洞府之外，剃草扫洒洁净，敷列醮席酒果肴馔，当鹿脯汤茶等。 国家六十四分，臣庶二＋四分。 如严醮之仪，乃盛服澡漱，朝谒法事，备如科式。 所在地司灵官，监察将吏，当为予关启洞中仙曹，通达告斋之简。 如此福善立感，不得都无关启，直尔投於洞中。 不达真灵，反获罪考矣。 若山水之洞稍远，师众不可俱行，难於登泛者，当选坛内法职一二人与弟子，赍简以诸洞所，设醮关告，投奠一如本仪。
chunks.translated_text:
Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting, *Ritual for Offering Dragon and Jade Disc* – *Lingxian Section of the Lower Yuan Huanglu Writs* states:

To deliver beings from the roots of sin, once all fasts and rites of majestic decorum are complete, follow the Red Writs and Jade Formulas, inscribe cinnabar upon the *jin* tablets, bind them with golden dragons and blue-green silk, and present them to the numinous mountains and Five Peaks. The pledge of ascension shall be sealed within the recesses of sheer cliffs. All must accord with the prescribed method.

*Lingxian Section of the Lower Yuan Huanglu Writs* states:

When the rites invoking the Five Thearchs’ majesty are complete, take one cinnabar-inscribed jade tablet and one golden dragon, bind them with blue-green silk, and cast them into the Three Rivers to present to the Water Thearch. The pledge of ascension must fully adhere to the jade formulas and written statutes.

*Lingxian Section of the Lower Yuan Huanglu Writs* states:

When the rites for the Water Thearch are complete, take nine jade tablets, golden dragons, and golden knots, bind them with blue-green silk, and bury them at the altar site to report and covenant with the Earth Officials. All must follow the regulations as stated.

*Zhenxian Section of the Upper Yuan Jinlu Writs* states:

To deliver beings from the bonds of life and death, when the fast’s rites of majestic decorum are observed, place five golden dragons atop the True Writs of the Five Directions. Upon completion, cast them into the mountains and waters.

*Lingxian Section of the Lower Yuan Huanglu Writs* states:

For the rites of majestic decorum to deliver beings from the roots of sin, use refined gold to fashion ten golden dragons to guard the Ten Directions. To deliver the flying souls, place one dragon at each of the ten directions.

*Yugui Mingzhen Ke* states:

When performing the precious Huanglu fast, use three *liang* of refined gold to cast three dragons, each weighing one *liang*. The state employs refined gold; dukes, ministers, and high officials use secondary gold; scholars, commoners, and the people may use silver, copper, or gilded substitutes, supplemented with jade tablets (the *yu zha*). Inscribe upon them the purpose of the fast, the state’s name, the year of the Great Year, the month and day, the Dharma master’s name, and the location of the offering. Cast them into renowned mountains and grottoes, numinous springs and dragon caves, or at the fast’s altar or dwelling place to report and covenant with the Three Bureaus of Heaven, Earth, and Water, allowing them to witness and verify the fast’s merit. Should any be omitted, the Nine Departments of the Earth Officials shall hold them accountable.

The regulations state: The dragon rides the clouds and qi, governs yin and yang. When united, it forms a body; when dispersed, it becomes patterns. Its transformations are unfathomable—it enters the earth and ascends to heaven. Thus, in the Thirty-Six Heavens, the realm of utmost yang, it serves as the courier to transmit messages and communicate with the mysterious and numinous. Is there anything but the dragon that can achieve this? The dragon is a yang creature. Of all things used by heaven, none surpasses the dragon; of those used by earth, none surpasses the tortoise; of those used by humans, none surpasses the horse. Therefore, the heavens employ dragons as their couriers, traversing between the heavens and the human realm. Gold, the noblest of the five metals, is unyielding and incorruptible—a treasure of heaven and earth that communicates with the numinous and harmonizes with the divine. Thus, refined gold is used to cast them in the dragon’s form. Cast into grottoes and palaces, they serve as pledges to covenant with the Three Primes. The true officials of the grottoes and palaces, along with their subordinate offices, receive the dragon pledges and written tablets, record the meritorious deeds, and memorialize them to the Most High Sages. The response to resonance is like a shadow following form. Those who cultivate and uphold these rites must not omit them.

The regulations state: The tablet (*jian*) serves to report, record, and inscribe. It records the world’s good deeds and reports them to the Perfected Ones. Its length is one *chi* and two *cun*, symbolizing the twelve earthly branches. Its width is two *cun* and four *fen*, corresponding to the twenty-four true qi. Its thickness is two *fen*, representing the Two Modes (yin and yang). Its top and bottom are square, symbolizing the sun’s square shadow. It is upright and unobstructed, yielding to nothing. The state uses jade for its tablets, for jade possesses nine virtues and may be used to ritualize heaven and earth. As a pledge to the divine spirits, jade is thus employed. Dukes, ministers, and commoners all use *jin* wood, for its purity and fine texture may be likened to jade, clarifying the distinctions of rank.

The regulations state: The jade disc (*bi*) is the treasure used to ritualize heaven, earth, and mountains and rivers, and is made of jade. When offering to mountains and rivers, use one round disc. Its color is azure, its diameter three *cun*, with a hollow center. The mountain tablet serves as a pledge to the Nine Heavens, so an azure disc is used, symbolizing heaven. When offering to water tablets, use a six-pointed disc. Its color is black, its diameter three *cun*, with a hollow center. The water tablet serves as a pledge to the Nine Seas and Water Officials, so a dark disc is used, representing the color of water. The six points correspond to the number of water. When offering to earth tablets, use a yellow disc. It is square, with a diameter of two *cun* and a hollow center. The earth tablet serves as a pledge to the Nine Lands. Yellow is the color of earth, and square is the shape of earth. The disc and dragon accompany the sealed tablet, bound with blue-green silk.

The regulations state: For the method of casting the three tablets, use nine golden knots to accompany the tablets. For three tablets, twenty-seven knots are used. The golden knots replace the blood oath, and the blue-green silk replaces the cutting of hair. To forge a covenant and convey sincerity, nothing is more weighty. Thus, the blue-green silk binds the knots, disc, tablet, and dragon before casting them. For the state, gold is used for the knots; for ministers and commoners, silver or copper gilded in gold may suffice. The knots have a diameter of nine *fen*, with their outer edges rounded like rings.

The regulations state: Upon completing the fast, select an auspicious day, or a day of purity during the fast. Prepare offerings, feasts, and ritual implements for the Dharma master, officials, and the fast’s host and disciples. Either board a boat to reach water grottoes or ascend by land to mountain gates. Outside the grottoes and palaces, clear the grass, sweep, and purify the area, then arrange the ritual mats, wine, fruits, delicacies, venison, broth, and tea. The state uses sixty-four portions; ministers and commoners use twenty-four. Follow the solemn ritual decorum: don ceremonial robes, bathe, and pay homage to the ritual proceedings, adhering strictly to the prescribed forms. The local divine officials and supervising generals shall act as intermediaries, reporting to the immortal offices within the grottoes to communicate the fast’s tablets. Thus, blessings and good fortune shall swiftly manifest. Do not fail to report and simply cast the tablets into the grottoes, for without reaching the true numina, one shall incur punishment instead. If the mountain or water grottoes are distant and the master and assembly cannot all attend or ascend, select one or two ritual officers from the altar, along with disciples, to carry the tablets to the grottoes. Perform the offerings and reports as in the original ritual.

chunks.original_text: 若国家投龙，五岳诸山具有金龙科式，与此常礼，繁省不同矣。 斋家或公私所拘，不得躬诣洞府者，可选精慎虔恪、信奉恭勤者一人，代往行礼。 无可代者，师为关告之，又不得藏匿简文，因循持久。 既关告盟之信，在地司录奏，获罪非细，切宜慎之。 至洞所於门外，选平地，或船中，或石上，并须扫洒精洁，以设醮位。 净席五领，醮巾五条，青布诽布，并可酒茶汤，盘数五果饼馔，随时所有。 国家六十四分，臣庶二十四盘，香四，炉巾案四副。 陈设讫，以香水洒坛之外。 以荡氛秽禁，勑如常仪。 师徒弟子，并须澡漱。 严洁以虔恭为先，不得因循，喧聒不恭。 如违，考罚尤深。 各礼师，存念如法 次思三尊，经宝玄师，五星五土，五岳五蒇五灵，经籍度三师。 三色云气，当处洞府，真仙灵司，监察官属，日直土地，并俨然在坐，罗列分明。 如斋法讫。 卫灵
chunks.translated_text:
If the state performs the *Investiture of the Dragon* ritual, the Five Marchmounts and various mountains each have their own golden dragon protocols, which differ in complexity from these ordinary rites. Should the fasting patrons—whether due to public or private constraints—be unable to personally attend the grotto-palaces, they may select one individual of utmost sincerity, reverence, and devout diligence to perform the rites in their stead. If no such proxy can be found, the master shall act as intermediary to report on their behalf. Under no circumstances may the tablets be concealed or the matter prolonged. Once the covenant of report and oath is made, the local divine officials shall record and memorialize it; the offense for failure is no trifling matter—utmost caution is required.

Upon arriving at the grotto site, choose level ground outside the entrance—or a boat, or a stone surface—and ensure it is swept clean and purified to establish the ritual space. Prepare five mats of pure cloth, five ritual towels, blue and plain cloths, and offerings of wine, tea, and hot water. Arrange five trays of seasonal fruits, pastries, and delicacies: sixty-four for the state, twenty-four for officials and commoners. Set out four incense burners, four burner cloths, and four tables. Once the arrangements are complete, sprinkle the area beyond the altar with fragrant water to dispel noxious influences and ward off impurities, as in standard ritual procedure.

Master and disciples alike must bathe and purify themselves. Solemnity and reverence take precedence; laxity, clamor, or irreverence are forbidden. Violations shall incur severe penalties.

Each shall pay homage to the master, contemplating the proper visualization: next, invoke the Three Honored Ones, the scriptural treasures, the Transcendent Masters, the Five Stars, the Five Earths, the Five Marchmounts, the Five Treasuries, the Five Spirits, the scriptural and ordination masters. Envision the three-colored clouds of qi, the grotto-palace of the locale, the true immortals and divine administrators, the supervising officials, and the land spirits on duty—all seated in solemn array, clearly manifest. Conclude as prescribed in the fasting ritual.

*Guardian Spirits.*

chunks.original_text: 五灵列位，焕镇五方。 始皇护魂，丹老卫形。 皓灵侍魄，黑帝摄生。 中央黄帝，统御万真。 元皇诰下，幽夜开光。 罪销北府，名列南昌。 金箓定籍，玉字除殃。 朱陵炼质，飞神太苍。 三官九府，无极神乡。 普受开度，上生天堂。 鸣法鼓二十四通 发炉 无上三天玄元始三炁太上老君，召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、左右捧香驿龙骑吏，侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十六人出。 当召此间土地、山川正神速出，，严装关奏。 臣今正尔烧香，奉为某官某甲设黄箓宝斋，功圆事毕，投简灵山。 愿得太上十方正真生炁，入臣等身中。 所启速达，径御太上无极大道昆仑五岳灵山洞府前。 各称法位 具位臣某等谨奉请大罗玉清无极无上至真大道元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，三宝众圣，一切尊灵。 垂慈降临，稽首再礼。 谨奉请某洞府真仙洞天官属得道真人，垂光降临。 谨奉请当境主司，虚空监察，香官使者，三洞威神，里域真官，诩卫将吏，山水川泽，一切正神，具官来降。 次三捻上香 献酒

The Radiant Spirit attends the po; the Dark Emperor sustains life. The Yellow Emperor of the Center commands the myriad perfected. The Primordial August One issues his decree, and the light of the hidden night unfolds. Sins dissolve in the Northern Bureau; names are inscribed in the Southern Prosperity. The Golden Register fixes one’s destiny; the Jade Script dispels calamity. The Vermilion Mound refines the substance; the spirit soars to the Great Azure. The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, the boundless divine realm—all universally receive deliverance and ascend to the celestial halls.

Sound the ritual drum twenty-four times.
Open the incense burner.

May they deign to descend in compassion. We bow our heads and prostrate ourselves again.

We reverently invoke the perfected immortals of such-and-such grotto-palace, the officials of the grotto-heavens, the attained perfected ones. May they deign to descend in radiance.

We reverently invoke the local governing deities, the overseers of the void, the incense officials and messengers, the mighty spirits of the Three Caverns, the true officials of the precinct, the guardian generals and officers, the spirits of mountains, waters, rivers, and marshes—all the proper deities, each in their official capacity, to descend.

Next, offer the three pinches of upper-grade incense.
Present the wine.

chunks.original_text: 各称法位 长跪，启白 具位臣某谨上启太上无极大道太上三尊，十方已得道大圣众、至真诸君丈人，东华南极西灵北真，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，太极真人，玄一三真人，诸天日月星宿、昆仑上宫诸神仙，西灵金母、五岳真君、灵山正职、潜霍储君。 青城丈人、庐山使者，锺山郁绝，西玄塘台，丘岳大神。 三官北部，六宫幽司。 天下地上，冥灵诸神。 监生主录，南上三门。 至神至灵，一切群仙。 臣胎诞尘浊，瞽暗无知。 万劫善缘，依承道化。 奉宣慈训，佐国立功。 济物度人，弘道赞法。

chunks.original_text: 若受经箓云以今某年月日，诣三洞法师，某岳真人某甲受灵宝五老真文，赤书灵篇，三部八景，诸天内音，神仙二箓，八威策文，五帝符杖，中盟真经，传授事竟，投简灵山，请以金钮，后两过无钮，除此四字。 金龙驿传。 黄箓投简云奉为某官某乙修设黄箓大斋，为国为家，普及存亡。 忏罪乞恩，解消灾咎。 法事都毕，投简灵山，金龙驿传，乞落除罪录，记名玉历。 愿神愿仙，解释九玄七祖、九族众亲、先亡后化，拔赎恶根，免脱酆都岱宗、二十四狱、五岳之府、九幽之中、刀山剑树、苦恼之乡。 魂睹光明，永蒙开度。 轮转受化，逍遥福门。 安稳坟墓，注讼不兴。 举家蒙福，一切荷恩。 妖精殄灭，善瑞日生。 修道参真，永阶仙品。 蒙如所启，仰荷玄恩。 臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首再礼。 谨启 次起立，捧简文，香上熏之。 叩齿九通 次读简文毕，用青纸封之，青丝缠龙钮璧等。 弟子执之香上，师咒曰 玄上开明，元始监真。 上帝五老，赤书丹文。 天地本始，总领三元。 摄气召会，催促学仙。 高上符命，普告十方。 日月星宿，五岳灵山。 天上地下，溟泠大神。 监生主录，南上三门。 关领玉简，勒名丹篇。 削落罪目，上补帝臣。 归凭至道，修斋立功。 拔赎九祖，一切苦魂。 行道事竟，谨依灵山。 请投玉简，乞削罪名。 皆蒙解脱，无有冤亲。 去离三恶，魂升九天。 生死开度，亿劫长存。 今日上告，万真咸闻。 请以龙简，关盟真官。 乞如所告，金龙驿传。 咒毕，众官再礼。 次投简於洞中 投龙颂 三礼 复炉 学仙赞 撒馔

Should the transmission of scriptures and registers be conducted on this day, the [day/month/year], the disciple shall approach a Master of the Three Caverns, the Perfected One of [such-and-such] Sacred Peak, [so-and-so], to receive the *True Writings of the Five Venerable Ones*, the *Vermilion Scriptures of the Numinous Chapters*, the *Eight Sceneries of the Three Divisions*, the *Inner Sounds of the Myriad Heavens*, the *Two Registers of Divine Immortals*, the *Eight Might-Inspiring Writs*, the *Tally-Staves of the Five Thearchs*, and the *True Scriptures of the Central Alliance*. Upon completion of the transmission, the disciple shall present a memorial tablet at the Numinous Mountain, offering it with a golden clasp. Thereafter, no further clasps shall be used—these four characters are to be omitted.

The *Golden Dragon Courier Transmission*.
The *Yellow Register Memorial Tablet* states: Humbly offered on behalf of the official [so-and-so] and [such-and-such], who has established the Great Yellow Register Retreat for the sake of state and family, extending blessings to both the living and the deceased. Seeking forgiveness of sins and imploring grace, dissolving calamities and misfortunes.

Upon the conclusion of the ritual, the memorial tablet shall be presented at the Numinous Mountain, transmitted via the *Golden Dragon Courier*, beseeching the erasure of sins from the records and the inscription of names in the *Jade Registers*. May the divine and immortal ones release the nine generations of ancestors and the seven lineages of kin, the departed and the transformed, redeeming their evil roots and delivering them from the Fengdu and Mount Tai, the Twenty-Four Prisons, the Courts of the Five Sacred Peaks, the Nine Dark Realms, the Knife Mountains and Sword Trees, and the lands of suffering and affliction. May their souls behold the radiant light and forever receive deliverance. May they be transformed through the wheel of rebirth, entering the gates of bliss. May their tombs remain undisturbed, and lawsuits cease. May the entire household receive blessings, and all be indebted to this grace. May malevolent spirits be eradicated, and auspicious omens arise daily. May those who cultivate the Dao and seek the Perfected attain immortal ranks forever. Should these prayers be granted, we shall ever bear the profound grace of the Mysterious.

This humble servant, [so-and-so], with reverence and awe, bows twice in prostration.
Respectfully submitted.

Next, rise and hold the memorial tablet, fumigating it with incense.
Knock the teeth nine times.

After reciting the memorial text, seal it with blue paper, binding it with azure silk and the dragon clasp, jade, and other tokens.
The disciple shall hold it over the incense while the master recites the incantation:

*"The Mysterious Above opens and illumines; the Primordial Beginning oversees the Perfected.
The Five Venerable Ones of the Thearchs, the Vermilion Scripts of the Cinnabar Writings.
The origin of Heaven and Earth, governing the Three Primes.
Gathering qi and summoning assemblies, hastening the pursuit of immortality.
The exalted tally-commands, universally proclaimed to the ten directions.
The sun, moon, and stellar lodges, the numinous mountains of the Five Peaks.
Above the heavens and below the earth, the great spirits of the boundless depths.
The overseers of life and keepers of records, the Three Southern Gates.
Presiding over the Jade Tablets, inscribing names in the Cinnabar Chapters.
Erasing the records of sins, ascending to serve as ministers of the Thearch.
Relying upon the Supreme Dao, establishing merit through the retreat.
Redeeming the nine generations of ancestors, all suffering souls.
Upon the completion of the ritual, reverently following the Numinous Mountain’s decree,
Presenting the Jade Tablet, beseeching the erasure of sinful names.
May all attain liberation, without enmity or kinship.
Departing the Three Evil Realms, ascending to the Nine Heavens.
Delivered from life and death, enduring for a hundred million kalpas.
Today’s supplication is heard by the myriad Perfected.
Presenting the Dragon Tablet, pledging alliance with the Perfected Officials.
May the prayers be granted, transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier."*

Upon the conclusion of the incantation, the assembled officials shall bow twice more.
Next, cast the tablet into the grotto.

*Ode to the Dragon Tablet*
Three bows.
Return to the incense burner.
*Hymn to the Pursuit of Immortality*
Withdraw the offerings.

the Great Emperor of Fusang,
the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital,
the Three Rivers and Four Seas,
the Nine Rivers and Huai Marshes,
the Three Officials and Nine Palaces,
the Twelve River Sources,
the Nine Palaces’ Water Thearchs,
the Great Spirits of the Vast Cold,
the Water Palace Immortals,
and all assembled numina.

This servant, born of humble clay in the lower realms, endowed with a meager and common intellect, has by karmic affinity with the Dao encountered this sagely dispensation. The Numinous Treasure has bestowed its teachings, the Great Dharma has delivered humankind. Assisting the state and establishing merit, he upholds the benevolent instructions. Having received the scriptures and registers—on this day, month, and year, he approached the Three Caverns’ Dharma Master, the Perfected of Such-and-Such Marchmount, so-and-so, who transmitted to him the Five Venerable Perfected of the Numinous Treasure, the Scarlet Writ of the Numinous Chapters, the Three Divisions and Eight Effulgences, the Inner Sounds of All Heavens, the Two Registers of Divine Immortals, the Eight Might Commandments, the Five Thearchs’ Talismanic Staffs, the Central Alliance Scriptures, and the transmission of all rites—now complete.

He casts the Dragon Tablet into the limpid spring, fastening it with a golden clasp. If no golden clasp is used, omit these four characters.
Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

Upon the completion of the Yellow Register Retreat, this servant, on behalf of such-and-such official, so-and-so, has conducted the Yellow Register Grand Retreat for the state and the household, universally encompassing the living and the deceased. He prays for grace and offers thanks, beseeching blessings and the dissolution of calamities, the resolution of enmities, and the augmentation of life and fortune. With the rites now concluded, he casts the tablet into the numinous spring. Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier, he petitions the erasure from the ledgers of death, the dissolution of sins, and the inscription of life. May the divine and immortal grant renewal. May the Nine Mysteries and Seven Ancestors be delivered from the roots of suffering, departing the Radiant Valley and the dark, frigid realms of the nether night. Bathed and refined, may they ascend to the heavens. May tombs be secure and felicitous, inauspicious entries forever obliterated. May the entire household receive blessings, their divine qi at rest and serene. May learning and discernment be illuminated, wisdom perfected and radiant. May the true Dharma be proclaimed, treachery and malevolence subdued. May the Three Realms bear witness to their deliverance, their merit fulfilled and conduct complete. May the emperor be secure and the state prosper. This servant humbly submits this petition, praying it be granted as stated.

This servant, with awe and trepidation, prostrates and bows twice.
Humbly submitted.

Next, the tablet is held and fumigated over the incense. The teeth are clicked three times. After the tablet’s text is read, it is sealed with blue paper, bound with azure silk, and affixed with the dragon clasp and jade ornaments. The disciple holds it over the incense while the master recites the incantation:

The Five Venerables of the Primordial Origin, exalted lords of the Highest,
The Perfected of the Ten Directions, the numinous immortals of Mount Taihua.
The Scarlet Writ proclaims the mandate, no hidden realm is untouched.
Ascending to the Nine Heavens, petitioning the descent of the Jade Text.
The Sun, Moon, and Five Planets,
The Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper.
Petitioning the Five Marchmounts at the center,
The numinous mountains of the Four Quarters.
Petitioning the rivers and seas below,
The Twelve Fountainheads.
The Water Thearchs of the Nine Palaces,
The Great Spirits of the Vast Cold.
Today’s supplication is heard,
All vows are declared.
Conducting the retreat and performing the Dao,
Universally for the living and the dead.
Praying for the redemption of the Seven Ancestors,
The roots of karmic transgressions.
Reverently casting the Jade Tablet,
Praying it be heard above.
Inscribed in the Water Palace,
Ascending to heaven in the past.
Delivered from life and death,
All spirits hear the plea.
Presenting the Dragon Tablet,
Pledging alliance with the Water Thearchs.
Grant as petitioned,
Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

The incantation concluded, the assembled officials bow twice more.
Next, cast the tablet into the Water Palace.
Chant the *Ode to the Dragon Tablet*.
Three bows.
Return to the incense burner.

chunks.original_text: 小学仙赞，散如常仪 投土简法 各礼师，存念如法 卫灵 鸣法鼓二十四通 无上三天玄元始三炁太上老君，召出臣身中，三五功曹、左右官使者、左右捧香驿龙骑吏、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符直日香官，各三十六人出。 当召此间土地里域、真官正神速出，严装关启。 臣今正尔烧香投简，愿得太上十方正真生炁，入臣身，中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道九土皇灵地府大神前。 各三礼 次各称法位 次向西南，降真 次长跪，启白 臣谨上启太上无极大道太上三尊，十方已得道大圣众、至真诸君丈人，东华南极西灵北真，五老上帝，三十六部尊经，玄中大法师，太极真人，玄一三真人，酆都大帝君，九府之宫、泉曲主司、无极世界高皇、九土皇灵季帝高真中皇，九土戊己黄神土府五帝，三界官属，土地里域，真官正神，及此观宅，一切灵祇。 臣禀气凡愚，叨因宿运。 会遇真法，与善因缘。 值灵宝开光，赤书宣化。 许以庸秽，参奉正真。 佐国为时，立功行教。 受法箓云以某年月日，奉诣三洞法师某岳真人，佩受灵宝五老真文、赤书灵篇、三部八景、诸天内音、神仙二录、八威策文、五帝符杖、中盟众经，传授事毕。 投简中宫，请以金钮，后两过无钮，去此四字。 金龙驿传。 黄箓斋主奉为某官某甲修设黄箓大斋，为国为家，普兼存没。 销殃谢罪，请福祈恩。 行道事讫，投简灵坛，金龙驿传。 乞削除地简，除其罪愆。 愿度愿生，保济形身。 九老仙都，玉历注名。 九祖父母、亿劫种亲、先亡后逝，咸享福缘。 去离九幽之下、八门之乡、地狱之内、楚掠之中。 殃注消释，冢宅清宁。 恶根断绝，上生福堂。 某学业圆就，功行盛明。 生死同福，永保无倾。 帝王受福，天下和平。 谨以启闻，乞垂感悟。 臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首再礼。 谨启。 次捧简文，香上熏之，叩齿十二通 次读简文毕，用黄纸封简，青丝缠龙钮璧等，弟子执於香上，师祝曰 天地开张，万黑分灵。 三元同符，十方朗清。 五岳上闻，主死领生。 丹书赤文，元始上经。 普告无上，九地皇灵。 今日上告，万仙定生。 修斋行道，普为存亡。 我愿我仙，请投玉名。 土府太皇，勒除罪刑。 奏告上宫，刊簿华清。 身得飞腾，天地同灵。 九祖种亲，腐骸更荣。 魂升南宫，受炼仙庭。 今日告命，万神咸听。 请以金钮，表明至诚。 请如所告，金龙驿呈。 咒毕，众官再礼。 次投简於坛中，或於月建之下 次吟投龙颂 三礼

The *Hymn to Lesser Immortals* concludes, dispersed as in the usual rite. The *Method for Casting the Earth Tablet* follows. Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian of the Numinous**
Twenty-four strikes of the Dharma Drum.

To the Most High Three Heavens, the Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, the Supreme Lord Lao: summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Left and Right Fragrant-Bearing Dragon Courier Scribes, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Six Fragrant Officers of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Registers for the Day.

At once summon the local Earth Gods and Domain Spirits, the True Officers and Righteous Deities, to swiftly emerge, array themselves, and open the gates.

This servant now burns incense and casts the tablet, praying that the Primordial Qi of the Ten Directions’ True and Upright Ones enter this body, that this petition swiftly ascend and directly reach the presence of the Most High Boundless Dao, the Nine Lands’ August Spirit of the Earth Mansion, and the Great Deities of the Underworld.

Each performs three bows.
Next, each declares their Dharma rank.
Then, facing the southwest, they descend in truth.
Next, kneeling in full prostration, they intone:

This servant reverently petitions the Most High Boundless Dao, the Supreme Three Worthies, the Ten Directions’ Perfected Great Sages, the Most Real Lords and Venerable Ones, the Eastern Flowery Radiance, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, the Five Elder Thearchs, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate, the Three Perfected of the Mysterious Unity, the Great Emperor of Fengdu, the Nine Mansion Palaces, the Masters of the Yellow Springs and Crooked Springs, the August High Thearch of the Boundless Realm, the Nine Lands’ August Spirit of the Seasons, the Central August, the Nine Lands’ Earth Gods of the Central Yellow, the Five Thearchs of the Earth Mansion, the officials of the Three Realms, the local Earth Gods and Domain Spirits, the True Officers and Righteous Deities, and all numinous spirits of this abode and dwelling.

This servant, born of coarse qi and foolish nature, has by karmic fortune encountered the True Dharma and auspicious causes. At the opening of the Numinous Treasure’s radiance and the proclamation of the Red Writ, this unworthy one was permitted to attend the Perfected. Aiding the state and serving the times, establishing merit and propagating the teachings, this servant received the Register of the Dharma on such-and-such a day, month, and year, from the Three Caverns’ Dharma Master, the Perfected of Such-and-Such Peak. The transmission included the Five Elder Perfected Texts, the Red Writ Numinous Chapters, the Three Divisions and Eight Effulgences, the Inner Sounds of All Heavens, the Two Registers of Gods and Immortals, the Eight Might Commandments, the Five Thearchs’ Talismanic Staffs, the Central Alliance Scriptures, and other texts. The transmission complete, the tablet is cast into the Central Palace, inscribed with a golden clasp—omitting the phrase “afterward twice without clasp” and these four characters.

Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

The Yellow Register Retreat’s sponsor, on behalf of such-and-such an official or such-and-such a person, has established the Great Yellow Register Retreat for state and family, universally for the living and the dead. To dissolve calamities, atone for transgressions, pray for blessings, and beseech grace. The Daoist rites concluded, the tablet is cast upon the numinous altar, transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

Pray that the Earth Tablet erase transgressions and remove sins. May vows be fulfilled and lives preserved, bodies safeguarded. May names be inscribed in the Jade Calendar of the Nine Elder Immortals’ Capital. May the nine generations of ancestors, parents, karmic kin of countless kalpas, the previously and recently deceased, all partake of blessed causes. May they depart from the Nine Darks below, the Eight Gates’ realm, the earth prisons’ interiors, and the midst of suffering. May their calamitous records dissolve, their tombs and dwellings be purified. May evil roots be severed, and may they ascend to the Hall of Blessings. May this servant’s studies be perfected, merits and deeds resplendent. May life and death share in fortune, eternal protection without peril. May the emperor receive blessings, the world know peace.

This servant reverently petitions, praying for compassionate response. With utmost awe and trepidation, this servant kowtows twice more. Respectfully submitted.

Next, the tablet’s text is held and fumigated over incense. Twelve knocks of the teeth.
The tablet’s text read, it is sealed with yellow paper, bound with azure silk, and adorned with a dragon clasp and jade disk. The disciple holds it over the incense while the master intones:

Heaven and Earth unfold,
Myriad darknesses part, spirits divide.
The Three Origins unite in tally,
The Ten Directions shine in clarity.
The Five Peaks ascend in report,
Masters of death, stewards of life.
Cinnabar Writ, Red Text,
Primordial Scripture of the Most High.
Universally proclaimed to the Supreme,
The Nine Lands’ August Spirits.
Today’s supplication is heard,
All immortals’ lives are secured.
Conducting the retreat and performing the Dao,
Universally for the living and the dead.
This servant’s vow, this servant’s immortality,
Pray cast the jade name.
Earth Mansion’s August Thearch,
Inscribe and remove the sentence of punishment.
Petition the Upper Palace,
Engrave the register in the Flowery Clarity.
May this body ascend in flight,
Heaven and Earth share in numinosity.
Nine generations of karmic kin,
Rotten bones renewed in glory.
Souls ascend to the Southern Palace,
Refined in the Immortals’ Court.
Today’s decree proclaimed,
All spirits hear the plea.
Pray with the golden clasp,
Manifest utmost sincerity.
Grant as petitioned,
Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

The incantation concluded, the assembled officials bow twice more.
Next, cast the tablet into the altar’s center or beneath the lunar station.
Chant the *Ode to the Dragon Tablet*.
Three bows.
